review_body: Really nice and newly renovated resort. Ocean and mountain view rooms. Excellent comfortable beds. Place is very clean, good sized rooms, water filters to refill your water bottles. Great pool/bar area. Offer activities like aqua aerobics. I would stay that is a 4 star not a 5 star resort compared to other 5 stars around. Be careful when booking as we booked online and then when we got there and checked in had additional charges wuch as resort fee and our bill had other charges were were not aware of that we had to pay. Great resturants, with Morimota Asia amazing for a amazing food and experience. We caught an uber to the airport as it is cheaper than taking the shuttle. Great location, right near beach and the main road. Would stay again.

My girlfriend and I stayed here for 10 days and absolutely loved it! The check in process was smooth and informative, the gentlemen that helped us was very kind & understanding (I wish I remembered his name). Everyone was genuinely nice and welcoming every single day! The pool tenders and servers were great and communicative, they provided us local tips on which farmers market to check out, restaurants, bars, hikes, etc. We loved it when they would ask us about our morning and what we got up to it really shows they care. We highly recommend that you upgrade to the longboard club, it’s definitely worth it! This is where we met Zoe and Jonathan Carlton, these two deserve a round of applause in what they do. Top notch customer service and very friendly and easy going people. Excellent communication skills and very attentive. These two definitely made our stay here extra special and we would like thank everyone at the alohilani resort for making this trip memorable! We will be back very soon!

Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the Alohilani. The room was clean, bed was super comfy, and the view from the balcony was to die for (35 floor with a view of the city and beach). The staff was great. We had everything we needed. Rooms were cleaned regularly. I cannot speak much for the hotel ameneties - I used the infinity pool once. The Oceanarium in the lobby was really neat to see. The location of the hotel is fantastic - it is steps from the beach and is right on Kalakaua Ave. I ate once at Morimoto (second floor of the hotel). I sat on the patio that is overlooking Waikiki beach. I only sampled a few items from the menu and found to be fairly tasty. Parking is expensive (40 usd per day). I found parking close by for much cheaper - for those of you searching for a place to park your car. The Honolulu Zoo does not allow for overnight parking anymore (4 hours max). You can park at the Waikiki Banyan (very close to the hotel -approx. 2-3 min walk) 80 usd for a week with in and out privileges. The one problem that I had with the hotel is the amount of homeless wandering around the hotel...The staff need to be more attentive to this. As I was going back to my hotel room on the 35th floor there was a homeless man wandering around the hallway...I have no idea how he got there. It really does not look like a luxury resort when you see this...All in all, I enjoyed my stay and would stay here again in the future.

Even though the staycation I planned landed in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic, I decided not to cancel my reservation and follow through with my stay. The down side was that all the hotel amenities were not available. However, the fact that the hotel (and Waikiki in general) was pretty empty, totally made up for it. Considering that Waikiki is usually bustling, social distancing was not an issue this weekend. It was great. The hotel lobby is gorgeous! Designed very beautifully. It also smelled nice. Check in was a snap. Great location right across from beach. The beach area is enclosed and very shallow and calm, making it perfect for people with families.The room was great. We booked an Ocean View room (located on the Beachside section of the hotel) with two queen beds. It was pretty much what we expected. The beds were comfortable. A little lumpy, but comfortable. The view was amazing. Great view of the ocean and Waikiki beach (looking toward the Royal Hawaiian). On many of the reviews I've read, a complaint was the size of the bathroom. I do agree that it's pretty small, it wasn't really an issue. The smart toilet and rain shower is great, though. The shining star of the property was the pool. I loved it. Especially since it was never really crowded. I hear that it's usually pretty busy, but thankfully we avoided all that. It provided a backdrop for a lot of nice photographs. Pretty much lounged around the area for most of the day. It was an awesome way to spend my birthday. Considering it was a really slow period and everything going on, interaction with hotel staff was very minimal. But the little that I did have was pleasant. Overall it was a great stay and I really enjoyed the hotel. I will say that I was disappointed not to be able to enjoy everything that the hotel had to offer, especially considering it's what we're paying for. However, it's a tough time right now so I understand. Would definitely consider staying at the Alohilani once again when everything blows over (and if there's good deals, hehe).

My sister and I celebrated her 50th birthday here. The location is across the street from the beach. Our reason for choosing this particular hotel was due to all the amenities they offered. Unfortunately, everything started closing down or was canceled due to the coronavirus! I was looking forwars to the lei making....canceled. The baracuda restaurant, canceled. Yoga on rooftop...canceled...canceled...CANCELED! I mean dern it virus! I know it was out of THEIR control but, we definitely did NOT get what was paid for. I will NOT be coming back here to this hotel. I've stayed in much better hotels. On the brighy side, the infinity pool was beautiful but, the jacuzzi was dirty. The kids were splashing and diving even though 'NO DIVING' was allowed. The Longboard staff was super friendly! They don't have a lot of options though. I did love the acai bowl...yum! An omlette bar would be a FANTASTIC addition. Some turkey bacon or sausage would be nice, too. The salmon was delish,too. The complimentary shampoo, conditioner and body cream smells super duper nice! The heated toilet seat kinda caught us off guard at first lol! The view is amazing. We didn't get to get massage we wanted. Had to end up walking about 15 mins away to a sketchy looking place to get one. I mean....what more can I say? Glad I was in Hawaii?? I would try other options somewhere else IF we come back. Aloha! (Good-bye)

Beautiful Hotel, close to everything and across the road from the beach. Hotel was very clean, and room was very clean. Pool was amazing and pool area was world class. Staff (Renee) were amazing, concierge staff could do with some enthusiasm in their job and get rid of the time share girl trying to sell rather than help. Overall pleasant stay for 9 nights and happy to state again a beautiful hotel.

Avoid this hotel at all costs. They will rope you into a timeshare presentation that will take up your entire morning while they accost you with slimy sales tactics. When we told them about our terrible experience they would only compensate us with a hotel credit that we wouldn't be able to use in the time we had left. This was a terrible experience and after this we will never stay anywhere owned by diamond resorts ever again. Save yourself the hassle and stay somewhere else!

The Alohilani is a perfect Hawaiian Host. Location, location, location brought us back. We first stayed when renovations were underway years ago and the staff and their hospitality were above average. Now that all is finished the amenities are grand. Love the pool, warm plunge and decks et al. That said the ocean access was perfect. Alas, one low point my husband had a close call with a sea urchin ... Tomeika at the front desk went above and beyond the call to help us. Daily also at desk the next day followed up beautifully and got us both on our way.

I checked in with Dailyn. She was amazing. She asked questions regarding my visit and when I mentioned I was visiting my boyfriend who is currently serving in the navy and stationed on the island and that we hadn't seen each other for 5 months and that it was also his birthday, she went above and beyond to make our time together special. The entire wait staff from the pool area to both bars were very friendly and attentive. Very clean and quiet. We stayed on the 17th floor ocean front. Beautiful and worth the upgrade.

My family and I stayed at the resort for 3 nights at the end of our trip to Hawaii. It was the perfect end to our trip! The resort is extremely well located, as the beach and the main strip are just a few steps away. The amenities are great as well (large aquarium, outdoor infinity pool overlooking the beach, and outdoor kids’ pool). We also found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful (particularly Jillian at the front desk and Jones at the pool)! With our daughter being just over 1 year old, it was the perfect spot, as everything we needed was within close proximity.

If you like a tiny bathroom where you have to step over the toilet to open the door then this is the place for you. The grounds and pool are absolutely beautiful. The rooms are just ok. The ocean front view upgrade was kind of worth it for the view. But the room was just okay. Dusty fixtures and the shower heads needed to be cleaned. The check in person we had wasn’t very friendly.

VERY impressed with the renovation and rebranding. We’re celebrating my wife’s bday and upgraded the stay with the Longboard club. We headed down to the lounge for some pupus and drinks and can’t say enough about the service Robert gave us at the Longboard club. He took such great care of us and my family, especially our little ones. SUPER grateful for him making our experience at the hotel top notch. If you stay at the hotel, go by and say hi to him, he’ll take great care of you!

This is a beautifully appointed hotel that is just across from Waikiki beach. The public areas arwed quite nice and the pool area is beautiful. There's a bar, hot tub, pool and lap pool. The constant breeze/trade wind is great - and can get a bit chilly at night if you're wet from the pool. The hotel is easy walking distance from many restaurants and shops for any need. Our room was on the 29th floor with a view of the beach and Waikiki/Honolulu. Lots of rainbows when it rained. The room was spacious had a frig, safe and a balcony.

The rooms were bright, airy and clean. The restaurants are amazing. The staff went above and beyond for us. Olivia was so kind for my husband's birthday, surprising him with a bottle of wine and a gorgeous fruit plate. Our entire stay was fantastic!

We had an amazing stay at Alohilani. We are vegan. I reached out to Nick Meisner the Director of Restaurants and Bars prior to our trip. He made sure the staff at The Long Board Club was ready to accommodate us. This was really appreciated and made a huge impact on our dining experience. We also loved are waitress Shade at the club in the mornings. The evening ambassador when we checked into the club was really awesome too (unfortunately I can’t remember his name). Finally, I had some trouble booking The Longboard Club and spoke with a manger named Amy who was very helpful. Great customer service in addition to a beautiful atmosphere made for a great stay.

We stayed at the Alohilani Resort which was a lovely relaxing and modern resort. The location was great, being across the road from the protected beaches which was perfect for our 3 year old and walking distance to the shops, trolleys, restaurants etc. We stayed in one of the partial ocean view rooms, which was spacious and tidy, bed was comfortable and bathroom was a good size complete with bidet(really liked the warm toilet seat!). The staff were all very helpful and lovely. The pool area was great and relaxing, we enjoyed dinner by the pool one evening watching the sunset. There were pitied water taps at the lifts which were great so you didn’t have to buy water everyday. The only thing would be the noise coming from the street at night but I think you would experience this with hotels along the main street. Overall a really lovely place to stay, for all types of families.

We thoroughly enjoyed our experience at the hotel! The room, views and service were great! All of the pictures shown from the hotel and patrons are representative of the actual hotel. We loved our ocean-view room, which also provided a view of Diamond Head. We would definitely come back again!

Overall this hotel is fantastic - I’ve stayed in several Waikiki hotels and this is one of the top three best. We stayed at the Hilton village and wound up moving because we wanted a more adult friendly hotel environment. Management needs, NEEDS to do something about the pool area. Our first day here we tried to get in the pool and it was absolutely overrun with toddlers and children screaming, jumping and splashing in the hot tub and infinity pool. Parents were nowhere in sight and the splashing and screaming became too much so we just went to our rooms. The next day we came back and by 8am the pool and hot tub were full of children. It was also absolutely filthy. Cigarette butts, hair, bandaids, plastic cups floating. I said something to the concierge who were kind enough to knock a day of resort fees off our bill. They have rules posted everywhere about kids under five not being allowed in, children under 13 needing to be supervised, and there’s even a children’s pool but the staff refused to say anything to the parents. I get it, you don’t want to offend parents who are paying an arm and a leg for their vacation. But the pool, which is ultimately why we booked this hotel, was unusable. We could also hear the screaming all day and night from our room, even with the balcony door closed.

My husband and I stayed here for 5 days and had a good experience overall. Gym had great equipment and well maintained and the pool was small but sufficient. We signed up for the Longboard club primarily for the convenience and would say the value is fair. Longboard club service was excellent with staff being friendly and welcoming. There were sufficient options for breakfast with assortment of pastries, toast, fruit and salad as well as daily miso soup, rice, fixings and proteins. The dinner charcuterie got a little boring after 4 days but the wine cruvinet selections were excellent. Special thank you to Robert who took the time to get to know my favourite drink and his excellent service during our stay. What prevents me from adding the extra star are the little details that didn't get addressed. I had to remind front desk three times (over two days) to remove an unsightly mattress left on our floor by the elevator. Kitchen vents are pointed directly at the cabanas in the Longboard area and the smell of oil was overpowering despite wind direction and we couldn't/didn't want to sit in that area.

Wowwwwwww~ was a recurring theme for our recent trip to Waikiki. I've been to Honolulu on multiple occasions but our experience at 'Alohilani made me never want to stay at another resort, EVERRRR!! And it was all due to the exceptional service provided by every one of the staff there.Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted and checked in by Jillian. She was the absolute sweetest and definitely raised the bar of our expectations for our stay!! We arrived earlier than the standard check-in time so our room was not ready yet, but since we had access to the Longboard Club, we we were able to check out the space and hang out for a little bit before our room was available. When we walked into the Longboard Club, there was a staff meeting in progress. We apologized for interrupting but every one of the staff turned and gave us the warmest welcome and genuine smiles all around! Seriously, so sweet!! We also went to check out the gym where again, we were greeted by the most friendly staff, including Dave, the manager. We were quite impressed by the equipment available there....full squat rack and other machines you normally don't see at hotel gyms.Once our room was ready, we went up and got settled in. The room is not huge but it was more than comfortable. The decor is clean, elegant, and calming like the rest of the hotel. The full wall of glass gave us an unobstructed view of the ocean ~~ heart eyes ^ a million. It was such a treat sleeping with the sliding glass door open and falling asleep to the sound of the ocean waves. Later during the day, we went back down to the Longboard Club for their nightly happy hour where we met Jonathan and the rest of the Longboard Club staff. The free flowing wine, beer, charcuterie, and a rotation of snacks/desserts were such a delight. Lounging on their outdoor sofas as the sun set into dusk, while sipping on a flight of wine in front of the gas fireplace was definitely a VIBEEEEE. By far, one of my fav moments of our trip. Jonathan was the BEST! He remembered our favorite selections of wine/beer and brought around refills whenever we were getting low without us even asking! The BEST I tell you! :P We didn't miss the happy hour once during our 4 night stay. The daily breakfast at the Longboard Club was simple but consistently good and satisfying.The housekeeping staff is always on top of getting the rooms cleaned quickly and efficiently. One of the days we had a late start and wanted to relax at the hotel for most of the day. We gave them a half-hour window to clean our room and when we got back....done: new towels, bed made, everything in order. Le sigh~ why can't everyday life be like this? ;)All in all, the BEST EXPERIENCE I've had at ANY hotel or resort. We even decided to extend our trip one more night because we were having such an exceptional time. I seriously can't wait to go back to Oahu just to stay to 'Alohilani again. I truly hope you have a similar experience, and the BIGGEST thank you to all the staff at 'Alohilani for making our trip extraordinary♥

This resort was fabulous! The amenities were great; the gym had lots of modern equipment but this place was pricy; it is located very close to the beach but it is a very non-inclusive place; we had to rent beach loungers with an umbrella on the beach for 25 US per hour and the beach staff were very prompt when time was up. The umbrellas are a must as the sun is intense. The ocean was great. A very pristine place and friendly staff. The pool was a bit chilly but it was January. I was on the 31st floor and had amazing views. Did a few excursions and was fortunate enough to see whales and dolphins. I would highly recommend if you have a large wallet; dinner out and drinks are expensive but everything is done to perfection.

it is a Wonderful space, and a Great team. Olivia was a great help, and we loved Jones 'the pool guy'. He was brilliant, and made everyone smile. Especially the 4pm Cookie run.Definitely heading back as soon as we can.

Jillian at the front desk was fantastic. She needs more money from whoever is paying her. The entire staff was comparable to the best thing you've ever eaten . Jonathan in the longboard club remembered everything i liked to drink after the first hour. He needs a raise. Get the longboard access. The food is fresh and it's free beer and wine for the time it's open. I got buzzed for free every night. So legit.This place is all GOOD VIBES and great humans. If I won the lottery I would gather the entire staff in the lobby and make it rain at least $50,000 so they can all split it.Seriously though...The best vacation resort I've been to. Your Buddy,Buddy

Did a pool party at the cabanas and I’d like to give a huge shoutout especially to Janice A. and staff for making it an amazing experience the whole time! They made it so seamless and made us feel special. Thank you so much!

Thank you so much Nina front desk check in. Made our visit so special. I want to say thank you for making our stay amazing. Hotel and staff above and beyond for a great island vacation. Thank you Nina. You were so helpful friendly and above all helpful for making plans on the island. AlohaLori.

Great resort with a really friendly staff. Smelled amazing...what diffuser scent are you guys using? We could smell it from the time we walked in until we left the hotel. Very clean rooms and a lot of nice shops.

Everything about this resort is amazing. Great people, great views even if not in a ocean view room ( Hawaii is beautiful) ! Great food, great vibes! All staff were helpful. The best part was the room which was so cozy to read a book and spend some quality ME time. ALOHA

Luxury hotel - gorgeous rooms and common areas.Staff were nice and friendly. Fantastic location - just across the road from Waikiki Beach & lots of shopping, restaurants. Pool area was nice.Cons:Pool could be a bit bigger considering the size of the hotel and guest numbers.Very noisy during pool party evenings - we were a bit jet lagged so turned in at 10pm and had to use ear plugs!

This place is amazing. Nikki at the front desk was very sweet. Perfect person to welcome us to the hotel! The birthday bubbles and dessert she sent to the room was so thoughtful. At the pool Jenny and Toby were on top of it! Definitely recommend this place.

This place is great!!!!! we've stayed in area before but this hotel is one of a kind! updated to 2020- super posh! every hotel is going to have to step it up. right across from the beach, terrific view, great rooms. check in was super easy. the staff was super great! cleaning service top notch - bartenders that know how to make a great drink. pool area amazing! look no further- you need to stay here!!!!!

It was our first time at ‘Alohilani Resort. The service and the staff were nice. The concierge staff helped us organize our trip planning and booking our activities. Unfortunately, what really disappointed me is that we were there for my Birthday and my husband called earlier and asked for special requests and they promised him to get it done and that they will put a note on our booking in the system but when we arrived they seems forgot about it and the check-in staff had no idea about it and said that there no note mentioned in the system either!

We really enjoyed our stay at ‘Alohilani!! All of the staff were so very helpful! When we first got there we received warm greetings from Kelly and the nice valet staff. Then a manager walking by and greeted us with aloha. At the front desk, everything was so easy and fast upon checking in with Renee! Renee was so full of aloha and made us feel so welcomed! During our stay, the cleaners were very respectful and thorough with their cleaning. Some cleaners just come in and don’t even check first, so that’s something that we appreciate. On Sunday morning, we tried the Longboard Sunday brunch and all of the staff were very friendly and helpful as well. We had the best time, listening to music and enjoying unlimited healthy açaí bowls, mimosas and beer until 3:00 pm. It’s such a great deal for the price!On Monday we enjoyed the salt water infinity pool, that over looks the beautiful Waikiki beach. Watching the sunset there, is really breathtaking! But it’s not just the view at the pool. There are so many different areas to sit down, chill out in the sun or shade and relax. You have so many different staff members assisting you and checking in on you. Jenny helped us to take our order and was very efficient and friendly. She always checked on us and made sure that we were taken care of. Jones and Andrew were assisting around the pool and made all guests feel welcomed. Jones is so energetic and just a happy go lucky guy. He’s so sweet and friendly! He offered us cookies and grapes and even to clean our sunglasses! Both him and Andrew also went out of their way to get us dry towels and water. All of the staff were on it and took care of our needs. Always welcomed us and made us feel at home, showing the Aloha spirit. We recommend this hotel to everyone! It was the best stay, in the heart of Waikiki.

I stayed here for 1 night after spending a week on the North Shore. Upon arrival, there was a 45 minute wait to check in, and then a 15 minute wait to even just get in the elevator. Everywhere you go is over crowded with tourists. The pool deck is not what is seems on the website. It’s also extremely overcrowded, and we couldn’t find any seats. The rooms are completely charmless and very small and “partial ocean view” is VERY partial. Mostly you’re just looking directly into other hotels balconies. There is nothing Hawaiian feeling about this hotel. Very disappointed.

First experience at the Resort was amazing, the resort is extremely clean and remodeled. Loved the modern look and how clean the resort is. My family enjoyed everything in it, especially the fish tank by the lounge area.

One of the most modern hotels in Waikiki, where most tend to take your money and not update their tired and dilapidated looking hotels, Alohilani is fresh! Overall, great stay, facilities and staff were wonderful.

A wonderful resort on Kalakaua Ave. Aliolani is always our first choice when visiting Waikiki. The front of resort is steps from Waikiki Beach. It has great views from pretty much every room. Ocean Tower is our favourite of the two towers but you can’t lose with either tower. Pool deck is large with a great infinity pool. Plenty of food and beverage options. Staff are always friendly and helpful. All round this beautifully updated resort has everything we look for and return to often.

The Alohilani is located right in the heart of Waikiki. The area around it is hustling and bustling. Waikiki beach is right across the street. The common area of the hotel is really nice. There is a big fish tank in the lobby, and they conduct fish feedings at 10:30am and 2:30pm daily. It only last about 5 minutes so be sure to arrive early if you want to catch it. There is a daily resort fee and valet fee if you have a car. The extra fees do add up and are charged upon check in. We did not spend too much time at the hotel or in our room since Hawaii is such a beautiful place to explore. Our room was average. It was located right above the Momosan restaurant and we can hear the music playing from the restaurant into the night. The restroom is small but there is a bidet which was cool! We had a partial ocean view, but the view was mostly of the guy sunbathing on his balcony in the condo across the street.One issue we did have was that there was a leak in the closet. We noticed the floor of the closet was damp when we checked in, but we didn't really think much of it being that there is a pool and the beach is right across the street. The closet is located right next to the door and we usually wore shoes or slippers in that area so we did not notice that the floor never dried during our stay. We had thrown a few dirty clothes into the closet throughout the trip and they were soaking wet as well. Luckily we discovered this the day before we left so we were able to put the clothes out on the balcony to dry before having them pack them up. We noticed the ceiling in the closet was soft and there was mold. We called the front desk to let them know of the issue. Since we were checking out, it wasn't a big deal for us. However, we wanted to make sure the hotel was aware of and could address the leak before checking anyone else in. The front desk said they would take off our resort fee and basically waived us off. We also notified housekeeping and maintenance so that the issue can be fixed. We would have hated for someone else to have the same problem or for the ceiling to cave in because of the leak. I'm not sure I would stay at this hotel again. It definitely did not feel like a 5 star hotel. There are plenty of other options in this area and the Alohilani did not stand out as being some place special. But it is a good home base if you can get a good deal.

Being close to activities and a great view was why we gave the ‘Alohilani Resort Waikiki Beach hotel a chance. It’s a little further down Wakiki beach than where we usually stay, but Morimotos restaurant is on site and we wanted to eat and then party without having to walk too far or drive.The lobby is busy. We checked in at 3 and there was Ali e of about 50 people. So get there a little earlier or a little later than check in time. We had Ocean view room with king bed. We chose the mountain side and the views f Diamond Head were perfect. The Ocean view was ok as we had to look through buildings to see. We were in 17 floor so go higher and your view of both Diamond Head and the Ocean will be stellar. The room was great and clean but wasn’t the most elaborate or special room we have been in. Bathroom and shower were ok, we basically used the room to sleep in and do more mature things after midnight. During daylight we were on the balcony. We spent time at the roof top pool and bar and hot tub. The food at the bar was fantastic. Get Ahi wantons as appetizer. Delicious. The hot tub was crowded. The pool deck was crowded. We didn’t swim or use the hot tub but laid out and had drinks. Bar tenders were awesome and super cool.We will com back but probably ask for a higher floor. Get their earlier. Get to pool and hot tub in morning hours and then hangout at bar or Waikiki in the afternoon.Not very kid friendly even though the indoor aquarium is badass.
user_name:
J T
Oahu's North Shore, Hawaii

review_body: This was my 7th trip to Waikiki. The service was terrible. We found the staff quite rude, especially in the club lounge and the staff that do valet parking.The club lounge was not worth the money and had small opening windows.Rooms were average but clean.The lifts were very slow especially with us being on the 36th floor. Location is great.

Every night in our room, there was a loud fog-horn type siren that would go off during the middle of the night that would wake us up. We were not able to sleep during our stay. We were also assigned to the wrong room upon check in which was not ideal after a long flight.

We enjoyed our stay here over Christmas in Oahu. In spite of being in peak tourist season and steps away from the beach and busy Waikiki, this resort hotel offers a good vibe during daytime and a quiet ambience at night. A highlight in the lobby is the impressive dual-level Oceanarium that makes other furnishings pale in comparison (though lobby area is tastefully decorated).The room is quite spacious and bright. A good-sized lanai allows for fresh air and ocean breezes. Guest floors seem quiet so sleep quality good. Bathroom area has a wash basin in the open (no door). Shower and toilet are separated (has door) but area for both is too small. It would help at least to have a few hooks to hang towel/clothing in there. Guest service at front desk was generally fine but Nikki deserves special recognition for her friendly and enthusiastic suggestion to us for signing up to access the Longboard Club (LC). Great decision - we really enjoyed LC! Staff there is terrific and helpful. We enjoyed the spaciousness and convenience of food and a fantastic 16-bottle wine Cruvinet and beer on tap crafted for the resort.Swell Pool & Bar with an infinity pool offers a relaxing and fine experience and cabanas can be rented for privacy. The pool area can be enjoyed also in the evening as when weather permits, there are video art projections onto the exterior wall of building.Location is terrific - an ABC convenience store is attached to the resort; an Alamo car rental is a short walk away; short walk to many shops and restaurants on Kalakaua Avenue and surroundings; and of course, near the beach but not noisy being too close to it.

I don’t want to go anywhere else or stay anywhere else...I’m already looking at return dates.I came for Pow!Wow! - I am the Creative Director at XLARGE and we were co-sponsors with Alohilani. I didn’t expect a sponsor hotel to be so amazing. I travel around the world and this place has the best vibe by far!I’m coming back with my wife and daughter.BIG MAHALO❤️@JoshMadden

We loved ‘Alohilani! We stayed for 3 nights and it was wonderful. We stayed on the 6th floor and had a king bed. Our view was a great surprise, and could see the ocean and the Main Street in Waikiki. The entire resort was immaculate, and the design was lovely. Check in and out was a breeze, and the staff was wonderful. The room was very nice, and the bed was very comfortable. It was bigger than I was expecting (it was a standard room after all) and had a great balcony with chairs to sit in. The pool was great, we only swam in it a night, and it was really nice. The hot tub was great too. The bar by the pool had excellent drinks, as well as the food. Everything we needed was within walking distance, or a short uber. Would highly recommend and would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Busy Waikiki traffic to get here and then check-in took way too long BUT once we got to the room it was clean, well appointed, had a balcony and a great view of the ocean. Make sure you get an ocean view room on one of the higher floors.

After several calls to front desk to quiet VERY LOUD pool music which affects those of us on upper floors of bldgs in the community, music CONTINUED SO LOUD. NO RESPECT. Build a barrier. Invest. Turn speakers away from manuka. SHAME ON YOU.

crazy pretty hotel and room. gorgeous pool, but be warned it’s not heated so if you come in the cooler months it’s not that pleasant. chose this place ir the pool for our one night stay away from staying with friends to save money and couldn’t even get in the pool haha. would be nice in the middle of summer tho.

Our experience here is so so. When we booked the hotel we were advised that this is a 5 star hotel. Not true, their defense is that it is guest rated star and they are a 4 star. They wanted $35/night for more ocean view and high floor. We were given a mid floor facing a parking lot and construction across the street. When we check in the room has not been cleaned properly and there was a damage to the cabinetry. I asked front desk and they said nothing could be done about it. When I check out I voiced my concern and they do not care. We stayed at Sheraton waikiki for 5 nights and 4 nights at ‘alohilani. We came out paying the same at Sheraton for less nights compared to this hotel. Valet parking is $45/day and self park is $40. More than what they charge at Sheraton. Will not stay here again.

I love everything about this place a true high rise resort with great facilities, plenty of staff and lovely rooms. Great location on Waikiki strip and the fish tank, infinity pool, beers in a cabana all make you feel miles away from everything.

The resort is great on paper, excellent location right by the beach, beautiful lobby and bars, great amenities with an infinite pool and huge gym, definitely 5 stars rated. But the room is definitely not up to par, room isolation is terrible which you can clearly hear what the conversation was next door and TV shows people were watching on the other side. I was given an ocean view room which probably has the best view in the entire hotel, but was also close to the housekeeping room and elevator, which you will constantly hear the elevator chime and chats between housekeepers. In-room amenities were also old and dated, with the air conditioning constantly having a grinding sound every time it turns on and off, completely unexpected if you look at how new it's in the lobby or other areas of hotel.

Aloha,This was our first trip to Honolulu and we chose to stay to stay at the Alohalani resort as it is a newly renovated resort and we had heard good things about it. We were right the hotel itself was beautiful with an Amazing foyer, aquarium, restaurants, bar & pool. But what stood out the most was the exceptional service we received from Jillian C at the front desk. On hearing it was our honeymoon trip she really went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. We are really grateful for her thoughtfulness and amazing service. We will be recommending the Alohalani Resort to our friends and family and Jillian should be commended for her exceptional service.

We were prior guests of Sheraton Waikiki, but needed a change since the quality dipped. We were pleasantly surprised with this newly renovated hotel. Public areas were very nice; rooms were decently refreshed; but the pool and outdoor spaces were the best part! Great lounge chairs, sofas, chairs, daybeds- all with a good vibe. And, to take the pool from very good to AMAZING, was Jones!Jones made us feel like we were VIPs... from spreading out towels to adjusting our pillows to cleaning out sunglasses. He is someone we will NEVER forget! And, he is reason enough to come back!

Lots of good and some unusual sides to this hotel. Two restaurants but both are Asian cuisine. Absolutely no room service which I found strange. Nice gym but you have to enter it through the spa. Conventions take over almost entire bar and pool area. Our room had an ocean front view but the TV on the dresser blocked the entire window. Toilets were extremely low to the ground. If you didn't watch your feet when you opened the bathroom door you could get a nasty bruise or cut on your feet. Tiny bathrooms and we are both small people. Staff was excellent. Nice rooms,Great comfy bed and lots of space.

Overall the hotel was great. The location was right on the Waikiki strip, the amenities included a great pool deck including an infinity pool and kids pool, daily free lei/hula classes in the lobby, a gym, and batting cages. Staff were friendly and accommodating throughout the hotel. Where the hotel could improve is in the guest rooms. The bathroom in our room was incredibly small. You could barely close the door without shuffling to the side and there were cobwebs in the corner of the bathroom ceiling. We also experienced some noise issues. When we checked in we were informed there was going to be a fashion show on the pool deck (we didn't think much of it). However, it turned into a full on Vegas DJ show that had the walls of our room shaking until almost 11pm. This was especially painful as we were travelling with our 4 month old baby who was kept awake screaming. In the morning I did speak to the front desk staff and they refunded our resort fee however that was not the start to a relaxing vacation I was hoping for. Also, the connecting door between our room and the next allowed us to hear everything the people in the next room were saying. Full conversations, what tv shows they were watching, etc. I can only imagine how the guests enjoyed our screaming baby.

Unfortunately it was raining when we stayed here so we did not get to try out the pool area. Lobby is beautiful. Room was clean. Staff were extremely helpful. We stayed at a different place, which was a great place, the following week but regretted not rebooking this place to try out the pool area.

Love this hotel. The staff, especially Jonathan, were amazing! The hotel is centrally located and the staff are amazing. We had access to the Longboard Club which was awesome! The hotel is very central to the Diamond Head walk and shopping.

My husband and I stayed at the Alohalani for 2 nights at the end of our Hawaiian honeymoon. We wanted to be centrally locates and were eager to try Morimoto’s new restaurant in Waikiki. The hotel itself is great for pedestrians and has a stunning lobby — beautiful art, a massive aquarium and gorgeous space in general. I was hopeful that we were in for a great stay. From check-in onwards, however, it was profoundly underwhelming. The check in employee up-sold us for a better view immediately. Even at an extra $90/night, the room has ZERO character. The bathroom was miniscule, which was especially odd given the giant alcove in the bedroom on the other side of the bathroom. No idea why they didn’t make a larger bathroom. The street and neighbor balcony noise was loud. Smoke was floating in our room from the neighbor’s balcony, which stunk and also implied really pool doors. This hotel was a classic example of being pretty on the public spaces, but not as high quality when it cans guest rooms after they suckered you into paying an up charge. The bill at check our listed our upcharge as “checkin merchandising”, which tells you everything you need to know. Even worse, that precious view we paid $90/night for also gave us a view of rusting, mechanical roof machinery just below is. I am disappointed and would not recommend this spot.
user_name:
Heather S
Metro Minneapolis-Saint Paul, Minnesota

review_body: We stayed at Alohilani Resort Waikiki for 10 days. We got dropped off via Roberts shuttle and everyone on the bus thought the Alohilani had the grandest exterior we drove up to. At the front desk, we were fortunate enough to be greeted by the kindest and most patient guest service agent, named Olivia. We booked our reservation through Expedia and they had entered our last name incorrectly, so Olivia wasn't able to find our reservation in their system, but she was able to pivot quickly and resolve the situation. Olivia also asked if we were celebrating anything special and we told her we were celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary the next day. To our surprise, the next day, Olivia left a sweet gift in our room - champagne and dessert was chilling in our fridge, accompanied by champagne glasses and a thoughtful anniversary card. Olivia is the best, and we believe that every place should have someone like her working for them, as she was always happy, helpful and so kind, every time we saw her. Plus, we overheard her speaking mandarin to a family in front of us checking in, so her bilingual skills are a major asset.The hotel itself, is in such a convenient location, across the street from the beach, and within walking distance of everything. We stayed in a premier ocean front view room, which was a beautiful way to wake up every morning. The housekeeping staff on our floor were nice, especially one man in particular, who would always ask us if we needed anything, every time he'd see us, even from across the hallway!During our stay, the Lunar New Year was being celebrated, and Alohilani offered free food in celebration. We happened upon it by accident, because we normally didn't enter/exit the hotel through the front entrance. It was a great treat, but it would have been nice gesture if there was some kind of newsletter to let guests know this was happening. The only two things that were disappointing:1. The bathroom was tiny in our room. There was hardly any space to dry yourself after a shower. On the website, the premier ocean front view room is described as having a "spa-like bathroom". Ours was far from that description, and when you're paying for a luxurious room like that, you'd expect the bathroom to match. 2. One day we went to use the gym facilities and a blonde woman at the desk was very rude to us the moment she saw us walk through the doors. She insinuated that we didn't belong there, but when we showed her our room key, she changed her tone. We should have gotten her name, but we were too dismayed and disappointed by what had just happened. Besides those two things, our stay was comfortable and enjoyable, it great part to Olivia, other helpful staff, and the view of the ocean. We would certainly come back.

Stayed for 12 days - was nice, but it would be more fun to have a few more things going on at the hotel. Found customer service from staff extremely varied! Highs were: Daniel on front desk & Jones at the pool & wait staff. Lows: 1 Barman in particular at pool bar & unfortunately quite a few staff who were sullen & unhelpful.

Could not have asked for a better stay and experience! Hotel was top notch and exceeded our expectations. Definitely worth it if you want to spend time relaxing at your resort and using the amenities!

What can I say about the Alohilani.....in short, just amazing! I was in contact with the hotel 2 weeks before I actually arrived for my holiday and it was clear to me that the entire Alohilani team wanted me to have an amazing experience during my stay. I also want to state that this focus and attention to customer experience covered the entire team, from the General Manager, through to the events team, the front desk staff, the pool team, bar staff, restaurant staff etc........I stayed at the hotel for 8 days, and everything was perfect. The hotel itself is great and has a boutique feel which is what I was looking for. Additionally the location is perfect in that you are right on Waikiki Beach and so have an easy option of chilling in the infinity pool or taking a walk across the street to the beach or even walking down to the hustle and bustle of downtown; everything is literally on your doorstep.I also had access to the Long Board Club which I would advise everyone to get. This provided me with a little exclusivity as well as breakfast and afternoon snacks and drinks. The real value of the Long Board Club for me though, was the fact that if I wanted some downtime to relax or read my book, then I always had the option of walking across from the infinity pool to the Long Board Club and chilling in a cabana, which was always available. I absolutely loves this hotel and if I go back to Oahu again, I will only stay here!!!Well done Alohilani team..........great work!

We stayed a week in an oceanview. We were on the 8th floor and was high enough to have one of the best views we have had at any hotel. Some of the reviews were confusing to me, if you are in the ocean side building then all the ocean views are great. However its if you are in the second larger building that is offset, behind the one we were in, where views can be restricted. You may want to clarify that when you book. With an oceanview you have to be ok with a little noise with traffic just outside the balcony but for us that’s fine, we are used to it. Both the ramen restaurant and morimoto Asia upstairs were great, the pool is decent during the day and pretty cool in the evenings. Service at check in / check out was good and the room overall was fine, a little small but so is everything in Waikiki. We may stay again later in the year as we really enjoyed the property, but my one complaint is that the bathrooms are small, like uncomfortably small. It’s not that big a deal, its a small portion of your day but its a design flaw to have a bathroom so small, the counter space was ok for both of us, but one person barely fits, and you have to navigate around the door if its open, you you have to keep it closed all the time.

We thoroughly enjoyed everything about this hotel! It was clean, great location across from the beach literally 300 feet. It has an awesome infinity pool (alittle chilly) and a hot tub with picturesque views of the ocean. I would highly recommend this hotel in the pool staff Jones and Janice were amazing Kudos to the boss at the pool for teaching for folk to be courteous, helpful and polite the pool!!! You have such friendly poll staff, thank you! I hope to be back next January!

All kinds of problems, gave me the wrong room, showed desk clerk the confirmatrion and his reply was "Wrong!" I asked him how it coould be wrong when it was the confiormation I printed out, his reply was "Its wrong" Put me in a room mush less than I paid for. When I got to room, I placed call to manager, "He's not in." left message, never returned call. And PLEASE do not send one of your replies, they send the exact same reply to every compliant sent to them, they always say we will bring it to the attention of management. How about fixing the problems, DO NOT STAY HERE! You are the hodpitalty business, or did you forget.

I booked a Ocean View King room online for a special vacation with my husband far in advance. When we checked in, everything seemed fine. However, when we got to our room, we realized it was a Partial View (less expensive tier than what we paid for). The view from our room was the wall of the next building. A few minutes later, we received a welcome text message asking if our room was satisfactory. I let them know of their booking mistake. The response I got was that they were fully booked and other guests had higher priority (implying they had paid more than we did). I was told to check back the next day, which we did and got the same response - that they were fully booked. I was sorely disappointed that no one from the front desk even gave us a call or offered another option or a quick apology for their mistake. It was quite annoying to receive a text each day to ask about the service, without actually trying to resolve our issue. Although the property is nice, the service was worse than we've received from inexpensive hotels.

Very disappointed the hotel decided to close the pool to hotel guests today (Saturday) to lend out to a private marketing company for their event instead. Front desk staff were completely disinterested in any guest feedback. I can’t imagine the Sheraton or Hilton closing their pool area to their guests for an outside event.

I love coming to Oahu and the experience is pretty much predictable (i.e., nice beaches, weather, etc...). On this trip however I was disappointed with a few items from this hotel. First and foremost check your rates, unfortunately there is an industry standard of tacking on fee after fee - this hotel is no different. My stay was increased by another $100 a day due to these ridiculous fees and in my opinion provided nothing special to account for it. Secondly, the pool is ummm "ok", when comparing to the Sheraton which is of similar price, the Alohilani is far behind the competition. Lastly, staff friendliness is hit or miss, upon checkout I was of no concern to them anymore and not even asked how was my stay. Next visit, different hotel...

I stayed for two nights at 'Alohilani, the place is nice and clean. Walking distance to Waikiki beach, located at prime location. The receptionist and other staffs are helpful and friendly except their concierge. I don't recommend their concierge as they are not very helpful for first-time tourists. We were lost and asking for information about sightseeing trolley or other tour options, the lady at the right end corner was not friendly at all, avoiding eye contact and give little information. The way she answers made me feel stupid. I don't feel comfortable and left, end up asking the valet staff for direction. At the end of our day, this lady kept staring at us when we were just chilling at the lobby. Other than this, the hotel amenities and facilities are great, just go elsewhere for tourist information, don't waste your time at their concierge.

We are on our last night of 5 in the Alohilani, the hotel is beautiful & in a great location, staff are very pleasant & helpful, especially Renee on reception who we met on several occasions with queries and she always went above and beyond to help. The hotel is very clean and modern with large bedrooms, great food, pool area & gym. If we ever get the chance to return to Hawaii we would absolutely stay here again.

Located super close to the beach. Check in was quick and simple. Hotel foyer is beautiful and the enormous aquarium is a must see. Hotel staff was very helpful and would check in with us during our stay to ensure all our needs were met and if they could assist us with anything. I definitely recommend Alohilani Resort -Waikiki.

Loved our 7 days here at the hotel. Rooms are clean and spacious (bathrooms bit small was only downsize). Great location and wonderful views. Friendly staff and great pool area with lots of lounges and deck chairs for everyone. Definitely will go back!

Stayed 1 night, Ocean View room was nice & clean w/nice view. My only problem was I had difficult time sleeping, probably due to the bed was not like my Sleep Number bed at home & pillow was too soft. Everything else was great.

Our girl, Olivia at the front desk is so helpful and went the extra mile to make sure we had everything we and made sure our birthday staycation was special. The hotel is clean and staff is very friendly. The pool can be cold not getting sun in the afternoon but perfect view for sunsets.

We had high expectations. Due to the reviews. The location is ok with easy access to the beach. But make no mistake it’s not a beach hotel. Your pool is in a building on the 5 floor. Small and partial view of the ocean. The rooms are nice and clean but the overall quality of the furniture bathroom and carpet feels like a cheap motel. They have outrageous hotel fees with almost no value. For the same price (not cheap) you can great value at the Sheraton, the Hyatt or many other truly beach hotels in downtown Waikiki. Have fun and be safe.

The Alohilani Resort Waikiki is a must stay at property in Waikiki. First of all is location, location, location. The Alohilani is situated exactly where you want to be in Waikiki. You can walk down Kalakaua Blvd. and experience better shopping than Madison Ave. & 5th Ave. in New York City combined. Plus Waikiki lights beautiful gas tiki torches every night along Kalakaua and Kuhio Avenues. Waikiki is super clean and super safe. The city even buffs the sidewalks with a floor buffer at night!!! Due to the high number of Japanese shoppers, shopping in Waikiki is geared toward Japanese shoppers because they are the real big spenders in town. Japanese tourist shop for the experience of shopping and Waikiki does not disappoint. Forget Rodeo Drive and MAnhattan can't hold a candle to the Waikiki shopping experience and the Alohalani is right where you need be located to take it all in. There are many world class restaurant experiences all around the strategically located Resort. The Alohilani Resort also has the best infinity pool in Waikiki and that is saying something because there are 42,000 hotel rooms within a 20 minute walk and countless hotels and pools. The food quality is very high in pool area and very reasonable priced for the quality, outstanding service and over the top views of the ocean over the best infinity pool in Hawaii. Ask to be served by Janice, Kira or Brooke. Sage, a pool attendant is outstanding in providing a world class guest experience by the infinity pool. Niki the pool experience manager is outstanding but was recently promoted. Chico took over the pool and he has some big shoes to fill to catch up to and maintain what Niki built into a ultimate pool experience on the island of Oha'u..The staff at the property is lead by Matthew Grauso, General Manager, a transplant from New City and heads up the best service experience in Waikiki. The front desk, consiger, pool attendants, even the maintenance and housekeeping are all world class. Jillian at the front desk, Rob & Kana in security, Garrett the belman, Chadwick & Wayne the valets will ensure a 5 star experience. Larry in Housekeeping tended to every need and I was quite impressed with several different rooms I have stayed in. A special shout out to a lovely maintenance and cleaning technician named Mario who keeps everything in the lobby and bathroom facilities in tip top shape. Again the location is unbeatable, the views outstanding the staff headed up by Mr. Grauso is outstanding. Mr. Grauso brings the urgency of a New York upbring with the Aloha Spirit!!!! The price points for the rooms are a great value for the location, service, overall experience! The property also has the largest indoor aquarium in Hawaii 270,000 gallons, three stories tall and has all sorts of marine life even sharks to easily see. Twice a day a scuba diver feeds the marine life and that's when you want to roll your video camera or Iphone. It is important to note I had a delicate situation arise and Brain Lauro, Head of security and surveillance was very professional and followed up exactly as he said he would.For dinner no need to leave the property as Morimoto's Japanese restaurant is on property and unparalleled in cuisine and service. Mr. Morimoto is a famous Japanese Iron chef on Japanese TV all the time and quite famous. He often golfs in the day and arrives at the restaurant around 7:00 Pm greeting guests and allowing photo ops. The price points at Morimoto's are outstanding for the highest quality Japanese food on the island with unparalleled service and views of the Pacific ocean featuring indoor and outdoor seating experiences.  I had a massage on site, it looked pricey until I experienced the magical hands of Jenny the Masseuse and it was worth every penny. It also important to point out this property is owned and operated by Highgate out of New York city and opposed to most hotels and resorts in Waikiki having Japanse ownership this is a US firm. That means money spent at the Alohalani stays in the US economy and is not exported to overseas never to be seen again. Highgate owns six properties in Waikiki alone and The VP of Operations for Hawaii is Kelly Sanders and his incredible executive assistant Maila oversea what I think is the best operating entity in Waikiki. I have been traveling to Hawaii since 1975, have over 250 visits, had an office on Bishop Street and built an undersea fiber optic network to the six major islands. My recommendation should carry some weight. All the Best William Karambelas...

We spent two days and booked an ocean view room with longboard club access.The view is excellent from our balcony and the King room was a nice size. The bathroom in single person only size but modern and clean.The Longboard club offers a very nice breakfast and afternoon food and drink service. It also provides indoor and outdoor seating near the pool area. This area and the pool are on the 5 th floor but are nicely landscaped and lots of comfortable seating. The beech is across the street and was very nice with a break water area for swimming and enjoying the water.Staff was very friendly and helpful.

First of all this hotel is way too pricey for what it is, its good location, very cute inside but the rooms are by far the smallest I've ever seen. Very disappointed with the room, the view was good ,we had ocean view ( which is a partial view )we wanted to upgrade to ocean front but they were all booked for the time we stayed at (12/27-01/9), breakfast at Lychee was just sad, not the best buffet I've eaten. when we checked in the resort fee we had to pay and that was $670 so that was a surprise ( way too much) mind you our package cost us $8600 to stay here w/flights, they have this long board club package which i was at first interested before coming here but my Costco travel said it would be additional 4K, which i said no thanks, and after seeing what it is i'm glad we didn't get sunked in, i think it would've been waste of money for sure. the pools are not heated ( not sure why they claim it is) it was extremely cold for us, The marimoto asian restaurant is very good, we dined there twice.Pros: Location, cute inside the lobby, asian restaurant Cons: resort fees, small rooms, cold pool, over priced.Places a must to eat at while in Oahu :Herringbone, Basalt, Hula Grill, Marimoto Asian, Pf Changs, Tiki Grill, Deck.

Overall, this hotel left a negative impression on me, but I'll start with the positives.Positives: 1) Great location.2) Once we were there, most of the staff were very friendly (even if not necessarily competent).3) Nice lobby (cool aquarium in the lobby bar).Negatives:1) Very small rooms with popcorn ceilings.2) Sliding glass door to balcony rattled loudly for the entire week we were there from the wind.3) Partial-ocean view required standing on the balcony with your head over the railing.4) Not sure why the word "Resort" is used in the name. There are 2 small unheated swimming pools with a small hot tub between them. The hot tub was so crowded that there must be more skin cells in there than water. As far as I can tell that's all you get for your $50/day resort fee. I guess you get access to the gym too, but every hotel I've ever been to has a gym.5) The gym is a separate business and not run by the hotel. I learned that this means the hotel will not do anything if there is something wrong with the gym. The equipment in the gym is very nice, but there are a number of minor issues (towels not always stocked, routinely out of wipes to clean equipment, etc.). The big issue I had with the gym was that we made a reservation for the tennis courts. We arrived to the gym at the time of our reservation and had to wait 40 minutes for somebody to show up to give us the code to get onto the courts. Then the person was totally unprofessional and unapologetic and then loudly talked to the other person working at the gym about my attitude.6) We were a group of 9 people in 4 rooms. One of our rooms needed to have a day added at the beginning of the reservation. For some reason, we couldn't pay over the phone and we needed to fax (fax in 2020?!?!) in the credit card info. Well, the fax line was always busy so we couldn't fax it. So, we were told to call accounting. Accounting never answered their phones and didn't return any of our messages. Finally was able to talk to a manager who put a note in the reservation. Then when our family arrived from China, they were told they could stay the night (after they paid with cash) but that their reservation would be canceled the next morning without our credit card (we were arriving the next afternoon). It was a total disaster and totally unnecessary.Overall, you can do much better for your money. Unfortunately, we booked our trip very late and our choices were limited. This is definitely not a five-star resort, despite the five-start resort price tag. You can do better.

We had never visited this hotel but it was recommended based on renovations completed in 2018. It is simply excellent all around. The rooms are nicely appointed and the pool deck is very clean and attractive. Hot tub was a big hit.But even more important for me was the complete gym. Rarely do you get a full bench let alone bench press, squat rack and full set of free weights. I was able to replicate my entire workout here. Club lounge featured different cheeses every night. Mmmm....And the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. LOVED IT!

The hotel is nice and in a great location. However, when we got there the girl who checked us in said they overbooked and our room type (king, partial ocean view) wasn't available. Instead of offering my girlfriend and I something better she said we would be given a room with two queen beds. I stared at her in disbelief after traveling 5,500 miles to get there. She then talked to a manager and offered us a "free upgrade" to an ocean view room with a king, instead of a partial ocean view. This room was all the way at the end of the hall away from the ocean. I'm not sure how much more "partial" it could get. Looking out from the bed was another hotel across the street - it's exactly what we paid for. I don't see how that's an upgrade, but maybe it is. Either way, that decision should have been made without trying to get us to downgrade after traveling all that way and paying all that money!!! That should be something that NEVER happens. Never. I'm still giving the hotel 3 stars - I want to click 2 but I'm too nice - because it's a great location, other staff were friendly and the gym was really nice.

Emergency(fire) alarm was kept ringing in the middle of the night (3:00-4:00am) and staff didn’t know the reason and said “we are all good. Nothing happened” All guest was super panic and nervous. There were hundreds of guest in pajama with bags at the hallway and lobby at that moment. The day after, nobody apologized it.

Great property, well located but does not have room service and the staff were - in general - poor. From the check-in desk to the bell staff, all the front of house team have a very poor attitude giving you the distinct impression that anything you asked for was too much trouble. Very 'Faulty Towers'. Having said that, the wait staff at breakfast and the room cleaning staff were lovely and made us feel very welcome. Overall though, the front of house staff ruined what would otherwise have been a great hotel choice for Waikiki.

My husband and I booked to stay at the Alohilani for four nights to end our trip to Hawaii. We were looking for luxury given we were celebrating our honeymoon and at the time of booking, we were pleased to find a 'new and exciting' resort that wasn't as dated as some of the original and more famous hotels nearby. Although the entrance is grand and the fish tank wonderful, this hotel lacks charm, service and we were incredibly disappointed to have spent as much as we did staying there. Upon check in we were invited to spend an additional $60USD a night to 'upgrade' our room. Thankfully we had already been clued up about this 'upgrade' process from our Uber driver who explained the front desk staff work on commission if they can convince you to upgrade. As such, and because we had already paid a substantial amount of money for the original room rate, we declined. We were placed in a 6th floor room, adjacent to the pool - the noise of the DJ and the pool guests being able to look directly into our room was not what we expected. Neither was the 'partial ocean view', which was directly onto a carpark and neighbouring hotels. Having phoned concierge, we were grateful to be moved to a room on a higher floor, with a much better view - however, we were unsure as to why this room wasn't offered to us from the outset, given it was the same room rate.The pool has its merits, however it is located in a bad position and incredibly windy. The sun is blocked for most of the day by one of the hotel's towers, so you've got better chance of getting a tan and enjoying the sunshine at the beach which, pleasing, is only across the street. The service at the pool is poor. They offer you a menu upon arrival, but seldomly come by to take your order.We were delighted to receive a 'honeymoon' treat in our room from the hotel (although it strangely arrived at the end of our second night) and were grateful for this thoughtful gesture. In addition, the beds are in incredibly comfortable and house keeping did an excellent job to maintain our room each day. However, truly for the money we spent, this hotel was absolutely not worth it. They provide you with a refillable water bottle to save the environment, but then only provide you with paper cups to prepare tea and coffee in your room...we phoned concierge for additional tea and coffee pods one evening and despite two phone calls, they never arrived. The bathrooms, as mentioned in many other reviews, are VERY small. Our general experience was that the staff are not particularly friendly, nor do they appear to be experienced or trained. Our vists to other hotels were far more welcoming and hospitable. It appears that this hotel, still in its infancy, is learning the ropes. It is not worth the inordinate amount of money (room rates, resort fees etc) they charge.We would not stay here again.

We stayed at Alohilani for 4 nights from 3-6 January 2020. The hotel has two towers and has been refurbished recently. The foyer area and reception are beautiful, with an amazing fish tank in the lobby. We booked interconnecting rooms (2 adults and 2 teenagers - 15 and 13 years). We were on the 10th floor with views of the beach. Rooms were clean and mostly comfortable (bed was a tad on the soft side, but no complaints). The bathrooms were quite small, but we managed. A good place to base yourself for good access to the main strip in Waikiki. ABC shop is just downstairs - we purchased cereal and milk etc. Didn't eat at the hotel at all, so can't comment on food quality. We were offered a "longboard" deal for $120 per room which included breakfast and then light meals between 4-8 including some drinks. We declined and are glad we did as there are so many great places to eat in Waikiki. I'm sure the longboard deal would have been great, but not suited to what we wanted.

Akami was so helpful in checking us in and taking care of our needs. She was prompt, friendly and made sure we were happy with our room. In addition, the cocktails by the pool are delicious and the music is great. Thank you Akami!

The offer higher than average rate but, they still tack on "resort fees" wit no real tangible benefits. While it's not a resort (at least not a traditional resort). They should be honest since the fees or mandatory they should be upfront and included in the advertised price. At least then the consumer can compare their actual rates against other hotels. The stairwells were filthy. When an elevator failed to work we had to use the stairs or wait about 30 minutes. I only had 26 floors to climb... I used the stairs.

At the outset we were greeted by the checkin person who wanted an extra $100 for an early checkin. I have never experienced this before. If you arrive at 9.30am after done 15 hours of flying and a room is available then surely it’s expected that you give it to the guest rather than further gouging them. Secondly the rooms are basic. It’s inconceivable that this would be anything more than a 2-3 star rating at best. The finishes are economy and the carpets are tired and dirty for what should be new. I would definitely not recommend staying here!

Having stayed in Waikiki before we wanted near the main beach & this hotel in really well located to all we needed. We arrived late & were put into a room with two queen rather than a king bed, but the late night reception girl found us a great room overlooking the beach in the front tower which is the better location. Tried the Longboard Club with special benefits which was great but could not see the value for the whole stay. The fish tank & feeding in the lobby was very different & well worth waiting to see. Staff were very friendly & helpful so would recommend this hotel for couples & families.

The diamond head view in 3362 is spectacular, and includes excellent water and beach views. Hotel is aesthetically very cool. But service is uneven, which seems to be from poor training and lack of support. Room and facilities were spotless. Beds are not comfortable and linens cheap. There is no room service and pool area is cramped and disappointing. However location is directly across street from beach and in the middle of everything, which is very convenient.

Beautiful resort, great views, right in the heart of Waikiki. Everyone was polite and helpful, honestly some of the best shampoo, conditioner and lotion. The infinity pool is fun and peaceful, just above the activity by the famous Waikiki beach. The pool area has several couches and at night they light gas firepits by each of the seating areas making it peaceful and romantic. They also had several classes offered free for guests ( yoga and lei making- and a few others)

Hotel is new, hotel staff was nice. Don't go during parties they shut down pool areas and hire private security who may treat you like crap. Pool was too cold to use, hot tub full if kids and musty smelling

The room also not offer two queen sized beds as stated on the room description, they are double at best. The rooms were lovely but the bathrooms are extremely tiny , the toilet is so low to the ground it hurts your knees. Longboard upgrade is not worth it at all , complete waste of money , only offers very minimal good and drinks . Cheaper to go to a bar and out for breakfast. Staff not over friendly .

Nice infinity pool, hottub and kids pool with poolside deck and food service. Gym is pretty good and clean. Lobby, entrance, waiting areas are very nicely done. Convenient on site ABC store and several restaurants, steps away from Kai coffee and more dining, shopping. Self parking with in/out for fee. Location is great, across from nice stretch of beach Resort fee is pretty high, AC is too cold, rooms and fixtures are redone but still feel dated. Balcony with ocean view was nice, but a bit noisy from pool activities and street. No room service (but plenty of options in and around)Good for families

We stayed a week for the Christmas holidays... What I really liked was the ambiance. The decor is minimalist, modern, with big open spaces and chunky furniture. The location was perfect ...buzzing Waikiki but just enough off the beaten path that you had a feeling of escape from the crowds once you got into the glorious massive lobby with its vast openness and cool furnishings. The massive two story aquarium is a sight to behold. On the 5th floor was an infinity pool with cool views of the city and ocean. The service for drinks and yummy food there was on point. The hip style Christmas music was softly playing in the background making hanging out there super nice...We paid for a Diamond Head View Room and got a wonderful bonus of being able to see an expanse of ocean too. From the 34th floor the view was breathtaking. Housekeeping was great. The Longboard Club was great. The staff was great. Overall, we enjoyed our stay immensely and got our money's worth. It was very easy to rent surfboards and boogie boards from two nearby locations. (One on the beach, and one called Moku a block away). And the glorious beaches were a short walk across one street in front of the hotel. Alohilani exceeded our expectations and we would recommend.

Stayed here over Christmas. I booked through American Express travel and it was supposed to include a $100 resort credit. At Check-in they had no knowledge of any such credit but in fairness to them they honored it when I showed them the booking reference from AMEX.The lobby and the O-Bar look fabulous and very welcoming but the “fancy” hotel ends there. Had lunch at Momosan and tried to charge to the room but they couldn’t do it for some reason.WiFi was slow, and the pool was FREEZING cold, not very many people in it. It is an “infinity pool” but it’s not really - it’s on the 5th floor, aside from being cold, it’s facing another hotel opposite, so you lose the infinity effect. The hot tub was always full. I called ahead a few days to add my Preferred Hotels membership number to my reservation, but the operator hung up on me and said “we don’t do check-ins over the phone.” I called back immediately and got someone helpful, I thought, but they never did add my membership number. We booked “Ocean View”, not “Partial Ocean View”, and AMEX also includes a free upgrade if available on check-in. When I asked about it, they said the hotel was full but they an “Ocean Front” room but only on 4th floor, but she said she didn’t recommend it. Ocean View is NOT Ocean View - there was no ocean to be seen from inside the room. If you go out to the balcony and look out to the right you get your ocean view between the other buildings blocking the view.The rooms are very old looking inside and don’t have a central A/C system, each room has its own heating/AC fan mounted on the wall. Even on lowest setting it blows hard and it’s just beside the bed so whoever sleeps next to it will get frozen! Housekeeping cleaned daily and did a good job but because the AC blows so hard, it makes the room freezing cold. We set the temperature to 77° during the day and kept it off at night, but every time housekeeping came they reset it to 72° and Hi, so the room was freezing.The Spa is just a gym with a couple of massage rooms, no showers, no sauna or hot tub, no separate pool.In the end, we used Express Check-out and called a few days afterwards, got the front desk or someone helpful, to get an email receipt, but never got it. Will call again!On the plus side, the hotel is in a great location in Waikiki, but it is hugely overpriced for what you get compared to other resorts like Hilton Hawaiian Village.

The lobby and common areas are beautiful and the location is wonderful but those are the only positive things I can say about this resort. We were there during Christmas and the service was horrendous. The minute we arrived Yoshi in the lobby asked why I had the valet ticket (that valet clearly gave me) and was very unhelpful. While they remodeled the entire property it is still a very old hotel. We could hear everything inside our room (every door in the hallway, the elevator down the hall etc.). There is still popcorn ceilings etc. They did the bare minimum to renovate and it shows. I would never stay here again.

I really wanted to like this hotel, so I tried to see the positive as much as I could. We booked Ocean view but we got told that they could "upgrade" us for $50 a day for Ocean Front. But when we checked into room we found that it was above a very dirty ocean front roof top. We did not spend a day out in balcony as it was ugly view and also stinky from the smoke from homeless sleeping just across the road. When we opened the door to balcony at nights, could not escape the smell of smoke from whatever these people were smoking. It was a waste of 600 Dollars for nothing. It is absolute shocker that the hotel even consider it as an upgrade. Every morning we woke up to the noise of cleaning outside and saw all these junkies loitering about. (for record, the first time I went out with my little son, I had to close his eyes passing the MacDonald close to hotel as there were 4 OD'd junkies getting attended by paramedics).Every day, there was something bad happening just outside the hotel and 4-5 Police cars turning up with the sirens blaring which add to the tension around the place. And we wanted a relaxing holiday. The concierge was a real bad experience. When we were checking in one guy tried to talk us into booking tours and even told us that the others in the concierge desk will charge us far more. Which they promptly did for worthless snorkeling tour. Just do not book any tours through these people. While the reception and bell desk staff were good, the minus is for the concierge experience. The room was good, hence the two stars. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were soft and comfortable, for all the minuses, I must admit they were the best pillows we have ever had in any hotel anywhere in the world.The bathroom was tiny and it was hard even for my 5'9" , 78kg frame to squeeze out of bathroom door without rubbing against the commode!House keeping was good. The rooms cleaned well and stoked up well. The room had a Coffee/Tea maker. And we asked for a Microwaves to the two rooms and received one for one room after few reminders. The pool was very small and virtually full the whole time and we did not spend anytime at all. The Kids pool was good for our two toddlers.I'm still baffled as to why the extra charge "Resort Fees" and other extra charges which add upto almost extra 1/3 of the room rate.

We spent there 3 nights. This hotel is located in the heart of Honolulu, close to the beach. We had room with ocean view, very comfortable. The pool was a little bit crowded and windy.The entrance to the hotel is impressive. The hotel is expensive but I recommend you.

We just got back from the best vacation we’ve ever had and it’s largely because of where we stayed - - it’s SO gorgeous! But what really makes it so special is the service and the kindness from everyone who works there - completely wonderful!! Especially Rani in O Bar, and Jenny and Chico at Swell - they’re so friendly and amazing at what they do. Thanks you guys for making our trip so special!!!!

Great place lace to stay. Actually still here (23/12/2019) until Boxing Day. Would I stay again....yes.....if I was Japanese. We saw it first hand today after already being here for 3 nights.
