We were totally ignored or not cared about and when we interacted with the staff they were so rude but after sitting and watching we realized why. I do t normally write bad reviews or dismiss hotels but this is obvious. Yeah I would stay again but not eat or purchase here.

Now as a someone who travels every week for work. I’m not one to quickly complain. However this was the worst experience I’ve had checking / out. Now when I was checking in ( 12pm) I was told it would be $50. I asked since I had a $55 food voucher if I could swap it for that, she said yes. Now when I went to check out at 6am, I had a lovely trainee girl who was telling me my total costs. When I asked for a breakdown print out. ( so many resort fees )Then the manager came and took over and re printed out my balance which was now higher than the original. She had put back on the $50 check in charge. I said how unfair that was as the original girl at check in said it was okay. And she just rudely said sorry and they can’t do that and I can spend my credit at the bar .. 6am on the morning I’m leaving for a flight. Cheers. She wouldn’t budge and said all staff know this. - clearly they don’t. So after spending $2200 on 5 nights stay and then to be charged $600 in fees alone is disappointing to say the least. So whilst the rooms had a nice view and great location. Was upsetting to have one person ruin your stay especially so close to Xmas.

The property is located in a lively area of Waikiki, but you have the piece and quite you are looking for when taking a couples vacation. The pool area and bar (Swell) is a hidden gem. Not only do you get the red carpet experience (shotout to Andrew for his amazing service) but you also feel like you found the only place that would make you question if you should walk across the street to beach.10 out of 10.

Everything about our stay at the Alohilani Resort was wonderful from the very moment we arrived. Our 2nd visit to the beautiful Hawaiian Islands and our travel agent recommended the Alohilani to us as our previous hotel was unavailable. After our 20+ hour travel from the UK we were warmly greeted at check in by an extremely helpful and professional young man (who's name escapes me). The lobby is exceptional, if you desire modern, wide open spaces with gorgeous design features then you can't fail to be impressed. Our room on the 27th floor had the most stunning view. From my bed I could see across Diamond Head and the sparkling ocean - that alone is worth the room rate. Very comfortable bed, excellent amenities. I loved the walk in shower as opposed to a tiny bath/shower combo and I personally prefer the vanity to be separate to the bath (who wants to put their make up on in a steamed up bathroom?) plenty of towels, plenty of light, plenty of storage. Also excellent coffee maker. Housekeeping are excellent and soon realised we are not early risers - never disturbed us and our room was always spotless on our return in the evening. The resort is so perfectly located, beautiful beach out front, leisurely stroll to the shops, restaurants and other delights of Waikiki. Also easy to catch a bus to further locations and we enjoyed trips up to the North Shore and Honolulu. Pool deck is beautiful, service brilliant and personal. I didn't feel it was windy nor shaded - I guess we chose a better week for consistent weather. We didn't eat breakfast on site but we did enjoy some cocktails which again I thoroughly enjoyed. Upon leaving we had an early flight, the valet were fantastic organising our transport. I loved this hotel, it's style, it's service and it's location - the next time we're in Hawaii I will be booking again!

The hotel is excellent, we had the premium view room of the ocean and diamond head. It was fantastic. We also had the longboard club access which was the cherry on the cake. The staff there was friendly, special shout out to Jonathan, Julie, Go, Zoey, Roschell and the manager Sway!! One of the best Property to live on the Waikiki beach front.

It was a great stay and great location. The Longboard club allowed us to relax in style. The lobby staff and service staff were very cordial and helpful. The aquarium in the lobby is remarkable and delightful to watch.

Very noisy outside couldn’t sleep rooms very plain nothing to write home about but great location. Great view from the room near everything just so you know nothing special about the room. 50 dollar room service fee at day with taxes adds up quick.

My husband and I booked the Alohilani to spend our anniversary there. We had a special rate that included Longboard Club Access, and we had a great experience dining there. The pool area was very relaxing, with no shortage of towels. The Swell Bar had some ono dishes and great service. We also had brunch at Lychee and the food was delicious there as well. I highly recommend staying at the Alohilani!

The location of the resort is great short walking distance to shopping, restaurants and the beach is across the street. I booked this thru Expedia and messaged hotel for early check in. Never got reply. Checking in wasn’t pleasant. The girl behind the counter wasn’t friendly. The But everyone else was wonderful from housekeeping, to parking attendant. We overall enjoyed our stay and would come back again.

I’m local and some high end resorts make you feel welcomed this is not one of those places. Not one person said Aloha from walking through the front door to asking about the pool bar at the front desk it all seemed to be a burden. Rooms and hotel look recently remolded and a very nice hotel but that doesn’t give you Aloha. We went up to the pool deck and it looked like a party of some sort, bartender said the VP of Hawaii was with his friends partying, I didn’t think that sounded right since they were so loud and obnoxious. Wouldn’t go back here while I received Kama’aina rates it seriously lacks spirit.

Wow what an amazing trip we had with our friends in Hawaii. Our stay was even more pleasant due to our wonderful hostess in The Longroom. Shade was incredible! She made us feel so welcome and looked after us during our stay. She was very attentive and not only provided us with exceptional service, but gave us some great holiday tips! As a result of this experience we became friends and had the opportunity to spend a Sunday afternoon by the pool with her. We look forward to continually recommending the hotel to our friend back in Australia. Thank you Shade!!

We travel to Hawaii once a year on average for the past 30 years... So "been there done that", but we have never stayed at this hotel before, booked it because the Sheraton didn't fit into our last minute booking. (10 day stay) We took the long board option and it rivaled the club at the Sheraton, I am not saying it was better because it is very subjective however I personally enjoyed the food and beverage choices and appreciated the presentation. More importantly the staff treated us with great service and consideration and shared their individual personality with us as we did with them, part of the management team who took time to introduce themselves to us "Nick and Jonathan" have a great team working with them. I could name everyone on the Long Board team but it is just better you stay there and enjoy for yourself

Great place for local families. Really took care of us and fantastic location across street from beach.Pool is awesome and DJKK rocked! She's a great DJ and a great role model for young women - really appreciated her taking time to talk with the kids.

We stayed 4 nights. Rooms are on the small side. Interior fixtures feels outdated comparing to the modern lobby and dining area. Staff are friendly. Nice and cozy pool area. I like the longboard club upgrade which gives me access two time a day (6-10 and 4-8) for breakfast, drinks and snacks. The bar by the pool was alright but food just average.

Worst trip ever. The staff does not car what you paid. If you look not rich or if your black they act as if it's a crime for you to be their. Be careful with this place my daughter also fell and smacked her head against the floor. Kiddie pool shut down no warning. Food was not worth it. The service sub par at best. Never again will we stay their. We live in. A world where I do not teach my kids to see color and that day unfortunately they did.

Reserved an Oceanview room with lounge access. What I liked:- Staff was so wonderful- Bed was very nice- Room spotless- Great wines at the Longboard ClubWhat I didn't like:- Oceanfront rooms aren't really oceanfront. There was a busy street under construction between your room and the beach. I guess anyone who had been to Waikiki would have known this, but it was my first time. We couldn't even sit out because it was so loud. - Longboard food is very limited and not very good, and found a hair in my eggs. A couple decent options like the cheese and meats, but otherwise pretty poor, and we had to go out to eat afterwards. Unless you plan to have 4 glasses of wine each for 2 people, the $80 extra per night or whatever it is probably isn't worth it. - Despite having the highest room class aside from suites, the bathroom was TINY. Even if you're used to Manhattan bathrooms. Two people can't use it at the same time unless one is in the shower. I believe they are purposely using a different bathroom photo to make you think it's what you'll get for Oceanfront. There is no closet opposite the mirror as they show on their website- it's like a 5x6' box max, including the shower. Far from relaxing, and definitely not worth the $500 a night, in my opinion. If you get a room on Hotel Tonight or something last minute, and your plans call for Honolulu, then sure. But don't pay $500 a night for an oceanfront room and expect it to a) be truly oceanfront, b) a blissful place to sit out and enjoy serenity, or c) have a bathroom worth the price.
user_name:
phillysilver
New York City, New York

review_body: This resort has it all, pools, bars, views, a night time relax area beside an open fire and a beach over the road the list goes on.It is a bit pricey to stay and eat here but it’s the location, location, location

food is crazy pricey!!!! NOT worth it 2 eggs bacon coffee cooked tomato ( they call fruit) for 2-$80 go down the street nice place egg Benedict home fries, real fruit and Bloodymary's bill only $60room was clean however no re frig., when i ask for the business office was the pool girl waitress says some hotels don't have them lol they have one but local kids come in and play games so getting on one is like pulling teeth

We are totally disappointed with how this once awesome resort has changed to a money hungry grabbing place We booked way back in January 2019 to stay 11 nights Later I realised we needed another night due to plane flight changes, I contact alohilani and they said I couldn't change my booking but I could book another room for the extra night on their site, which I did. I then received an invoice for the extra room it was a non-refundable amount with a no cancellation policy. I paid $aus 455 being the total cost of the room, I was sent a receipt and told the one night would be connected with the 11 nights. When we arrived we are told we only have the 11 night not the 12. after looking the receptionist discovered we had 12 nights, however we owed $50.08 ($aus 72.70) on the room When I asked the question, what are the additional charges for? I was simply told it's just other charges They had actually put the two booking together and called it an “Advanced deposit” so added the additional cost to the non-refundable room as the room price had gone up since we had paid. We were offered early check in for an additional $100 so we said yes. She then said we would be on level 10. I told her we had paid for an up grade to a higher level of 20 above at $15 per night So in reality they were charging us another $100 and then downgrading us, so we waited Paid for partial ocean view and got a fingernail view, nothing like the picture shown in advertising. Bathroom, yes cruise ships are huge compared to this bathroom, but the biggest thing NOT was the toilet. In australia these size toilets are put in our pre-school bathrooms, they were suitable only for 5 and under so low to the ground. In fact the system would fill almost over the edge because the bowl was so small, most of the time you found yourself flushing 1/2 way through your business Most staff were rude, asked the Concierge where the ice machine was, you think I had asked for a million dollars, we only wanted some ice as there was no fridge in room just a cooler One pool attendant was the most horrible, rude person ever who thought he was better, never met such a rude person in my whole life.Everything time you wanted a towel you had to go to the pool level to get it. The first 3 days our room number was taken which is ok but this one was always quite abrupt about it when asking. Then on some of the days when you went to get a towel there was no one there or they would just let you have one with asking for room. On our sixth day when we went into the pool area there was no one at the counter which had become the norm over the past couple couple of days. We put our used towel back and took a clean one and went for a swim in the pool as we were paying $45 resort charges daily to use the pool along with all the other added in charges. When leaving we put our towel back and took a clean one for the next day. There still was no one at the counter. Theb from no where this absolute agro pool attendant came yelling at us, telling us we just couldn’t take a towel we had to be staying there. Well seriously, we are in the pool area it’s a pretty good guess that we are staying there. I said yes we are staying here and gave him our room number, he still kept yelling at us telling us that he was doing his job you just can’t take a towel. I said well there was no one there and we had been staying there for 6 days at that point. He was still being so aggressive I just walked off and he still yelling at us as we are walk down the stairs to the lift. Another pool attendant was laughing really I didn’t think being yell at by an aggressive person was funny. When we get to the lift I said to my husband no that is so rude we have done nothing wrong I’m going get to his name and report him to the  manager. So I went back and politely asked him his name. He wanted to know why and I told him I was going to report him for his rudeness. Well off he goes again, Spitting lava bombs out his mouth. He actually followed us back down to the lift saying we can’t report him he is only doing his job. I said yes but your job is to say, “ what is your room number ma’am” not abuse me and treat us like we are trying to steal a towel. There were people at the lift a Japanese couple who were totally shocked by his behaviour not knowing which way to go just trying to move out his way quickly, they got in the lift. another couple stepped back because they could see how aggressive he was being and like us though he was going to follow us into the lift. We when back to our room, got dress and went to report him. The manager couldn’t be bothered when we asked to speak to him he just sent his assistant. She was understanding and said it was not acceptable behaviour, however nothing was done about his behaviour for two days, as the next day my husband went to get towels and say our room number, this pool attendant puts out his hand in my husband face, seriously. We did got an apology on the Friday with a fruit platter, I think they View the CTV, yet I never went to the pool after that again. This hotel now, people are no longer people they are just $’s and what’s amusing this pool attendant doing his job NOT instead of worrying about people taking a towel back to their room for the next day should be doing something about all the others things that make this pool area horribleStops the drunks drinking in the spa with breakable glasses. Stop them smoking in the spa and pool. Stop people using the pool after 10pm , stop children using the spa these are all rules set up by the pools management yet never kept only one pool attendant in the time we used the pool told some drunks off for smoking in the spaI echo don’t waste your money we paid $6,500 Aus$ to stay for 12 nights the worst decision we ever made, this hotel completely spoil our holiday, in the end we only slept in the badly made bed and made sure we stayed out almost all day, we came for rest and a little bit of luxury and all we got was stress.I agree with other reviews here “budget room” and service at the price of the “ritz” They use to care about people not anymore, give this resort a very wide berth - [ ]

Small bathrooms. Unable to use the WC and close the door. The pool area is very small. There are limited food options for dining. Only two Japanese restaurants in the evening. Why two Japanese? The signage was virtually non-existent. O sign from our tower block to the roof top pool. Ask at reception who were also unsure. Watch out for timeshare sales in concierge area. Little help for Europeans to take excursions. A whole room for Japanese.

Hi We stayed at this fabulous resort for one week In August. Sorry it has taken so long. We are a family of 7 with 5 kids ranging from 13 years to 6 years old. Please look no further. Everything about this hotel was amazing. We had two rooms in the block close to the beach. Rooms are a good size and very quiet. The resort has been recently refurbished and it is extremely clean. The pool area is amazing. A massive shout out to Jones and his amazing team that took extra special care of my family. The sunglass clean service and the free afternoon fruit and cookies was greatly appreciated. Amazing team. The pool service menu is great and the service was outstanding. Nothing was a problem for the team. Well done. We ate in the 2 Japanese restaurants on site - outstanding, We loved them so much we ate most nights at the hotel. Plus we ate 2 nights at the hotel lounge. The kids loved watching the fish and the food and service was lovely. The hotel is in a fabulous location, beach is right across the road and shops everywhere. Plus there is an ABC store in the hotel lobby. The lovely General Manager (sorry forgot his name) even made a special visit to the pool area to talk to guests. We loved this hotel so much we will definitely be back. Thanks again team.

This is a beautiful hotel. We didn’t stay here but walked through the hotel and went to the lounge on the 5th level and the bar/lounge near the main lobby. The lobby bar has excellent seating, a fish tank that covers one entire wall in the lounge, live entertainment and great food and nice beverage menu. Our server Rainy was great! The bar on the 5th level also had live music and multiple fire pits. The resort is quite new and you should check it out. Very impressive!

Location is excellent. We had ocean front with fab view. Staff extremely nice, helpful & friendly. Breakfast at Lychee was wonderful! Bathroom was small & someone was smoking on their balcony. Smoke was awful to smell at a non smoking hotel.

We are enjoying our stay at this superb resort. Excellent location. Very clean room, quiet and elegant. Love their super white bed linens. On Very nice and helpful staff. Thank you Alohilani for taking care of us.

My wife and I spent 4 nights at Alohilani during our honeymoon. The lobby was great, check in was good, the facility is good. However, the service and the customer experience was very poor.When we got to our room upon checking in, we found a sheet of what looked like body hair on the bathroom floor, right by the bathtub. It was disturbing, but I just gave it a quick sweep and complained to the customer service. At the time, the front desk said they will waive 1 night of stay, which we were in agreement for.Then, they say that they will change the beddings every 2 nights, and throughout the 4 nights of stay, they did not change it at all. Also, my side of the king bed was sunk in in the middle, so it caused me to have back pain by night 3. We complained about these things upon checking out, and the front desk person did not even apologize but asked if we brought this to their attention earlier. And I did through their text messaging system, but never got any response from them. They did not offer anything for this poor experience. Then, the person also told us that because we booked through a third party (we used Expedia), they can only waive the resort fee, not the whole night stay that they promised before because of the sheet of hair. This really left a poor taste in my mouth and made this trip not as enjoyable as it could have been if the customer care were somewhat up to the standards.The facility and location are above average overall, the customer experience is poor.

We stayed here for 4 nights and had a wonderful time. Great location that is walking distance to everything. Had a really fun time in Honolulu and the Concierge desk was great with recommendations in town and on the north shore! Zeb at the desk was super helpful, very kind. Jillian at the Front Desk, dropped some knowledge and welcomed us after a long flight. She gave us a list of awesome spots to hit and when she found out we were going to Maui, gave us places to dine, snorkeling spots, beaches. This hotel was great to come back to each day and watch sunset from the pool. Chill Beats at night and mellow fire pits to hang by. We plan on coming back here for sure. Honestly, From the people who greet you as you get out of your Uber to the housekeeping staff that was always quick with a hello, this spot is consistent in their attention to guests, friendly energy, and professional service. Also, the Ahi nachos at the pool are Ridiculously awesome. Loved the udon at the relaxed Mamosan restaurant on the ground level and caught some great Chill live guitar music in the lobby bar with the giant Aquarium. Thank you Jillian, the concierge staff! and the Alohalani, see you soon! Mahalo!

I booked this after looking at almost every hotel in Waikiki. It looked luxurious online and It felt decadent when we arrived. Once we got to our room it was clear that it used to be an old, average hotel that they’d redone and tried to turn into a 5 star hotel. There was some chipping in the shower and a few other spots that they’d overlooked in the renovation. The pool bar/restaurant was a nice space but the menu was very strange, everything was just slightly off. The beds were very comfortable and it was nice to have a balcony with a good view. The highlight of the hotel was the nice pool and the awesome morning water aerobics class! Another perk of this hotel was the lack of children, families don’t seem to book here which is fantastic.
user_name:
jen_travels636
New York City, New York

review_body: The room itself wasn’t anything fantastic (the bathroom was super cramped and the lack of shower door left a lot to be desired). However, our oceanfront balcony was amazing and the location can’t be beat. Attached to two Morimoto restaurants and walkable distance to everything. What I LOVED- the infinity pool. I’ve never seen a pool with the chairs inside. How amazing! I recommend this place!
user_name:
SassyParalegal
New York City, New York

review_body: This is the most underrated sell at check-in. It’s almost like a Disney Club 33 experience when you ask “how about the Longboard Club” and the front desk says “ohhhhh (you discovered our gold mine)” We are talking hand curated cicerone and sommelier picked wine and beer at dive bar prices if you average over two people per room and have one drink an hour from 4-8pm. Add in Keala Kennelly (DJKK)for deep house tropical tracks and this is THE premiere Friday night in Waikiki.

Let me first off start with this is an amazing and beautiful resort! From the time we booked it for our honeymoon from the time we checked out we had an amazing experience. Our room was beautiful with an ocean front view, the pool area was beautiful and O Bar was a nice relaxing spot to enjoy a drink. I will be honest we did not talk with much of the Front Desk staff except Ms. Dailyn who was a joy to work with. She was our go to for every question we had and really made our trip the absolute best! From great recommendations on places to eat and sites around the island she was the go to person! Her friendly and welcoming personality made us feel right at home at the Alohilani. We encountered many friendly staff members throughout our entire stay who made us feel welcome and valued as guests, but Dailyn really went above and beyond to make our honeymoon the absolute best! We had a great all around experience with this property and can't wait to return. We also had a great dining experience at Morimoto Asia - Waikiki which is located in the hotel and every morning we enjoyed a wonderful cup of coffee from Kai Coffee located on the first floor ocean front. Their Kai Latte is AMAZING!! Again I can not say enough wonderful things about our experience with Alohilani Resort, it was a trip we will always remember!

The location was exceptional & the burger place nearby was a hit! I enjoyed having a balcony with some sort of view and I loved being so close to the beach, specifically to watch the sunset. The store in lobby was very convenient. I cannot forget to mention the toilet seat warmer! How is this not at every hotel yet?!

The lobby is lovely and the hotel is nice but it does lack the wow factor considering the price. There are long waits for the elevators, there was a small patch of damp in the corner of our room, no courtesy room to use if flying late and already checked out, balcony pretty small. Quite a lot of children around at the weekend, not enough sunbeds, the pool is in between the two tall towers of rooms so spends a lot of the day in the shade. The most irritating thing is that to use some of the facilities around the pool that enticed me to this hotel in the photos you have to reserve and pay aren't allowed in even when there's nobody in there that's booked. All of this said the beds are extremely comfortable and watching the sunset from the jacuzzi was beautiful. Great that the pool is open til late too.

Modern, fresh resort with everything you could need in a fantastic location. We had interconnecting rooms, with ocean views (very different to ocean front, but still lovely). Convenient to have a guest laundry on site and an ABC store on the ground floor. The pool is not fantastic for kids - too many people trying to get content for Instagram. The pool was named one of the most “Instagramable” in Hawaii to be fair. The gym is also pretty much non existent unless you’re into freestyle dance - it’s just a studio. But for two nights, as a young family, who spent most of our time exploring, the resort was great. Special mention for fantastic pillows and comfortable beds. Thank you Alohilani.

Extremely poor service of cleanliness of the room. Terribly difficult to get in touch with Front Desk. There’s not even a Concierge final button on in room phone. Roach in my room. Location is alright; kinda far.

Perfectly locatedGreat staff at the pool and longboard. On site parkingBeautiful swimming pool and common areas. Ocean views and large room (small bathrooms despite)Longboard access vip perfect treatment

Beautiful, updated hotel with amazing views. Staff is great, especially Dailyn at the front desk. She made my birthday trip so special. Great amenities, great location, definitely would stay there again. Did I mention Dailyn at reception is a godsend? Anyway, the lobby is wonderful, it's close to the beach, restaurants, and shopping. Perfect.

Recently while visiting Waikiki we met a couple ( Bennett and Rani) while out having drinks one night. They told us that they worked at Swell, Alohi Lani and raved about the food,atmosphere and how much they both enjoyed working there. They were very excited about the new renovations and menu and invited us to visit them for Brunch. Due to their excitement we could not pass on this recommendation.Swell did not disapoint. We were greeted by both Bennett and Rani who then introduced us to their Manager. The roof top lounge was beautiful with amazing views and comfortable seating. We enjoyed one of the best brunch buffets I have ever had and then were invited to enjoy their beautiful pool for the afternoon.We had a great experience and were so pleased to see young people so happy to be part of a team. Thank you Bennett and Rani for exemplary customer service, we will definitely be back when we return to Waikiki.

Check in was very smooth, there was occasionally a wait for the elevator but it wasnt bad. Check out was also very smooth and they kept our bags for us for several hours until our flight which was fantastic! The only complaint I would have is that on our 2nd or 3rd night our battery in our door lock died, which locked us out of our room for about and hour. We had gone out to grab dinner and were headed back to eat it on our balcony when the battery died, so we were stuck with dinner and no room. We decided to eat it in the lobby and were asked to move because we had outside food too close to their restaurant. Other than that though we had a fantastic stay!

My overall experience at this hotel is very good. Check in went smooth. My room was on the 32nd floor with a view of Diamond Head which was spectacular. I highly recommend this view or the Ocean. The staff were friendly, helpful and responsive. The food was delicious at Longboard Club, the hotels indoor/outdoor guest only venue that serves breakfast , wine in the evening and international cheese and charcuterie selection plus more. I dined one morning at Lychee restaurant where for $40 you get a delicious breakfast buffet. I also dined at Morimoto's, an award winning restaurant located at the hotel. The dinner was outstanding and worth the price. The infinity pool and outdoor lounge are beautiful and a lovely area to lounge, swim and tan. There are day beds, cabanas rentals and fire pits for the evening time. I had a wonderful relaxing day by the pool swimming, lounging and enjoying the pool side bar service. My only suggestion to Alohilani Resort and Hotel is to upgrade their bathrooms. They are on the smaller side with one sink and the bathtub/shower is older and does not reflect the multi million dollars they spent to refurbish and upgrade this property. Other then that the nightly room rate is on par for a 4 * hotel and I would recommend this hotel. The location is great, right across from Waikiki Beach.

An amazingly good hotel...great facilities and wonderful staff. Wonderfully designed and in a perfect location. Restaurants good and pool and gym facilities excellent. Staff very pleasant and professional and concierge very helpful.

Brillant hotel, top standard and is a little luxury in the middle of Waikiki. Modern, fresh and great facilities with brillant staff. Do yourself a favour and stay here.Views are amazing of Diamond Head and the beach.

Beautiful resort with wonderful friendly staff. The room are spacious and clean with large comfy beds. Close to shopping and restaurants in Waikiki. Beach is across the road. Magnificent views over Honalulu especially in the evening at sunset.

We had an amazing time at Alohilani. Everything about the hotel was beautiful. I like that there is a life area. I will definitely be coming back but next time I would like to bring my whole family to enjoy this hotel!

Everything was awesome except for noise outside the room like the elevator, loud maintenance radio from staff and other noises like pounding on walls and floors. Other than that the O bar was awesome in food and drinks. And the sunset was amazing from the pool deck. Made for a nice photo op. Beds were comfy and bathroom was very clean and loved the bidet toilet. Cable options and the Google chromecast feature made for the perfect way to relax in the room.

I had the most delightful stay at this resort. Not a huge fan of the bigger franchised hotels so thought I’d try something different. This hotel was modern, clean, the pool area was the best I’ve experienced in Honolulu and the location and proximity to the beach was the best!

A very modern resort located towards the end of the waikiki strip. the rooms are quite specious with nice view of the ocean or the Diamond head. surprised to find out that there are not so many amenities in the room - no shoe horn or sewing kit etc. no electric outlets next to the desk at all which was weird. great club lounge on the 5th floor.

Absolutely love this place. This is my third visit and I keep going back because the place is amazing and the service is outstanding. The minute we got out of our car until the minute we left, we definitely felt the genuine Aloha spirit. The pool views are breathtaking. We had exceptional service at the pool from Janis. She took care of us and is so super sweet. Thank you to everyone on site who made our stay comforting and memorable!!!

Nice modern hotel, located close to the beach, diamond head, shops, restaurants... They make an effort to do the best guest service by asking you per sms if everything is to your satisfaction, which gives you an excellent impression, but then when you asked for something it doesn't work out as desired.

It goes without saying that this hotel is beautiful and has amazing views of Waikiki beach and landscapes. The decor is utterly exquisite and it makes you feel great just to be there. However, spite the obvious reasons why this hotel was amazing, non of it compared to the service that I received from two of the employees at Alohilani Resort Waikiki Beach. Renee at the front desk is someone I will never forget. Her service alone was unsurpassed from ANY hotel I have ever stayed at. She made me feel so welcome and as if I belonged. I was staying only for one night to celebrate my daughter’s 16th Birthday and we decided to hotel hop and stay at three different hotels in total. People in Honolulu are extremely pleasant, but there was nothing compared to the care and highly regarded service I received from Renee. I was grateful to have come across Renee at the beginning of my stay as she set the tone for my best expectations of this incredible resort. However, upon my departure I met Nikki Matthew at the pool. Her service, care and regard were mind blowing. I have never felt so welcomed and led to feel peace in my life as we spoke about all my options to find peace and take advantage of all the amenities the resort offered to it’s guest. Between Renee and Nikki Matthews, Alohilani Resort was rated in my option the pinnacle of a five star stay in Waikiki. I have since advised ALL friends, family, and co-workers to join me and stay at Alohilani in hopes they will too have the most amazing experience Waikiki Beach has to offer. Best Regina Jules

Right across the street from the beach. I couldn't ask for a better location. The selection in the Longboard Club was delicious but very limited and repetitive. It would have been nice to see some variety there. The ocean view room we had wasnt very large but the view was incredible (22nd floor) and the balcony is very nice. I did notice one night that the walls must be quite thin as I could hear the conversation going on in the neighboring room at 2 AM which was irritating. The pool cant be beat...infinity edge that faces the ocean. It is amazing. The concierge is very helpful and friendly and there is also onsite exotic car rental that ended up being surprisingly affordable. Overall I highly recommend staying here. You will not regret it!

My wife and I travelled all the way from South Australia to Waikiki and chose to stay at the Alohilani resort. We left the day after our wedding and had a delayed flight straight away before arriving at 1am in the morning at the Alohilani. Arrival was nothing special at that time of the night and unfortunately we had to change rooms straight away because we had a connecting room. BUT after the first night it was honestly the best honeymoon venue we could have ever asked for. There were two staff members in particular ‘Jillian’ and ‘Daiylin’ who both went FAR above their call of duty to bless my wife and I beyond anything we could have asked for. From restaurant recommendations to personally running half a block after us to give us a travel adaptor so we didn’t have to buy one, to refunding us money for missed breakfasts without us even having to ask, to then hand delivering a written note and bottles of champagne to our room, we were treated like a king and queen by these two!! They truly looked out for us and the quality of staff members in itself is a testament to the allure of the hotel. The greatest testament to the quality of the experience was when their computers went down and we couldn’t check in for our second leg of our honeymoon, so they gave us two complimentary cocktails and free appetisers at the bar! Incredible!! Without rambling about the staff anymore - the hotel is a picturesque paradise. The diamond head view rooms are tremendous, the gym facilities are the best of any hotel I’ve been to (deadlifts and squat racks with free weights!!). They have an indoor aquarium (what a novelty!) and a tonne of activities run by the hotel for their guests. You must sign up for the longboard club where you can have unlimited drinks and nibbles morning and evening. A stones throw from the beach front this truly is a fantastic destination for any travellers and particularly couples!! Highly recommend!!

Hmm, where do I start ?!OK, the location doesn't get any better, sorry. You are right across the street from the beach, crazy right? You are in the center of all the action.Upon entering this hotel you are greeted by the valet, my man Charlie works the am shift. You will not find a better staff member in regards to customer service, i promise you that. Even though he grabs your car his responsiveness to the guest is more like an ambassador to the hotel and tour guide if you need. Ask him anything and if he doesn't know or can't find it, he will get you the answer when you return.Now enter into this gorgeous 5 star hotel. Massive open doors to walk through that lead you to the front desk. Lots of staff waiting to help you, if there is a little line it moves quick, this is a very busy hotel for a reason.Ami, is the hostess with the mostess, she is mostly behind the scenes making sure everything is flowing right for the guests. Her official title is, Arrival Experience Manager, but in no way, shape, or form does that describe what she does on a daily basis.I've had rooms in both buildings, all types of views as well. I find them all equally as nice, I am somewhat low-maintenance but these rooms are always clean, neat and well kept, i have always been happy.Great pool overlooking the beach, you definitely have to pull up pictures of this resort. Need to check out the "fishtanks" at the bar, i will leave it at that, he he.Great restaurants inside the hotel as well, I recommend Morimoto, great frozen beer, yep i said frozen, and the Duck is my favorite.I mean I could go on and on, but come here and see it for yourself, you will not be disappointed. i left so many things out so go on the website.Oh, one very important last thing to mention. They have a little secret club here that a lot of people don't know about. You won't find this in other hotels. It's called the Longboard Club. You do have to pay an upcharge, per day per room, but it is absolutely worth it !!Breakfast is awesome, coffee is crafted in front of you, and in the afternoon they host a happy hour with beer and wine. This is not ok wine, it's Caymus and Prisoner (2 of my favorites) plus others, it's for real. It's a hidden value because you will spend more outside and not eat and drink as well. And you can go in during their off times for light refreshments, coffee and light snacks. Take advantage of this perc you won't find it anywhere else. Also, it has a great lounge to chill and get some work done if you want to get out of your room for a while, just talk to SHADE and she will assist in any way.Matt Grauso is the GM for this property and is killing it ! Don't make the mistake of staying somewhere else when you come to Honolulu, Waikiki, Its the only place I stay !

I stayed here once before the remodel and it was ok. Now it's very nice!! Looks way better. The rooms are so nice and comfy!! The pool is sooooo nice and the ocean view at the pool is beautiful. The service at the pool is amazing. Janis was our server and she is absolutely wonderful. Thank you Janis for your awesome hospitality. I definitely recommend staying here. The location and service is great!

Lobby: beautiful. Front desk staff: Beautiful. Pool:Relaxing. Rooms:Relaxing. The trend in Waikiki these days is to charge the most expensive resort feels while providing the least service. Alohilani is an exception. Do they charge a resort fee? I don’t know. I was too relaxed to care.

Aloha, I’ve been stopping in a lot lately for business. The property itself is just fantastic. It’s in a great location and basically brand new. The best part for me however is the pool. I think it’s the best pool in Waikiki and I’ve been to almost every single one of them. I like the pool so much for several reasons. First the water is chilled so it’s very refreshing when you get in and it’s never too warm. Also there’s a Jacuzzi and I’ve only seen one other Jacuzzi in Waikiki. Then there’s the food. Everything on the menu is delicious and reasonably priced. To top it all off the service is just over the top. My server was Jenny and she did a fantastic job. Everything she recommended was delicious and reasonably priced. Nikki, the pool manager is also fantastic. She keeps things fun in a really hip yet super relaxed atmosphere. Then there’s Kelly Sanders in charge of everything. His reputation speaks for itself as every hotel he’s been involved with in Waikiki and on the mainland ended up 10 times better than when he first found it. And every time I visit a property that he used to manage the employees there miss him dearly. I highly recommend this property for those reasons. Aloha

We stayed in Alohilani for 1 night to wait for our transit back home after we were back from Hawaii island hopping. We booked a room with ocean view and King sized bed. Sadly, the room we booked was not available, and the front desk staff said she’s going to “upgrade” us to another room, which would have 2 queen sized beds, partial sea view and on a higher floor. Well, when we got to our room, it was a pretty nice clean room, with the view of the Diamond head and we still managed to see the ocean as we looked to our right. But we definitely did not see our room being upgraded, if not actually downgraded. Our room was on the 26th floor, the highest floor of the building was 39th if I remembered correctly, and our room was directly facing some other hotel balconies actually, so I didn’t really get the “higher floor” part. We felt a bit disappointed at the hotel’s effort to make up for not fulfilling our requests at all - the King sized bed and ocean view, which are pretty much everything we booked and paid for.And what’s more, the next morning my husband got text messages for 3 credit card payments to the hotel, one is USD 200 something, one is USD 500 something and one is 20 something which we presumed to be the tax. Geez, we were only staying for one night in a basic room, and then charging us USD 700 something? So we went to the front desk to ask, only to find out the hotel wrongly charged us for the price of staying in an upgraded suite: first we did not stay in a suite, second I don’t think our room had been upgraded from my previous description and third, what kind of hotel asks guests to pay for upgrade fees when they cannot offer the room the guests requested in the first place? If my husband did not have that text messaging service, and did not ask for a receipt, we could have just unknowingly left Hawaii with the overcharge. I am sure this did not happen often but somehow it occured to us. Anyway we appreciated the staff who helped us amend the bill and waive our resort amenity fee as a courtesy. Still, Alohilani’s location is excellent, the price is alright for a hotel at the Waikiki beachfront, the room is clean and reasonably spacious. We just felt there were a bit too much hiccups for a one night stay and we had better experiences with its neighbouring resort.

We stayed here for one night on the last night of our honeymoon after a week in Maui staying in lovely small guesthouses. We thought a night in a luxury resort would be a special treat to end the trip. It was just one bad experience after the other and I feel totally ripped off. Maybe I am just not used to the resort lifestyle and was ignorant of what happens in this sort of hotel. I felt bewildered at no information given or any sort of hospitality. It’s like you had to have been there before to know what to do. The manager did take the drinks we had off the bill to apologise, and also the *amenity fee* for the one dip in the pool (which we didn’t realise we had to pay extra for)...On check in, the person greeting us hardly made any eye contact and it was really unwelcoming. I’ve wanted to come to Honolulu and Hawaii for years! It was so rude. The signage was really bad and some signage is just in Japanese with no English at all so wayfinding was really difficult and there was no information in the room about where to go or what time things open/close. Nobody told us about breakfast options, we had to look on the website. We got to our room and yes the bed was a big king size and very comfy. The only good thing. There was a partial view of the ocean in our ‘Ocean View’ room and the bathroom was so basic. Like a Travelodge with an electronic toilet (which didn’t work). Not to mention scolding myself on the shower when I went to turn it off because there was no signage at all and I must have flipped it the wrong way. There were no bath robes, so you have to walk across the lobby to the other tower of the hotel to get to the pool with no robe or fully clothed. I thought there’d be a discreet way to get there without walking past front desk in your costume! I wanted to have a dip in the infinity pool the morning before we had to check out. After trying to find out what time the pool opens (not on the website, no signage on the room floors or elevator, nobody answers at concierge desk) Only to find an aqua fit class with pumping music at 8:30am. It was just so not what we were expecting. Not relaxing luxurious and enjoyable at all. I think they rest on the laurels of the location...I felt like a second class guest and it was not a nice ending to our honeymoon. We didn’t stay for breakfast which was €30 each for continental buffet (with no view).On the other hand, Marimoto restaurant was fantastic and we had great customer service there, and great food.

We were put here by Diamond Resorts; their other property in Waikiki was finishing up a refurbishment. Glad they did! This was a great location, staff very helpful, right on the beach and easy to walk up the street to the International Marketplace or one of the great restaurants on Kalakakua Ave. Our room had a wonderful full of Diamond Head (just as they had promised). We'd like to stay here again, please!

We were so excited and hopeful about this resort. Over 30 minutes for check in even tho there were only 2 couples ahead of us. Check in staff were friendly and nice. Got to our room. Hmmmm. King Beach room. King bed for sure. Still don’t know how they call it a beach view room. If I go into my balcony and strain I can see the beach. Just expected to be able to open my door and see it. Super tired after traveling to get here so wanted to order room service. Couldn’t find the menu. Called down. NO ROOM SERVICE available at all. Strike 3. Stains on the window sheets. Bathroom so tiny it would make a cruise ship bathroom look large! Nothing in the mini fridge. Nothing extra at all. I feel like I’m in a Motel 6. Just please find anywhere else to stay. So very disappointed. Good luck.

the amenities and location are well worth it. The view from the pool with the sunset are great for pics and memories. its a super nice area steps from the beach. Ilove the coffee shop around the corner and near lots of places to eat. at night theres a live DJ and projection show. The staff there is great- good vibes. The longboard club is also worth it :)

All I can say is...learn to live outside your comfort zone. The Alohalani Hotel DOES NOT disappoint and is a must go to place if you want to experience great service. Romantic and adventurous. I cannot say enough about this amazing place.

We loved our stay here in October. The staff were so helpful every step of the way. The room itself was lovely, with great views of Diamond Head and the ocean.The pool was a highlight! The Frose was a highlight! the Cheeseburger pizza...actually tasted like a cheeseburger. We had our 2 year old with us and she was treated so well by all the staff at the resort. We will definitely be back! Thanks again

Beautiful, hip, exciting yet easy. Love the vibe of this property with soft activities like jewelery making class in the boutique. Amazing staff , each and everyone from room staff to the check in ALL extremly friendly.

“Rarely does Beautiful Aloha and Friendly Business come together so seamlessly”From bell desk to their C-Suite everyone is emoting Aloha and fulfilling promised is unparalleled hospitality and class. Whether for a vacation, staycation, or event: the Alohilani Is truly exemplary. If you happen to meet Kelly their leader tell him Paul says “Aloha!!!” We’re all looking forward to going back to the Alohilani again ASAP!

Great location. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Easy access to many locations. Just few steps from Waikiki beach. Very close to a trolly and city bus stops. Pool is very nice and romantic. Bathroom very comfortable with its washlet which is rare in Hawaii.

Great hotel close to the beach and Diamond Head. Lots of shopping and beach activities within walking distance. Clean and tastefully decorated hotel with a gorgeous pool area. The double queen room with a view of the beach and Diamond Head was perfect.

first time to Hawaii, and stayed at the best Resort, Alohilani right on Waikiki beach. It has it all. Location, pool, food, room/view, vibe. Great for couples. Enjoy an entire day on the property/ABC.

The pros, location, large lobby, rooms are big, great view....water filling station, I expressed concerns to manager, she was fantastic and listened , gracious & professional. Housekeeping staff are fantastic & they offer a list of activities.Cons, cold unfriendly staff, washrooms are as plain and small as they say, can’t leave things on balcony: pigeons, 2 schools there so had to wait in lines for elevators...I prefer character & warmth at a hotel. Staff need customer service training, that’s all!

Our stay at Alohilani Resort was great. Definitely worth what we paid. Would love to stay there again sometime. Rooms were clean and very spacious with amazing ocean views and really close to Waikiki beach

Checking in was a breeze! Paul was fantastic and had amazing customer service from beginning to end. So grateful to be spending our vacation at such an amazing resort! Also, the vibe is so calming and relaxing, aloha chic for the win!

I was attending a business conference at the hotel, and had to check out early due to a family emergency. The director of customer relations took care to resolve the issue quickly. Very satisfied with the way this was handled.

Our family of 3 had a wonderful 10 night stay at The Alohilani. The location of the property is perfect with all the Waikiki action at your doorstep. The rooms are large enough and comfortable. I read a few earlier reviews of the bathrooms being a bit cosy but this wasn't an issue for us at all - we would rather have a larger room with a small bathroom rather than vice versa!!The rooftop yoga at 6pm was fantastic and the perfect way to end a glorious day in Oahu.The staff at the resort are a credit to this place. Shout out to Renee at reception who went above and beyond for us, ensuring our room was ready asap after our early arrival into Honolulu. Overall a great holiday had & The Alohilani was definitely a contributing factor to it.

Everything about this hotel felt lux! I was previously at Kona Island for a medical conference and left it as soon as it was over to see Honolulu. I checked in later than expected due to my flight and Jillian was more than accommodating. She helped me to upgrade my room to a Seascape room with views of both Diamond Head and the Ocean. She said the view would be amazing and she was not lying. I absolutely loved it! She went above and beyond what she was required to do and that was the best first impression I could have gotten of this resort. My room was meticulously clean and I enjoyed the balcony. The hotel is in a great location and I was able to walk everywhere including a nearby shopping area with stores ranging from Gucci, Louis V, to H&M. There was something for every budget.Also, I received complimentary drink tickets to the pool and let me say the pool area was very relaxing with staff constantly checking to ensure that you were comfortable while lounging. I've never had that even when I've stayed at hotels in NYC that cost more than 1000 a night. Kudos to Alohilani for that. Overall I loved it and if I return to Waikiki this will be my go to hotel.

I stayed at the Alohilani Resort for two months while there on Business. First of all you can't beat the location. Alohilani Resort is right in the heart of Waikiki and is across the street from Waikiki Beach. The Lobby is stunning and the oceanarium was quite thrilling. The Staff at Long Board Club is exceptional. Special thanks to Shade who goes over and beyond to make sure any request is met, Kelli, Shelly, Moriko Jonathan and staff for Top Notch service. Your attention to detail, Excellent customer service made each visit special for me and my guest. I always looked forward to returning. It was nice to have a central place to go for Breakfast and evening Pupus. The staff that work in the Infinity Pool area are also exceptional Thank you to Nikki, Jones and Staff for making my pool time fun. They offer great free treats like Frozen Grapes and Cookies. The Infinity is great while a little small I enjoyed it. While the drinks are a little pricey. The Froze is divine and I highly recommend anyone who enjoys frozen drinks to try it. Overall I enjoyed my stay at Alohilani was fantastic and I look forward to staying there again on my next visiti to Hawaii.

I know the title seems a bit weak, but it's just something that we come to expect when paying a premium for a hotel. Room service feels like a core part of any luxury hotel, and the convenience and relaxing nature makes it something to be desired.Our experience was truly great though. The pool is insane and we tried to grab as much pool time as possible over our 7 day stay. The hotel staff is nice, and the view was incredible from our ocean view room.

The pool personnel, especially Jones, Ella, Jenny, and Kaylyn made our vacation so special. Their attentiveness without without being overly doting was particularly impressive. So friendly and professional! My only complaint is that often the infinity pool was filled with lots of young children whose parents didn’t see fit to parent them regarding being courteous to other non-family adult guests. Hotel personnel stepped in once, but I think more supervision from them was more necessary. All-in-all, a wonderful vacation.

Bought a package deal with United Vacations and selected this hotel. Rooms are fine. Pool is a little small but a nice Infinity style. Waikiki Beach is across the street from hotel so it’s nice. Morimoto restaurant is also attached to hotel and a very good place to eat but pricey. Hotel rooms typical setup with bed and TV, balcony is nice. We have to get two rooms because of our family size of 5. We will stay here again in the future. Location is great for shopping and al of the choices for restaurants.

Very small bathroom, no signs going to long board or pool there should be a written sign on 5th floor by the elevator arrow going to pool/longboard no food service in the room no room menu for senior citizen like me

spent 7 nights here; just over the road from Waikiki Beach. Beautiful swimming pool and facilities; the lounge/bar area has amazing aquarium to help keep the kids occupied. Rooms are comfortable and Ocean View rooms gave great outlook

Very well located hotel,great pool and bar area,ocean/city view rooms were great with excellent view of waikiki beach .plenty of options nearby for a drink and food.friendly staff at front desk and pool bar areaOverall a great p lkace to stay.

My wife and I recent stay at this hotel. We were there for 4 nights. The location of this hotel is perfect. It is walking distance to everything. The outdoor is great and hotel is clean.The absolutely best thing I find about this hotel was their pillow and bed. I felt so comfortable in it. I liked it so much that I have email the hotel requesting more information about it so I could get some for myself at home.

They really upgraded the Alohilani public spaces. The lobby, O-Bar, Island Club, and the pool are really nice. Been to a couple of Make-A-Wish events on the pool deck and it is super swanky.Also, Swell Bar on the pool deck is worth hanging out. Especially, if they have a great DJ like Keala Kennelly. The vibe is awesome when she is spinning and the wall is lit up.

Personally not happy: 600$ per night (via Booking with parking ) for a tiny bathroom is too much. Formerly we use to put the toilet in the bathroom well at the Alohilani they put the bathroom in the toilets..... About 2.5 m2 ...... bath included ... obsolete shower curtain and unhygienic, cheap furniture, unthinkable in a 4 or 5 stars. In the middle throne electric Japanese toilet essential for the Japanese customer . Negative point, the main avenue with a lot of traffic passing at the foot of the hotel, the rooms are very very noisy the fault with uninsulated windows, phonetically saving money. We sleep badly despite excellent bedding. No water bottle in the room, the tap is bleach. Endless waiting at the elevators. Apart from that a beautiful hotel, prestigious lobby. Giant aquarium. Nice room. Small swimming pool. Breakfast hall sinister way canteen. The espresso machine is broken: will be repaired in 1 month !!!!!!! It was not a good idea to book here.

My partner and I spent 4 nights here and really enjoyed our stay. We had a lovely time in the O Bar sitting next to the awesome aquarium, eating a delicious supper and enjoying the live music. We also thoroughly enjoyed being poolside in the evening with cocktails, taking in the entertainment as the sunset over the infinity pool. We had a partial sea view which we were worried about and were offered an upgrade, but for US$190 extra per night we decided to stick with the partial...and it was fine. In fact it was a lovely room with super comfy beds and plenty of space. There were other hotels opposite so we just kept the sheer curtains closed most of the time. Would highly recommend this hotel and it’s location.

This is an excellent hotel. We were fortunate to get a room with a fantastic outlook over the beach. The staff are very helpful and always looking to assist wherever and whenever possible. The rooms are quite expensive and for the price paid, the rooms are not very large compared to other hotels. The location is also excellent, close to plenty of shops and restaurants.

The location of this hotel was the excellent- conveniently placed on the Main Street but off towards the end so it wasn’t too noisy.The pool upstairs was clean but the menu was over priced compared to the drinks you can get along the main street of Waikiki with better views. There was also a private event on one night during our stay so all hotel guests were unable to access the entire top floor that day/night.The service from the concierge was pretty average compared to the other staff at Alohilani (the guys downstairs at Enterprise car rental and the valet staff were fantastic!). Unfortunately, the hotel kept charging us twice for the hotel tax (over $400usd) and it went unnoticed until our last day, which is not something you would expect to happen at a 5 star hotel.We thoroughly enjoyed our holiday to Hawaii but will be staying elsewhere in the future.

My family of seven enjoyed the stay at the Alohilani Resort! I highly recommend the LongBoard Club. It was so nice to have a designated place to go for breakfast and snacks in the afternoon. We also had a chance to visit both of the restaurants at the hotel. Our dinner at Morimoto was wonderful. The service and food were excellent! The raman restaurant was good! Two people really enjoyed the curry raman. It was great to stay at a hotel that had been recently renovated. Everything was new and clean. Overall, this resort is one of the best that I have stayed at, and my family has stayed at five-star luxury hotels before. One thing to note is that this hotel does not have room service, which was not an issue for us (We had the Longboard Club to access). For some people, this may be a necessity. If you can get pass the no room service, this is an Excellent Resort!

My family (4 of us) stayed here and met some friends (7 people) that also stayed here. We got the Kama'aina rate with the Longboard special. We really liked this hotel. The Longboard was nice, especially for breakfast. The afternoon was definitely not dinner but worked if you ate a decent lunch and just wanted a small bite to eat and the beer and wine was a great perk. The rooms were nice, two queen beds, shower with a tub. They could do with a few more hooks to hang towels. The pool areas were very busy but nicely done. The staff was very helpful, happy and efficient. If that Kama'aina deal stays we will definitely be back!

We booked a night here to get a night away from our kids! This hotel is wonderful! Great renovation to make it feel very boutique style. The pool area is great and the kids pool is perfect! Staff is friendly and service on point. Rooms are big and spacious with excellent views! Loved our stay!!!!!

Outstanding brunch at Alohilani. The chicken and waffles had a sriracha honey that was amazing. The food selections are unique and creative, definitely not your typical brunch. The cocktail options ranged from a variety of spiked seltzer's and mimosas to Bloody Mary and sangrias. The DJ was not overbearing and had a great vibe. With entry to Sunday Club brunch you also get access to the Alohilani pool-Swell. They have cabanas and firepits available as well. The staff was super friendly. This is a nice new brunch option in Waikiki. $49 for entry and $30 for All Access (all you can drink).

This newly renovated hotel was pretty and well located near waikiki beach. We were given a complimentary upgrade which was nice. The staff were lovely and very helpful, and the room was very clean. The one complaint I do have which almost ruined my stay here was the bathroom situation. There was no real shower just a bath shower and what made things worse was the toilet was right beside the bath. Like literally cm away. It was very squashy in there and the door almost hit the toilet when closing. I felt really uncomfortable showering in there.Other than that the partial ocean and diamond head view was beautiful.

We decided to stay here in our stopover to Vegas from New Zealand.Nice enough hotel, good views and facilities ok.Some of the 1 star comments are right, lifts are slow and there is a long wait to get into your room (but in fairness we arrived 8am and most hotels don't do check in until 3pm so it's not their fault). Staff are fine, some very good (club and pool good examples). Front desk were a little disorganised but that wasn't a huge issue. Location was good for most things.Not sure if it is rated as a 5 star hotel but we generally find hotels outside of Europe and the USA are of a much higher quality anyway. Nice enough and would stay there again.

The Alohiani is an exquisit resort. Friendly, Clean, a gorgeous infinity pool. It is located right infront of the beach. Most all tours pick up here or right behind in the Hilton. You can visit Pearl Harbor for a day, Highly recommend this.Only downside, it is extremely expensive. A simple Maitai was $15! Generally anywhere in Waikiki the food is pricey. The North shore is much better and more beautiful

Alohilani has a fantastic foyer, spectacular pool area with bar & food service and very comfortable rooms . Location is very central. Walking distance to everything you need with Beach right across the road. Amazing and always friendly service from all the staff. A special mention to Jones in the pool Area for very friendly advice and service with a smile. P.S. Make sure to watch the sunset from the pool area. We will be back Aloha and Mahalo

Our room had bugs in it, however we were moved to another room to accommodate for the bugs. Everything else was absolutely amazing, the pool and the giant fish tank were my favorite things about this hotel.

We stayed on a family / business trip and can only report that the staff were fantastically polite, cheery and helpful. The bedroom (twin share) was perfect, clean and tidy and large enough for two adults and two kids - albeit ... when you're in Hawaii, I recommend not spending much time in the room! (Besides the kids normally make a mess ... so put your bags in the corner and go and explore Hawaii!)Why? For example, the hotel pool is open to midnight. Have a splash and then jump in the spa until you get too hot and jump back in the pool!In fact, most days at the pool someone comes around to clean your sunglasses for you ... they clean your sunglasses! .... Certainly can't complain about this ... it was the first time in months my glasses where clean!Add in the ice cold hand towels that were given out for a mid afternoon face refreshment or the free cookies or frozen grapes that seemed to magically appear by the pool .. and this tells you about the level of service on offer.Admittedly, we read some other reviews about Alohilani ... and the negative reviews are nothing like we experienced, and actually are quite funny!Sure in our room, like someone else noted, the bathroom door may be close to the toilet - but if you going to Hawaii to study the distance between a bathroom door and a toilet ... you probably should stay at home ... :) There are many other things to do in Hawaii than study bathroom access ... :)Like ... the location of the hotel is perfect ... walk out of the hotel and bang ... you're in the heart of Waikiki. Walk along the beach front shops or it's a short trip to the local shopping centre by trolley or bus. The trolley stop is literally a couple of minute walk ...Admittedly, some of the cabana's in the pool area are for rent ... just go and sit in the ample seating by and around the pool instead - this isn't rocket science! Or sit right next to the cabana in the pool side lounge area which is absolutely free, relaxed and perfect for a bit of relaxation. Even the pool side food is fantastic, flavoursome and well sized to share if you want to.And here's the kicker ... the hotel is also across the road from the beach and a very short walk to all the surf action. We happily carried our hired long boards from the hotel to the beach and the kids were in the surf for hours!Having said all that, with that level of service provided by the hotel and its staff, life is pretty good. The staff should be commended on their level of service and they genuinely appeared to enjoy their jobs and wanted to be helpful.It's Waikiki beach - so there are a lot of hotels ... but this will be high on the list when we return and should absolutely be in your consideration if your staying in Hawaii.Congratulations to the staff and hotel management.

The location could not be better, across the road from the beach and walking distance to everything. From the moment we arrived we felt welcomed. The staff are so friendly and helpful. The rooms are always kept clean and the service is fantastic. They have a great free cultural tour as well as lieu making and hula you can do. The cultural tour is in the hotel but was so interesting. If you want to relax you have a choice of the Bar with the large aquarium where you get drinks a bite to eat of coffee. Live music of a night very relaxing. The Swell Bar by the pool, you get great service and nice to get cold towels brought to you. Lovely area of a night to relaxIt is worth the money and we will go back.

It would be a challenge to find a hotel to compete with the service Alohilana provides.Alyssa and Rani in particular, CREATED this 10/10 experience, and are being under utilized. Our initial experience of the hotel was taken over the top with Alyssa’s hospitality and genuineness. Rani stopped at nothing to make sure our dining experience was convenient and above par. THANK YOU LADIES!!!!

Had an airbnb fall through the day we were supposed to check in and from the moment we called to the time we left the Alohilani staff went above and beyond to ensure we enjoyed our time in Hawaii.I cant receommend them highly enough

This hotel is a dream, the staff is so attentive and friendly. Anything you ask for they work very hard to accommodate. Some of the standouts are, Andrea, Jones, Janice, Ella, Niki, Kira and Sean. Highly recommend staying here. The light show at night with the DJ alongside the infinity pool is spectacular. Make sure you try the macaroni and cheese sandwich!

I booked an ocean view to stay here but when I got in to my room, it’s in front of buildings. I called guest services thinking there was a mistake, they told me to go out to the balcony to see the ocean. You can see a small view of the ocean and you have to go specific corner of the balcony to see it. So again, I told them I booked an ocean view not a partial ocean view? I was told that it’s their ocean view. Seriously? They finally moved me to a floor higher, the room has a better view this time. Their room is small and especially the bathroom! You haven’t thought of sliding door for such tight-space bathroom? The pool area is nice but the pool water is filthy and water is murky. The hot tub is slippery at the bottom. Small pool overcrowded with kids who likely pee on the pool. Decent drinks and food and Morimoto’s restaurant is in this property which was an amazing experience. Check-in was horrible, unfriendly staff. Maybe they thought we were poor people because we don’t dress extravagantly. Would I stay here again? No. Would I recommend this place? No. Room rates are not worth the experience and room quality. You can also notice in the hallway and elevator area that painting job is half-assed especially the ceiling. Supposed to have just been renovated.

We arrived on Monday afternoon, our fly was delayed and we kind of feel tired from waiting at the airport, right after we got to the Alohilani hotel we begin to feel at heaven, the stuff was wonderful, professional, warm and genuine, definitely we will come back here in the near future and we will look forward to stay at this location once again.Thank you Mr Grauso for making our staying unforgettable! Jorge

From the moment we arrived the staff went out of their way to assit us. Couldn't ever fault them. The location is amazing right opposite the beach but walking distance to everything you need. Food, shopping and all other amenities. The rooms were clean and spacious. The OBar you can get a coffee or beverages and just sit and relax watching the fish very peaceful,has live music of a night. The Swell Bar is great for relaxing as well and the pool is amazing. They have a great cultural tour in the hotel where you learn about the history- really interesting and costs nothing. Has other activities such as lei making or hula lessons. It is worth the money and we will stay here again.

Unfortunately we ended our epic family vacation with our last few nights here and were utterly disappointed in the family "unfriendlyness".It has had A beautiful renovation but lacked any positive vibes from the moment you walk in the lobby. Staff were very sterile and no family friendly environment including the pool. More suitable for the young cashed up Instagram motivated population. Really disappointed to end the trip on a downer.

Great check in process with Dailyn, smooth and seamless. It took about 5 minutes which i love!! Beautiful lobby and room. It is very trendy and clean. The scent in the hallways is very fresh too. They also have two eco friendly thermos containers too!

Lovely hotel just across the road from the beachRooms were clean and spacious Pool area was lovely and the infinity pool was stunningStaff all very friendlyDidn’t try the buffet breakfast due to the price - $33 plus tax which we thought was very expensive

As the hotel has recently been renovated, it is gorgeous. The staff was very welcoming and friendly. We actually had an amazing experience at the pool thanks to Nikki and her team. Evenings are very soothing, you can enjoy a drink by the pool, in confortable seats around the fire, with the wind blowing. The breakfast buffet was just lit. The hotel is very well located on Waikiki, you just need to cross the street to reach the beach. Definitely would stop by next time I come to Hawaii.

Too many homeless people in front of the hotel.Helpful person team.Lovely breakfastNice swimming pool and nice barBeautiful curtainLovely balconNice range of activitiesViser oversættelse til Hjælpsom personale

Myself and my husband stayed here for a few days whilst on vacation. When we booked it stated that we would get a Hawaiian check in experience however that didn’t happened. The check in was like any other check in experience and unlike my friends who stayed in a hotel down the road, I didn’t even receive a lay on check in, which I was very disappointed by. The hotel was clean with a lovely lobby area and the staff were friendly. The bedroom was very spacious and the bed was nice and comfortable. However, the rooms are not very sound proof and we could constantly hear toilets being flushed all night and the noise of the lifts, not to mention people going back to there rooms etc. The outside was also quite loud and we were on the 32nd floor. If you are anything like me and are a light sleeper then ensure you bring some ear plugs if staying here. The pool area was nice with a nice vibe. However much of the nice seating areas they show you on the website area extra and rentable. The pool is also open to members of the public too and it is difficult to get a bed next to the pool.

Amazing experience for my family and I. We will definitely be staying again in the near future. And we also enjoyed the aquarium tank. Hotel overall is a great spot & beautiful. Thank you very much for the stay.

We had a wonderful stay. In short, great rooms, wonderful views of the ocean and Diamond Head. Rooms are clean. The aquarium in lobby is stunning. Pool area is awesome. Staff are polite, helpful and professional including the guys in the valet who helped us with our shuttle. Had a wonderful time thankyou.

This hotel was beautiful! The aquarium, the restaurant/bar and the pool were all great! We stayed in the premiere ocean view room and although it was a bit of a splurge, it was absolutely worth it! Pictures don't do it any justice!The only negative was the bathroom was really small. The amenities in the bathroom were great and you don't spend much time in there but I would expect a bigger bathroom at a place like this.

This was hands down the best experience ever in Waikiki. The service on property was amazing and they never miss a detail. The pool was amazing and the room view was gorgeous. Can't wait for our next stay here!

This is a very nice resort. Even the bathrooms smelled nice. The staff is professional and helpful. I highly recommend this place to anyone wanting to be close to everything and enjoy Hawaii. So many things are within walking distance and car rentals are everywhere.

Shantel at the front desk is the reason ill be rebooking at this hotel next time im back. She empathized with me when I had a horrible experience at a nearby hotel and she found the perfect room for me on a busy night. When she communicated the situation to her associate Chelsey she also was nice. When i checked into the room I was very happy with it. high ceilings, clean, and modern. Once agan will be rebooking.

Stayed at Alohilani for a week and I can’t rate the staff, experience and the overall hotel highly enough! Recently refurbished, the hotel offers brand new, modern and extremely clean facilities. Ideally situated and steps away from the beach and the retail stores on Kalākaua Avenue. Special mention to Jones (working at the pool area) who constantly ensured that guests were greeted, setup and comfortable for a day of sun- lounging! Definitely delivers the Aloha spirit! I will certainly return to the hotel in future trips.

Just returned from a week at the Alohilani. Sadly jewelry was stolen from my room. Security is investigating but have heard nothing....but do not expect to as other than ourselves, only housekeeping was in our room. Housekeeping also straightens your cosmetic bags and meds, if you leave them in sight of the sink. In all my years of traveling, that has NEVER happened , even in the cheapest hotels we have stayed at.From front desk to pool bar, bellman, etc. All were gracious. Morimoto's is not associated with the hotel , merely is in the same building but I totally recommend Morimoto's Happy Hour....tried all the Happy Hour snacks and drinks.....ono.So, if you visit, use the room safe, go to Morimoto's happy hour, lock up meds and cosmetics.Also read previous reviews of the hotel. We were lucky, our room was bug free and clean, no night time arson fires, no rude employees. Or were we lucky, considering I lost two pieces of expensive jewelry.....

This hotel really was a resort, even the locals know that this place has the best pool in Waikiki. The rooms were light, bright and modern. Other reviews say the bathrooms are too small, but they aren’t that small and the layout is clever. The room is a good size, the AC was cool and we often sat on the balcony and took in the view. A highlight of our stay was the pool manager, Nikki, she was so helpful, professional and friendly. It’s the little things that take this hotel to the next level, the icy towels by the pool, the large pull in area at reception, the water filter stations and the surfboard storage. The best coffee in Waikiki is also at the front door, Kai Coffee. The only cons about this hotel are the exorbitant resort fees and the bed felt a little tired (sunken in a bit). The location is great if you want to surf out queens or the learner’s reef. Also across the road are the swimming areas within the rock walls.

We wouldn’t describe it as a resort, more a city block property close to the beach. To get from the hotel to a very narrow and very busy part of the beach, and then behind surf breakers, think salt water pool levels of exitement, requires crossing a three lane road.
