The police station folks near the beach seems to know some of the more colourful hangers-out by name. Didn’t observe any book ‘em Danos. On arrival there was an excellent street market on. The area is quite noisy so we slept with airco on - set fan to low for silence, it has a degrees C or F choice in terms of temp - and balcony door closed. Minibar was empty, ice machine near the lifts. Bell boy very helpfully filled up ice bucket after dropping off our luggage.Powerpoints easily accessible but the USB ones didn’t seem to provide lotsa juice. (Probably adequate for a mobile phone, if not a digital camera. Our own multi-plug travel powerboard with regular power plug points and USB ports seemed much faster.)Well laid out room. Enough storage. Good sized safe.Simple lighting controls. Comfortable loungey chair inside, table with chairs, and balcony chairs. No hooks or stand for drying beachwear.I can’t remember any issues with Wi-Fi (using Net Analyzer on an iPad fifth gen speed showed as 18.5/ 5.1 Mbps, Speedtest showed 18.9/ 18.5 Mbps, ping 4 ms, jitter fine, service is by SystemMetrics/ “Hawaiian Telecom 2”).Never switched on the TV (no Apple/ Google/ Roku streaming devices or HDMI cable).The facilities appear new and in good condition. Though when they say ocean view, check exactly what is meant. There’s essentially left side, ‘premium’ front and right side ocean view. I’d say ours had about a 60 degrees view so nothing to sneeze at.In our case we got a top floor room facing away from Diamond Head, beautiful sunsets. Having requested a room away from the lifts, we got one right outside the lift unfortunately, no double doors so can hear the lift bell clearly, though no in between rooms noise (could be drowned out by noise outside), despite a mid to late afternoon check in.No bathrobes. Automated throne in bathroom had a non working battery-powered control unit which wasn’t addressed during our five day stay despite leaving a note for housekeeping. Traditional manual flush worked fine, :).The shower pressure/ spray is quite good but makes a bit of a mess. The little ledge for shampoo/ conditioner/ face wash etc is too small. Only one hook for a towel on the back of the door, towel rack too small for towel, face towel, face cloth etc. Housekeeping solid.Pool area on level 5 is very comfortable and connects to the other tower too. Image projections from tower next door on side of tower very Limerocket like. Service friendly and quick. Lobby lounge and bar is unique because of its large aquarium.Restaurant Morimoto Asia - recommended, but tell them if you are enjoying the experience so as not to rush you through - is now part of this complex. Other than that we used local coffee places to refill our keep cups or have breakfast. In terms of food and beverage we picked locations with unimpeded beach views (see hotels below).Concierge seemed to have some untrained folks. (Weeks before arrival email to hotel about best car service or help booking one never got a response.Seriously would AVOID the Roberts Hawaii dot com Yellow ‘Express’ airport to shuttle service recommended on hotel website, for what would be a 30 minute tax ride, took 2.5 hours and they couldn’t find our reservation on two/ three iPads and one Macbook, airco did not work, had luggage in the aisle and they stopped at 4 to 5 hotels along the way, though they did provide a refund, so hopefully this was a one off stuff up.)Usual though pricey valet parking.The Hyatt a street away has a Hertz car rental a level above the ground floor in the arcade, and putting “car rental” into Google Maps showed a variety of others from full service to low coast to exotic. There are quite a few shops on the stretch, or at essentially flash Ana Moana Centre a trolley ride or walk away, and there are a range of outlet malls on the other side of Honolulu (say 20 to 30 minutes drive).There are lotsa activities in the area, including Catamaran sunset cruises right off the beach.Highly recommend Diamond Head walk in the early morning before it gets too busy or hot (even in Sep it was 30+C, walkable or 15 minute drive), and the aviation museum at formerly Barbers Point Naval Air Station/ Jeff Rogers Field (half an hour by car), Pearl Harbour area, Northcoast and Southeast coast (though there seem to be a quite a few people permanently living in campers/ vans/ tents). We stayed at this property after time at Oahu’s Northshore, and then the Big Island of Hawaii. The area has a vast range of accommodation. On this stretch we really like the Halekulani/ LHW (more private, includes the House without a Key) or Moana (busy beach, Banyan Tree, great outlets, excellent service). Overall Alohilani feels more like a 3 to 4 rather than 4 to 5 star so I’d shop around for deals given the wide range of options in the area, and depending on your personal preferences. Between the time we made the booking, prepayment was taken, there then was some confusing email attempt to upsell to a club, allegedly taxes changed on 1 Sep, and so upon arrival there was not just the usual credit card reservation for incidentals, but some further USD160+ amount that reception wasn’t able to explain adequately, let alone provide a prior email warning.

My family and I were on Vacation in Hawaii a couple of weeks ago, and we stayed at the Alohilani Resort! We were greeted by an awesome concierge staff! We were very impressed with the newly renovated rooms and the comfortable beds. We had an Ocean View that was breathtaking, but what makes this place, AMAZING....is the Staff! When we first arrived, we were checking out the pool area, and Nikki (the Manager of Swell Pool& Bar) approached us and began telling us about all of the amenities the resort offered and made a few awesome suggestions of great places we could visit while on the Island! This meant so much to us, being that this was our first visit to the island! We added Longboard access to our reservation, and it was a great decision! Longboard is a new addition to the resort that offers exclusive access to private cabanas and dining areas. We received excellent service from our host Shade V. She was pleasant and very helpful, by the end of the trip, Shade and Nikki became part of our family! We look forward to making this an annual trip! Thank you so much for a wonderful stay to all of team Alohilani!!

Overall stay was good! Front desk need to improve their service especially share warm aloha and smile. I didn't see guest service agent smile in my nights of stay. However Adrew from pool bar server was awesome!

I am a local resident and hosted a birthday party this past Sunday for my husband and my sister and rented Cabana #5 at the pool. I also got a room for the night as a treat. Everyone had the most fantastic time. The pool facilities manager Nikki was just amazing and treated us like royalty. Ended the evening at the Long Board Club Lounge. The charcutterie and cheese was deliicious and some of my guests got to beer and wine taste as well. This hotel is brand new and very reasonably priced for all the amenties to get. The next morning I took the water exercise class in the infinity pool to refresh after the party. The room I had also had a diamond head view and ocean view. It was just lovely.
user_name:
Catherine W
Honolulu, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Our stay at 'Alohilani resort was wonderful. It was a short walk to the beach, the staff was friendly and accommodating and the quality of their restaurants 5 stars.We would recommend 'Alohalani resort to all of our friends and family

Alohilani Resort is an amazing place to stay! The rooms are very comfortable and the views are to die for, but what makes this place is the wonderful staff. At Reception, Dailyn is just a beautiful delight! She could not have been more helpful nor friendly. Chelsey was also great. Thanks to Monica and Alexsey at Concierge, you were both a great help organising our day trips. I must say, the helicopter flight over the Island with Blue Hawaiian was simply amazing. Now onto the pool.. A massive thank you to Jones for looking after us daily, you are such a wonderful guy. As is the beautiful Kira, your service was outstanding and I knew we would hit it off when we found out we share the same birthday! ❤️ Every staff member we encountered were wonderful and friendly. Thank so much for a wonderful stay to all the team at Alohilani.

We came for a conference and we were very impressed with the accommodations. The rooms are large with beautiful views. The staff at the hotel is extremely friendly and helpful. The infinity pool is gorgeous and the location of the hotel could not be better. We loved the size of the hotel - not too big - it was very manageable. All around a FABULOUS stay.

This hotel was in a great location right down by the beach. Pool was fabulous and gorgeous view from the pool. Room was cleaned nicely every day. The view from room was wonderful. We will return to this location again. Thanks

We stayed here for a week while attending a conference, staff were friendly and professional and the amenities were fantastic. The longboards club was relaxing and I got addicted to the amazing Acai bowls every morning. Location is central to Waikiki and walking distance to main stretch. Overall a great stay.

Staying at Alohilani always is like staying at my home away from home because of the amazing staff. Janice at Swell, in particular, is spectacular and is always so kind and welcoming. I feel lucky to have met her over the course of the last 2 years! Every time I leave, I can’t wait to go back.

After trolling the web sites through countless hotels we selected Alohilani and then have our choice confirmed by our agent. Our stay was made memorable by the fantastic staff. Shade was the host in the Longboarders bar and she treats everyone as royalty. The Longboarders bar is well worth signing up for..... just ask when checking in. Apart from the super comfy beds and well appointed modern rooms the location was absolutely fantastic for us. You are on the edge of the buzz of Waikiki which makes escaping towards Diamond Head area simple. The beaches at this end of town towards Diamond Head are less busy. The hotel has had a major refit so all areas are fantastic. The infinity pool and service around the pool amazing. I would recommend tower 2 which is 1 back from beach road. In this tower the rooms come with balconies. Enjoy your stay.....

We stayed here as part of an international conference and the hotel did an excellent job of embarrassing themselves on an international scale. Overpriced (and I mean ridiculously overpriced), poor service and generally just a very bad experience. God forbid you ask the staff for assistance or if you had an enquiry. Even before we arrived I should have seen the signs when I emailed the concierge twice with an enquiry regarding parking and never got a reply. Guests were arriving from the UK, Australia and Asia on early flights only to be told your room won’t be ready until 4pm at the earliest. With 300 plus guests arriving over two days perhaps it would be an idea to organise yourselves to accommodate the party a little bit better instead of asking weary travellers to sit around for up to seven hours, many with children. Not to mention when we could check in I was slowly losing the will to live as it took SO LONG. I understand the hotel was recently renovated, though you forgot the elevators. There are four elevators servicing a 30+ story building, we spent half of our time waiting for the lift. There was a general joke around our party “the slowest lift in Waikiki”. On the plus side we did get plenty of exercise using the stairs as it was much quicker. Overall the facilities were average only matched by the very average service. I went to use the gym with my kids only to be told you have to be 16 to use the facility, way to promote yourself as family accommodation. Again, they did get plenty of exercise using the stairs instead. To be fair there were a few positive points, the location is very central, the bed in the room was comfortable and checking out of this horrible hotel was simple. With so many other places to stay you won’t be seeing us back EVER!!!!!

We enjoyed our stay at this central Waikiki hotel, which has a rich history with Hawaii's Queen Liliuokalani. It is located directly across the road from the main beach. The hotel, although newly renovated and very attractive, was lacking some local Hawaiian atmosphere, artwork, koa wood decorations and Hawaiian music that has brought us back to the islands many times since 1980. However, the hotel's cultural ambassador, Andria Valenzone, is stepping up to the plate to bring back "what is Hawaii". Make sure to take one of Andria's cultural tours of the hotel! The housekeeping staff, valet and the front desk staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. We thoroughly enjoyed amazing views of Waikiki Beach and beautiful Hawaiian sunsets from our 17th floor OCEAN VIEW ROOM. In my opinion, this is one of the best views on Waikiki! Our room was very clean, comfortable and bright. While there, take some time to bring home a bit of Hawaii from the KOLOHE jewelry shop on the main floor. The proprietor Rose is fabulous and offers free jewelry making sessions for all guests of the hotel.

I very much enjoyed my stay at 'Alohilani. The hotel was extremely clean and tidy. Also, the staffs were kind. My experience at the hotel was memorable thanks to the guest service agent named Chelsey. She was down to earth and professional. She provided personalized customer service that made us feel very welcomed in Hawaii. I will definitely visit this place again. Thank you.

What a beautiful hotel. Pros: Wonderful welcome & such a lovely start to our stay in Hawaii Lots of staff throughout the property Lots of very helpful staff on the front desk at all times Very clean & you can see the property being constantly maintained throughout the day Beautiful design & decor throughout Liked the staff uniformsRooms nice clean and airy Pool area very nice, infinity pool impressive Location excellent, 2 min walk from beach Feels safe Cons: Food and drink at pool poor

We only had a 2 night stay but first impressions were good with a striking lobby with floor to ceiling fish tanks. The room was clean and comfortable with a balcony with a view. The roof top pool is a nice touch but don’t expect to be able to do any swimming as it is very crowded.The hotel enjoys a great central location being only 1 block back from the beach, and close to numerous restaurants and shopping options. An annoying part of the stay is being charged a “resort fee” which appears to be simply a money making scheme. This isn’t unique to this hotel but watch out for it when booking as it adds it the already high cost of a stay in Waikiki.

Not expected before staying - room cleanness - slow staff service - not enough maintenance of bathroomBut we could enjyo very beasutifl room view when sun set,also near Waikiki beach.Hope ohter customers don't take same "unfortunately..."

I absolutely loved this hotel the staff was the best of fhe best.My room was small but nice and clean too. The common area was so relaxing we really enjoyed hanging out near the beautiful fish aquarium. I fell in love with the parmesan popcorn had it for the 1st 3 days of my stay. Now my only negative was the pool I wanted to swim but there was too many little people in it for me to be anywhere near it, sad to say the jacuzzi was also over run with these same little people. Parents must have been kicking back some where cause they sure weren't in the pool with them. I"m just saying.

I have never left a hotel during a stay so this was a first. We checked in late and were given a room on the 39th floor. The room was extremely noisy (sounded like banging from above). The room was terribly musty and it looked nothing like the photos online. We asked to be moved as the noise from equipment on the roof was overwhelming... We were told there were no king bed rooms remaining. We offered to pay extra for any suite available- whether one bedroom, two bedroom or a pent house so we could sleep together during the anniversary trip. The front desk told us they were sold out and all that was available were rooms with two queen beds (not ideal for an anniversary trip). We took what was available since the noise was overwhelming. We were told it was an upgraded beach view room... We walked in and had a full view of the parking lot facing downtown. No water in sight- even if you head your head off the balcony. We went to bed and could hear our neighbor coughing through the walls. We also heard other neighbours cellphones ringing and around 7am we could here housekeeping starting their cleaning service. Anytime the door was shut, our patio doors shook and rattled. This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. For 350$ a night USD and "5 star" I was expecting decent rooms. This should be advertised as a 3 star hotel.

I took my daughter to the Alohilani Resort for her birthday at the end of August 2019. First of all I made it very clear when making the reservations that I wanted a full ocean view room - upon getting there I was informed that the room was a 30 to 40% view and to have what I had requested would cost me another 150.00 a night! Bait and switch. We decided to keep the room but I was not offered any type of compensation whatsoever. At the pool, we waited for over an hour and no service, I finally asked my daughter to go up and get us drinks, the waitresses were just walking around and not asking anyone if they needed anything. This happened everytime we were at the pool, I just was amazed at how poor the service was. The final issue was at breakfast - we waited over 25 min for coffee and water. Then 5 min later our toast arrived. then 5 min later or breakfast arrived while the toast got cold. For that breakfast I paid $75.00 which was outrageous. The hotel is nice, the rooms nice, but overall I would not stay there again for the non existend service and bait and switch I received.

I live in Hawaii and was able to use the Kamaaina VIP rate. It was amazing! Best ocean view, clean room with washlet installed in the bathroom. With Kamaaina, resort fee was waived and parking was free as long as it was self-parking. I highly recommend staying here for staycation for local residents!

I travel very frequent and thought i would write a review on Alohilani Resort.We were traveling in the USA on a 4 week trip and were finishing our holiday in Hawaii at Alohilani. The hotel and revamp looks great and gets you in a nice vibe with the music on arriving. Please keep in mind people you want an uplifting vibe as you are on holidays in Hawaii. We received outstanding customer service from jillian. She went above and beyond to make sure we were happy with our room as we would be spending 2 weeks there. Jillian is a great asset to Alohilani and some of the front counter managers should learn from and be proud of her efforts. Once settled into our room we went to the pool area. We found our little spot away from the infinity pool which we would use for the next 2 weeks along with the cabana. The staff and service at the Pool & Bar were fantastic. Service was second to none. Thank you to Nikki and Jones for looking after us and making sure we were comfortable and sunglasses cleaned daily, frozen grapes at 3.45pm and yummmmm chocolate cookies daily. a big thank you for the amazing service in the Pool bar and friendship to Jenny, Suzy, Mila and Janice. Thank you also to Britanios behind the bar for the great cocktails.Overall a great 2 weeks in Hawaii made better by the staff at Alohilani. We felt special on a daily basis and will be returning to Hawaii every soon and will definately stay at Alohilani. Mahalo

Nice location & Resort, staff friendly and very helpful.Amazing foyer and large fish tank where diver feeds the fish everyday. I would go back as this resort has it all and i am sure if you are looking for a hotel that is close to everything this is the place to try!

The overall hotel experience is great with excellent customer services. I would not recommend dining at Asia, the quality of food is poor, stay away from the roast duck, it is very fatty and chewy. We did not enjoy any of the dishes that we ordered.

Beautiful hotel as soon as we enter the hotel we knew we made the best choice, Best staffCleanIt was a pleasure staying Beautiful pool and nice area to relax with few drinks and love the happy hrs so we could have few cocktails Nice beach area

I checked out after one night because the bathroom was too small, a legit motel-sized bathroom. I had an oceanfront room and asked if the hotel had any bigger bathrooms and was told nope. Other than the bathroom, I thought the hotel was ok. Nice staff, and a decent fitness room and pool area. I thought the Longboard Club would be oceanfront but it’s located on the back side of the hotel, so not really a place to relax and enjoy the views.

We enjoyed or stay very much. We had an ocean view room. Service is excellent. Front desk found out that we were in Hawaii to celebrate my wife B-Day, they sent a complementary bottle of champagne and macaroons in our room.

We had an amazing experience staying in Alohilani ,the hotel is beautiful ,has great location and pool is amazing and we cudnt get enough of it ..hospitality and staff is amazing .I would have preferred the room to be bigger for and a better welcome experience but they still did a great job .
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
TarunMohatta
New York, New York, United States

review_body: Amazing hotel, but children should be required to swim in their own pool and the infinity pool should be adults only. Splashing, pool toys and jumping around is not only unsafe ,but should not be tolerated at a resort of this caliber. This was a major disappointment during our visit as we were really looking forward to relaxing at the beautiful infinity pool, but were unable to with pool water constantly getting splashed into our drinks.

What a beautiful place, I had everything I needed all within the confines of the resort. Very clean and tidy, Also, very close to all the touristy things, (if only I had time) Highly recommend this place.

We (two adults with a 13 yo & 11 yo) spent 8 nights here. We stayed in the shorter tower closer to the beach with a partial ocean view. We had stayed at this hotel (as 2 adults) many years ago when it was called the Pacific Beach hotel. We came back partly because we think it is a great location. Pluses: Excellent location - beach right across the street and you can chose to be behind a seawall or exposed to the open ocean. Umbrellas/chairs available to rent. Waikiki with all its shops & restaurants is in walking distance. The big park, zoo, aquarium and Queen's Surf beach (excellent for snorkeling) are all in easy walking distance.Our partial ocean view was better than "partial" might suggest.Very nice lobby and bar with aquarium. Breakfast buffet has variety & quality (but costly)Hotel is very clean and feels new ( was remodeled not too long ago)Staff are very helpful.The pool has an excellent grillMinuses:The biggest negative was noise early. There was lots of street noise early nearly every morning. A big part of this was apparently trash trucks but there was also landscape maintenance (leaf blowers?) and general traffic. We were 8 floors up. The infinity pool sits on top of a part of the hotel and is quite small. Despite the view it does not have any Hawaiian ambiance. The look of the hotel is "modern" - sharp angles, lots of gray (some may like this but I don't) Valet parking is very expensiveThough we didn't stay in the taller tower we were in the elevator there a few times and it took a long time sometimes to get an elevator.

I am staying here at the moment for my 60 th birthday surprise that my family booked. Well they booked this place months ago and asked if we could all be next to each other explaining that we were coming from aus as a family and could that please happen.Well that hasn’t happened not that it matters that much but we have travelled before and 5 stars we would expect to be accommodated so far out with a booking. When I drove up yes 5 star the foyer 5 star.Then everything and everybody 3 stars Then I discovered how much we payed 400.00 aus for 5 days (580 uSA) For this price I do except 5 star.When booking in we were told on Saturday the pool is shut from 12 noon for a function which is $ 125.00 uSA to go to Then talking to a family that had been here for a week said it was shut down twice from them and they charge you ammenity fees what a joke for what a closed pool.My family choose this because of the pool as we have a seven month old baby and we could just lay around. So because of this we got breakfast complimentary for all of us. We went this morning it is not that good and am glad I am not paying.Go down the street to a nice cafe with fresh food this is not 5 star to me. Well we had to wait for our room we went to the pool area There are little huts to the side we sat in one as there was no couches or seats left. Then we were asked if we booked it said no can we he said yes to then come over with a book and tell us it is $175 .00 usa a day. We had to move out not paying.Then we ordered food from the bar no one told us we had to come back and get it.A girl came and asked did we want to order anything we said no as we have already 35 mins went past so went up to see why here is all our food sitting on the bar cold as you only get it delivered to you if the waiters order it. There is only one overs on at the bar so they couldn’t come and look for a party of seven in a small area not five star. We spent 148.00 uSA for cold food. Not being happy our son in-law complained the front desk and got a credit,but this shouldn’t happen at a 5 star place.The rooms are okay .If I go 5 star in Melbourne and all the places we have travelled the service is sooo much better we save a year to do this and I am not impressed at all for the 580,00 dollars. You don’t really get anything in your room No tooth brush,no tooth paste ,no shower cap nothing really just the 3basic things .You get a plastic pouch to fill up with cold water but that’s only on the first floor. So far I am not sure how it gets 5 star as it is not to me only the appearance. The family are a bit disappointed in what we have paid and what we have got.If you are spending that sort of money just have a look at other Places as I am not feeling special at this five star. I have stayed a lot at the Novotel chain and I would rate that 5 star compared to this. Five years ago we stayed at the outriggers reef on the beach and that was 5 star to us not shore now.

Exactly as expected, enjoy this hotel and plan on staying here every year for this occasion. A very pleasant experience in all aspects. Convenient and centrally located in the heart of Waikiki. Mahalo

The hotel is right across the street from a beautiful beach that is protected with a sandy beach and sandy bottom! The rooms on the beach side have fantastic views of Waikiki! The pool is on the 5th floor and is an infinity pool! The area around the pool includes an open air lounge with bar and food available! They always have cold water with fruit available! There is a good sized hot tub and another smaller pool for kids! They have a water aerobics class every morning! At night they have live entertainment and they project photos of Hawai on the wall of the tower! There is a parking garage and restaurants and conference rooms on the third floor!

This is my second stay at Alohilani, and the pool deck keeps getting better. My spouse and I camped out at the pool for most of the week, and I was pleasantly surprised at how homey they make you feel at the pool deck. In particular, Jones, took care of us virtually everyday and would go above and beyond in making our stay enjoyable. Throughout the day, we experienced the following: we received free snacks of frozen grapes and baked cookies, free sunglasses cleaning, and free mists of body sprays to cool us down. If you’re looking for beautiful views of the ocean and a wonderful place to relax, the Alohilani pool will fit the bill!

Really enjoyed my stay at the Alohilani Resort with everything so central and right at your door step. Rooms were great, very fresh and clean with outstanding views from our balcony. We had a partial view room that gave us great view of ocean right around to Diamond Head. The resort itself offers a great infinity pool to unwind in the afternoons with great service and snacks from the O Bar.All your needs are catered for with the ABC shop downstairs and great coffee at Kai Coffee next door. Just a short stroll to all main restaurants.We will be back here very soon 100%...

We really enjoyed our stay at The Alohilani. It was clean, comfortable, and close to everything. Nothing was a problem during our stay and the staff were all friendly and helpful. Highly recommend to others looking for a modern hotel with all the amenities, great value for money.

This hotel doesn’t deserve even 1 star. It’s the worst hotel I’ve ever stayed in my whole life.1st, we booked with an 1 king bed room but the staff gave a twin-bed room without any mention. So we asked if it’s possible to change but they said just “NO”. All the staffs seem to need an education to be nicer. Their service doesn’t meet basic qualifications. 2nd, the hotel provides 2 plastic tube bottle for water and the water purifier is on the first floor. We stayed on 34th floor so we had to go to the first floor from 34th every single day at the 5-star hotel. CAN YOU BELIEVE??3rd, the hotel provides disposable(paper) cups for coffee in the room. KIDDING ME??4th, about poor amenities. There was no toothpaste, no toothbrush, no shower cap, no shaver, no cotton stick, no comb, no sliper, no nightgown. SO WHAT IS THE RESORT FEE FOR??5th, bathroom is terribly small. It was even not easy to open and close the bathroom door. Furthermore bathtub is extremely small so I couldn’t enjoy bathing there. 6th, the swimming pool is toooooooo small compared to the number of guest rooms which means very few people can enjoy the swimming pool. SO I REALLY WANT TO KNOW WHO GAVE THIS HOTEL 5 STARS???

We had a wonderful time this Labor Day weekend! What a nice hotel. Beautifully done (down to the fabulous body lotion provided—I’ll be buying more); we loved our ocean front room; never left the Swell Pool & Bar; really enjoyed the Longboard Lounge. And we loved our bed. Better night sleep than our own at home!People were super nice, so helpful (a poolside sunglass cleaner-person!) and everyone seemed happy to work there. It was the best staycation we could have had.

Our time at ‘Alohilani was spectacular and we would return there without hesitation. The rooms were cleaned above expectations daily, the in-room coffee machine a delicious treat and the staff always willing to go above and beyond. The pool area is fantastic and the views breathtaking.

This was my our (wife and I) first time staying at ‘Alohilani and thanks to Dailyn, it was nothing less than amazing. Check-in was a delight, as Dailyn not only greeted us with a warm welcome but her positive attitude was very refreshing as most check-ins can typically be robotic, monotonous, and very transactional. Furthermore, upon asking for recommendations around local eats and to-dos, she wrote down a novel (in a good way) for NSEW parts of the island!!! I have NEVER had anyone be so kind and genuine within less than 3 minutes of meeting. And as someone who works with big name clients from a client experience perspective, I am extremely impressed.As far as the hotel goes with service and staff, I found everything to be more than satisfactory. The complaints in some of the other reviews may have some validity but I ask everyone reading this to consider a few things: 1) Views. It’s almost entirely irrelevant what you’re looking at outside your balcony. As long as you’re not looking at anything outright disgusting or inappropriate, you’ll be fine. Get off your high horse and humble yourself. GO OUTSIDE, YOU’RE IN HAWAII!!! 2) Staff sentiment. Having been on both sides of customer experience, your chances of landing a top notch, helpful person is 50/50. Be kind, ASK nicely, smile, and hope for the best. At the end of the day, these folks work hard just like you do and you don’t know what they might be going through in life or that day. They might seemingly live in paradise, but not all that glitters is gold. We’re all human, so we should be more humane. Respect the people and their culture.If you haven’t picked it up by now, let me reiterate that the star of the show here is not the infinity pool (awesome as it is), the aquarium by the bar (very nice to look at), or meeting Miss Hawaii USA (a beautiful soul), it is Dailyn. She set the stage for what has become an unforgettable Hawaii vacay. ‘Alohilani is a wonderful resort on the Waikiki strip, but the aloha spirit that Dailyn shared with my wife and I has been the most surprising delight of our entire stay.Thank you ‘Alohilani, and a very special mahalo to Dailyn! A hui hou kakou!

Great service, super nice hotel, would recommend for families, couples, and tourists. The workers all over from the lobby, to the valet, to the amenities areas is great. The ocean view whether its full or partial, is amazing.. nice to take pictures.

This is our third trip to Alohilani and unfortunately we have been severely disappointed by our experience. When we tried to check in we were met by a front desk staff member who made us feel like we were the last people she wanted to speak to. We were told to come back in half an hour rather rudely as check in was from 3pm. This is the first time we have checked in close to 3pm, our first stay we landed in Honolulu at 7am and the front desk staff were so helpful and nice and even had a room ready for us in an few hours. This staff member even tried to charge us more money for the room even though everything had been prepaid. One of the reasons we kept coming back to Alohilani was the service. We had always received exceptional service from all staff members we had dealt with. We have recommended this hotel to all our friends and family but we will definitely be changing our recommendations. It really is a shame.

Room is gorgeous. Well appointed. The staff though is what makes this place sing! I've traveled around the world and the staff here are easily among the best. Shout out to Helen from cleaning, Janice around the pool, Nikki for making our time priceless. Thank you for giving us a memories. Till we see you all again.

i reserved for a room with CITY VIEW, i dont know what a city view means for them but my room view is facing a car garage from another hotel. soo dissapointed! if you want microwave they charge you per night, most expensive hotels that ive been with, the rooms already equipped with microwave, but alohilani hotel still wants to make money for a freaking tiny microwave. constructions in the main lobby and concierge area that creates soo much nosie causing pain in the ear. they should do this at night when less busy transaction in the main entrance lobby and concierge area. they have CONAIR hair blow dryer, thats painful in the ear because the noise from the blow dryer. as much as i hate CONAIR cause its loud when in use. i should bring my own. what i love most is their infinity pool and the location. you just cross and your there at waikiki beach!

Aloha! We have been staying at The Alohilani for a week and checking out this morning. Our experience has been absolutely wonderful in all aspects including service, quality, food, amenities, location and so on. The staff including management go out of their way to ensure their guests are taken care of. Shout outs go to Dailyn at front desk for welcoming us with a beautiful smile and following up on our stay during the week with a surprise treat in our room!! Lorenz and Monika in Concierge helped plan our activities and gave suggestions to make our trip memorable. Lorenz followed up half during our stay and surprised us with a box of chocolates and Monika offered us her brownie to eat. These folks truly care and personalized the entire experience for us!! Elizabeth, also in Concierge Services, ensured we had the best deals available to us. Good for her! Andrew in the Lounge served us well and made a special list of non-tourist places for us to visit and made great suggestions on where we could go for Thai food. Mila in the Lounge was also fabulous! Joseph and Matthew, congratulations on managing an exceptional team! We will be back and will make sure to tell the world how wonderful our experience was at Alohilani Resort and the wonderful memories you all helped create for us. MAHALO!!

My husband and I took a trip to Waikiki and spent 4 nights at the Alohilani Resort. The resort was beautiful! Everything was very nice and clean. Staff was extremely friendly and hospitable. When we weren’t at the beach, we loved spending time at the pool. The pool experience manager, Nikki Utley, was soooooo nice. She always had a positive attitude and was very welcoming to any help or questions we had. I really enjoyed the water aerobics class every morning. I would definitely return to this resort and can’t wait for my next trip. Thank you Nikki and the entire Alohilani staff for a wonderful vacation!

the 'Alohilani sits at the Diamond Head side of Waikiki which I enjoy as it is less crowded, yet close enough to walk to the other end of Kalakaua. The rooms are large, clean, and sufficient, but the reception, lobby, bar and pool area are amazing. The pool is very relaxing, the deck is inviting.

Check in was the quickest ever experienced . The room was immaculate with great ocean views. Infinity pool, jacuzzi and kids pool were fantastic . Live daily DJ was awesome. Everything including beach , shops at your doorstep. Cu soon Alohilani

I would highly recommend Alohilani resort. Staff are wonderful and so friendly,nothing was to much trouble. Our room was amazing.we stayed in the beachside tower and it was awesome directly across the road from the beach...fantastic resort

We stayed there 21-24 August 2019. As we requested a full ocen view our rate was like 500 USD - close to the rates of the grand ladies in 5 star hotelerie in Honolulu. But this is the mosz overpriced hotel stay of my life. The so called 5 star product was far from that ratint (did the pay for it? ) The rooms are ok except bathrooms. They are tiny aven smaller than in any no star Motel. Unacceptable. The decor is done a lot with plastic, even the wood is artificial. The breakfat sevred in windowless mezzanine had charge of 40 USD and not even lattes and espressos or oatmeal orders where included, they were all extra. Couldnt belive it A 5 star product has all this on offer included always. Never seen it different. As we didnt like the breakfast we went to Halekulani Hotel a real high class product only to find that their buffet is 39 USD but the quality and offerings outstanding and of course verything included all served on a beautiful terrec by the ocean. What a difference. I dont know how the Alohilani can be so highly booked, To me its max worth would be 200 USD for a seaview. Seeing the clientele there which was VERY casual and even loud I cant imagine that all these people paid 500 per night. So if it was me who paid and not my friend I woudl have sued for a refund. Unfortunately it was a prepaid booking , if not we woudnt have stayed. i dont understand how all teh positive comments came about. Its a mass tourism quick busieness acommodation, nothing to do with a five star hotel .. sooo far away. Dont go. If you have a budget put 150 on top and go to Halekulani or the grand old Kahala to experience quality.

My husband and I came for our anniversary. The location was great! It was close to the beach, close to all of the shops and we could get everything we needed here. The coffee shop, Kai Coffee, located on the bottom floor was convenient in the morning before we headed out for an activity. I would definitely stay here again.

You will receive top-notch customer service at the Alohilani Hotel. Don't look for any extra amenities, however. There is no room service available, and there are no in-room snack bar offerings. Pool is great if you get a spot early on in the day. All staff is extremely friendly. Also, the BEST ramen house, Momosan, is located at the bottom floor.

I sent a private message to the hotel over two weeks ago and never received a response despite following up three times, so I suppose it's time to publicly share my thoughts. I'm shocked that I never received a follow up after drafting this list of errors/missteps for them.Here are several things that went wrong while we stayed at the resort for a week: Insult from bellhop – Someone at the bell desk asked from where we traveled from. When we said we came from Oakland, he replied that he was shocked that we hadn’t been shot/killed living in such a dangerous city. I found the comment insulting and insensitive, especially in light of the recent shooting in Gilroy, which is not that far from Oakland. I thought about the comment the entire stay, especially when walking around crowded Waikiki. Please tell your staff to be more sensitive about that topic. I am appalled that someone in the hospitality industry would even think to make such an insensitive and rude remark to a guest. I did not catch his name. (And, alternatively, I’d like to praise Eddie from the bell desk, who was extremely friendly with us the entire stay.)· Billing error – I reserved a rate that included a $150 resort credit. I scrutinized my bill and noticed that it wasn’t applied and had to take time out of a very busy departure day to clear that up with the front desk. I’m glad I noticed it and received a refund, but I shouldn’t have had to do any of that. · Baby amenities – Before we arrived on Oahu, I’d emailed twice in advance and even mentioned to someone on the phone that we needed a crib in our room. We arrived around noon and were told to come back at 3 pm for our room and I reminded the front desk that we needed a crib in the room. When we arrived at our room, there was no crib. We mentioned this to the bellhop who delivered our bags and he called housekeeping for a crib, which was not delivered on time for our baby’s afternoon nap. I was also surprised at the lack of other baby amenities at a hotel of your price point. We are frequent travelers and most hotels also offer white noise machines and some offer infant tubs (especially those hotels without bathtubs). Our baby was a bit too big for the bathroom sink so I had to hold him in the shower every night.· Inefficient housekeeping line of communication – We had pleasant interactions with the housekeeping staff we’d encounter in the hallway, but to reach them to schedule our room cleaning was quite the endeavor since I had to call the main line and request a transfer to housekeeping. Once, nobody from housekeeping picked up and I wasted several minutes on the phone repeating this process. I’m not sure if there is a direct line to housekeeper and if so, why it wasn’t included on the welcome card by the phone.· Elevator – The wait for the elevators was quite long and because we were on a higher floor, it took several minutes for us to reach the lobby due to multiple stops on the way down. I was annoyed whenever I’d encounter a staff member taking the elevator just a few floors down. Couldn’t they use the stairs for that instead of delaying the guests? Also, the bellhops should use a service elevator to deliver bags instead of clogging the guest elevators.· Lack of service at the pool – I was at the pool every day for seven days and was only asked if I needed anything once, even if the servers were chatting up/helping the people right next to me. I’m not sure why I was overlooked so often. Also, I’m not sure why certain guests were provided chair covers while I was never offered one. Also, it would be nice if your staff would take time to visit the kiddie pool to check on the parents. It was difficult for me to get anything when I had to carry my baby and my gear back and forth whenever I needed a new towel, etc. · No live music – We were excited to listen to live music at the pool during the evening but on one day there was no musician. We were also ignored by the staff there to the point that we left without receiving so much as a glass of water.I'm sad to say that I would think twice before staying here. I had such high hopes for this resort and left feeling quite bitter. I spent time drafting the list of poor experiences for them but the lack of response to me despite three follow up emails over two weeks shows how little they actually value the guest experience.

Our room was small but acceptable. The housekeeper that cleaned our room everyday is one of the most amazing & sweetest ladies we’ve met. We went back to grab some items when she was cleaning and she was professional had an amazing personality. I’m glad we saw her on our floor multiple times. The pool was great! Drinks were pricey but tasty! My biggest issue with this hotel was the check in process. We were only one hour or less early and they had no rooms available. We were downgraded and compensated for it but once we were in the room, I hated it. It ruined the experience for us. Within 15 minutes I called the front desk and had them change our room. They gave us something that was the partial ocean view but it was pretty much no view. However, I was not about to move a second time. Next, the pool was closed after 3 pm second night of our stay for a private event. I was pissed because we picked the hotel for the pool. Fine, went to the beach instead. However, we came back late at like 9:30 and whatever event they had was LOOUUUD. It sounded like their was a Loya boom box in our bedroom. It was so bad we had to call downstairs because our 8 month old son couldn’t sleep. Brings me to the cleanliness of our first crib, DISGUSTING. Second was was ok. The worst pet of the stay is that after everything that we had to deal with, they couldn’t accommodate us to stay an extra night at our initial rate or wave the resort fee at least. On top of that, they wanted to charge us more because we had to move to a different room since there was maintenance scheduled in ours the next day. It was upsetting and not wanting to move our stuff to a different hotel we decided to fly home instead of staying an extra night. Never staying here again! This hotel wants to set an image of a high end hotel but can’t meet expectations. Needs serious work.

Impressive clean and modern fit out. We stayed for 4 nights. Located at the busy beach end near the Duke statue. The pool overlooks the Waikiki beach, with great views. The hotel has a nice glass wall live fish swimming feature in the bar. Quite a large resort it was a little too busy and too many kids for me however we did visit in peak season and school holidays so I acknowledge that this may be avoidable. Easy to find good food nearby and plenty of ABC stores for the essentials. Very comfortable King bed with a good room size. The only grumble is the bathroom which appeared to be an oversight with a bad design flaw of the door only just clearing the toilet. Far too small for a high end hotel and room. Although it was good to have mirror and the sinks outside the bathroom for dual people use at the same time. Special mention of the customer services manager (Nikki I think) who was charismatic, friendly, hardworking (she never stopped) and made everyone feel welcome and looked after. High five for Nikki!!

Maybe my expectation was too high for this hotel, but we experienced some “amazing” customer service while we were here.1. While we were getting ready to head out around 3pm, housekeeping knocked and ask if she can clean the room, I said come back after 10mins. Not even 5 mins she knocked again and rushing us if she can clean NOW B/C SHE IS GETTING OFF WORK! This shocked me because I worked in hospitality field many years and have NEVER experience or heard this kinda thing that rushing customer to go out and let them clean the room.2. If you don’t like to hear the noise next door, go stay at somewhere else. We heard the family next door talking very clearly everyday. Overall, although it has an amazing view at their swell pool, I would still book somewhere else next time we visit. I’m not sure how they train their employee about the customer service, I don’t find any reason I should come back.
Beautiful hotel. Everything seems to be new. Nice room with good balcony.Fantastic breakfast buffe. They made omellets of your choice.Beautiful poolarea overlooking waikiki beach. Very good location.

We recently stayed here and the hotel was very average. It was clean and tidy in the rooms and the housekeeping staff were always happy but every other staff member acted like they didnt want to be there. Everything was a hassle and no one would smile or make it a pleasant experience. We had 5 rooms for 8 nights with my family all staying there and we all felt the same. The pool was very small but ok and not enough sun lounges for when it is busy, myself and my husband often had to share one or be on total opposite sides of the pool. The staff at the restaurants and pool bar were rude and nothing was easy for them, its not hard to smile and say hi to guests but here it was very difficult. No extras in the room such as shower caps or anything.

This hotel pays for being rated 5*. It is far from any 5 star service. the price is 5* and that is it (500$)the bathrooms are the smallest I have ever seen in my life. You cannot move in the bathroom so tiny,cleanliness is an issue, every day a black hair in the bath room. the carpets are smelly and not hygienic.this hotel is made out of plastic and the checking seems robotic. the breakfast is overpriced with 40$ plus latte machiato extra- and the venue appears like an employees cantina. again more plastic than you can possibly like. If I had not paid in advance I would have left right away. the only hotels with class in Waikiki and near are the Halekulani and a bit outside the Kahala (stayed there last time)After one night they moved us to a better room where we were able to smell the menu from the outside chimneys while opening the door. IIalso have never been in a 5* where you have no amenity kit in the bath, no shower gel just shampoo, conditioner and lotion . NEVER EVER. an overpriced joke.

The hotel was clean and fresh and clean. Staff was friendly and eager to please. Bathrooms were tiny but adequate and well cleaned and serviced. No room service was annoying, particularly with some of our family members ill for a couple of days. Food had to be brought in by us. Also no slippers and gown provided as is usual in a 5 star. Otherwise the hotel was well situated and a very nice stay.

Primary issue with our stay was the lack of customer service. Staff had difficulty managing special requests. There was inconsistency with information from days leading up to trip, to check in and during our stay.Other complaint was that we booked an ocean view and would say it should be clearly stated as “partial ocean view” as the view while pretty was misleading at the time of booking. Positives - Very nice lobby with aquarium. Good location, nice gym. Food and poolside service was great.

Extremely disappointing experience here. Instead of receiving the room we originally paid for (partial ocean view King), we were told when checking in that the “category class” we booked was overbooked. So instead of offering us a free upgrade (which is what any respectable hotel would do) they said we could upgrade our room for $500 plus taxes or stay in a city view queen room. Already having spent quite a bit of money on our FIVE night stay and after 12 hours of traveling, we were exhausted and agreed to take the city view queen. The room was a total downgrade in all aspects. The “lanai” (balcony) I paid for? Non-existent. The view? From what I could see out of the tiny sliver of a window was of the top of a roof littered with cigarettes and used cups. The bathroom was so tiny that every time I closed the door my leg touched the toilet. The bed sheets felt like paper. I am a seasoned traveler (for both work and for leisure) and never in my entire life have I been told that a hotel didn’t have my room available and then been downgraded. This room should have listed on their website as the lowest class for a significant discount (I’m serious). Instead, you will not see it on their site, probably because they are so embarrassed they have rooms like this.I also want to mention that we met another couple at breakfast in which the same thing happened to them and they were also downgraded! The scheme this hotel is running is unacceptable and ruined our Hawaii experience. Shame on them. I would never stay here again. Next time I would stay in a well-known chain where they know how to treat their customers and where I know what I am paying for.Shame on you Alohilani. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

The stay was awesome. I slept really great, and woke up even better in the comfy beds that was provided. I liked the batting cage and tennis court,that's a great add on. Price was a little high for the cage but it was fun. The greeting from the staff at the check in was very great. I hope to see you all again. Thank you for the stay

We had a great stay. Everyone was really nice and helpful. They have surf racks that you can rent for free. Nepo Salaga was really helpful with getting the key to the locker back that fall in between 2 walls.

We stayed here for 2wks on our honeymoon and we cannot speak highly enough of the place and people we met. Nothing is too big or too small for the staff, they made us feel really welcome and special. Every morning Julius & Nestor took care of us at breakfast, Jones, Jenny & Nikki in particular looked after us in the afternoons at the pool. Thank you guys.We will miss the place along with the people. Mahalo

Guest service was above par, rooms were clean with a beautiful view. Toilet/shower area was incredibly small. Location was directly across the street from beach. Pool was beautiful, but some nights were packed to the brim. Biggest downside, wait time for the elevators and bathroom size. Overall, amazing experience. Would definitely stay again!

We stayed in this hotel for 5 days and the hotel is modern and well decorated, we like the lobby bar with aquarium. The room is clean and has a view to the beach. Pool area is also great in atmosphere. However, there was a fire in Aug 4th evening at 26 floor, and guests exits the hotel around 10PM, guests heard different voices about what was going on and different opinions from different hotel representative about when we can go back to the room. We didn't feel safe about the situation, and stayed outside until 12AM until we double confirm with hotel service people that it's safe to go back room. it's communication that need to be improved, but other than that, the hotel is good. I agree with other review that the bathroom is way too small ( like half size of normal hotel such as hyatt or hilton) and big people is difficult to get in, but as long as personal security is concerned, this is not my top things to worry about. What do you think?!

Great location, modern and clean hotel. Its a big hotel and if you are travelling during peak periods prepare to wait for elevators, front desk. The pool is small and overcrowded, lots of kids. Walls are thin, we could hear the person snoring next door while wearing ear plugs for three consecutive nights. The resort also has private events and closes the pool with one days notice. The restaurants stop taking orders just before 10pm and there is no room service.

It’s been interesting reading the reviews and the standard replies the management are giving which pay little or no attention to the problems that guests have encountered!Firstly I cannot see how this can claim to be a boutique hotel. It’s huge and overrun with tour groups.We were in the main tower and had a high floor,which was lovely, giving views over Diamond Head, but I didn’t expect such long queues for the lifts all the time. Yes it was school holidays but when they remodelled the hotel they should have added extra lifts to that tower or even a separate bank for the pool floor. The hotel is basically 30 or 40 years old and although the bedrooms have fairly new soft furnishings they have remodelled the bathrooms so that the vanity sink is outside of the absolutely tiny wc and shower room. I have never been on a cruise ship or slept on a train but I cannot imagine anything being as small as these bathrooms ! Also due to the era the hotel was built, the sound insulation is non existent. Not only from adjacent rooms but also from above (despite the 80’s artex ceilings!) and if you are on a lower floor from outside too.The pool was small, noisy and on the 5th floor which also led to aforementioned lift queues. It is a wind tunnel there as the pool is stuck between the 2 towers! However the redeeming features were the Longboard Club, giving a little bit of sanctuary and generally all the staff were very friendly. The location is also good being straight across the road from the beach.

We enjoyed our stay at The Alohilani Hotel...first time. Rooms are nice and clean. Staff is very helpful. Will definitely stay again and take advantage of the Local kamaaina specials. Loved the breakfast buffet.

My partner and I were so excited to spend our first three nights in Waikiki at the absolutely beautiful Alohilani. Our first two days there were so enjoyable. We loved the hotel, the location, and the helpful staff. In addition to planning to return back in the future, we were also remarking to each other about how we would highly recommend the hotel to our family and friends. This was up until our third night.After a sunset dinner at the Outrigger Canoe Club we decided to go back to the hotel for a post-dinner nap before enjoying more of Waikiki during our last night there. We arrived back at the hotel around 8 pm and woke up around 9:45 pm to inaudible arguing outside of our 28th floor room. Within a minute we heard what sounded like the phone. This was soon after followed by banging on our door. My partner rushed to open the door and he quickly ran back in breathless to tell me that we had to evacuate because there was a fire outside. I rushed out of bed and opened the door to terrified hotel guests and smoke filling up in the hallway. When I turned to the left of our room 2855, within 5 ft away I saw a small fire growing from the carpet and going up the wall. Some guests were yelling it was an electrical fire and that we had to evacuate. My partner and I quickly went back into the room to get water to try to extinguish the flame. After trying to extinguish the fire ourselves with water, we tried connecting to the staff on the hotel line, but had no luck getting through. We started to pack our belongings but more guests on the floor began banging on our door to evacuate the building. We then started our descent down 28 floors with the other guests.Once we got to the lobby, I knew it was important to notify the hotel staff exactly where the fire started. I calmly asked a receptionist to step aside in order to prevent any panic amongst hotel guests checking in and those who had evacuated after hearing the fire alarm. I informed the receptionist that there was a fire on the 28th floor outside of room 2855 and that my partner and I had attempted to extinguish it before evacuating. She looked in complete shock and went to phone the update immediately. Soon after I saw a man exit an office near the front desk, who the receptionist quickly went over to meet. He turned out to be the hotel manager on duty that night, and the second person I informed that there was a fire on the 28th floor outside of room 2855. Within 2-3 minutes we heard the sound of fire trucks arriving at the hotel. This is when the hotel manager went outside to meet the first responders. I also saw a valet man go up to meet the firecrews. This man was the third person I informed that there was a fire on the 28th floor outside of room 2855.After 20-30 minutes the fire crew began to exit the building. The hotel manager then announced that the fire department had extinguished the fire, the elevators were going to resume operations, and hotel guests could return to their rooms in the Seascape building. I went up to ask the manager what the guests affected on the 28th floor should do, especially in the case of me and my partner with the fire being outside of our room. The manager assured me that I could get a new room after checking in with reception. I then asked what we should do if all of our clothes now smell like smoke. And he said the hotel could arrange for dry cleaning. A bit alarmed by this response, I went back to my partner to tell him the update. This is when I overheard a little girl tell another girl that there was a fire on the 26th floor. At this point I attributed this to hearsay. As more fire crew began to start packing, my partner stopped one fireman to ask if they determined the cause of the fire. The fireman told him that there was a fire on the 26th floor and that they were still trying to determine the cause. This was when my partner told him there was also a fire on the 28th floor outside of room 2855. The fireman immediately picked up his intercom to report the second fire to the remaining crew. The fireman told my partner that they were not informed of a second fire in the hotel and this was the first time they heard about a fire reported on the 28th floor outside of room 2855. Within the span of the 40 minutes that we first saw the fire outside our room, evacuated, and reported the fire to 3 separate hotel staff, the fire department was completely unaware of a second fire in the hotel that night. The hotel staff had let guests back into the building even before the fire crew were able to investigate the second fire. The fire crew asked us if we would be willing to go back into the building and were all completely shocked that the second fire had not been reported to them. We gave our accounts to both the fire crew and policeman who finally made it up to the 28th floor. A firewoman was the person to suggest to us to try to get a fire discount from the hotel for experiencing the incident outside of our room. The only people who thanked us that night for extinguishing and reporting the fire were the first responders. We did not receive any thank yous from any hotel staff members that night or when we checked out the following day.In fact, when we went to go ask for a room change, we were given a smaller room than the ocean view king room that we had paid and worse it was located in the back of the hotel where the dumpsters were. My partner and I were very shaken up from the incident and restless our final night at the Alohilani. No hotel staff ever came to check in on us that night or the following morning. The only call we got the following morning was from the Honolulu fire investigator asking for our statement. We were never offered a late check out to help make up for the interruption of the previous night. We were never offered a meal to make the next morning’s start any easier. When I checked out and asked the receptionist to speak to the hotel manager, she first inquired why and after learning that we were victims of the hotel fire she offered to cover one night of resort fee. This was the first offer of any compensation and it was barely anything. When the hotel manager on duty that morning came out to greet us, I recounted my concern with the hotel’s emergency response the previous night and shock that the staff did not report the second fire to the department. The hotel manager’s first response after hearing this was, “well I have heard differently and we are still reviewing video footage to investigate the incident.” I had told her that I was not there to get any compensation, I just wanted to share my complete disappointment and sadness with the lack of hospitality, customer service, and common decency to check in on any of the guests directly affected by the fire, especially those who risked their lives to extinguish the fire and save other guests and the hotel property itself. The hotel manager did not show any sympathy or empathy. She did not even ask for my name. She did not provide her card or show any willingness to try to make up for the situation in any way. She then offered to cover the three full nights of resort fee. I told her that when people come to stay at a 4 star hotel like the Aloholini, they come for both a memorable experience and also to feel safe. We did not feel either staying at the Alohilani and even more so after the hotel management’s lack of response the night of the fire and lack of courteous human response the morning after. I asked her if we could at least be refunded for the Sunday night stay in which we were victims of what ended up being hotel arson (two additional nights of arson attacks happened in neighboring Waikiki hotels after ours). She said because we booked through a third party, there was nothing she could do. I asked her to at least try. I have not received any follow ups in any form from the Alohilani hotel since.What started off as a relaxing recharge turned into a complete nightmare to live through. We ended up not being able to sleep well the rest of our stay on the north shore after the arson attack at the Alohilani. My partner and I were both traumatized by the fire and the hotel’s lack of care for what we had experienced and helped to prevent from turning into what could have very well be a much more dangerous incident. In trying to preserve their image, the hotel management failed to recognize that hospitality and customer care are important in both good and bad experiences.

We had a room leak coming from the next floor up and maintenance knocked on our door to tell us the customer on the floor below us was complaining of water leak from our room. We had a leak as well so we let management know and they said they would check it out. They didn’t communicate the next steps on what to do and we just stayed in our room with a soggy carpet. This was never fixed for the four nights that we stayed there so I’m pretty disappointed with management and how things are handled. If you get room 802. Make sure they fixed the issue and the black mold on the closet ceiling or you’ll be waisting your money on a problematic room.

The location of this property is perfect- right across from waikiki beach, the pool is gorgeous- picture perfect infinity pool; the aquarium- soooo cute, but the staff- amazing. Every where I went they seemed to remember my name, asked about my day, etc. So friendly and accommodating. I saw a guest asking a passing by manager for a banana for his grand daughter who was hungry, and she got right on it and hand delivered it herself. The longboard lounge is such a great added benefit- a must for everyone staying at this property- a great selection for breakfast, including build your own acai bowls, and cheese cart for happy hour. I can't say enough how I enjoyed my time here!

We had an incredible stay at the Alohilani as part of our Hawaiian honeymoon. We were upgraded upon check in and found champagne awaiting us in our room! The staff were fantastic with us throughout our stay and the hotel was spotlessly clean. This hotel is perfect for couples and the views of the beach at sunset were superb. We couldn’t fault anything about the hotel and were grateful for all the little extras they generously provided. Would defend stay again!

Hotel and staff are amazing, Was able to check in early which was great bonus, had an amazing view even though it’s partial. Location is amazing, beach literally across the road. We loved our stay. Great hotel.

Had quite a circus getting our rooms - ended up being on three different floors before finally getting rooms, one room we were given was occupied by someone else! Renee at reception apologised sincerely and got us sorted with some breakfast vouchers as an apology - we were all ok with things up to this point. The hotel (i would not describe it as a resort - more of a hotel with a swimming pool) is not boutique as it looks on the website. It is a 39 storey highrise, I would guess the building would be 30+ years old. The room we finally ended up with had a very strong smell - I think some sort of deoderiser to try and mask previous smoking guests perhaps. It took days to get rid of the chemical smell. Very noisey rooms - you can constantly hear all the toilets flushing in the adjacent rooms and from the floors above, along with street noise and noisey air conditioning unit. The old single glazed sliding doors to the balcony didn't provide any relief from the street noise. Room average to below, has been done up, but some time ago and too superficial to disguise the age of the place. Overpriced and overrated. We won't be back!

Booked this place through Costco travel and so was a little disappointed that even though this was supposed to be prepaid, I still had to pay an extra $45/night for resort fees and another $35 for parking. However, this just may be how all the hotels on Waikiki are since parking seemed to be a mess in this general area and resort fees are everywhere here.Despite all this, I was overall was happy with the hotel, their staff, and would probably stay here again given its location and cleanliness. Lobby - Very clean, the attendants at the valet area helped take our bags right away and brought it up to our room right after we checked in, they were very helpful and friendly. They even have a water station in the lobby to fill up your bottles.Check In - Pretty easy, checked in around 3pm at the front desk in the lobby and there was not much of a wait (2-3 mins). A woman named Natasha helped check myself and my family in and she was very friendly and courteous during the whole process. She went through all the different amenities included in our stay and explained how the parking garage works with our rental car. Room - Looking at reviews, seems like it was recently renovated. Had a new hotel feel to it on the inside with a modern look. Rooms were fairly small but I don't think you really get much bigger in this area of Hawaii. We had a double bed room with an ocean view, wasn't directly to the ocean but able to see a majority of it! Texting system - They had a texting system to make sure everything was going well with your stay which was pretty neat, I was able to request some extra towels for our room with this. Staff - Everyone we interacted with were extremely friendly and willing to help and answer all of our questions. Food - Though they don't have room service (which I rarely use anyway), they had PLENTY of options within walking distance so this was never a problem.

Nice hotel with good views for partial ocean view room.Main Pool is always full of children when the children’s pool is always empty.A lot of wasted time waiting for elevators which can be very slow!!

Great location - walking distance to the beach and shopping. Excellent, friendly service from staff. Rooms are small (but that's because it's older hotel). But the renovation is amazing! Beautiful property. Food at the Lychee Cafe is outstanding for breakfast! A bit pricey ($40pp), but they have a great buffet. Definitely worth a try.

I stayed here after receiving a voucher for a diverted flight. When I arrived, the front desk was very kind and accommodating, giving me a room on one of the highest floors. I loved the relatively modern look of the rooms, the quiet surroundings, and the outdoor balcony for fresh air. The pillows were somewhat soft, but the beds were comfortable and gave me a perfect night's sleep. This was an unplanned stay, but I would definitely come here again!

Hotel met all our expectations, great service, super clean, lots of amenities. Convenience of great restaurant at poolside as well as on premises. Cabana at pool was the best. Jenny, our server was SUPER

(1) Noisy Rooms:We stayed in room 2967 which is on the "Seaside" Tower of the resort. The room was not sound-proofed at all. We could hear the next door guests having a conversation as if we were in the same room. Furthermore, there was a child staying in the next room and the child would occasionally scream or cry (and yes, in the middle of the night and early in the morning too). Because of the noise problem, I asked one of the staffs if it would be possible for us to move to a different room. The person told us that there is only "standard room" available and that the resort cannot give us anything "higher." Although we didn't expect to move to a "higher" room, we at least expected to move to a comparable or slightly worse room. However, we were moved to a room 322 on the other "Beachside" building which was a half-basement - we were looking at people's feet and basically left without anything pleasant to look at. Because the staff also waived our resort fee, we decided to suck it up and move on. (2) Process of Moving But what really upset us more was the process of moving. I asked the staff if we could have 20 minutes of time to pack and prepare to move to a new room. However, the staff sent us someone well short of 20 minutes. The person knocked on our door and was standing on our doorway. Although the person did not hurry us, we felt hurried to put away our clothes. On this process, we left a bathing suit hanging in the bathroom. Within 1 hour of moving, I asked the same staff who moved us if there is any way we can retrieve the bathing suit. The staff told us that she will "check" with the housekeeping team. After the housekeeping team stated that they found nothing in the room - which is a total lie because we know we left our bathing suit there - the staff told us that there is nothing she can and will do and that it is highly likely that the housekeeping has thrown away our bathing suit. I do realize that it was our own fault. However, she did not even say she is sorry to hear that or she didn't even show any sympathy. Overall, Alohilani does have a wonderful infinity pool and the original room that we were assigned to had amazing view of the Waikiki ocean. So anyone else may have had a wonderful time in the same room absent the noise issue that we faced. But for us personally, Alohilani ruined our honeymoon. We were stuck in a terrible room with virtually no view and tiny bathroom. Cannot recommend this place.

Great hotel in a great location. Friendly and prompt staff. The pool area is nice it would be better if it was adults only. Lots of kids in the pool as early as 8 am. Maybe because it was summer time and the kids are out but overall it was a great resort.
user_name:
Alwaysonthego28
New York City, New York

review_body: What an amazing place. The rooms are immaculate, clean and spacious. Everyone is ultra friendly and helpful. What a pleasure this hotel was. Will definitely return close to everything and right at the beach.

A thoroughly enjoyable stay with all areas (location, service, friendliness, facilities) of a high level. Only one issue, don't recommend the Medical Centre (Waikiki Medical Centre) to guests - a real rip off.

Rather than describe how disappointed my family and I were with the “ocean view” room that we paid a substantial sum of money for, I will let the photo attached to this review speak for itself. We tried to no avail to seek a happy resolution, and instead the staff insisted that the city/parking lot view is in fact an ocean view room, but we were welcome to pay even more than we were already paying (essentially double) to upgrade to a suite. We have previously stayed at the Laylow in a room with a partial ocean view and though the hotel is not on the beach, the view was much better than what the Alohilani calls an “ocean view,” (plus the hotel and staff there are simply superb, which I can’t say about the Alohani). I have nothing against a city view, but if the Alohilani is going to charge patrons more for an ocean view, then they should provide what was paid for.

Lovely hotel, newly renovated, great staff, good food, entertainment & views! Jones and Nikki are always happy, bubbly and friendly! Great vibes from them! Always willing to help others out and make them feel welcomed!

This place has been updated a lot. The design is beautiful. The rooms are alos clean and very chic. The view of the ocean and diamond head was very clear from our room. There is also a breakfast buffet Lychee which was very good. We hope to return soon.

We stayed at the Alohilani for 5 nights at the end of our Hawaii trip, the hotel is modern and located conveniently on the southern side of Waikiki beach. The rooftop pool was a great location to relax and watch the sunset with a cocktail. The room was clean and the bed comfy.

This is the most awful hotel I've ever been. It's even worse of some hostels.I would advice to go in some other motel or camping.Without counting it was our honeymoon.As you can see from pictures, the toilets was dirty from previous customer's pee and it has been cleaned only after my 5th request. Finally, exhausted of waiting nothing, I talked to the manager who just shaked my hands with normal apologize.The shower was really bad constructed because it was impossible to avoid of getting wet all the floor.As a cherry on the top of the cake: cockroaches got out from the pool floor!!DISGUSTING!!

Our property had amazing views and we loved every second of our stay. The hotel is first class & the staff are lovely. Highly recommended to anyone wanting to visit Waikiki in luxurious style. Pool atmosphere was great

With a young family, the location is perfect. Across the road is a safe and perfect beach. Our four year old loved it! The trolley stop is outside and there are plenty of options for food. We would definitely go back.

The Alohilani hotel is beautiful, clean, and the guest services are excellent! The staff are friendly, professional and accommodating. This was my first time staying at the Alohilani and I will be back!!

The hotel did a great job on remodel. From the lobby to the restaurants to the guest rooms, the remodel was nicely done. The Ocean view rooms are amazing, but even the partial view rooms we checked out were really nice. We ate at each of the restaurants. The Ramen spot is a nice casual restaurant with great food. Tetsunabe pork and duck fat fries are delicious. Morimoto restaurant was a little more fine dining. Def get the smoked old fashioned and Ga Prao Rice. Try the Ishiyakyi A5 if you want a fancy steak.Loved the pool, get there early so you can snag a good spot. Longboard cafe is worth the price if you like breakfast and afternoon snacks. The wine dispenser is so cool.O Bar is a chill spot in the lobby. The Allison Rose Cocktail and Bacon Teaser are must tries!The best part...the beach is like 12 steps from the hotel...then head the other direction and they have great shopping a few blocks away.

We recently stated at Alohilani end of July. Hawaii / Honolulu is by far one of our most favourite destinations.
