Even though we spent very little time in the hotel room we were quite underwhelmed with the room and the facilities. The king bed was very comfortable and they made-up the room daily, which was nice. The bathrooms was tiny!!!! The door opened onto the toilet and the bathroom itself was so small, barley 2 people could use it at the one time. The pool area, although lovely, was overcrowded with a million children and families, not quite the most happening part of the hotel if you're young wild and free, literally kids everywhere, oh and don't expect to nab a good seat, they go fast. Come mid-afternoon the pool gets very little sun and the pool area seems to be situated in the middle of a wind tunnel, so glue down your wigs! The daily resort fee is also an absolute rort, you are literally paying for nothing but a jam-packed pool area full nasty loud children. Staff were friendly and the other public areas are lovely. Word to the wise, question the resort fee, we complained and were given a partial refund. Will stay there again? probably not... thank for the memories though.

Our visit to Hawaii was wonderful. The hotel and room were beautiful. I called it " a room with a view". It looked out over Waikiki beach. Beautiful sunrises and sunsets. The infinty pool and bar and lounge area was amazing. Would stay here again.

We had 6 days at this Hotel - pure Holliday. Location is good and it´s a nice and clean place. Perfect Pool area and you just have to cross the street to go the beach. Service level is ok - but I will note rate this as a 5 star property, it´s a good 4 star experience - with the best service at the pool area. We enjoyed staying there - but I would recommend the Hotel to train part of the staff (checkin & out) to act like the really enjoy taking care of the clients. I had some small incidents - where part of the front desk staff acted to ignorant and arrogant - and basically took themselves a little to serious in front of the guest´s. Small things - but it really spoils some of my total experience while staying at a place like this - I just expect a nice - positive and serviceoriented handling - and a willingness to find solutions. I will still recommend staying here, for the perfect location.

We enjoyed Our stay at this lovely hotel. Specifically Jones at the pool. He fulfilled our every need with the utmost professionalism. We would definitely come back just to see Jones. From room 1562 July 31st-Aug. 5th. Thank You Jones, see you again.

Enjoyed our stay! It was our second time staying here and both times were relacing and enjoyable. The front desk can get busy and staff unable to accommodate in timely manner. But overall it was a nice, clean room and facilities are great. Food by poolside was also good. Pool is small and can get packed, but view is nice. One of the stays they stuck us on 6th floor and the balcony was directly in view of people lounging by pool so that wasn't great. People could just look into the room so we kept curtains drawn when we were inside. Love that they have water fill stations for reusable bottles. The parking can be really bad depending on time of day because they allow for non guests to also park there which I find unfair for guests. Also had an issue with a cabana rental, or more so our server. We rented the cabana for half day which is 12:30 to 5:30. Server was nice and never gave us trouble, but she wasn't our server for the full time and swapped out with another girl around 4PM. Instead of just letting us know she was swapping servers, she made us close out our bill early (presumably so she would get the full tip) and open up a new bill with the next server. Very odd and first time that ever happened to us. Other than those few hiccups, our stay was nice and relaxing.

When we arrived, we were very impressed with the lobby area and our room (we paid for an upgrade). However, the pool area is a disaster. There were at least 40 to 45 children in the pool, and the water was incredibly cloudy and dirty.As well, there was a fire alarm late in the evening and the hotel response was incredibly poor. We were able to go down 39 flights of stairs and wait outside for 8 to 9 minutes before the arrival of the fire department. The manager on site, who was genuinely trying his best, did not have much support from the staff on site. They were still checking in staff and oblivious to the emergency situation, there was no water or food available, and there was no communication with guests. We didn’t get back to our room until almost 1 AM, between the response by the Fire department, Police Department, and elevator company. Emergency responders were excellent. By the sounds of it, fires were intentionally set on floor 26 and 28.It will be essential that the management of this facility conduct emergency response training with the staff. They were openly admitting to being completely unprepared. I tried to help last night. Overall, the hotel is beautiful on the outside however, is poorly run and not guest oriented.

Friendly and cleanliness. Good place to stay for family. I would definitely recommend friends and family to stay at this hotel and experience the friendly atmosphere here at this hotel. The internet has decent speed but it would be better with a faster speed. We put in a baby crib when booking online but never get the actual crib. Everything else is good except for the not being deliver when requested and baby never deliver when requested.

前回泊まったロイヤルハワイアンと迷って、子連れのためキッズプールがあること、新しいラウンジ(ロングボードクラブ)があることが決め手になり、こちらをトライすることにしました。日本語も通じますし、何より施設が充実していて、どこを取ってもモダンで美しく、大正解でした。子どもはキッズプールを大変気に入り、インフィニティプールにも夜泳ぎに行くほどでした(プールは24時までオープン)。プールサイドでも、ボーイさんがフルーツやクッキーを配ったりサングラスを拭いてくださったりと至れり尽くせり。子どもはボーイさん(thank you Jones!)に覚えてもらい、たくさんクッキーを貰って大喜びでした。プールサイドには軽食を食べられるバーもあり、持ち込みも大丈夫なようです(何も言われませんでした)。カバナを予約しようか迷いましたが、出入りするので予約せず、空いているビーチベッドを随時移動しながら利用しました。ただし、プールの上に設置されているビーチベッドは有料なので要注意です(空いていたのでうっかり使ってしまい、あとで有料だったことを知り焦りました)。24時間稼働しているランドリーもありますので、長期滞在にも向いていると思います。朝食はラウンジで十分です、それほど充実しています。お味噌汁や白いご飯もあり、ビール、ワインの飲み比べを主人は楽しんでいました。夜は8時までなので、食事前の一杯にぴったりです。部屋の掃除も行き届いており、アメニティは人気のマリエなのもポイント高かったです。一階に給水所があり、ボトルや部屋に備え付けのパックに入れれば、ミネラルウォーターを買う必要もありません。レストランはモリモト(日本食)とモモサン(ラーメン)があり、お子さんがいらっしゃるファミリーには助かるポイントだと思います。わたしたちの滞在中にポップアップショップをやっていたハワイのジュエリーブランドKoloheが、ちょうどワークショップをやっており、オリジナルのアクセサリーを作る体験もできました。また、ABCストアも併設されていますので(24時までオープン)便利でした。隣のカイコーヒーも美味です。長くなりましたが、次回の滞在もここに決めてます！Thank you for the great hospitality, we are sure to come back next time!

We booked the premium ocean front room and wow it did not disappoint! The view from our room cannot be beaten. It was the best we've ever had. The rooms are clean and modern and quite roomy. The pool itself it nice however being where it is it was quite windy. The only downside to the hotel is that there are lots of homeless people out the front. They weren't any trouble however it brought the luxury feel down a little each time we stepped outside.Highly recommend the beach directly across the road if you have little ones as there is a break wall and the water is lovely and calm.

Great resort with the best location, all the staff were super friendly and although our check in was delayed a while the staff member tried her absolute best for us.The only criticism i would have is that it was a little difficult to find a spot at the pool to relax.Also top quality Japanese restaurants at Alohilani, we ate there many times

We just loved this hotel. It's stunning, new and modern, the staff are helpful, pool is lovely (albeit a bit windy) and the gym, rooms, food and beverage are amazing. We stayed here for our honeymoon and enjoyed every minute and the hotel bed is to die for!!

I highly recommend this Hotel. We moved from another prestigious hotel (it was just too far away from the wonderful mayhem that is Waikiki Beach) and looked at several hotels before settling on the 'Alohilani:1. Hotels in the Waikiki area have smaller room sizes than most. The 'Alohilani rooms are smaller but not cramped. As other reviewers have noted, the bathrooms are the only thing that feels small. 2. You have decide whether you like rapid beach access. You can be on the beach in 2 minutes. 3. You have to decide whether you want to be in the center of activity. The 'Alohilani is in the center of things. If you walk out, you will find people walking around, restaurants and shopping.Check-in was easy. When the line got long, someone actually came out and apologized, gave everyone water and added another receptionist. The check-in staff were extremely helpful. The lobby plays lounge music and gives the place a hip vibe. The usual mix of clientele walking around from couples to some families. The bar is nice and feels good. I like sitting at bars and this one had a good feel. The backdrop is a massive aquarium. There is enough seating. The LongBoard Lounge was a great for us. The food offerings are not extensive but certainly enough. Beer and wine is available and the wine offerings are excellent. I like lounges and paid the extra dollars. The staff is superb.The pool is negative edge and sits on the 5th floor of the hotel. There are always people there but we never had a problem finding a spot to sit. Service is excellent and the staff always responded to our requests. Only downside is the smallish bathroom size.

Stayed here with the wife on our latest vacation to the island. Overall we had a nice experience. Very nice spot which is located across the street from the beach and along the strip with all the shops and restaurants.Check in was quick and painless, and we were given a room on the 32nd floor. I had requested for a king bed at the time of booking, but ended up with a room with two queens. They said it was because of availability. Our room faced Diamond Head, so we did get a partial view of the ocean. The room was sufficient. The beds were comfortable enough. The shower and toilet worked adequately. We had a mini fridge which came in handy. We did not venture to the pool, so I can't comment on that. We did hit up the O Bar a few times, and had a pleasant experience every time. There's a good sized aquarium there for your viewing pleasure. One night they had live music which was cool. You can also order food at the bar, and the food we tried was excellent. We went to the Lychee Restaurant for breakfast. They had a nice buffet style selection and an omelet station. The food that we tried was pretty good.The modern decor of the hotel was very cool. The first floor area is wide open and spacious. I love that they had a water filling station next to the elevator. The only real setback was that we got stuck in one of the elevators on our second night at the hotel. At around 10pm, we were trying to get to the 32nd floor, and a mother and daughter were trying to get the 20th floor. The elevator stopped at 16 and was stuck. We were told by security through the intercom that an elevator tech would come out, but they ended up calling the fire dept to pry open the doors. We were stuck in there for at least 30 min with no ac. It was a most unpleasant experience. There were hotel workers waiting for us as they opened the doors with bottled waters in their hands. Guest relations gave us a credit to be used at the hotel for our troubles. It was a nice gesture and was greatly appreciated. So other than the elevator mishap, we had a very nice experience. If I had the choice, I'd probably stay here again.

We really enjoyed our stay. The room was nice, very clean when we arrived and the cleaning staff did a great job during our stay. We had a partial ocean view that many people complain is misleading because you have to step out on the deck to see it but I still thought it was nice. The valet staff worked fast and were very courteous. The hotel location is great and the food was wonderful at the associated restaurants. The pool looked great but was always crowded with no place to sit so sadly we didn't experience it. The resort fee seems a bit steep. However, we have our next trip tentatively booked at the Alohilani - I really like the hotel but my husband thinks it is overpriced so I continue to look for deals - A couple of minor things - there doesn't seem to be a loyalty break for return guests, they charge for late checkout, and the online booking system is not great - it showed a special rate because of some of the internet deals but I could never get it to take my reservation and the mysterious special rate never showed up again as an option.

I stayed at Alohilani Resort to enjoy my vacation in Waikiki. This hotel is in front of Waikiki Beach, and I was able to enjoy the brand new facilities including infinity pool, pool bar, jacuzzi, and delicious buffet. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I will highly recommend this hotel.

Superb ambience, great food & friendly staff in a modern feel accomodation. YOU WILL BE IMPRESSED. Local musical entertainment, two pools and Spa , sensational Aquarium, very close proximity to the Beach, food & gift shops - this place has it all.

Hotel is spectacular specially the infinity room had a great dinner at morimoto asia and breakfast buffet at lychee the food is superb will definitely coming back. But hope you can allow late check out and early check in at no cost just like other hotels in waikiki

Great location and fresh and bright rooms. the aquarium was great. Would certainly be improved with some extra dining choices, room service and an adult pool zone. This is not the hotel for a relaxing stay

We just returned from 7 nights at the Alohilani Resort and every component of our stay exceeded our expectations. From the helpful concierge even before we arrived, to the friendly check-in, the incredible Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach VIEW!!! from our room and lanai/balcony, comfortable bed and room amenities, and the general ambience... First trip to Oahu, hopefully not our last. We were amazed at the proximity of the beach (literally just across the street) and could get to every restaurant or shopping we wanted by walking. It was wonderful strolling along the shops and streets with fellow vacationers from all over the world. The concierge staff were helpful in answering our questions or helping to book excursions. And the pool/pool deck was incredible - relaxing in the infinity pool around sunset with live music playing was the proverbial icing on our anniversary cake. Truly our only disappointment was our micro-fridge chilled so well it froze some of our snacks and beverages...and having to leave. Thank you Alohilani for making our second honeymoon a dream vacation.

A lovely contemporary hotel with reasonable size rooms, great pool and pool deck, several restaurants, friendly helpful staff, healthy food options, free water bottles and water refilling stations, great gym and fitness classes, close to the beach, restaurants and shops.

The management at this hotel is at best a 3 star level.Young manager and front desk personnel with lack of experience in customers service were very rude and dismissive. We inquired about our “partial ocean view room” with absolutely NO ocean view from the room, and the explanation was that you had to step into the balcony (and stretch your neck) to see a small portion of the ocean behind a high rise!!Regardless of the mediocre room, loud lobby, dirty carpet in hallways, the most disappointing part of our experience was the quality of customer service and poor behavior of the management. Do not be fooled by the 4- 5 stars given to this hotel. This is certainly not one!!

Was such an amazing experience. We were here near three weeks and experienced four different hotels, including the big names like the Moana Surf Rider ect. The Alohilani easily out did them all. The staff are all so friendly and always so welcoming. The highlight defiantly was the out door relaxing area/pool retreat, This was extremely more spacious and inviting and also so much bigger then every other hotel, allowing you to have a little more space and swim/relax without so many people always in your personal space. A very special mention to Jones in the pool area. He was extremely helpful in every way, happy, polite, fun, always wanted to chat and really makes your Hawaiian experience one to remember. He was defiantly our go to man for all questions. Another special mention to the management as our flight had been canceled and we had to be accomadated at very late notice as you could imagine. The manager found us a room and even gave it to us at a great discount to help us out financially. I highly recommend this hotel and I will be returning for sure.

Terrible experience with staff and disgusting event hosted at hotel. Graphic and sexual instagram photography with guests, vulgar and offensive sexual activity with group of four in the spa. Could not attend family movie night at hotel after complaining about non-family behavior at the hotel pool. Could not sleep because the movie outside was so loud that woke up our children. Hotel was clean, the vibe was a feeling of Vegas trash.

Alohilani has the ideal location for visitors to Honolulu. Explore the neighborhoods around and venture out of the Waikiki area to make the most of your visit. The hotel has superb in-room amenities and guest services. Breakfast Buffet is excellent.

the room and view was amazing. It looked just like the picture on line. We had a view of the ocean and Diamond Head. The room was clean, comfortable and accomdating for a party of 4. The entire hotel was just recently renovated and everything was new. The only complain I would have is the bathroom was a bit small. However, overall the staff hospitality went above and beyond!!!

It was a great stay. The location is second to none. Across the street from the Pacific Ocean. I highly recommend the Alohilani Hotel. Super place for locals and visitors alike. The staff, hotel, and location was perfect.

This hotel was booked by our travel agent. It was presented to us as one of the newest and best hotels in Waikiki. Unfortunately, we did not find this to be the case at all. In fact, the customer service was some of the worst we have ever experienced. The location was fine and the rooms were average. If poor service and mediocrity is what you are looking for, this is the place for you. If not, stay elsewhere, as there are too many good hotels in Waikiki to settle for this!

10/10! From the moment I walked in, I fell in love. You pay for quality. The lobby is gorgeous with the aquarium. Everything is close by and if you need an uber/Lyft it’s not more than $10. Dukes is right by and Outrigger has many activities. Just a walk away. Diamond head / ocean view was unbelievable.

Great place but check the charges they apply to your credit card! The location is good but it is the last good hotel in the downtown Waikiki area.Pool area good but was very crowded.Rooms small but good.

Awesome place. Hotel is quiet and tucked away, but yet close to everything. Good eats at hotel restaurants - there are two Morimoto restaurant on premises. Excellent service. Nice pool and bar service. Only downside is that elevator can be sluggish during busy hours.

This was our third trip to Waikiki and our first time staying at the Alohilani.It might take you a few times to learn how to say the name correctly however you will never forget it once you stay there. The hotel is situated perfectly on the strip but down near the zoo so you are not right in the middle with all of the tourists. The rooms are clean and modern but it is the pool area that makes this worth coming back to every time you are in Waikiki. The biggest decision to make every day is if you'll walk 20 steps to the beach or just head down to level 5 for the pool. Either way the tan will happen. We rate this place highly and can't wait to return

pretty good hotel with Japanese quality of amenities and food; nice location directly at Waikiki beach; good Japanese restaurants, a nice spa and shops; modern and fresh design; liked the stay and highly likely to return there

You might want to consider booking through an online travel agent as we saved a couple of hundred dollars by booking that way - despite the "best rate guaranteed" mentioned on the hotel's booking page. The hotel still hasn't replied my two emails from more than a month ago, asking for a matched price if booking directly. Due to the lack of reply, it was close that we'd have cancelled the booking altogether.In any case, we were very happy with our stay. The room was in a good shape and our view was beautiful. Many people seem to complain about a too small bathroom but the size of the bathroom wasn't a problem for us at all. I wouldn't have minded to have a rack for hanging wet clothes, though. Overall, the service was good throughout the hotel, especially our cleaning guy (perhaps named Christian?) was particularly courteous and did an excellent job. The only notable exception we encountered (twice) was the service at the pool bar whose staff's service can be compared to the performance of the immigration officer on our way at LAX airport: making people feel welcome isn't of course the primary task of border control and similar thinking seemed to apply at the pool bar. By the way, if spending a lot of time in the pool is a requirement for you, this might not be the right hotel to you, given the fact that the pool is small and the pool area is often rather crowded.We had the breakfast once with a voucher. The breakfast was very good but it's significantly overpriced (approx. $40 p.p. with tax & tip). The restaurant next door is way cheaper and the ABC store downstairs is also handy for any snack needs.

We had a nice stay that became a bit better as we went along. When we had an issue the staff members, particularly Dhen, addressed it immediately and graciously. Needless to say we experienced world class service. (Just would recommend cleaning the carpet in the room in the tower on the same side as the ABC store.) Would stay there again hands down. I feel comfortable that the employees here care about my experience.

I sadly had to check out of the Alohilani Resort recently. I thoroughly enjoyed staying here thanks to my room view, the location of the hotel to places of interest, and most importantly the people. I had to say goodbye to my favorite person this week from the Longboard Club Lounge, Shade. Our conversations will be missed, breakfast will never be the same. She is a wealth of knowledge to ensure you have an incredible time during your stay. Everyone in the lounge made it feel like home. I can’t wait to return to check out the Longboard Lounge expansion. I wish the lounge was open until 10pm instead of closing at 8pm.

Alohilani exceeded our expectations in every way. Gorgeous hotel, an early check in available after a long overnight flight from Australia, stunning Ocean View room, with a birthday surprise of Champagne, Macaroons & Balloon waiting for us in our room. The staff were great, housekeeping kept our room beautiful & special mention to the amazing Jones at the pool...he ensured we had a wonderful evening in the pool side cabana! We are looking forward to staying at Alohilani next time we travel to Hawaii.I also must mention the delicious Kai Coffee cafe downstairs, head in there for a great coffee & breakfast treat before you venture out for the days activities.

Pros: Great location - close to the beach and shops, clean room - house keeping did a fantastic job daily, comfortable bed.Cons: rooms lacks basics for a ‘luxury’ hotel - no robes, slippers, wine glasses, mugs, bathroom kits etc. the bathroom itself is tiny, the hair dryer is not practical - 20cm cord. Anyone off the street can access the hotel pool, pool area very windy due to design, house keeping vacuumed the corridors twice at 11pm, the lifts malfunctioned 1-2 times a day - met a couple who were trapped in one for 40mins, the hotel ran out of hot water one night and took 7 hours to rectify (from other reviews this was not the first time), most of the staff lacked basic customer service skills, unsure what their ‘resort’ fee pays for.

Great meeting venue. Beat food I have ever had at a meeting, friendly staff, great location. Amazing aquarium at the lobby bar. Lovely rooms. Close to the beach. Outdoor pool tennis court and Boot camp circuit.

The Alohilani is centrally located. Beach, shops and restaurants all easy walking distance. Staff we found helpful and friendly. Highly recommended hotel and would consider staying there in the future. The rooms and amenities are clean. We had an issue with our room and was upgraded without any fuss and give full credit to their customer service managers.

my son and bride's reception was impeccable with the F&B staff's attention to detail...food was excellent and their suite was amazing! a destination wedding !! I particularly liked that they had several servers who came around and asked your preference and brought it out immediately! the hotel is beautiful and tastefully decorated! very nice! great location on Waikiki.

Reviews are always relative so here I'll try to post the specifics:Location: in front of Waikiki beach, towards quiet end near the zoo( looking out to Marriott Resort & Aston Waikiki & Waikiki Circle Hotel, which are even nearer to beach & maybe cheaper for full ocean view rooms?)Location: easy access to trolleys, shops, restaurants ( Eggs & things- yummy)Rooms- slightly smaller than typical Hilton/ Marriott. Ocean VIEW rooms = side, partial view ONLYTo get full ocean view you must pay the price, and the view is great in these roomsDo not stay in lower floors (below 15) if you are a light sleeper. You be staring at Circle Waikiki / Waikik resort rooms or worse still, listening to loud pool music if you are in that block. Walls are thin so good luck if you stay next to noisy groups/ kidsPool: talking about pool/ bring your headset as the music is blasting all day. Ok if you like the music played. Not good for people like me who prefers a quiet pool to enjoy the beautiful tranquil beach view. Bed: very comfortableDesign: stupid. Open style toilet so a big inconvenience if you have different waking habits. Eg you cannot close off door to do your private grooming, make less noise - such as hair drying Hair dryer so stupid- you are stretching yr head to the dryer as the cord is only 20cm long! No shower although room description is shower/tub. It's actually merged with a tub. So small, 7ft talller guys would be knocking over. No shower cap, no toothbrush, no disposable shavers. For a 5* hotel you'd expect such convenienceNice coffee maker, not kettle though. Housekeeping: Superb. Room always immaculate with amenities enuf for no of people in the room. Facilities: gym is big & comprehensive equipments. Not crowded., Free lessons. Pool: Pitiful. Advertised as infinity to draw Instagram crowd but otherwise, you cannot swim a decent lap in it. Just to soak. So swimmers, take note. Deck beds always crowded. Therefore it is not a resort! There are hardly enuf beds to meet the demands. You are literally squeezed in a renovated 5th floor deck! ( forget the resort type lounges/ pool a la Marriott resort) For USD350 a night, it doesn't qualify as a resort. More like a hip hotel. Negatives about the pool- no control by attendant. You do not need a key to obtain towels so anyone can stroll in to use the pool, which is already tiny! Selfish people leave their towels there to 'hold' the beds for hours, again no control by pool attendants. Nice cookie breaks by pool attendants every few hours. Refreshing mint water by pool. Reception: polite but not overly friendly. You do not get that 'welcome to Hawaii' feeling.Also, they should consider directing enquiries other than room specific to the concierge. It's annoying standing and waiting for guests to check-in and ask loads of tour related questions when you just want to crash after a 30hr journey! Having walked along stretch of hotels, I'd recommend Hyatt Regency, Marriott Resort. Note: Towards zoo end, lots of homeless who smells ( sorry to say this but police should relocate them. We met a really scary lunatic who shouts & flung his arms aggressively. And they take up the beach tables and that section reeks of foul smell) Sad actually. Hilton, Marriott Courtyard and Hyatt Place are not along Waikiki beach. Hotel Halekulani is gorgeous. Sheraton is still under renovation so DO NOT BOOk! A few floors drilling and in pool, you'll be looking up at workers & listening to drilling sounds! Hawaii IS heavens!

Luxury stay !! This should be removed from luxury stays as it is very far from it !! We found the staff useless with them all seeming like they are helping you with your request but nothing gets done .

I was pleasantly surprised by the Alohilani Resort Waikiki Beach. This was my fifth trip to Hawaii. I had previously stayed at different hotels along the beach. The Alohilani was accross the road but it didn’t really matter because it was close enough. The hotel has recently been upgraded and Wow I loved the natural coloured pale decor. Perfect for the beach. The hotel was smart but casual which suited its surroundings. Staff and hotel were Very impressive,The only thing that let the place down a bit was the lack of lifts. Number one kept breaking down and 100s of people were constantly waiting for the lifts. Make sure you watch the fish feeds and look at the stunning artwork behind reception.

This was our 3rd accommodation over a 15 day stay in Oahu, on our 4th year in a row returning to Hawaii.It was supposed to be the 'luxury 3 night finale' and certainly for the price we paid, it should have been.I did do my research before booking and knew that I was possibly paying too much but was hoping the gorgeous pics on the website were the real deal. Sadly not quite.Our experience mimics a lot of the comments on here. In my opinion there was nothing grossly bad about the Alohilani but there was nothing truly great either... except the bed. The bed was fabulous :) We found the rooms to be very clean, personally I liked the modern minimal decor and our partial ocean view from 1601 was better than ok. But the noise from other guests, doors slamming, the lifts and the pool area is unbelievably loud. Plus where are the basics?? No robes, no wine glasses, no minibar, no room service and a cramped small bathroom ... surely these amenities are not unrealistic expectations of a 5 star hotel?The pool area was a good experience for us. It wasn't over crowed and we easily secured a couch & shade. Food and Drinks from Swell Bar were good enough although overpriced, even for Waikiki standards Service wasn't great sadly ... we had to ask for service pretty much every time we wanted something, although the waitstaff did have time to take pics of each other in the Cabanas ... Check in was efficient & polite although not overly welcoming ... The music in the lobby when we checked out on Saturday morning at 6.30am was so loud I found it hard to hear. I mentioned it and she shrugged and rushed me through ... On checking my credit card statement this morning I found that I have been charged twice for the resort fees, taxes and room charges. I hope the email I sent to Guest Services this morning requesting a refund is dealt with swiftly There are definitely some common themes running through these reviews and in general I have to agree with them. I would certainly come back but not at the 5 star prices that are being charged

Alohilani is an excellent recently renovated property. OK its not right on the front row at Waikiki, but its only 50 metres from the beach. Very good rooms, with small bathrooms.The Hotel is Very clean with great overall service.The Longboard Club is worth joining for your stay.The Pool is nice but difficult to get a lounge.W e had a room on the 36th floor and it was sometimes quite a long trip from reception when the lift was full !!

My family and I are Hawaii vacation veterans, and we like to try out different properties each time. This time, we stayed at the wondrous 'Alohilani, and I'm very happy to report that it lives up to the hype. From the stunning lobby (with two-story aquarium), the doesn't-seem-like-just-a-hotel fitness center (with free weights), and the two Morimoto restaurants, this property has so much to offer (and I haven't even mentioned the infinity pool yet).Moreover, the service has been a standout. Jillian at the Front Desk was so friendly and so helpful with securing the perfect room for us (Diamond Head + ocean view!). And her colleagues have followed up since then with texts to ask us if we needed anything. My family and I feel well taken care of here, and the 'Alohilani is on our list for when we return.

We had 7 nights at this lovely hotel and found the location and ambiance of the hotel to be very good.We had an ocean front room which was very spacious and had great views. The only issue was the bathrooms in these ocean front rooms are very small. The partial ocean view rooms have larger bathrooms. Apart from this we loved our stay at The Alohilani. The signature restaurant Morimoto on site is excellent and there is an ABC store and a Coffee shop in the building

I enjoyed my 3 night stay here.I note the previous comments regarding noisy air conditioning, poor bathroom design and incredibly noisy room door closers and found them all to be true. I appreciate that the first two are hard to fix but the explosive sound of doors slamming can be fixed.So instead of just the banal thank you for your review why not promise some action on items that can be fixed!

Had the perfect stay at the Alohilani over the 4th of July. My ocean front room gave a majestic view of Waikiki. My stay was made all the more perfect by the poolside service. Ask for Nikki when you get to the pool. She is AMAZING! She sets the perfect vibe at the pool and takes care of the guests. Will definitely return for her alone.

My husband and I stayed in Alohilani for two nights with the complimentary. We went to the front desk at first to ask for reservation, they told us that they can’t help us book it we need to call the reservation office. we called the number in the beginning of June for few times but no one reply, so we left few voice messages. After a while no one get back to us, so I emailed to the sale coordinator on 6/25, they get back to me and asked me which day I want to book on 6/27.After I replied to the email on 6/27, she hasn’t get back to us for a long period of time. Meanwhile, we kept calling and no one answered so we left few voice massages. After few days we decided to call front desk and ask if there are any other way we can book it, then they transferred the call back to the sales coordinator still didn’t answer our call.She finally get back to us after 6 days, we felt so frustrated and disappointed for this experience. Not sure if it’s because we used the complimentary so we are being treated disrespectfully or they are generally have a bad customer service. Another thing is that we are using the complimentary but when checked out we still need to pay $90~ Resort Amenity fee. Also, the parking fee alone is $30 a night?! Overall this hotel doesn’t worth the price, can have much better choices with this price range. Think carefully before you decided to stay in this hotel!

Booked as a pkg with flight. Comfortable, newly renovated balcony view of the ocean was fantastic. Short walk across the street to the beach. Live music nightly. Friendly staff additional 40.per night resort fee,ouch but otherwise great place

This hotel was great. My stay in Hawaii was for two weeks. One week was at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the other was here at Alohilani. By far kicks the Hilton in the butt... Surprising I know, but it was a great hotel. The infinity pool and water cabana's are a plus. Great Hotel.

We stayed here for 6 nights and from start to finish it was amazing. The room was beautiful and had the most amazing views. We paid for an upgrade to include the Longboard Club room and I would highly recommend it. The drinks and canapes in the afternoon are wonderful. Our favourite was Breakfast as we had an amazing host "Shade" who went out of her way to help us with everything. She is an asset to your hotel. My only criticism would be that they didn't have the egg station available in the club room everyday which I really think is needed. I would highly recommend this resort and we have booked already to go back next year.

Alohilani is amazing! The staff, the service, the rooms are fabulous. The location is perfect and walkable to everything. We really enjoyed that end of Waikiki. Great beach and great pool deck. Morimoto restaurant is right on site, gym and spa are both excellent.

Had the best Sunday relaxing poolside, thanks to Nikki Utley! She took care of us like we were VIPs: made sure we had pool chairs, plenty of towels, cocktail service...she even cooled us down with a refreshing body spritz. Great staff, sweet view, wonderful drinks and the best music from DJ Anit. Cannot wait to go back! Nikki, you gave us such a fun and memorable day. Mahalo!

This hotel was nice, but expensive. The food and drinks were very expensive, but good quality. I loved the water aerobics class each morning! Close to Waikiki Beach! Close to shopping and restaurants!

Kanika Nikki Utley is an amazing poolside host! No matter how many guests she is serving, you never wait on services! She is like “super woman”, there when you need anything before you need it!! Thanks Kanika for the wonderful service! Until next time!!! Aloha!

Great stay. Enjoyed the amenties and fitness center. Rooms were clean and bed was very comfortable. Centrally located on the beach and close to everything. I would absolutely stay here again. Thank you.

needs more staff, too close to the homeless bums. long wait at the bars, at the check in. great pool aerobics with shaun, great lei making class. the street can be noisey. good spot near beach, . ocean front is best, ocean view is only partial view.

I wasn't sure what to expect with some mixed reviews but my expectations were far exceeded for our 6 night stay. We had a luxury escapes deal which was great value. I love the young, fresh vibe of the place, the rooms are fresh, gym is amazing with great classes and yoga timetable included. The Swell Pool and bar is the best, after a week in quiet Ko Olina, I was a bit overwhelmed by Waikiki especially with young kids so we spent most of the day by the pools after a morning swim at the beach. Great food, drinks and music and kid friendly. Yes the room was a little noisy but what do you expect being right on the strip. We did not hear any noise from adjacent rooms or level above. We requested a room on a higher floor and away from the lift. I was expecting a much smaller bathroom from previous reviews. Its not so much the size of the bathroom, it is just poorly designed. The toilet is in a very awkward spot but its not a dealbreaker. Great staff, no issues at all!

A pleasent week stay .Enjoyed all that you had to offer.The view is excellent .The hotel is beautiful.We had a great time.The hotel is very close to all the stores and the beach.The drive through was well managed.

Amazing pool side..Pool staff Janice Atenara has made our time here so comfortable and warming, she was so accommodating.Jones, another incredible staff member, catering to all our needs.I would love to thankyou all for the most enjoyable time we had at your resort, we preferred to spend more time at the pool than the beach, due to the incredible staff..

Pros:1) Wonderful stay, great patient and calm front desk staff and managers, very attentive cheerful guest services staff, helpful housekeepers, clean rooms and prompt services.2) Ocean front rooms still perfect but a bit noisey at time, but bearable.3) Guest services great--always fast response.Cons:1) NO pool towel service area for pick up/drop off at the Ocean Tower, guests have to walk to another tower, waiting for slow elevators at the Seaside Tower just for this towel exchange.2) NO bathroom trash liner in plastic/wood containers. Not sanitized in appearance - germs.3) Door locks too loud when closing - slamming noises whenever guests come in or go out at all hours, worse at night after 11pm or early bird before 7am.4) Bed a bit soft but still ok.3) Door slamming to close noises from guests always a bad problem especially past 11:00pm and early morning before 7:00am. It has to do with the locks mechanisms..

My husband and I, my parents and my two brothers stayed for 8 nights this month. We all enjoyed our stay here. All the staff at the hotel were wonderful. The buffet at Lychee has great variety of food. The food and drinks at O Bar restaurant there was great too. The air conditioning fan can be noisy and hearing people going noisily to their rooms late at night after being at the pool or coming from somewhere else but i can put up with that. The aquarium in the O bar is neat, cool watching a diver feeding the fish. The Cabanas were great to relax and chill in while while having our Mai Tai's.I liked our hotel room. Got a bit of the ocean view and diamond head view. Definitely would stay here again. Our group had a really great stay here. I would recommend this hotel to family and friends who was going to go to Waikiki for a holiday.

We love the Alohilani! The hotel is beautiful, the food is great and the staff is amazing! Jones, from the pool deck, was so friendly and made our visit so special! We will definitely be coming back!!

Our June stay with you was amazing! ! We particularly enjoyed our time around the pool with Nikki,Mikki, Jones and Bailey. My wife, Cheryl, also enjoyed the afternoon Lei making. Our goal on this trip to Honolulu was to have no structured agenda. Wanted to enjoy our time around the pool. We did just that! ! Nikki and her team made sure we were able to do as little or as much as we wanted. Can't wait for a return visit to spend more time with them and do what the locals do. The Alohilani is a true example of the Aloha spirit! ! Thank you.

I want to express my thanks to NEPO SALAGA in the Engineering Department at Alohilani Resort. The handle on my suitcase broke in transit to the hotel. Nepo came to our room and offered to fix it for me. Nepo, you are the best!

This hotel is in a great location facing Waikiki beach. Features a stunning infinity pool complete with view of beach. Our room was spacious & nicely furnished & came with a sea view. Great hotel for a family vacation, our package included a daily continental breakfast box which included fresh croissants, yoghurt, fresh fruit, tea/coffee/juice which provided a good start to the day. Buffet breakfast also available.Staff all very friendly & helpful. We will definitely be coming back.

The location of the hotel was wonderful - near to the beach, shopping, trollies and bus-stops. The interior design of the hotel is modern and chic, and the room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. My only issue was that my room was located above the driveway and music starts playing early every morning which woke me up. Perhaps lower the volume or start the music a little later? Enjoyed the gym which is big and well equipped. I was able to get help easily from the concierge for activity bookings from the tour companies. However, the pool is small for a hotel this size, so it's always over crowded. While some staff were exceptional, I did not experience a great sense of hospitality throughout.
user_name:
Angela H
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: We have recently returned from 5 nights (23rd-27th June) at Alohilani Resort and although I don't leave a lot of reviews I felt one was necessary in this instance. The location is very convenient and central to most things in Waikiki. On arrival, we thought the foyer and O Bar were great, just loved the coral artwork behind the check-in desk and of course the aquarium and its inhabitants :) Our room was good, beds were very comfy, our bathroom was well appointed and very clean. We dined at Morimoto which was fabulous and highly recommended. The good pretty much stopped there sadly. It was impossible to sleep with the very large and noisy aircon running, the hallways are particularly noisy - slamming doors, noisy conversations, crying children etc echoing which is extremely annoying when you are trying to get a decent nights sleep. We were also a little surprised that there was no swipe card security in the elevators, so anyone could access the accommodation floors. The main reason for the poor rating though is the fact that the pool and surrounding deck is not exclusive to the hotels paying guests. This property like many others charges a $40 USD per night fee for the use of the pool and other amenities, which we knew about and were happy to pay, but we didn't expect to compete with people (large and loud groups) from other hotels when trying to order food and drinks, not to mention find somewhere to sit or heaven forbid, squeeze into the pool :( We will certainly return to Waikiki but will be doing a lot more research before booking accommodation and we will never return to this particular hotel again.

5 solid stars. The venue is beautiful and clean with super attentive staff. Janis took care of us on her shifts in the Swell bar and made us feel like VIPS. Attending to our every needs including our water consumption whilst lazing by the pool. My first time but I’ll be back and the Alohilani will be my accommodation of choice. Our room view was breathtaking.

I had an awesome stay at Alohilani Resort. The staff was really friendly and the hotel was really clean. my family and I will return to stay. It is really close to the beach that allows you to swim and the pool or in the ocean anytime and there are always plenty of towels. The valet guys and front desk employees were so friendly and made us feel very welcome.

Nice hotel, good pool area (although pool too small for number of guests but Waikiki all the same)Bathrooms shocking. Aircon very noisy and no ceiling fans, rooms quite noisy (we were right near lifts)Morimoto amazing, Kai coffee excellent.

Room service is a must.. breakfast should be at least til the other restaurants open.. need more options to eat.. maybe a cafe open for a quick lunch and/or dinner.. cabanas and pool area very nice.. valet guys re the best! overall nice hotel. Great staff!

Wow! The old Pacific Beach Hotel got more than just a facelift. If it was not for the Fish Tank you would not recognize it. Check in was smooth. I do wish they had a separate line for Long Board Club. Stayed in a Diamond Head Ocean View room in Seascape and the view was fanfreakintastic! Rooms have been totally renovated. Loved the USB power ports next to the bed. Bed super comfy. Room was of good size. Good sized safe for a laptop. Rain shower is great...but water pressure can fluctuate. They are still working on renovating areas of the property but noise was not really and issue. The pool looked awesome but was pretty much packed our entire stay but we are more beach people than pool people. We had the Long Board Club. Guys the Club is worth every penny. Service is on point. Miss Shade and Miss Kumiko and the rest of the crew were awesome (sorry I am really bad with names). They are still working on the exterior ofthe Club and I can not wait to get back to enjoy it. If there was one thing I would have to ding them on is the Elevators. The timing is way off. Be prepared to wait. The valet, bell, and anyone we encountered were super friendly. My partner loved the work out facility. We checked out and our flight was delayed 24 hours. The Airline put us in another hotel which we stayed at for a few hours. Then we found out our delay was 2 days! I called the front desk and spoke to Miss Jane. She went above and beyond to get is back in...to the very same room no less. I can not think of a better place to stay in HNL. No more Hyatt Regency for me or my peeps! We will be back. Mahalo!

We were in an incredibly beautiful room overlooking the beach and ocean. The bathroom is very nicely appointed, but as others have mentioned pretty small. There is a Keurig in the room which was great. Very comfortable bed. They could use with more signage and a better variety of restaurants. Breakfast at Lychee was very good, but why are they only open for breakfast?

The worst option and resort I could ever chose to stay at.There is noway I'd recommend this place to anyone.I don't even know where to start, the rude staff and receptionist from the arrival point to unsafe and slippery elevators which people used from amenities to their room and noone ever bothered to clean or put a hazard sign.It's not worth a penny!

The front desk staff was great, easy check-in, and even got to check in early, which helped us out A LOT!! Nice room, beds were comfy and great Air Conditioner, cozy comforters, great view. The price was better than the Hyatt, too, and the rooms are newly remodeled. The location is perfect for our needs.

We went for our honeymoon, the rooms were clean and gorgeous and the view to Waikīkī beach was delightful. Just walk across the street and you are in the water. The aquarium in the bar was lovely. Easy access to everything and walking distance to all you need!

Beautiful resort. Aquarium walls in the O Bar. Rooms are spacious. Visit Iron Chef Morimota's restaurant at the resort! Endless supply of beach towels. Infinity pool. Staff was helpful and very friendly. Would definitely return.

Look no further for 5 star service that does not attack your wallet....  I normally stay at 5 star resorts that have all the bells and whistles .... however it was my first Attempt at a boutique hotel and it blew me away...  hotel was chic and updated and the rooms were big and spacious!! And the view from my 16 floor was breathtaking !!! Food was great and Consistent! And do ask about the Longboard Club.... But the Secret of my experience was the bright and FULL OF JOY ...NICKI!!!!!!  She is the glue that makes everyone’s experience Unforgettable!!  I thought it was our connection... until I witness her spread magic and NICKI DUST to EVERYONE!! She makes Wishes come true .. THANK YOU again Nicki for such a wonderful experience .... I will come back for sure... ☀️Daniel Combs Westlake Village,CA

Arriving at Alohilani we knew we would be in for a treat. We were able to leave out hire car at the front for 10 mins while we checked in, the check in process was smooth and we were allocated a room in a higher level. Our was clean and spacious and the only downside to the room is the incredibly small bathroom and being able to hear your upstairs neighbour flushing their toilet. The pool area was beautiful, and the bar had a great selection of drinks and food. We spent most our nights either in the pool area or at the bar watching the fish in the aquarium. The hotel is in a great spot and was easy to walk to dinner, the beach and a decent coffee. We had a great stay at this beautiful property and will definitely return.

Hi, I am beyond words and appreciative of the stay at Alohilani, from the best ever check-in young lady (Dailyn) she surpassed my expectations!!! When we checked in us as a family were celebrating two milestones my husband’s 50th Birthday and my son’s high school graduation. Well (Dailyn) took upon herself to make us feel special...our second day there when we returned to our room we were surprised with a fruit tray and a plate of chocolate covered strawberries and two personalized cards for each occasion. The rest of our stay there was wonderful and the hotel is gorgeous especially the aquarium inside. I would definitely come back and stay at Alohilani again hands down. Mahalo for the exceptional service..

Resort was extremely clean and beautiful. Love the pool, as well as the outdoor bar. Very nice and clean rooms with spacious bathrooms. Employees very kind and courteous when I asked for assistance or questions.

Over all great, though the bathrooms are very small, you can only fit one person in it at a time, there needs to be some security for floor access, there is none at the moment. The food in all areas was great..

Nice hotel located right across from Waikiki beach. It's an excellent location. The amenities were very nice. Infinity pool with great view of the beach across the street, Excellent gym and restaurant on site and many other restaurants very close by. lots of sites, shopping and transit in the area The room however was very average and we disappointed that the bathroom was very small for 4 people. No kitchen. Staff was excellent and very helpfull

This resort is amazing!!! It’s located directly in the middle of everything giving you direct access to the beach, shopping and food. The staff was very nice and addressed issues in a timely manner. I would stay here time and time again. 5 stars!

We stayed there in 2016 while it was still in renovation and we came back this May to see what it looked like. The hotel looks so amazing, the lobby area is the epitome of chic and luxury. The ladies at the Front desk were wevy friendly and helpful. The bathrooms are quite small and should be completely renovated too (only the sink area was in our room). The location is perfect, right by Waikiki beach. Such a great experience to go back there!

Very good hotel with great location and spectacular view at Waikiki Beach. Only annoying thing was the elevator bell which could be heard in the room. Bathroom is not very big but nothing to complain about.

Appearance of the entrance is great & gets you excited for the potential .... But then..Zero organisation at reception. There were lines of people at every desk and some being served quicker than others. People cutting the queues to ask "quick questions" were not redirected to concierge or bell desk. There was no cold town and welcome drink (as advertised on the package for direct bookings) . Check in thereafter was easy enough.We got to our room - Nice and spacious.. nothing overly special. The rooms in the old renovated building (closest to the beach) still have the old sliding doors & frames which are rough and not easy to open and close and they let a lot of street noise & air-con generator noise in. The bathrooms are a horrible lay out - the toilet is literally at the door & next to the shower. You have to go in and step to the right & shut the door to use both & there is no space to move. No complimentary water & no wine glasses or bottle openers etc.The infinity pool is on level 3 - there was NO signage in our building. No directions from staff at check in & no instructions or guidance in any "in room guide". We went up and down the halls & had to ask another guest (also perplexed on arrival) & they directed us to .... the fire escape - a door that is usually alarmed, so we would never have walked out of it. The pool was cloudy pretty much our entire stay, so we barely went in.Service around the pool area was poor. It was slow and the staff were not very friendly. They would avoid eye contact so they didn't have to come over & they would stand and talk among themselves when people were waiting for them to catch their eye. We found out later (after complaining) that they had been churning through some staff over the months & hadn't got a good team together yet. There were some weird cocktails on the list too ... didn't quite work but you could tell they were trying to be different.The pool itself was in the shade quite a lot of the time & it was also very windy much of the time. But in contrast - the chairs behind the pool deck were blocked by the wind and very hot to lay in as they caught more of the sun. We struggled to find a happy medium.The gym was great! loads of good equipment all in good nick. The coffee shop on the main strip out side the hotel is awesome!! Great frozen coconut frappe (get a double shot) and great snacks an takeaway breakfast/lunch options. Good coffee - roasted in house. (name escapes me now unfortunately).Morimoto was GREAT!!! went 3 times!!!Location - it was ok ... bit far up the strip. If you like beach swims, you'll enjoy the location. Considering the price - I expected A LOT more.

Located across the street from kuhio beach. Newly remodeled, very clean, simple modern design, great service. Beautiful spacious lobby with giant aquarium where you can watch them feed the fish twice a day. Kids pool perfect at only 2.5-3 ft deep but still large- also lawn area with giant connect4 and Jenga. Bfast buffet free for kids 5 and under and half price for 6-12. Room includes reusable water bottles with access to water dispensers.

After reading the reviews, I chose this resort for my family's first trip to Hawaii/Oahu. It was a great decision. We had two queen beds, stayed for a week, and were very happy with our stay. Rooms: The decor is modern and fresh. The room was very clean, good working AC, big TV, fridge, coffee maker, and a decent size that fit our family of four. The room also had a balcony with chairs providing a nice ocean view. Overall the room is nice but not luxurious. Bathroom:It's small. No double vanity, no robes or slippers (or similar amenities you'd expect in a luxury hotel), and the toilet is nearly inside the shower.Location:Great but: 1) The resort is not on the sand. You need to physically cross the street to hit the beach. 2) The resort is located near the southeastern end of Kalakaua Ave. The restaurants and shopping centers are all located the opposite direction. Staff and Service:Excellent. We never encountered a single employee that wasn't extremely nice, hospitable, friendly, engaging, helpful, and genuinely interested in providing good service. I honestly thought about the reviews where people spoke of bad service and rude or unfriendly staff and I can't even imagine that being true from my experience with valet, the bellhop, spa, and the front desk. For example, Gabrielle was our server at the pool cabana and she was excellent. Attentive, prompt, made recommendations and suggestions on what to eat at the pool and around Oahu generally.Loved it, would go back.

The gist:Location: Exceptionally well. Hotel is located along the main street (escapes me) and you are just walking distance from Royal Hawaiian, International Marketplace and DFS (among others). Great restaurants as well surrounding the hotel. This is about the only good thing about this hotel.Rooms: Below average. They don't have slippers for guests. They don't have toothbrushes. They don't even provide complimentary bottled water in your room. For USD375 per night - these are small cost items they can put in to make the guest feel like the hotel is after their convenience.Bathrooms: Way below average. We were given one of those bathtub/shower combos that are messy and inconvenient. The drain kept clogging. The toilet bowl is around 5 inches from the edge of the tub - which makes one wonder who would luxuriate in the tub with a view of the toilet just inches away? Shower curtains need to be burned - they stink.Beds: Above average. Comfortable bed - firmness is just right. One queen sized bed each for me and my son.Beddings: Average. Nothing great. Nothing bad. Just average.Hotel Service: Below average. Staff isn't friendly - but they are not rude. They are just in a hurry all the time. No time for a smile or a hello - it's just a bland "Hi. Yes?" You would expect something more from a Hawaiian resort - but apparently, this is not the case. Eating around during our weeklong stay would suggest that they normal Hawaiian hospitality is quite warm and welcoming - the same isn't true for the hotel staff.Misc: 1) Just odd notes that might be of interest. They have someone in the hotel that called my wife at 8am trying to sell time shares. The next day, they called my room at around 9am with the same intent. Seems odd that the hotel is allowing this to happen.2) Twice, housekeeping knocked and opened the door asking if we want to have our room cleaned already. This was 9 in the morning. It seems they expect us to be out of our room by 9am. How early do Hawaiians normally wake up?3) The property provided free wifi to guests.

We have spent one week to this hotel. Place very nice, staff very helpful and friendly. Room is enough big and clean. Unfortunately only a few seats in the swimming pool area but view is very suggestive.

Amazing resort! Super friendly staff. JONES is the BEST. Find him at the pool area. He made us all feel like Kings and Queens . Had an issue at check out with the hotel charging our credit cards when we asked to pay cash but was promptly resolved by management. We will be back!

The resort is very stylish and chic and the staff was very gracious. The modern designs incorporate the Hawaiian culture, the aquarium was beautiful, the views of Diamond Head and the beach from the room were spectacular and the pool had a great seating area.

Updated hotel rooms with great views. Rooms were a good size with a coffee machine & large smart TV. Staff in pool area bar need training as found they were very slow and not willing to come back and either clear table or offer more drinks so only went there once! Great restaurants and bars short walk away. There are homeless people in front of the hotel and is not a good look for the hotel either. Hotel check in is slow with long queues even if you only have to pick up your key. No early check in available either.

This hotel is in a great location! Very easy to get to places and everything you need is within walking distance. The hotel itself is very well appointed and lovely to be in. The Foyer is very impressive upon arrival! They have a gorgeous wall behind reception that sets the tone for the whole hotel, which is lovely. The indoor aquarium is beautiful to look at in the Ocean Bar area. The rooms are large and the beds are exceptional...so comfortable!! We had double rooms with Oceanviews and they were both great rooms. The bathrooms are pretty good and the shower pressure is good - must say the only strange thing is that the toilets are extremely loud (flush like aeroplanes) and you can hear every single time toilets are flushed in all the rooms around & above, which means that you hear them mostly late at night and early morning. The pool area is lovely and well appointed. Loads of different seating options which is great to have at a hotel. Not often you see more than just sun lounges, so that was great! The service staff are very good (the room service and reception especially), only staff that let down the team were the concierges who need a lot more training in being helpful and pleasant - they left a lot to be desired which is a shame as they are the ones who should be the most pleasant and helpful. All in all we would absolutely recommend this hotel to others and we would certainly stay again! It is worth the spend. Great experience.

The hotel is in great location right across the Waikiki beach. The lobby area and the pool looks very pretty. Swimming pool looks nice and clean but was super tiny and crowded all the time. There was an ABC store on the ground floor and some neat restaurants which was convenient.Unfortunately, the room was old and had popcorn ceilings. My room had marks of water damage and possibly moldy looking black spots. The bathroom was very small. The walls and doors are not sound-proofed and it was very noisy thoroughout the stay, with noise from street, pool party, toilet flushing. My room had a door into the adjacent room and the neighbors voice kept me awake till 2am in the morning.The room had bare minimum amenities. There was no water bottle, no slippers or bathrobe. There was a soap bar instead of a liquid soap. Shower was tiny and had rainfall shower head with no shower handle.Both the checkin/checkout was quick and staff were pretty responsive and helpful when requested. However, at the checkout, I indicated that I had a late departure flight and would like to use their shower facility at the fitness gym, I was refused when I requested to have the access extended till the evening. Their reasoning was that the Fitness center was managed by third party.This is not a 5star or 4star hotel and for the shortcomings I would rather pay more for better service. There was no reason to compromise a once in a lifetime vacation for few hundred bucks IMO.

A trip to Oahu would be incomplete without a visit to the Alohilani. First the lobby is breathtaking with a 200,000 gallon fish tank and lounge. With stunning views from patio, our room had diamond head and ocean views. Located right near Waikiki strip everything is accessible walking. Walk to surf hops and they have board storage. The pool is saltwater infinity pool with nice sunset evenings and a bar. The longboard patio is being expanded and its excited to see the upgrade when it is complete. Both restaurants were great I preferred momasan for casual dining. Dailyn and customer service were friendly and resolved any issue promptly. Hope you are able to visit, enjoy your stay. Cheers!!!

We recently stayed at this great resort, the service was exceptional, a special mention to the team at the Swell Pool, Jones, Jenni, Nikki and the team couldn’t do enough for us to make us feel welcome and relaxed during our stay, the Swell Pool has a relaxing atmosphere. The resort is modern, clean and amenities as second to none, the gym was equipped. The hotel location was excellent central to everything Waikiki has to offer, the rooms are roomy, clean and we had an amazing view of Waikiki. We upgraded to the new Long Board club which we highly recommend, a great way to unwind, the breakfast offer, and wines and canapés in the evening including beverages was well worth the value. We highly recommend this hotel, all staff from check in, right through to management made our stay extra special. We can’t wait to return again next year, Mahalo

We're an Aussie couple, stayed for 10-nights, and only on O'ahu (our first time in Hawaii).The Alohilani has a new renovated look and feel, was comfortable, clean and friendly. Note that if you look at the hotel photos online, the odd looking hallway carpets are new but just a strange pattern.We liked that we were given reusable water bottles on check-in, such a good idea. The water refill stations are on Level 1, which is a bit annoying when you're thirsty at 10pm, but still a great idea overall.Staff we're great. Pool is nice, and looks towards Waikiki beach. Gym is near new, and excellent.Be aware that if you stay longer than 6 nights, the hotel auto-charges your credit card for the first 6-days. Unfortunately we weren't told about it when we checked in. It was an issue for us, as they also held the full amount on check-in, so both amounts combined maxed out our credit card (Aussie banks take a couple of days to release the held amount). Something to consider for your circumstances.Location is fairly good, lots to do (and in our opinion the better part of Waikiki beach), and we spent a lot of our time to the West of the hotel along Kalakaua Avenue.Alohilani is right opposite the sheltered lagoon on Waikiki beach (minimal ocean waves) but you can paddle out further for a surf if that's your thing. We did stand up paddle boarding here, and really enjoyed it. There's also a free hula show on Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday at 6pm, about 50m to the west of the hotel, along the beach front.If you're an Aussie that likes espresso style coffee, rather than American filtered style, definitely go to "Kai Coffee" directly downstairs on Kalakaua Avenue. A small cafe latte there is like a normal Aussie latte.

I was in Hawaii on a business trip and stayed at the Alohilani Resort Waikiki Beach for 4 nights. The location of this resort is several footsteps from the beach (a must for me). My room was very comfortable in every way. I woke every morning to a room view that overlooked both the Pacific Ocean and Diamond Head Mountain. Housekeeping made sure my room was immaculate every morning, the hotel employees are friendly and extremely helpful. The outdoor pool area was true to the photographs (amazing), more importantly, the pool staff headed by Nikki Utley (Pool Experience Manager) made my trip even more delightful. This group is exciting, full of energy, very attending and offer a great poolside experience. This will always be my hotel choice when visiting Waikiki Beach in the future.

Highly recommend this gorgeous hotel which has a lovely pool and patio area on the fifth floor and is close to the beach but not in the craziness of the area. Excellent hospitality! Really love the staff
user_name:
Barbara B
Mundelein IL, United States

review_body: We checked into 'Alohilani around 0200 in the morning after needing to escape from a disastrous Airbnb experience, one that was crawling with bugs and cockroaches!!! 'Alohilani was our saving grace. We had called this resort around 0030 that morning, explained our situation, to which the manager responded "just come on down, we'll take care of you, no further explanation necessary". We drove down to Waikiki from the North Shore, arrived at 'Alohilani, and were greeted by Solomon, the manager on duty. Solomon was warm, welcoming, and empathetic to our situation. Solomon went above and beyond for us. Not only were we provided with a lovely clean room, but since it was so late and we were only staying the one night, he waived the resort fees, parking fees, and provided us with two complimentary breakfast vouchers. Solomon, thank you so much for your hospitality. We slept great that night, and you truly helped rescue our vacation.

I stayed here for 6 nights. Firstly the place is really nice and the pool and gym are great. The staff were nice too. We had one of the newly renovated rooms with a balcony where you could look out and see the pool and some of the ocean. The coffee making facilities were good and the continental breakfast is a croissant, yoghurt an apple and a museli bar. My biggest complaint is the bathroom. The shower and toilet are seperate to the sink and mirror. There's a door in between but no door to hide you getting changed in front of the mirror. There is another mirror in the room which reflects perfectly so the other person can see you if they are in bed. Why not get changed where the shower is you ask? Well unless you like putting your stuff on the toilet there is absolutely no room for it. So keep in mind if you are travelling with someone whom you don't want to see you naked then this is not the place to stay.The cleaning lady on floor 14 was really nice and some of the concierges were good. The place is pretty clean except when I was having a drink in the aquarium bar and went to use the toilets and they were covered in piss. Female toilets. I said something to one of the bar staff but they didn't seem to care.

Excellent service and amenities; would definitely stay here again Service and quality of service was excellent. Great place for family couples or even single. Wish it had a microwave inside this hotel

My family and I stayed here for our staycation and it was the perfect getaway! Great price and location for our room. Wonderful pool and hot tub, an easy view and walk to the beach, restaurants and shopping right there! We would definitely book again.

As soon as we got into our room we called the front desk to come and clean it the room and bathroom. Hair all over the bathroom and bed. Walls and floors were dirty. The bathroom was TINY!!! It doesn't look like the pictures they post online.

Wonderful Place Great Location, Awesome property, Staff very friendly and helpful. Pool area was relaxing day and night with infinity Pool, bar, food service and comfortable couches with fire pit at night.

Just got back and we were in room 1201 (the front tower) for 6 nights. It’s an interconnecting room and could hear lots of noise from the other room. 1201 is also right on the corner 5 levels above the pool so can hear all the noise from there which wasn’t a big deal and expected during the day but went on until late at night. The view we had was great but not worth the noise as we were on holiday to relax and also like a good nights sleep. We spoke to the hotel when we first got to the room and asked to be moved they said they were full and would get back to us the next day. They didn’t get back to us again for our entire stay. We even did a google review while there which the hotel commented on but still didn’t contact us. Our last night was the worst sleep of all as people were in the spa yelling all night. We had to get up at 4am to get to airport and they were still in there going strong at 5am when we left.The drinks at the pool were expensive $29 for a draft beer and cocktail. We have previously stayed at the Outrigger Reef but thought we would try somewhere that was a little more updated and regret this decision. We will be going back to Outrigger Reef. I think what disappoints us the most is that they simply didn’t care about doing anything to help. They already had our money so nothing we could do.

Awesome holiday experience, the service was sensational, the Swell Pool area is the most chilled & relaxing atmosphere, Jones Valenzuela, as always is the perfect host, joined by a professional and friendly team, Nikki, Mikki, hosts, Jenny Kim, and Janice who could not do more for us to make our stay special. It was great to also meet the Food & Beverage Manager, Jonathan Cohn, who took time out to meet, and great guests to make them feel welcome.The rooms are modern, this was my 10th trip to Hawaii, and the best hotel I have experienced in Hawaii, with upgraded & modern facilities, and the gym is well equipped. Guests are made to feel special, and all staff at the hotel provided personalized service right from check in, concierge, Swell Pool, room service, and the Long Board Club which we highly recommend upgrading to. We loved our time at this hotel and will be back again next April. Wonderful experience, highly recommend, Mahalo

Stayed here twice on our recent holiday. First was 3 days in the bigger of the 2 towers. About level 23. Room was quite and comfy. Second stay there was for 6 night and was in the smaller tower level 12. Right above the pool. Which is clearly not controlled as there were guests partying well past 4:40 am ( we checked out at this time) the room we had was interconnecting and we had a baby and loud talkers staying next door, we asked to be moved they said they would get back to us. They didn’t. We wrote a google review while still there. They didn’t care and just said sorry and would pass on our comments. This hotel looks pretty. But that’s it. Pool drinks are very expensive. And poor service from bar staff. Lots of places are better to had a drink. They room toiletries weren’t nice and in our first stay they clearly weren’t checked as the bottles were half full. Air con was either hot or freezing. Would not keep to a constant temp. Resort fees are very expensive for what they say you get. Queue when waiting to check in can be very long at times and disorganised with no actual line so basically if your pushy and rude you go next. Cleaner decided to vaccume outside rooms at 8:30 am a few times. I must say only really positive I found here compared to the other place we stayed on our last visits was its right above KAI coffee. While the wait could be between 10 and 30 mins for a coffee. It was one of the best coffees we had while there. Next time we go we will head back down the other end towards outrigger reef.

The super friendly and well managed staff was very attentive to our needs. Really enjoyed the decor and cleanliness of our room. We love the lobby bar with the giant aquarium. It is so tranquil and relaxing. I'd recommend this place for visitors and locals alike. A very high class clientele with lots of aloha.

I requested 2 queen beds and got a king so one of us had to sleep on roll away for 3 days. They assumed giving us free breakfast would suffice. They did not offer another room at any point. I had to request one be found. Bathrooms so small you practically had to stand on toilet to shut the door. As for partial ocean view, yes if you lean out balcony and look left you can see the ocean between the other hotels. When we changed rooms, they gave us ocean view which was nice but the room smelled when the air conditioner came on like it was taking in air from their kitchen exhaust outlet. We gave up and bought an air freshener. The room and balcony doors need sound proofing because you can hear all the noise in the hall and outside street level - doors slamming closed and especially the elevators ringing when they arrive at your floor. I was down the hall but I felt really sorry for the people close to the elevators. No exhaust fan in bathroom. Definitely not a 5 star resort..

This hotel is placed far from the malls, but if you enjoy walks, it is OK. Staff was excellent, rooms and service was very good. The beach distance is good, about 5 min from room. The food is bit pricy, but the food tastes great.

We had a fabulous experience staying at Alohilani Resort. We arrived very early for check in, and assumed we would have to wait about 4 hours for our room- after flying all night with a two year old. We were greeted by Eric at the check in counter, and not only was he super friendly, but he informed us we could check in early. The room was clean and tidy, with a wonderful view of Waikiki Beach.Only one criticism, the buffet breakfast was very expensive, and for the price was disappointing. Thank you very much Eric, and thank you Alohilani Resort! The Williams Family :)

We have just had 4 nights here. Ocean front room on 12 floor. Lovely views and you see all sorts from here. However, we think we should have had a room away from the Main Street. The rooms were clean and light. Bed was comfortable. But it was noisy pretty much all night. I guess on the beach front you have to expect this but it was the homeless people who seem to dwell on the rise opposite that fought through the night who made lots of noise. People banged doors loudly and one night we had the air con off the music from the room next door came through our vent so loudly it woke us. This seemed odd. We also found the air con noisy at night but when turned off the room was too hot. No winning here really. The bathroom as others have said is very small with mere centimetres to spare when you sat on the loo and closed the door. A larger person would struggle. I’m 5 ft and found the space claustrophobic. Amenities a bit short. If you don’t want wet hair, take your own shower cap as you won’t get one here. Pillows were very very soft and one traveller had to deal with a sore neck.Upside ... good location, excellent restaurant on level 1 Momosana, friendly staff, clean, nice poolside area for snacks in the evening, good pool towels.Be aware of the resort fee. It’s a bit pricey, but excellent fast wifi included. They do tack on a tree tax mid way in the final account. You need to ask to have this removed. This should be optional, not assumed. We’d consider this 3.5 star to 3.75, as opposed to 4 star

Sometimes an apology is not enough when you experience more than one bad experience at the same hotel. Over charged for parking, no room service available, not enough servers at the pool unless you rent a cabana. Room was smaller when I upgraded to premium ocean front. Used laundry service for two bags of laundry and only got one returned to me. Brought this up to front desk and asked to speak to a manager. She did not call the manager to speak to me.
