Staff are friendly but seemed understaffed when I went. I expected a lot better from this hotel.

Throughout our whole stay we spent most the time by the pool and eating at the pool bar because of the amazing service we received. Janice and Jones were wonderful. Nothing was too difficult and with my children we had a lot of requests. Our daughter had her first birthday by the pool and Janice and Jones allocated an area for my extended family to relax by the pool without me even asking. She even organised plates and spoons for cake for us. They were always one step ahead and always happy to see us which made us feel special. Other staff were also lovely we will definitely be returning in the future. The pool area and faculties were great for adults and children and my family and I had a great time!

Checked in @ Alohilani Resort in waikiki and I was amazed but how beautiful this hotel has become after renovations. Stayed in the beach tower and everything so near from ABC store in the lobby and the beach just right across the street. They even have a Resturant called Morimoto Asia and I highly recommend it during happy hour 5-7pm drink specials and food specials. Something I’d say it worth checking out.

Travelling as a party of four, almost everything was great. Check-in was easy, and the staff had all our details on the package we had bought. The rooms were ample in size, and as we were in the rear tower facing Mount Head, our views of the beach area were restricted, but that did not reduce the impact of the view.We loved the Pool Area and the staff. And we all thought the food and drinks were better by the pool rather than in the O Bar. I assume the food all comes from the same kitchen, so maybe it was just the environment that made the food seem better.As many others have commented, the toilet/bath area is tiny. I guess there must be some sort of fire regulation or structural need for the internal wall, but a good investment by 'Alohilani would be to get an engineer to sort out the bathroom area. The concierge area was a nightmare for us; they kept trying to sell us some sort of timeshare, to the extent, that after day two, we avoided using the concierges.The real rating for this review should be a 4.5, but I can't do that, rounded up to a five.

Great stay-cation destination. Wife and I spent the early part of the weekend here and absolutely loved it. The staff is great. We we're greeted with a smile every time we passed them in the hallway, parking lot or elevator. From what I understand the hotel was renovated a year or so back and they nailed it. The Swell Bar is a nice place to listen to music and enjoy company by the sofas. The O Bar with the three story aquarium has the best ambiance in Waikiki. Friday night they had live music at the O Bar and a DJ at the Swell Bar. Nice views of Diamond Head and Kuhio Beach from our room. Comfortable king size bed. We will definitely come back when we feel like being "tourist" again. We didn't get to try the resort restaurant s though. Definitely would recommend for anyone wanting to stay in Waikiki, or locals that would like to do a stay-cation. Come check it out!

My twin and I turned 65 this month and we truly enjoyed ourselves. The Alohilani Resort is spectacular! We both had our own partial ocean view room. The husbands had a wonderful time as well. I used the fitness center everyday as well as the amenities.

Today is my last day at this wonderful resort. Just had to write a review so that others can find this place. I arrived a week ago and had to make a last minute adjustment to my reservation. Amy (bell desk) found the perfect room for me and my friend who had flown all the way from Berlin to join me. We LOVED our room, the view, etc. (#1509) The location was awesome, not buried in the midst of the shopping centers but close enough that I could go and grab my friend a “welcome-to-Hawaii-and-thanks-for-flying-sixteen-hours” gift from Lush without too much trouble. We rented a car for the week so we could explore the island (a must). Parking is very expensive on the island but not at our resort. We bought a week parking pass in the hotel which cost less than %50 the price of a daily pass. This is also a must. There are two GREAT restaurants on the ground floor. One is pricey but worth it (Morimoto) and the other is perfect for your daily ramen fix (Momosan.) A beautiful beach is right across the street from the hotel and last night (Saturday) there was an awesome Hula show on the beach with dancers of all ages. Just wonderful.

My experience at Swell Pool & Bar, i.e. the infinity pool on level 5 was fantastic with some truly wonderful staff working there (Nikki, Jones, Rachael and Gabrielle to name a few)... Unfortunately, the hotel itself was not quite as fabulous! Guest Services would send me a text message enquiring about my stay but as soon as you said you had a problem via return text, they went silent and ignored you... and I was stuck in the lift for 45 minutes with just a 'sorry' when we got out (a complimentary cocktail or similar may have been nice).Negatives: noisy air conditioning units, air con would turn itself back on during the night, flushing of toilets in adjoining rooms was audible during the night, water pressure in shower is very very low and challenging when washing long hair, beds are comfortable if you get past the fact that some have developed a depression in the middle from use.Positives: good location, great pool, good food and cocktails poolside.

As this was our third time in Hawaii we wanted to try somewhere new and this hotel did not disappoint! From the moment we arrived we were treated so well! Jane at reception was a delight and was so patient with our two overtired kids! I found this an excellent hotel to stay at as a family with young children. The hotel and rooms were spotless. The location is perfect and we found the quick walk over the road to the beach perfect. The infinity pool was the absolute highlight of our trip as our kids spent most days there. There is also a kids pool (right by the infinity pool) which they also liked. The staff at this hotel are genuinely interested in your wellbeing and making sure you are enjoying your stay. In particular Jones, who works in the pool area, was an absolute star and made sure we had everything we needed! Jones went out of his way to make sure my boys enjoyed every day by the pool. We can’t thank Jones enough for his exceptional customer service and for making those days by the pool so much more enjoyable! Another hotel highlight was the oceanarium where they feed the fish twice daily. My boys loved watching the diver feed the fish, especially the puffer fish! There was a marine biologist on hand every feed to answer our questions which was great. It was such a lovely experience for us all. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Waikiki! We had a wonderful stay and will be back!

We stayed her for three nights and where glad we chose this area and hotel. The hotel itself is beautiful, and very clean. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. The pool on the 5th floor is also very clean and nice. Although I do disagree with them charging to reserve certain areas in the pool lounge area. So we stuck to the complimentary beds. I can't fault this hotel as it ticks most boxes. But they can do something in terms of security as anybody can walk in from outside, access the lift and get to any floor or pool area. The hotel is located right opposite Waikiki Beach (3/5 mins walk). And so many places to eat around the area. Being vegetarians we had no issues finding food. Highly recommend staying here if your looking for a hotel in the Waikiki area.

Location was prime and stay was beyond measure! Treated with first class service the whole stay. Price was just right! Not too high and not too low! The views were absolutely wonderful! 17th floor was amazing! I suggest it for everyone!

The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki. Very clean and well appointed. It is expensive and, like most of the hotels there, you also have to pay a daily "amenities fee" on top of the room cost ( this is currently $USD40 per day + tax of $1.88 per day). The amenities, many of which we didn't use, include WiFi access (which was very fast), so we could not really avoid paying it. It seems you cannot book bed and breakfast, but room only. We did not have breakfast at the hotel because it was very expensive (currently $USD33 per person), but there is an ABC shop attached to the hotel which sells all kinds of things, including breakfast fixings, so that was really useful. The hotel had a very nice infinity pool, also a gym (we didn't use it so can't comment) various shops, bars and restaurants. Also has a tour desk and they were helpful.

the Alohilani is perfect position to visit Waikiki close to a beach and restaurants and many retail shopsevery member of the staff was courteous and followed thru with any request. if one rents a car and pays for valet parking it was worth every dollar.

Just finished a 7 day stay at the Alohilani. Overall, we were happy with our stay. The bed was extremely comfortable, room clean and the pool/spa are excellent. Staff were accommodating but this is definitely not a 5 star hotel. The facilities did not meet standards of other 5 star hotels I have stayed in previously. No body wash in the supplies, or hand soap at the basin. There was also nowhere to hang wet bathing suits, or towels after being in the water. The bathrooms are TINY and the door only clears the toilet by a matter of 1-2cm. No robes or slippers which would have been nice as it is cool in the evenings and I had really sore feet from hiking and a cut from the reef. No amenities kit, no mini bar, no room service. Breakfast was stupidly expensive so we went out every day to get our own. Maid service was ok but bare minimum, made bed and topped up coffee supplies. Was kept up a couple of nights from loud noise (people screaming!) in the pool past 11pm. Rang front desk and was told it would be sorted but the screaming went on until 12am when the pool closed. Overall, definitely not worth the $400+ per night. The location was good and it’s new and modern but I would stay somewhere else should I return.

I am very happy with this hotel. It is down a way from the crowds near Hilton Hawaiian but still right on the beach. You had to go out on the balcony to see the ocean but that was ok, having an ocean view was more than I wanted to pay. I loved crossing the street and being on the beach. The pool was great too! On the 5 th floor I think it’s called a infinity pool. It looks like the water just falls off the edge. There was an ABC store across from our elevator to buy sundries and reasonably priced food. There were also a few restaurants in the complex. I would stay here in a heartbeat. Check your bill though, they missed a few credits that I was due, but we got that fixed.

We enjoyed the roof top pool, location of the resort and the activities! Everything you need is at the resort. The staff is friendly which helps with making your stay pleasant. My husband and I were the best looking people on the beach and walking through the resort, since we attended both of the lei making classes.

I can’t say enough about our recent visit to the Alohilani Resort. The rooms were clean and beautiful and very comfortable. The Infiniti rooftop pool was our favorite part of the day. The pool staff were awesome. From the lush towels to the bar/food service to the chilled face towels to the frozen grapes and freshly baked cookies.... Nikki Utley and her crew should be commended for providing the ultimate pool experience! I loved the Alohilani pool chair towel so much I wanted one as a souvenir which Nikki helped arrange. Thank you Nikki. My husband and I can’t wait to come back!!

We stayed here for a week and we had a partial ocean view room. It was amazing with a beautiful view of Waikiki beach. The rooms are large and have everytbing you need in them. The hotel is so beautiful with such a nice ambience.There is an awesome pool with bar etc and also a lap pool. The check in and out service was efficient.A really nice place to stay

We enjoyed our stay at the Alohailani. We had a partial ocean view room which was great however we found it very noisy from street traffic and music from the bar below as there is no double glazing on the lanai doors.We appreciated the coffee pod machine in the room but regularly had to ask for more supplies which were given happily. The bed was comfortable and amenities were good. We loved the location and found it very handy to the beach as well as the ABC store connected to the hotel which was very handy for any supplies needed. We thought the roof pool was quite small for the number of hotel guests and extremely busy alot of the time.Overall a lovely stay and great location

We stayed here with a group as we were attending a wedding.The whole experience was very pleasant and accomodating.The staff were always obliging.Especially the maintanence team who helped with a few things.The pool staff Nikki,Mathew and Jones were fabuluous!!!!the bar staff too Russ!!

There were cockroaches in our hotel room. I experienced this problem in a cheap motel but I can't believe I would see it in a 4-5 stars resorts. That's such a huge disappointment. The website on trip master shows that this resort has a sauna but I asked the guest service at the fitness and spa here and she said they don't have a sauna. Either she doesn't know or it is false advertisement! Also the refrigerator was not working properly. Twice we have to call someone to come fix it.

We stayed for 3 nights after completing a cruise from Australia. The checking process was ok with plenty of people on the front counter. We dropped our bags and headed out. Our room was ready when we returned. The hallway of the level we were on (3) was freezing to the point of uncomfortable. The room was ok, very clean and well presented. I found the bed to be quite uncomfortable. The walls though are paper thin. Noise travels through the walls and door quite a lot compared to other hotels as does external noise as the sliding doors are older and not soundproofed. The amenities were good and the staff very pleasent and helpful. A great location for Waikiki beach of course. So overall as per the title- some good and some not. Would probably seek out a different place next time.

There were a lot of ups and downs with staying here. Small rooms, no room service, no necessary amenities, microwave, mini bar, toiletries etc. For as much as the rate is you think they would upgrade the goodies inside, but sadly no. We came during construction time apparently and it was beyond noisy and smelled of toxic fumes everywhere. Unfortunately the staff was a hit or miss as if they couldn't be bothered to even say hello. However, we did get lucky at the pool, our cabana server Brittany was great. She knew what we needed without asking, was so sweet and even recommended dinner spots and secret places to see during our stay. The classes they offer was another up, with the sunset yoga and hula classes. This hotel is in a great location but they squeeze you for your pennies so choose wisely.

1. Rooms and bathroom very small. No where to hang wet towels. 2. Rooms have a stand alone ac unit like you see in a 2star hotel that makes one side of the room very cold and the other side comfortable. The ac unit made a loud crackling noise the entire trip and maintenance said something about the whole tower had air in system and nothing could be done about it. 3. They have no earplugs to help accommodate the very loud noise. No individual toothpaste if you forgot or ran out( even courtyard Marriott gives me toothpaste when I forget it ). 4. They have NO room service. The restaurant will do to go orders, but won’t take the order over the phone, so you have to deliver the order and then go pick it up. 5. No concierge (the people they have is a third party trying to sell you packages and no knowledge of local restaurants)6. Newly renovated and public areas are sleek and modern. 7. Beautiful view of diamond head from 38th floor. The long and short is the hotel is pretty, but the employees (except for shay on the concierge floor who was wonderful ) we’re not very helpful or interested in improving the situation it’s a 3.5 star property but definitely not 5....

We stayed at Alohilani for 7 nights in a partial ocean view room. I would recommend asking for a NON interconnecting room as the noise from our neighbours in the room next door was quite loud. The location was fantastic and the pool was very nice too. Very hard to find info on the day spa - we never made it there. The food offerings are two japanese style restaurants connected to the hotel but open to the public. We did not get breakfast included as it was $35US per person per day and there was a multitude of offerings within easy walking distance which were cheaper and offered much more variety. for my 30th birthday we received a small size bottle of wine and a plate of macarons.

We had a wonderful family holiday at Alohilani Resort where all our expectations were met. The resort is in a great location with easy access to the beach, transport and shopping - will definitely return her in the future.

Chic and minimal design fits perfectly in this beach front location. Expansive lobby with over sized fish tank is very inviting. Japanese influence is seen in the decor and vibe. Isabelle at the front desk is charming and very professional. Her smile and aloha spirit brought some much needed energy to us weary travelers. Room decor is modern, minimal and well appointed. Hotel location is great being right across the street from Waikiki. Roof top infinity pool and bar are elegant but casual. Cabanas and seating areas are accented with fire features. Perfection. Not giving 5 stars because of the lack of room service. Morimoto Asia is a must however.

spent Memorial Day weekend at this beautiful property that is placed along the Waikiki strip. I’d give it 5 stars but the staff was very aloof & unhelpful Room was clean & well stocked. Some unique artwork if you are luck enough to have the right building

I stayed at this hotel with my friend. The hotel was so clean and great location. We liked the infinity pool too! Even though there was not enough staffs when we checked out, we were satisfied with this hotel overall.

Our first trip to Hawaii far exceeded our expectations thanks to this beautiful hotel and it's staff members who stood out namely Nicki and Jones. After 14 days there it was sad to leave them as they treated us like family more than just guests. So friendly and so helpful and warm. Our 30 year anniversary was spent in style and luxury here. From the ocean front views to the exceptional pool service this hotel was perfectly located away from the bustle of the main hotels. The pool didn't have every tourist walking past. The evening entertainment and ambience on the roof terrace was a great way to unwind and meet new people. We will be back. Our new home away from home.

I stayed here in July 2018 and was more than impressed with everything from staff right through to all amenities, as a result I returned in May 2019. I have been left very disappointed. The rooms are still modern, however staff were often less than enthusiastic. My first few days were Memorial Day weekend and the hotel was at capacity. Service at the pool area was awful. One of my favorite things about this hotel is the outdoor training area. I used this a couple of times and on one occasion found the toilets to be blocked or simply gross. I tipped the maid daily, however a glass from the pool bar remained in my room (and it is still here!) for three days. The AC thermostat does not detect when the room is above the desired setting, meaning that during the night I was awake and melting from the heat. I am not entirely sure I will return. If I do, it will be for the outdoor exercise area!

Great location, very friendly staff, beautiful hotel lobby however rooms are comparatively somewhat dated. Pool area is really crowded (seems like a lot of people just show up to use the pool or people are getting rooms and inviting loads of friends/family over) but this is not a big deal since the beach across the street is beautiful and has way warmer water than the pool.
user_name:
rob b
New York City, New York

review_body: Entire team from the parking, front desk and housekeeping had Aloha and were all about service. Love this resort. Location is awesome and rooms are modern and so comfortable! I appreciate finding a resort like this in Waikiki.
user_name:
Duane E
Kihei, Hawaii, United States

review_body: This hotel is in a great location as you can pop out the back door for a swim or to shop, and an ABC shop is in the ground floor. The boys out the front were extremely helpful booking transport and with advice on buses. Unfortunately the windows are not double glazed and the room doors are not soundproof. Expect it to be noisy and try to get a room away from the lift well as the lifts have a bell that rings loudly each time the doors open.

Good location just off Waikiki beach. The public areas are good. The pool areas were a little busy but great atmosphere. Hotel rooms are basic with small bathroom lacked a little luxury. We had a premium room.

Our room was a king bed suite.It was comfy and clean.The staff were friendly and accommodating on every instance.The pools and surroundings were beautiful and so well presented that spending time there was very enjoyable

I stayed here at Alohilani in February and absolutely loved the property and the amenities. Therefore, back again in April. The views were amazing and the pool staff was over the top! Janis was amazing. She always makes me feel at home and was very friendly. She truly is the prime example of exceptional customer service. I appreciate you Janis and cannot thank you enough for being so awesome! You and your team are the best!!! Thank you again for another wonderful stay.

We stayed here for 2 nights after a week in a hotel on the beach. Wanted to try out this refurbished hotel for our next visit to Hawaii. The hotel itself is beautiful. The rooms were lovely but as I had read in other reviews, you almost had to step over the toilet to get into the shower. Bathroom was very small. Service and staff were great. Eddie took us to our room and he was fantastic. Full of useful information and very helpful. As lovely as this hotel was, I wouldn’t go back. Firstly, it was up the seedy end of Waikiki beach. More annoyingly, it was overcrowded. Constant queues to get up the elevators or to talk to reception. On our last day in Waikiki we wanted to just relax and lounge by the pool. Went down 3 times and couldn’t get a seat. In the pool itself, it was standing room only. Kids everywhere, splashing and very loud music blaring. I refused to pay the resort fee, as I didn’t get to use the facilities. Other concern was that you could access the elevators from a side door off the street and anyone could go up to any floor they wanted with no security. Made me feel a bit uneasy. Beautiful hotel, but just way too busy.

The Alohilani Resort is a very upscale hotel in a unique location. It is situated towards the Southern end of Waikiki, a couple of blocks away from the Honolulu Zoo. It is the quiet end of Kalakaua Ave., but a very short 10min walk to the nightlife, action, and shopping.My biggest takeaway from the hotel was how clean it was and how attentive staff was. In particular, Dailyn (concierge) went above and beyond. She was very helpful with recommendations, accommodations and checking in on us throughout our stay. Furthermore, she was very down-to-Earth, which is something I cannot always say about staff at other high-end hotels. Her recommendations for food were great!

We booked two rooms for two couples at the Alohilani for one night in early May. It was a nice stay with excellent rooms, but then we found that we'd both been charged for one of the rooms. Okay, we'll get a refund. How hard can that be? (Expedia manages it in seconds.) I got in touch with the hotel, filled out a form (which they quaintly wanted faxed back) then had a call with them to confirm that I'm really me. Days later, I'm still waiting for the money to arrive in my account. I've emailed several times confirming my account details and asking when this payment might turn up. Is there a problem? Do they not have enough information? I have no idea, because I'm still waiting for an answer. I've resorted to this review in the hope that it might summon a response from the Alohilani. And also a refund . . .

This hotel is modern and newly renovated from the old Pacific Beach hotel. The room is bright and cozy. Amazing view of the ocean From the balcony. The infinity pool is a great place to relax and watch the sunset. The hotel provides you high quality bathroom amenities from Miele. It is situated near the plentiful of shops and restaurants along Waikiki. I would definitely come back and stay here again.

The heart of this hotel is around the Swell Pool area. The staff here are attentive, kind and a lot of fun. We were staying for a couple of weeks finishing off our honeymoon and the pool staff couldn't have been nicer to us. The bar menu for food and drinks is great and a turn in the cabanas makes you feel like a movie star. I'd like to make a special mention of Jonsey and Janice who looked after us so well - friends like these are fantastic find on holiday.In respect of the other amenities in the hotel they are more than adequate but if you're a regular in 5* hotels you might be a bit disappointed by the overall standard of the rooms. The complimentary toiletries are a bit basic (bars of soap for example), the aircon is old-fashioned and very noisy and there's no mini-bar.The onsite restaurants are pretty good and the breakfast offering is very good for Japanese guests but less so for Europeans.

Lovely hotel in a great location. Very clean and tidy. The pool area is amazing and the pool itself an absolute joy to swim in and then overlook Waikiki beach. Good food and cocktails/drinks at the pool as well.

The Alohilani Resort was a great place to stay, close enough to the action of Waikiki beach without being over crowded. Good room layout and design, with excellent storage and power. The recent refurbishment of the hotel was well done with all common areas a cut above other local hotels. Food in the restaurants was excellent, staff were helpful and diligent.

We stayed here last year and had a great time but this time around were left disapointed. Costs seem to have gone up and there were a few issues with the service like the waitress serving me an alcoholic drink that I did not ask for even though I am six months pregnant and the room not being cleaned that thoroughly. The hotel itself is beautiful but I'm not sure i'll be staying here again.

Very impressive upon arrival check in very quick and pleasant except room wasn’t ready given a key and when entering room people still in there however the rooms although satisfactory very small bathroom you need to step over toilet to get out of shower but the most disappointing of all is the pool area loud busy music blaring kids all over the pool even thought there is a separate pool for them playing football in the sauna and overcrowded we could not stay as the noise level was I unbearable Staff amazing but we would never go back there it completely spoiled it for us

This place was so beautiful, very clean and modern Jones in the pool area you are an amazing person you went above and beyond to look after us on a daily basisOverall this place was fantastic great location very central and suited our needs Highly recommend for families

We stayed in the Alohilani Resort Waikiki for 5 night, in an Ocean View Room. The positives are the location, amenities and customer service. The rooms are clean and well presented and i did enjoy the pool deck and all the facilities offered. The concierge was the best, helping us arrange tours and providing advice, thank you so much. It really is a great place to stay and we will return there again. But to be honest I felt we got the short straw regarding the room. Our room was #1216 and whist the ocean view was nice we were on the east side of the building. On the ground floor of the east side is a very large kitchen exhaust fan extracting all those fumes from the food outlets on ground floor and this made the balcony at times very unpleasant. So for our next stay i will request the west side of the building or the premium ocean view room, which is a true ocean view

Had a wonderful stay at this excellently located Hotel in downtown Waikiki. The food was excellent and I loved the location with a beautiful view of Diamond Head. It was perfect that it was located on the edge of town so there were no buildings on one side where the zoo was located. We could actually hear the elephants trumpet while we were sitting next to the pool which was really cool.

Just got back from our 5 night stay at The Alohilani Resort. The property is gorgeous with great amenities. Pool is wonderful! Room was very large and clean ( Im very picky with cleanliness). We ate one night at the pool lounge Swell. Price was reasonable and service was great. Momosan is a must try! I would highly recommend this hotel!

We stayed here for 9 nights, and we stayed in a “ocean view” room, hmmm not sure if you can call ocean view having to go out into your balcony and turn your head right and see a 50 metre of ocean a “ocean view”, rather it should be called a partial ocean view. We had partial view of Diamond Head, and a full view of the car park below. I thought the room was on the smaller side and bathroom even more so, but it was clean. Pool and Bar area was great. Staff were friendly. Location was great, across the road from the beach ( which is great for little kids because of the break wall) and down about 200 mtrs it’s better for older kids and adults. Major bus stop 100mtrs up the road also. I think the hotel is over priced.

Food was great, service even better. Staff was absolutely excellent at desks, restaurants, pool, etc. Brittany, Mickie, Jones, Janice....even when placing phone calls with questions. Housekeeping was wonderful! Couldn’t have felt more taken care of. Highly recommend.

This looks like an amazing hotel. My friends and I booked to stay there for 7 nights but we ended up changing to the Queen Kapiolani (better deal and views to die for). I cancelled the booking more than 72 hours beforehand as is required by the terms and conditions and I received a confirmation of cancellation email. However upon checking my bank account whilst in Waikiki, the Alohilani had withdrawn over $800 Aus (2 rooms for 1 night each) for not cancelling. I rang them and they chased it up. They said they were at fault as they get a lot of cancellation emails but mine were missed... They have now refunded the money since I have returned home so my spending money on my trip with friends was reduced by over $800....not impressed.

Stayed here one month ago for a week of spring break vacation. The things I like:.Convenient location. Right across street from the beach. Shopping mall and various restaurants within short walking distance .Our ocean view room on 20 floor has good views of the ocean and Diamond Head..Both the lobby and room are clean.Wifi signal is strong What I don’t like:At the time of checkout, I got charged for close to $300 of Resort fee. That’s for public access of WiFi, pool and gym. This should be considered as essential services for any modern hotel. Compared to the real Resort in Caribbean, there is no on site activities or fancy hotel ground. I don’t think the Resort fee is warranted. There are some real resorts out of Honolulu when we took boat ride. I’d classify this one as a hotel.

What a great location with the resort being right across from the beach. Great staff well worth staying at this resort Have stayed here before and has totally been renovated and looks amazing and great pool area.

For Waikiki, this is really good. To set the scene, though, I have to first warn people about Hawaii if you haven't been there.We love Hawaii - it's just so - well, mahalo. It's chill, it's relaxed, as long as you don't erroneously expect a modern luxurious holiday - which you certainly won't be getting, and that's tough considering the price you have to pay. America in general is very run down, tired, in desperate need of infrastructure spend. It's worse in Hawaií, as it's a locked-in Democratic state - both the Dems and the GOP know that money spent will make no difference to the electoral outcomes so is a waste, hence: no infrastructure spend. There's no industry but tourism (and the miltary!!!) and (at a guess) 85% of the hotels are owned off-shore, so that's where the profits go.If you've been to Fiji then you'll know what Hawaii is like - a bit richer than Fiji, but not much. (And that's not saying a lot!) It's not as garishly touristy as Bali, and the quality is higher, though very run down.I first visited in around 1987 - it looked tired then, and from what I can see there's not been much spent since then. Downtown Honolulu is OK, but Waikiki is like a tired Surfers Paradise. (As an example - the beachside showers in the dead centre of the prime beach of Waikiki were rusty pipes with no shower heads. Really, guys? Seriously?So read this review of Alohilani in light of that background.I have a vague idea that the Alohilani "Resort" hotel (it's big stretch to call itself a "resort") used to be the Pacific Beach hotel, and it got pretty thoughourly renovated recently - I'd guess at maybe three years ago. And the renovation was done very well - a little on the frugal side, but it does have Japanese toilet seats! - which I'm a big fan of, though you certainly don't need your toilet seat heated in Hawaii. But a large part of their customer base is Japanese, hence the toilet seats. All in all a very satisfactory renovation, economically done, but very effective.A big caution here: We had ocean-front rooms, and that had a huge effect on our enjoyment - and there aren't many ocean front rooms. My wife fought like a rabid cat to ensure that room was the ones that we got, and I'm glad she did. In particular room 25 (we had 1125) stands out as the very best room on the floor. So we had the best of what Alohilani could offer, and it was good.(My wife would like to explain that the fight was not with Alohilani, but with Agoda, and even though we won, we'll never be using Agoda again.)I'm not going to nit-pick. This rates a solid four in my judgement.The manager must be good at his job - the staff in general were great, most things worked as they should - and we had a great time there.Thanks Alohilani - you're not a five, but a very solid four.If, however, we had been in one of the vast majority of rooms which did not have full beach frontage, then I suspect I'd be rating it no higher than a three.

Overall a nice hotel. Definitely not the quality of a resort. The rooms are nice but not clean. The carpet is gross. The air conditioner was so loud I couldn't use it. If they lowered their rates I would probably stay there again. For what I paid, I feel was overpriced.
user_name:
Helen Z
Basalt, Colorado, United States

review_body: I love this place, everyone from Sarah V who checked me in with her kindness and smile, her manager Wade for ensuring my stay was nothing less than perfect. Jacque, Kari and Erlinda who said "Good Morning' each morning when I ate at the Lychee. Sway and Bennett who ensure I had that drink and wonderful smile when stopping at the bar. And Chico who always took care of not just me, but everyone to ensure their stay was an awesome one. This hotel has a staff of wonderful people and that is what is all about.

We stayed in an oceanfront king room for 10 days. This stay at the Alohilani was a little disappointing and some aspects of the hotel seem to have changed since we last stayed in Nov. 2018. The view from the room and balcony is seriously amazing—just as pictured on the website. However, the bathrooms in the oceanfront king rooms are incredibly small and poorly configured. The bathroom door opens into the bathroom and only clears the toilet and sink by a few inches—this means you have to shimmy around the door and toilet each time you want to access or leave the bathroom—which was annoying. They told us this was a very common complaint for the oceanfront king rooms (the bathrooms in the other types of rooms can be normal sized).Since our last stay six months ago, the resort fee has increased to $40 (previously $35), however, the services offered have actually decreased! Including, no more complementary welcome drinks and no longer offering turndown service. Additionally, the batting cages are now $85 per hour.On a positive note, the cabanas are amazing to relax in for the day—especially the one on the end with the ocean view.Overall, while the view and the cabanas were amazing, the price point doesn’t seem to match the offerings for an oceanfront king room. Additionally, the services are inconsistent and seem to be decreasing . Next time we plan to stay at the Ritz which is the same price and we get room service!

Alohilani is the best resort in Waikiki. It is modern, funky and the staff are awesome. The pool... OMG amazinggg! Most resorts in Hawaii are outdated, old and pretty average facilities. I can't wait to go back and stay here again!

Very clean and well kept room. Easy access to the beach and excellent restaurants. You really don't need a car if you're doing tours. Uber does the trick. It was our first trip to OAHU and we enjoyed it immensely, always something to do!

My husband and I stayed for 4 nights on our way home from an intensive snorkelling expedition through Micronesia and Palau. We arrived tired, and hadn’t slept through time zone changes. We were given a room on a lower floor which ended up being very noisy due to spring break activity inside and outside the hotel. We asked for a high quiet floor and were delighted when the front desk staff changed our room to the 34th floor ocean view. The room was quiet, the view of the ocean and the hills in the opposite direction was wonderful from our corner room. The room was spacious, the bed linens and pillows good quality and the service always with a smile. The hotel has a lovely lobby bar with a 2 storey fish tank and the lobby decor was very marine modern and interesting. Location of the hotel across from Waikiki beach and many good restaurants was ideal. We are looking forward to staying here again!

For Mother's Day my husband and I visited Hawaii for the first time and spent 7 wonderful nights at the Alohilani Resort. It has a beautiful grand entrance and we were greeted with a big warm welcome by the Hotel Manager, Joseph which we greatly appreciated as we had a long flight from Virginia. Also, big thank you for to the front desk team, Eric and the arrival team Ami and managers Wade/Mark who went out of their way to take care of us.We absolutely loved the Diamond Head view and beds were dreamy. Mother's Day Cabana Brunch was beautifully done with cocktails, tea sandwiches and a leis for each Mother. Big applause to Chef David for the delicious Mother's Day menu and by the way, the wings on the Pool Bar menu are finger licking good.Service at the pool embodied the spirit of Aloha given with great personal care from the entire staff. Deep mahalo to the servers Brittany, Suzy, Steph, Gabby and pool attendants Jones, Mikki, Rachel, Bailey and most especially the pool experience Manager, Nikki who made sure every single mother felt honored and special. Oh and the view from the infinity pool was awesome.Another great spotto hang in the hotel is the Obar. They have the best Long Island Ice teas. Bartender Tracy nailed every time and great laughs with Bennett and Gray. We even got to shake a leg when the DJ started spinning . . fun. My husband enjoyed hitting the gym early and the fact that the hotel is centrally located in Waikki easy access to the beach.Great time at Alohilani, the best time until next time. Mahalo

Check booking is accurately followed . The room we booked was not available !.The staff said it was because the hotel was overbooked. Unacceptable excuse .staff tried to compensate but it really shouldn’t have occurred

This hotel is our absolute favorite in Waikiki. Matt Grauso the hotel manager hosted/sponsored our organization Boys To Men Mentoring. It is because of contributions like this that our organization is able to do what we do. Thank you to all of the amazing staff and the wonderful executive team for being so supportive of local charities.

This was a terrific choice after looking at all the opportunities in Honolulu. Very nice hotel, great people and service, terrific pool and deck and bar/restaurant area. Fish feeding in enormous tank a treat. For the money cannot beat it. The only thing is the bathroom is small (others have commented on this so it was no surprise) with a rather industrial shower -- but room itself is well appointed. I got a partial ocean view and look out to the beach at the Royal Hawaiian. If I look one way I see a mountain and if on the terrace I see the beach across the street. Great location as well. I am walking everywhere.

Where do I start the hotel was beyond what I expected from checking in to checking out . Sarah from front desk went above and beyond to ensure my stay was the best ! She texted to check in on me loves that perk . Avery our pool waitress was so sweet and kind loved it ! Also I was able to observe how all your staff goes the extra mile and that is something I appreciate! The Alohilani Team made turning 27 a year to look forward to ! Thank you all !

Nice hotel and at great location. Staff very kind and caring. Manager tried to get us to accept a roll away bed instead of the room with two double beds that was requested and reserved four months prior. We did not receive the adjoining rooms requested. Also,we were told we were paying for an ocean view room but we actually had partial ocean view rooms. We were disappointed with the deceitfulness of hotel management but overall we enjoyed all the family sharing this special time together. After spending almost an hour with the reservation clerk trying to convince us to accept less than ehat we paid for after a 6hour flight we had no choice but to accept what we were given. Bad business. Would I stay st this hotel again. I don’t think so but would stay st one of the surrounding resorts hoping to receive what I pay for.

Aloha,  I would like to say Mahalo to Rhoderika Miranda Events specialist at the Alohilani Resort. As President of Hawaii Fashion Week I was in search of a location to host the production of WORLD a production of Hawai'i Fashion Week. Featuring artist from many different countries to showcase exclusive seasonal collections to 150 attendees. I choose Alohilani Resort after communicating with Rhoderika Miranda as she was able to share creative solutions that Alohilani Resort was able to offer. I proceeded with my decision to host the premier event as I was confident to know she understood my vision for Hawaii Fashion Week. All guest who attended our premier event were pleased with the quality service, Accommodations, and especially the food. Facilities are well maintained and the design represents a sense of place. I highly recommend this location to anyone looking to impress your guest with the Quality and the attention to detail for their next event.  Joseph K. FigaroaHawaii Fashion Week President
user_name:
JosephKFigaroa
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel is recently remodeled and shows well from entrance to room. The whole hotel is very nicely Decorated in a modern deco. Internet was surprising good for a hotel internet. Bathrooms and room was nice size and completely updated. Pool Area is very nice and the infinity pool is a cool feature Only downside is the hotel doesn’t offer online checkin and they host large groups so check in lines can be longer than expected, especially if you are a loyalty program member of one of the larger chains. They have the terminals to accommodate but only 2-3 of 5 are usually open. Overall would recommend.

Deluxe King - Room was very clean and well kept. Staff was friendly and helpful. The location was close to the beach, shopping and multiple restaurants. Would consider future visits. Texted daily to make sure you were happy with the service.

Spent some time by the pool - amazing view of the ocean while in the Infinity pool! The pool bar - great ambience, and wonderful staff. Shout out to Jones, Jenny, Gabi, and Suzy - each and everyone made us feel so welcome.

Great location! Right across from the beach. The pool area was great. The hotel had a modern, clean look to it, but lacked a traditional ‘Hawaiian’ feel. The elevators were pretty slow, and there was a lot of street noise, but otherwise it was a nice stay. No special touches for anniversaries/birthdays. The bathroom was on the small side, but was still nice. Nice sized balcony. It was a bit pricey for what you get so I’m not sure I would stay there again

Recently stayed for 3 nights at the beautiful Alohilani Resort on Waikiki Beach. Hotel is recently renovated, very modern, spacious and clean. Rooms decent size, although bathroom was tiny, huge comfortable bed, balcony and we had double aspect views.The reception/entrance and public areas are beautiful with lots of space and seating. Pool area, bar and chill out zone is stunning, with table/sunbed service. Very well located just steps from the beautiful Waikiki beach and lots of fantastic shopping and dining.

The pictures on the website are not consistent with what you get. It is a renovated property. Most impressive part is the lobby in case the music volume is not blasting out like in a night club.Reception is efficient and friendly however the Concierge Area seems to be at times like big party with employees talking loudly.Room is quite well appointed however the ocean front rooms are terrible noisy and the owner should have installed sound proofed windows. Doors with huge gab contributing to a unrestful sleep and no amenities provided unless you ask for. Housekeeping denied the shaver and ask me to buy it in the lobby shop.The bathroom a absolute joke and that is not mentioned on the website that it is the size of a closet about 1.60 meter x 2 meter.Breakfast subpar and not 5 star resort food overrun with groups and absolutely no ambienceResort Amenity Fee at 40 usd double to what we paid in L.AWould not be coming back for this price

Unfortunately the street people by the hoards was surprising, right outside the hotel & across the street.I realize every state has homelessness but I have never seen it so rampant. If I do come back to Hawaii it will probably be to Maui

The Alohilani Resort is gorgeous, the hotel staff are the most accommodating. The Seaquarium was delightful to view from the open Lobby to the restaurant. The entire decor of the Resort was amazing.Would definitely return for a longer stay. Good location, across from beach, shopping and restaurants all nearby.

I was very impressed with the quality of the accommodation and service and the friendly and helpful staff. Location was great and right on the Waikiki Beach. Great opportunities for shopping and dining out.

We had a nice stay. The room was much smaller than I expected. It was not quite the luxury I expected other than the common areas. The breakfast was very good. The pool and bar area was great and nicely set up.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel and had an absolutely incredible experience. Solomon, the guest service manager, went above and beyond to make our stay magical and unforgettable. The care we received was like no other, we felt so special and were treated like family. The hotel was beautiful, the location was perfect, and the staff were so professional and kind. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Waikiki Beach. We can’t wait to return with our family!

Our girls had a blast on their first trip to Hawaii. We extended 1 more day and we chose Alohalani Resort to stay at. They were so easy to work with, from making reservations, to booking a Cabana. The Cabanas were all full except for one that was next to the construction site. They gave it to us discounted. Such a great deal, it wasn't that bad since there was music playing which almost drowned out the noise. At the Cabana we were greeted by out server, Janis... She is awesome. She was so friendly, and very attentive. She made our one day stay at Alohalani extra special, giving us recommendations on the food they serve and most especially making sure that our drinks was always refilled... We will be back soon and will definitely stay at this hotel and hopefully we get to see Janis again.

Amenities are top notch, pool is great and it has the best gym and I mean gym, not fitness center. Squat rack, Olympic flat and incline bench, Smith machine and fitness center. Rooms are old school small, but nicely updated. On quieter end of Waikiki, but full of shopping and a nice beach.

As a whole, the stay was amazing. Incredible infinity pool with a great view. The location couldn't be any better! The only slight downside is the room didn't have a microwave or exhaust fan in the bathroom. Breakfast buffet wasn't worth the cost either. All and all, would STILL RECOMMEND!!!

We were a group of 20+ friends and the hotel's location was perfect for walking around the Waikiki area to enjoy the beach, shops and restaurants. The rooms are regular-size and the bathrooms are small. It is advertised as a 5-star hotel but the room amenities are similar to a 3 or 4 star.

This resort is first class in service. You never have to wait for valet, bell hop, or anything. Further their attention to detail is not only warm but heartfelt. I cannot say enough about Doug and Cyril from the valet .Upon finding out we were on our honeymoon, they gave the most authentic well wishes along with sending up complimentary amenities - to be noted I was very impressed they did not just send champagne. We do not drink, they sent the most beautiful chocolate covered strawberries and beautiful fluted stemware with a personal handwritten note by Doug and Cyril- Impeccable customer service ! Mahalo

Obviously Waikiki is very busy, so the beach area was a little cramped for my style, but that isn't the hotels fault. Would stay here again, but make sure you stay out of the city for a few days if you come to Oahu. I normally love big city, but after a few days out of the city, I hated how nosy the city was. Hotel was very nice. Clean rooms, comfy beds, great pool area, friendly people. Drinks in the pool area were fantastic, but remember you are at a resort so you will have much higher prices. Other restaurants and shopping are close by if need be and the beach was just across the street.

I visited Alohilani with my 2 year old son and husband all the way from Toronto, Ontario.Overall the location is most ideal. Close to restaurants, shopping and the beach.The hotel itself is updated. The lobby is definitely beautiful. The room is quite small and the pool area is an okay size. Things like that would be difficult to change.But what needs to change is the customer service. A simple “hello!” can change someone’s entire mood. No one ever greeted us in the lobby. Even when we first arrived there was no effort, basically checked us in and that was it. During our time at the pool they weren’t as helpful in helping us with our stroller (there’s wasn’t any ramp for us to bring the stroller, so we ended up carrying our stroller up the steps every time) There was even a time when a male worker at the pool saw me waiting for someone to help me. And he just stood and looked at me. That same male worker I noticed only attended to “certain” people. DEAR MATT GRAUSO, if you are reading this and actually taking our reviews seriously; just having better costumer service can make a huge difference. And costumer service is what you guys should excel in because you guys are in the hospitality industry. Plus it doesn’t cost a penny to educate your staff. So forget your lobby design and your infinity pool and focus on costumer service!I’d try and take notes from 1Hotels (Miami); Beautiful hotel and excellent service! Definitely a 5 star!I will not be returning. But thank you for the Instagram worthy photos. And that is all.

We stayed here for a week. We experienced excellent service from the friendly staff, who were always pleasant and helpful. Room was clean and comfortable! One of the highlights of our trip was the service we received from Brittaney Payne at the Swell Bar by the pool! She was always engaging, attentive and a true professional! She made all four of us feel special and made our day better!

Nice but perhaps better in Waikiki if research further. Would stay away from Waikiki if stayed longer in Hawaii as very busy, noisy and dirty on main strip. Better to try other side of island or other islands

So much fun at this hotel! Solamon at front desk and Kayla at the pool! Great service and hospitality.Had a really nice 2 night stay. Very convenient having abc store attached! Thanks for everything!!

This is a great hotel. Reception with Jane was seamless and she gave us excellent room advice. Position perfect across the road to beach, close to shops and restaurants and great value. We will definitely come back here. Thanks for a great stay.

we visited the alohilani resort in april and it was a beautifull resort, very central location, meteres from the beach,shopping,restaurants..We had a ocean front room and deffinately would reccomend that, the only thing was the bathroom was really small but in saying that we didnt let that bother us.The hotel as recently been refurbished so that was nice,deffinately will go back hopefully soon.

We recently visited this hotel...and were very pleased with the accommodations. I will have to say one of the highlights of our stay was a young lady, Brittany Payne, that worked in the pool area serving us each day. This young lady was remarkable.....very attentive, personable, polite, knowledgeable and just delightful to get to know. As a restaurant owner myself, I wish for employees as dedicated and well rounded as Brittany. I do believe her skills and personality will definitely land her in management. I know, I personally would hire her immediately....if only she lived in the US. Our overall experience was wonderful and I would definitely stay at the Alohilani again.

Georgous hotel facilities and first class amenities . Staff and service are excellent ! Great restaurants . Right on the Beach , close to shops beautiful walkable sidewalks to all beach areas , shops and all sorts of food ! Golf course few blocks away ! I am going to return here !

This is a recently updated hotel that is experiencing a few growing pains, but they were relatively inconsequential. Very pleasant staff and rooms were clean. Prices are ridiculous, but welcome to Hawaii... They were no different here than anywhere else. Nice views too (34th floor of the Seascape Tower).

We stayed for only a week unfortunately and was completely satisfied, everyone was lovely and welcoming.We did arrive much earlier and our room was not ready but we were able to leave our bags with the hotel and go to the pool area where we had some food and drinks while our room was gettimg ready for us.

Would not stay here again! Pricy ocean front room too noisy to leave the door open. Carpet was very dirty. Toilet did not work properly. Customer service lacking. Bar service poor. No attention to customers.

I LOVED staying here. The hotel is beautiful but the Customer Service was perfect. They assured we had a great room with a view (905), and checked in on us via text during our stay to make sure our needs were met. The bar in the lobby was great, but I spent more time at the pool bar. The bartenders there were friendly and made great drinks. There is an ABC store in the lobby and make sure you visit the ramen spot for some ramen and a frozen beer. I will 100% be back on my next visit. Oh, as a person with a disability I really liked how accommodating to those of us less abled. The room across from us had a peep hole that was wheelchair level, and the room next door had a "doorbell" for hearing impaired (I assume it flashes lights). Just seeing these two things made me feel like they care about guests of all abilities.

As Kamaaina, I have stayed here many times when it was the Pacific Beach Hotel, a few times as it was renovating into the Alohilani, and now as it has hit it's stride. As always, the staff if full of ALOHA, and professional. We always stay in an OCEAN FRONT room. As a surfer, I appreciate the view of the surf breaks. The bathroom is still small, but totally OKAY. The gym/fitness room is opened 5am - 10pm. They should open EARLIER, and stay open LONGER. Many people like to workout early, before heading out for a full day of activities, or workout later. Also, there should be some disinfectant available to wipe down the machines after use. The new Swell Pool is much nicer than the old pool. The website states that it is a SALTWATER infinity pool. It could be, but it definitely smelt like chlorine when I swam in it. No big deal really, but if it isn't saltwater, they should correct their website. The surrounding seating area with their fire pits are nice...and warm after a late night swim. All and all, the Alohilani is a terrific place to stay, and I would definitely stay here again.

I created this account only to send my gratitude to the staff during my visit. I’ve visited so many hotels at Oahu and this newly renovated resort deserves the praise...Don’t forget to check out the events the resort offers, including the Lei making classes and hula dance sessions! My instructors were Andrea and Kristen who were so wonderful and made every attendant felt at home. Thanks to both of them, I left with wonderful memories and learned a lot about Hawaiian cultures and its history.Many thanks to all the staff members for making our experience pleasant.. hope to see everyone again! ❤️Andrea & Kristen❤️ I still have your lei’s!!

We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in the beach tower with sea view. The room was very clean and the staff was very friendly. The only complaint was, that the door to the balcony was not very sound proof. So you can hear some traffic from Waikiki. Nevertheless the location couldn‘t be any better. You have the best view on famous Waikiki sunset!

Outstanding resort and services... prime location... wonderful and accommodating staff... pool and physical exercise facilities were awesome... we would recommend a stay at the Alohilani Resort to anyone looking to spend a great time on the island of Oahu.. Mahalo to all those who made our stay one we will never forget...

We recently hosted an annual conference for our state association here! It was an excellent venue for our day long meeting that hosted about 105 attendees. Here are some of the highlights:1) Parking- there is ample parking on the hotel property, it is only $8 with validation for the day, which is incredibly reasonable for Waikiki. 2) Cultural Connection- We were so fortunate to have Kristen, one of the hotel's cultural ambassadors, to open our conference with a brief history and significance of the hotel, the land which the hotel sits on and the district of Waikiki. I recommend this to anyone having a meeting here!3) Food- when selecting the food for the meeting we had many GREAT breakfast and lunch options available within reasonable prices. 4) Service- the banquet porter Jeff and lead were extremely helpful, hardworking and accommodating. They were able to meet all of our requests, including a private space for our breastfeeding moms, which was very important. In all we have held this meeting for over 80 years at various venues across Oahu, this has by far received the most positive feedback from our attendees and we are excited to host our meeting here again.

Oh.my.gosh! My girlfriends decided to rent a pool cabana for the day at Alohilani for some sun, relaxation, lunch, swimming, and cocktails. What an amazing Friday! I almost don’t want to write this review because I don’t want the secret to get out. There were four of us that rented a cabana which was AMAZING by the pool - it had an electric adjustable sunroof, nice ventilation for a breeze, a cooler, small safe for our personal belongings while we swam, 2 couches, music, plenty of plugs to charge our phones, lots of space and some lounge chairs sitting in a foot or two of water to cool off. It was SO NICE! We had a cocktail server at the pool named Stephanie and she was the BEST waitress I’ve ever had. We were so demanding ordering food, drinks, water, soda, wine, more food, more drinks, more ice, more water! She was on top of it and brought it fast. I couldn’t believe she had any other tables because she was so attentive to us it was like having our own personal cabana attendant. We tipped her a lot because she was amazing... & fun - we wished she could’ve hung out with us - ha! When we were enjoying our day, the manager Nikki kept coming to check on us. She came by with a cucumber toner spritzer and sprayed our faces, necks and shoulders and it smelled so good. Then later she sent a girl by to clean our sunglasses for us! I said to my friend, “I really need to get up and clean my glasses so I can read this magazine but I’m too comfortable and too lazy to get out of this chair right now.” Literally, 3 minutes later a girl working for Nikki is walking around the pool cleaning sunglasses and then comes by our cabana after! It.was.heaven. ❤️☀️ My friends and I have decided we are going to book a pool cabana with Nikki and Steph either once a month or once a quarter being we had such a great day. I highly recommend the luxury pool cabanas - you’ll think you’re in a whole sunroom, private resort. Also, I got so wrapped up telling you about the cabana I forgot to say the food is AMAZING, the drinks were perfect, the music level at the pool is good, Sean taught an awesome morning water aerobics class we all loved, the infinity pool overlooking Waikiki Beach is beautiful, and the place is just gorgeous!

We recently stayed in an oceanfront room which had magnificent views of Waikiki. The bed was very comfortable and the room spotlessly clean. Bathroom is small but spotless. The pool deck and bar was really good too. Loved it

People working at the spa/fitness center were rude. They wouldn't even say hi to you, I saw them walk past me and other people. They just pretended like they didn't even work there. So I had to ask if they worked there and when i asked questions, they were exteremly rude. It just felt like they didn't want to do any actual work. The rest of the hotel staff was great, it's just that one part of the hotel makes everyone look bad.oh and there were huge cockroaches in the room.

We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of our honeymoon, very pleasant stay! The room was very clean and tidy, with nice linens etc. It was also a good size. Bathroom was small, but served its purpose, and was clean.The Pool!! The pool area is very nice! It can get quite busy, but was awesome after a long day. The service here at the poolside bar was a bit hit or miss, but overall was good.Overall a very nice hotel! The only 1 thing we thought was missing was a bathrobe in the room, would have been handy for going to and from the pool.

Beautiful Hotel, amazing service, situated in the perfect spot in Waikeke. The infinity pool was a hit with the family and was open late, for late night dip. Room had a gorgeous view and we loved the aquarium in the bar

My law firm held its First Annual Continuing Legal Education Seminar at the Alohilani Resort in Waikiki. We had guests attending from all over the country for a welcome party by the pool and a two day conference. We had an incredible experience and highly recommend this hotel for personal travel or for business or personal events. The hotel is beautiful, the location cannot be beat, the food was excellent, and the pool area is perfection. The conference room was exactly what we needed. Most significantly, though, the staff went above and beyond at each turn to make things perfect. The staff was warm, knowledgeable, professional, and extremely helpful. Rhoderika Miranda was in charge of coordinating our conference from inception to event - and she was nothing short of fabulous! She helped us plan the event from the big picture down to the littlest details - providing her own excellent ideas and advice from her years of experience planning events of all types. She made sure our event was perfectly planned and executed and was incredibly kind and warm to work with. Her team on the ground was truly excellent – they made sure every detail was perfect and on top of it they were accommodating, warm, and gracious throughout the entire process. I want to specifically mention Jonathan Cohn our banquet manager, Melanie Ruben our banquet captain, Chef David our Chef for the reception (the food was absolutely delicious and our guests were raving about it), Lee Eugenio and Jeff Cho who helped with setup and Ryan Kotani who helped with making sure we had all the items we needed. And all the other Alohilani staff who helped make our event such a success. Thank you!!!!! If you are considering a hotel for your Waikiki vacation or for an event – look no further – this place was beautiful, warm, and they made event planning an absolute breeze.

By the pictures this placed looked nice however it seems like it recently got a makeover . Service was average at best. The receptionist wouldn’t stop talking when all we wanted to do was check in. I booked an ocean view but because I was trying to check in early there only was room that had a partial view. Partial at best, I had to go onto my balcony and look to only see a small view of the ocean between two all buildings. The staff never said anything about renovations and construction starting at 7am and I had to use earplugs in the morning.Room fairly small . Bathroom was TINY. The sink was not even in the bathroom. It was in the room. Bed was comfortable—That’s about it as far as room goes. Pool/ Lounge area was Decent. Small pool with limited chairs. Service was sub par. Would not stay here again especially for the price .

We stayed 2 years ago when it was under construction. The work is done and it is amazing, beautiful and so comfortable, we slept like babies. The new pool and Swell bar was great and delicious. The aquarium in the O'bar and seen from the breakfast buffet was gorgeous and so peaceful. I didn't want to leave.

Attended a business meeting held at the hotel. Spent 5 days as a mini vacation. The confusion starts with a parking garage that uses letters for floors with no indication that there is a ridge to the hotel tower on level C just A, B, BB, C...so after figuring out cis the bridge level to the 3rd floor then you have to go back down to the lobby(1st floor) where you go to a large hall with just one desk ate one end with four employees. No Aloha or welcome just a “are you checking in?” Hmmm You get the feeling they are working to a script and not “hospitality people” Same for the valet/front staff. Never in five days of walking by did they offer a greeting or any help generally gossiping amongst themselves. The hotel is in a sleek modern style which seems out of place for Hawaii. It’s nice enough but bring your own alarm or clock - nothing on the night stands. And no room service! Seems to be trying to be sleek but spirit. The housekeeping staff was warm and happy to greet you with warmth. Nice enough hotel if you are just sleeping there...
user_name:
Kenji B
Rancho Palos Verdes, California

review_body: Being our very first time in Hawaii, we didn't know what to expect. Standards there are quite low in terms of accommodation, and we had to more than double our usual budget to get something decent in Hawaii. We ended up paying 500 AUD a night at the Alohilani. While I don't think it is worth anywhere near that much, this is the going rate for anything nice in Hawaii. We arrived with very low expectations, and were still surprised that no one bothered to come greet us when we arrived. Quite strange. When we got to our room we were underwhelmed by the view. Yes, there's a partial ocean view, which is lovely. But the rest of the view is of ugly, derelict buildings. We knew Waikiki would be pretty run down, but it was still disappointing. Our room itself was very modern and fresh, but quite small for what we are used to. The bathroom was tiny. Getting out of the shower involves a game of Tetris. We managed, but it's something to be mindful of if you need room to move. As we settled into our stay, we quickly came to love the Alohilani. The room is quite nice and all the facilities are to a high standard. It's in a brilliant location. Directly across from the beach, and right in the middle of the action. We didn't have issues with noise, except for the odd siren. We were able to walk to lots of great restaurants and cafes within minutes.The pool area is great, although the size of the pool and the number of people staying there meant it was usually fairly crowded (we went in April). There is a kids pool, but it's mostly in the shade. The jacuzzi was a great touch. We often went there after dinner. The oceanarium is a big hit with kids. Viewing the fish feeding was a highlight. They also do different activities each day. We attended the lei making class, which was a lot of fun. The lady running the class is brilliant. In terms of food, we only tried Momosan, and it was to die for! Highly recommended.It was really handy to have a water fountain and an ABC store on the ground level. We used both all the time. Overall, I would definitely not mind staying at the Alohilani again. It is very overpriced for what it is, but that seems to be the case anywhere in Hawaii.

I have vacationed in Hawaii nine times now and have stayed in many different hotels and resorts through the years. Alohilani was the best hotel and resort I have vacationed in. From the beautiful, clean room to the outstanding and friendly staff to the awesome restaurants and bars, I can't say enough great things about our experience. Everyone was helpful, kind, and made for an even better experience than we could ever imagine. I am already looking at when I can book another stay at this amazing resort. Thank you Alohilani!

Located right across the main road on the beach at the Duke statue end, only a few hundred metres from the main shopping area in Waikiki. Hotel recently renovated and looks great. We were moved from the Sheraton due to overbooking but were definitely not disappointed with the Alohilani, great hotel and stay.

My heart was touched with the perfect pool and lounge and I will never forget this amazing experience at this resort. I recommend you try the Private Cabanas which has a ceiling that you can open with a remote and close the curtains for nice privacy- I absolutely loved it. The inifiti pool & jacuzzi were refreshing along with a delicious lunch; I had the Fish tacos, YUMM. I always save the best for last, "The Staff." Out of all the resorts, hotels, and five star restaurants i've ever been to in my life, Nikki, Jenny, Mikki, and Rachel have more aloha than anyone i've ever met. I did not want to leave.. but now that i know about this gem, i will be coming back every chance i get.

Can't wait to visit this beautiful resort again. The staff is so welcoming, valet is fast, rooms are so clean and bedding was fresh and comfortable. Overall the staff and their ALOHA for their visitors is always what stands out the most for us. We can't wait until we can visit on Oahu and stay at Alohilani Resort

Enjoyed the stay. All went well. Close to beach. Close to abc store. Staff at bar.staff for the breakfast was very friendly and alway had our breakfast orders correct. Pool was nice with a great view of Wiakaki beach.

My friends and I took a trip to Hawaii for the vacation of a lifetime and this hotel gave us everything and more. The first night we had an issue with the shower drain and they came up promptly to fix it and even left us a cute note and some chocolates for our trouble. The pool and hot tub area is so beautiful and the seating on the other side by the bar is such a cool hangout area - especially at sunset or when they had live music. I had some great times dancing on the deck out there! The cabanas are pretty awesome and what makes the entire hotel experience that much better is the pool manager - Nikki. I cannot stress how much this woman made our vacation. She volunteered to take photo shoots of my friends and I, danced with us and even pointed us in the right direction to the nearest medic when I got sun poisoning. She is truly so caring and she deserves so much recognition. I had so much fun- the rooms were spacious and the porch outside was great for morning coffee or an afternoon snack overlooking the beach. The aquarium is awesome and I think that the only downfall is how expensive the breakfast was- but we actually never got a chance to go there. All and all I would love to go back - in fact, I dream about it. If you are looking for a great Hawaii experience in a clean, fun and updated hotel that's a 2 minute walk to the beach - stay here! Love it! Thank you Alohilani for such a great stay!

We thoroughly enjoyed our experience in the Alohilani Resort, the rooms are very modern, clean, beds extremely comfortable, the bathroom is slightly small, but has everything you need. The pool and bar area fantastic, such a great atmosphere, the staff were just so accommodating and friendly, the music very cool which gave the place a great party vibe.We booked a part ocean view room, which was exactly that! The location couldn't be better with the beach and activities right across the road! The restaurants were excellent as well! We've already booked our next trip!

NOTE: I am writing this with many days left here on my stay at the ‘Alohilani Resort. I am genuinely considering paying the fee to forfeit my stay here and seek alternative accomodation. Please do yourself a favour and book elsewhere.Do not fall for the facade of the fancy pictures online or flashy website. This hotel falls way short of anything it (or the price tag) is proposing to be. In the spirit of honesty and not in bitterness, here are the major shortcomings of this hotel:1). The doors to the hallway are totally useless. From your bed you can hear absolutely every conversation and footstep within 15-20 yards of your door. Not to mention clearly hearing the elevator beeping twice every time it arrives at your level! The incessant beeping will drive you crazy by keeping you awake at night and awake you in the morning!2). The partial ocean view rooms are hardly that. Generally speaking, it’s 100% you staring at the apartment block across the road unless you go out on the balcony and stand towards the side to get a decent view. No water views from inside the room whatsoever.3). The room is small and bathroom absolutely tiny. The bathroom door opens a couple of inches away from door. You can imagine the rest.4). Even on the 9th floor you can hear conversations on the street because balcony doors are so poor in quality (many things still remain from the original building prior to renovation).5). Very little is offered in the room (e.g. no alarm clock/Bluetooth speaker, no food in the mini bar, no slippers or robes unless asked for, no milk for the coffee machine, no ceiling light in bedroom only lamps etc.) Although priced like a luxury hotel, your room will be stocked like a three star hotel.6). The noisy pipes, noisy air con vent (even when off sounds like a blower vac is on outside), poor/absent sound proofing in the walls/ceiling (I can hear each neighbour open or close their drawers, sneezing etc.)7). The pool/outdoor area is deceptively advertised.I don’t enjoy doing this but for the sake of honesty, it’s best people know the truth before booking here.The two stars are for location, the staff and general cleanliness of the common areas.

We spent my 50th Birthday in house all weekend and hosted a small party at the cabanas poolside Saturday afternoon with music. The staff went above and beyond making sure our day was fabulous. Suzy is awesome and will take great care of you! Highly recommended.

We had a lovely weekend stay at Alohilani Resort. Very nice, our room was modern and clean, the staff was very helpful and attentive. The resort location is in a great spot with easy access just across the road from the beach. Easy walking distance to lots of nearby restaurants, bars and shops. We really liked that it was right at the beach. We would definitely stay here again. The front building with direct ocean view is probably spectacular. We were towards the back of the resort but the view was still nice. Thank you to the resort staff for a wonderful weekend.

Fabulous hotel, with excellent service and very friendly staff. The pool area is beautiful with the infinity pool overlooking the beach. Loved every moment the cocktails were great and the beds were so comfy.

We stayed here for three nights as a stay-cation and really enjoyed our stay. The check-in was quick and easy with friendly service. Self-parking was easy (although expensive). The lobby and property were beautiful and clean. The room was spacious compared to other Waikiki rooms we've had before and had modern furniture and fixtures. The shower had plenty of hot water with good water pressure. The balcony had a 90 degree view of the beach. The only drawback was the firmness of the mattress. I couldn't get a comfortable night's sleep on the bed, however my wife thought it was the most comfortable bed she's slept in, so it must be personal preference.

Very impressed by this hotel from the moment we arrived. The recent renovations are impressive and the modern Hawaiian atmosphere creates a holiday feel. Had a partial ocean view room and had a good view as well as city and mountain views. The three story fish tank is impressive and daily fish feeding viewing was enjoyed by the kids.Room was comfortable, quiet and functional for what we required. Bathroom is tiny but clean and plenty of towels. There are no added luxuries like mini bar or wine glasses for in room beverages but made do. The coffee machine was well used and the coffee was tasty. The kids loved the pool and we enjoyed the pool bar - Mai Tais were my favourite. Around 5pm each night free cookies are brought around! Hip music playing, sunset ocean views and a bar - perfect way to unwind after a day of sightseeing or on the beach.Tried the breakfast buffett on a couple of occassions and plenty of choice. Overall the hotel was in a very convenient location and very close to shops, restaurants and transportation. Highly recommend this property and if we were to return to Waikiki would definitely stay there again.

Staff said pool is not kids friendly because it's 9 feet deep. Reality is there is a pool for kids that is 2.5 feet deep throughout. Staff is not knowledgeable. Also oceanfront means partial Oceanview.
