The majority of the staff is very nice, only exception is the table waitress on Sat. night (4/13/19) at the O bar. Very slow service, salty disposition and when I asked where to get some food since everything was closed (it's about 10pm on a Saturday night), she says there's a restaurant a block away. Find out the next morning, there's an ABC store in the hotel, open until midnight!! The rooms are bland, no color or flowers, I have no idea I'm in Hawaii, popcorn ceilings! The pool is small and shaded most of the time, due to tall the high rises surrounding the hotel, and jacuzzi is constantly packed. There's a kids pool, but they use the slightly bigger pool. The cabanas aren't even in sight of the pool, clever photography. The spa is under construction, but what they don't tell you, is they lead you down a long, public hallway, to an open hotel room (bed removed). There's your spa room! wth! Thank goodness my daughter and I were together, I would not want to share the room with a total stranger! On portable massage tables, with SO much noise from the adjoining room! not the fault of the spa personnel, they were very nice, but management either needs to notify customers or finish the construction. I've had numerous massages and that was the WORST experience!Not impressed at these prices!!!

We stayed here for our honeymoon. The hotel has been renovated and looks awesome. We stayed here 9 nights. It’s right across from the beach anda short walk from everything else. I did notice that towards the end of our trip we could hear the pipes creaking when people in other rooms were showering. Also it look us 8 nights to realise the balcony door does have a lock. That was after the last cleaning lady locked it for us. Other than that the hotel was really great and we will be staying there again if we come back... We hope to come back!

We stayed here at the end of March/beginning of April. We absolutely loved everything about this hotel. We loved the view from our room. We stayed in the premium ocean view room. We were in room 1709. We had a great view and we really liked that we had two queen beds. It accommodated our family of four perfectly. The lanai was nice and perfect for sitting out and watching the ocean! The room was quiet and we rarely heard noise from the hall. The elevators are a little loud when they arrive on a floor, there is a loud bell sound, so rooms by the elevator may not be as quiet. The rooms are clean and modern. The staff was awesome and accommodating. We had some downtime one day and did a lei making class that was totally awesome and super fun. And we learned a lot. The valet drivers were some of the best we have had at a hotel. We especially liked Kelly. They remembered us each time and like were literally running to get cars and get people taken care of quickly. They were able to accommodate a late check out for us with our later flight time which was super appreciated. The hotel is just across the street from the beach and was perfect. There is also a McDonald’s right across the street and then many shops and restaurants within walking distance. We will for sure stay here again next time we are in Oahu!

Stayed here in February 2019 for a conference. Very clean, employees all great, had no issues at all. My flight was cancelled and they were able to get me a room for the night last minute at the same rate. Would definitely stay here again.

The only hiccup was that my iprefer website reservation did not bridge over to this hotel. In short, after a 10 hour flight, it was concerning that our hotel was not expecting us. Other than that, it was clean and everything worked. It is certainly well located for a mid-range beach-accessible hotel. As for the iPrefer chain of hotels, other properties usually acknowledge my membership and level with upgrades and welcome gifts. That was a clear miss here. It seems iPrefer and this hotel are not fully linked.

My two sisters and I spent 8 nights here. We had great service from the moment we walked through the doors. The location is superb, we were able to walk to the beaches, shopping and dining. The pool area has a gorgeous view. All the employees were very friendly but there were three that really stood out. I want to thank Andrai with guest services for her kindness, she went out of her way to make us feel so special as it was the one year anniversary of my husbands passing.Eddie a bellman could not have been more accommodating, and always had a personal greeting and gave us great ideas for places to go.Gabby at the pool was so sweet and gave great service.We had a wonderful time an will definitely be vacationing at Alohilani again.

We decided to bring our 8 month old infant on her first plane ride and we chose Hawaii as a destination trip. We chose this resort because I really wanted a hotel with a nice pool for us to lounge in during our stay.Check in was quick and special shout out to Eric who checked us in. He couldn’t find our special requests that we had made but he still tried to help us out once we told him we had the baby and needed a quiet room. The hotel is very modern, love the modern decor, the live music at the bar, and the larger than life aquarium.The pool did not disappoint. Loved the jacuzzi too, perfect temperature. One of the highlights of our stay was meeting Mikki at the pool. She was so gracious and helped us make sure our daughter was comfortable with her first pool adventure. Thank you Mikki for going above and beyond and for the aloha hospitality!Our room was quite spacious, loved how clean and new everything looked and our partial ocean view was amazing! The only reason why I am giving this a four and not a five star is because the room walls are pretty thin and I could hear my neighbors activities both nights.

I really enjoyed our stay at Alohilani. The staff was friendly and let us check in early (though for a fee) after our long overnight flight. The room was nice but the highlight was the stunning view from our balcony. My only criticism is that the walls are very thin as we could hear every single word the people in the next room were saying as though they were sitting next to us. Luckily I had earplugs. The pool and jacuzzi are fantastic and we really loved Swell Bar at night, especially the large loungers and fireplaces. The poke bowl was awesome. The location is convenient to everything in Waikiki. I would stay again, as long as I had my earplugs with me.

I decided to wait till I had been home for a couple of weeks before writing this review as I wanted to really think about it and not create some knee jerk blurb. We stayed here for a few nights in Sept last year and after botching our arrival with an incorrect room the stay ended ok and we decided to give it another go for 14 nights in March this year. We booked months in advance, asked for a specific room and in the meantime had recommended this hotel to several friends and family who stayed here.So when we arrived to check in (surely they couldn't get it wrong again ??) we were informed that our room wasn't on the oceanside we requested, we only had a partial ocean view and it was tucked right at the rear of the front tower. There was construction going on below us and it just wasn't going to be pleasant. How hard can it be to facilitate guests in the correct room they book?? After much stamping of feet at the front desk, we finally were moved to an actual ocean view room. The deck and view were great but the constant smell of cigarette smoke from others smoking on their decks was horrible, especially as it's forbidden in the first place.!! And of course when you step out the front ocean side entrance the homeless are all sitting on the wall outside smoking up a storm of various substances, and often slumbering in the entrance. As we had to book 2 nights here through our travel agent as part of their package, we had to do a check out/ recheck in again for the last 2 nights. Surely this would be an easy task?? Not so. The receptionist handed me a receipt for 12 nights resort fee which she had just automatically billed to our credit card.!! As we had already paid this rip off fee on arrival it was fair to say that we were not impressed. It then took my "significant other" an hour of badgering to get this rectified. I had to walk away for fear of losing it!! So, did we have a great time?? The pool staff are great. Jenny, Micky, Nicki, Kayla, Steph, Suzy and of course Jones. We thank you sincerely for running around after us, being on call and for all those great cocktails and "longboards. We are going back to Hawaii again in about 6 months time but I'm not sure that the Alohilani will receive my hard earned dollars again. Just too many things went wrong again and I don't think it will be 3rd time lucky. Sad really as we have promoted this place and have been responsible for friends and family spending thousands of dollars here. Some things to note. Make sure you actually get the room you book, check your receipts thoroughly and engage with the front desk at your own peril. I know I will get the usual placatory return email but just don't think it will cut it on this occasion, sadly.

I only ate at Swell Bar (which was difficult to find because of no signage - Fire Exit isn't a sign). I got lost on the way back to my room on the first night again no signage I walked down 3 flights of stairs and ended up in the Maintenance Room. My room and Swell Bar were very noisy due to construction. Other guests slamming their room doors was supremely irritating. No Mini Bar. I wanted to use the Spa but had no idea where it was despite being given a discount voucher. I wasn't told that if I was ordering food at the bar but sitting elsewhere that I needed to collect it. My food was often cold...cold fried chips? Mmmm NOT. It's not obvious there are only two pools, didn't know there was a laundry, I would have used it. The bathroom at the children's pool is dangerous due to water it's the closest one to use near Swell Bar. I asked for a Wake Up call prior to my departure at 5:30am, never got one luckily I had a timer on my phone that woke me up half an hour before I was due to be transported...and I'd packed the day earlier. Not sure I'll be back, though the bed & pillow were very comfortable. Best part of the hotel was the staff, oh and the internet was pretty good.

Comfortable and a great location. Nice view from Ocean view room.Check in was please for us, however not for our travel partners, they were told nothing about the plact.The breakfast boxes were very good idea and had plenty of food in them. Didn't eat at the breakfast buffet.Morimoto Restaurant was beautiful for a special evening.Easy to book tours at concierge and good tours they were.Bell men were extremely helpful.Bidet in bathroom, shower had no pressure, rest of the room was fine.At times the pool area didn't have enough sun lounges to be by the pool. And the pool area was quite cold and blowy at times. A much tooooo loud DJ was there when we were also, it wasn't encouraging to relaz there.Laundry on fifth floor of taller tower and reasonably priced, take you own washing powder if you want to save some dollars.ABC right underneath, very handyMemorable stay.

Things you don’t ever want to feel when you step into your suite on the first day of your long planned getaway: sheer disappointment.After being warned at reception that our suite (ocean view) would only have a partial view (booked months in advance) we sprang for a further 100/night for an ‘ocean front suite’. The view is stunning - truly amazing. Just like many of the other hotels in the vicinity. Unlike many other hotels here, the rooms however look like they belong in a midlevel Best Western. Spartan furnishings, an updated interior that can’t escape a 70s feel, and tiny. You literally have to wedge yourself into the bathroom - space is tight. The clientele seems mainly middle American families and bemused Japanese tourists who probably were wondering (as was I) what the deal was with the creepy family men ogling people on the pool (which is a delight when said creepy men weren’t hovering). This will sound meaner than it’s intended to, but the vibe from the clientele is closer to Chuck E. Cheese meets a dated Vegas pool club than whatever the original aim was. There’s no bugs, the amenities are great, and the staff are helpful and solicitous. However there’s no way this is a 5 or even 4 star experience as some sites would rate it. It simply isn’t. Don’t go here if you want upmarket; go here for clean and functional with epic views. After the upsell (on an already upgraded suite choice) I’m left with the sinking feeling I could have laid out a fraction (under 100/night) more and stayed at the Ritz. Literally. Given this is our sole planned trip for the year and we work HARD for the time off we take, I feel like we have cheated ourselves by not researching this hotel more and investigating the suites vs just blindly following ratings. The common thread of most of the negative reviews reflect our experience. Believe them if you value your money and want to avoid feeling duped instead of thrilled on your Hawaii vacay.The other common thread in the poor reviews is the placatory message from Alohilani after a negative review on TA. Given the sheer volume and recent weight of complaints perhaps less time should be spent apologizing and more time doing the necessary measures to ensure a more honest experience: stop letting your resort be considered luxury when it’s not. Have a sense of decency and honesty. We don’t want your apologies, we don’t want to be deceived in the first place. And we don’t want your reviews to be flooded here with reviews conducted at the hotel’s prompting - which is obviously how this hotel is trying to avoid surfacing the less positive ones.

We chose the Alohilani because of it's design focus - something hard to find in Honolulu. It lived up to our expectations and has been very tastefully renovated to feel like a new hotel. We stayed in an Ocean Front room on a high floor which was well worth it as we found ourselves enjoying the view and watching the passing humanity constantly. The only criticism is the very small bathrooms which initially came as quite a shock as the overall room is spacious, but in the end did not spoil our stay. What really made our stay unforgettable was the way we were treated by the staff - in particular the Guest Service Manager Ami Sueyoshi who went way above and beyond the call of duty to make sure our stay was unforgettable - she certainly succeeded in this and ensured that we are looking forward to staying again at the Alohilani and enjoying the pool, the cabanas, the bar and huge fishtank, the location, the wonderful food at the onsite restaurant Morimoto and the great view from the ocean front tower rooms.

Now we have stayed here once, we won't bother looking anywhere else for future trips. Very well priced, beautiful resort, beach front - literally a few 100 meters from moana surfrider and 'main' drag. Rooms are modern.Check in staff went over and above for us.

Great spot and good rooms. Bathrooms super small but clean and everything worked. WiFi was always kicking off and had to reconnect constantly. Pool area WiFi was terrible. Also nice they had water bottle refill stations all over. Overall a decent stay.

Alohilani was our home away from home, the staff are warm, friendly and happy to help. A special mention to Marlene at O’bar, thank you Marlene, your service was second to none. Renee from front desk, a warm friendly face. The hotel itself ticked all the boxes, the rooms are kept nice and clean, food at both O’bar and swell bar is great. DJ is a nice touch, pool is great. Thank you for an amazing stay, We look forward to our next visit.

The Alohilani Resort is a great location directly across from the beach! The staff was friendly and very informative! This resort has a beautiful pool area with cabanas and a bar. Most of all the rooms are very clean!

We have had the absolute best first visit to Hawaii. We want to return home, sell all our belongings and move back here and be beach bums. This is paradise. This district of Waikiki is very commercial and I’m excited to find some quiet, less populated parts of the islands.

All and all our stay at Alohilani was very good! The location was incrediable right on the beach and walking distance to all Waikiki destinations. We had an amazing view from our balconey of both the beach and the hills. I absolutely recomend a partial beach view so you can see not just the ocean.

The hotel has all there is to offer.The occupancy tax is a bit high though (why it's needed at all is still questionable), you would think that this levy would be in the room rate which in itself was not cheap at $655 per night.The restaurants and bar areas are first class and well worth dining in.

I’d definitely recommend a stay at alohilani. Great location close to everything. We booked an ocean view room through luxury escapes which included a daily breakfast (bagel/pastry, yoghurt, banana/apple/orange) and $200 resort credit. There is a big supermarket about 30 min walk/short Uber away and there are abc stores everywhere. Any issue we had was dealt with swiftly and professionally. We asked to be moved after our first night as we were above some construction works and it was very noisy. Reception staff were very accommodating and moved us to the other building (closest to beach) and we ended up with a better view which was great. The first photo is the ‘ocean view’ view from the eastern tower (furthest from water). Second photo is same room grade but in the other tower after we moved - much better !Room servicing was hit and miss but overall was fine. The room has a balcony which is great but it’s quite noisy so we didn’t really use it. There is a pool but it was pretty crowded most of the time we were there so we didn’t really use it. It also got quite windy so was a bit cool compared to heading down to the beach.

This is a great hotel and everyone is very helpful and friendly. If you have small kids like us, this is a great place to stay. We mostly stayed by the poolside and the infinity pool is great and it has a great view of the ocean/beach. They have a kid pool that our kids played for hours. The lobby is very spacious and has high ceilings. Everywhere in the hotel smells fresh and great. As soon as you walk into the lobby, you notice the aquarium by the bar and it is stunning.

This place is the perfect respite- we can’t wait to return again. The staff is lovely and accommodating. The pool (so amazing),restaurants and activities on site are so wonderful- you don’t need to leave!

Incredibly beautiful views from our oceanfront room! The hotel is very clean and the gym and free fitness classes were amazing! The pool area is gorgeous and the pool staff is very friendly and attentive. Jones's poolside service was incredible! From offering to clean your sunglasses to serving frozen grapes and delivering chilled scented wash cloths, the service was truly TOP NOTCH! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Alohilani

Nice newly renovated property in Waikiki Beach. Excellent location, not on the beach directly but just separated by a road. Easy walk to to food and shopping. While the property is newly renovated, you can tell that many of the old stuff were kept. They simply painted over doors and stuff. Not a deal breaker but it doesn’t make it a 5 star hotel. More 4+. A lot of the rooms have a sea and diamond head view, I would go for those as it makes the experience of sitting at the balcony nice!Service overall is good. Breakfast spread is very limited so after a week’s stay, we were tired of the food. All in all a nice hotel on Waikiki. I would stay there again!

The rooms are clean, it’s a decent value for your money and the hotel is updated and modern. Morimoto Asia on the property and the happy hour is great! Food and beverages are well done. Business center is helpful to have for business travelers but the pool area, view from the ocean view rooms and the lobby make it hard to want to work. :):) special shout out to the front desk crew Eric, Mathea and Dailyn for helping me out with some printing and just going above and beyond. It’s the sort of service I’ve given up on expecting but am always surprised and happy when I see a hotel staff provide such a positive experience. Will def continue to stay here.

I stayed here with my husband for three nights in March 2019.Over all the hotel is beautiful, chic and modern in a good position on Waikiki Beach, being directly across the road from the swimming lagoons, which are great to swim in and kid friendly.The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful, and make you feel very welcome.Our room was on the 33rd floor looking towards Diamond Head which afforded great and authentic Waikiki views.Plusses:Great location and by being a little out of the hub, and not directly on the beach makes the rates are a little lower for new chic luxury.The two restaurants located at the property Mosomans and Morrimotos are exceptional dining experiences, and should not be missed.The infinity pool and pool deck are beautifully appointed with a seperate kids pool and area, and a great place to people watch, chill and enjoy a cocktail.Great for under 45 with young families and young couples who love to instagram.Dissapointments:The breakfast is extremely underwhelming and expensive, whith gratuity automatically included, I feel that if you are going to assume gratuity, you really need to deliver a memorable experience, you can go down the road to the iconic Moana Surfrider and do it in style for the same price.The bed was VERY SOFT so if you like a firmer bed, this place is not for youthere was no disclosure of there charging structure, and half way through our stay we received an unexpected charge to our credit card, of an amount much higher than we were expecting, and when we asked for clarification, there system had gone down and they were unable to explain. It took over a week for the funds to be resolved.Generally I would not recommend this property to an older crowd, if your 50+ you probably will feel a bit out of place and not enjoy the music.

My husband and I have been loyal to this hotel. We stayed here twice before when it was the Pacific Beach Resort, and twice as AlohilaniThe final renovations looks great! A soft, light filled interior. Rooms are tastefully decorated, ours had a partial ocean view which was great. Staff were accommodating and helpful. Note: Self parking and resort taxes were pretty pricey... in Australian dollars, we were spending $100 AUD a day. Over a four night stay, $400 is a lot to pay on top of your room.

The pool area is great. The rooms are a bit dated, the cocktails are good but avoid the wine. It's near a lot of shopping and restaurants but also in a very crowded area. Morimotos is located in the hotel and is amazing. There is no room service.

Nice hotel that was a much better deal only because it was literally a hop, skip and jump to the beach. The balcony offered not only a beautiful view of the ocean but also a beautiful view of the mountains. Our room was slightly dusty and we could not sleep well even with the balcony sliding door closed. The noise from the many many trucks, vans, service vehicles, etc were just too loud. That's really my only complaints. Even with the noise, I would stay here again.

Excellent kamaaina rates! Perfect location within walking distance of Waikiki Beach and surrounding area. Relaxing pool & friendly pool attendants. Enjoyed dining at Morimoto’s which is located in hotel.

Your staff made the experience at the resort an amazing!! Nikki and Rachel at the pool are awesome. They were friendly, fun and pampered us like royalty. I loved how Rachel knew all the best sun tanning spots at all times of the day on the deck :-) The pool was beautiful - everyone that worked there made me feel welcome. The restaurant staff was also wonderful. Averie was our favorite server but they are all so nice and so good at their job. I will always think of this trip as one of the best I have ever had and a big part of the reason why is the experience at Alohilani Resort.

We stayed here for 3 nights and had a fantastic view of Diamond head on the 37 floor. This hotel is so modern and awesome. Eddie showed us to our room and he was a delight. He gave us tips on where to eat, rent surf boards and shop. The aquarium in the dining hang out area was memorizing. The kids enjoyed watching the diver feed the fish. The pool was great too. They have a kids pool, infinity pool and a hot tub.The only thing I felt was misleading is the sign that says "shops at the Alohilani" right behind the front desk area. There are hardly any shops back there. They had a JTB area, a retail shop that sells product in the rooms and an ABC store. I was expecting quite a few shops like the Hyatt. We also had an issue with the guest in the next room. We called to complain twice and no one answered the phone. My husband had to physically go down to the front desk to complain.Other than that, I thought this was a great hotel.  .

We stayed here for 8 nights and we took a room facing the diamond head and the beach on the 36th floor. It was just amazing waking up every morning to the view we had. Room was a good size and we had no complaints. Check in was a breeze and the staff was really helpful. The aquarium on the ground floor was just amazing.We love the hotel, staff was just amazing as they could not do enough to make you feel at home and location was just fantastic.We love the Japanese restaurant attached to the hotel.Overall awesome hotel and we will come back again.

The resort was clean and over the top beautiful. It had amazing amenities and a lot of freebies like free filtered water/bottles, free cookies+facials by the pool, free lei making, free hula dance classes, etc. mini fridge in every room and the rooms are absolutely gorgeous. 10/10 I recommend.

Truly impeccable service throughout the hotel. It seems clear that the staff enjoys working here and every person we interacted with went out of their way to be helpful. We had a room on the eastside in the large tower with a partial view of Diamond Head. Every room has a balcony which is a nice amenity. Beautifully appointed room, comfortable beds, and fairly quiet for an in-city property. Beach is directly across the street and it's a nice stretch of Waikiki - not too crowded and lots of amenities immediately in the area including rentable chairs and umbrellas, surfboard rentals, bathrooms and lockers. This is a swimmable part of Waikiki. Newer ABC store in the hotel was a plus and a new coffee shop is coming soon that we are sure will be a great addition. Pool area is truly luxurious with different types of seating - crowded on the weekend, but we easily found chairs on the week days. Killer view from the infinity pool. We spent equal time at the beach and the pool. Hotel is walkable to all of the main shopping areas along Waikiki, but out of the crush of the crowds. Business center was open and inviting - I typically work a few hours every morning and liked not being in some small room cut off from the rest of the activity. One of my favorite hotels I've ever stayed in.

We capped off a 9-day vacation in Hawaii with an overnight here after a week in Maui, before our flight back to the U.S. Mainland. This was a bit of a splurge after a week in a condo but not ridiculously expensive given the quality. Stylish and classy resort with very little of the cheesiness you find at other Waikiki resorts; everything new and clean instead of old and tired. First class fitness center, worthy of an independent health club. Beautiful experience at the rooftop bar & infinity pool. Note that the hotel allows late checkout at a nominal extra charge. This is very handy for the many people who have night flights back to the Mainland. We (family of 4) took two rooms, and they let us keep one of the rooms until 6pm for an upcharge of something like $90. This enabled us to have a full day of activities in Honolulu and take showers before heading to the airport, without having to pack up and stow luggage. My 4 star rating reflects a few criticisms. First is the easy one: if you book two rooms for a family of four, where two of the people are kids, you expect to get the rooms close together if not adjoining. When we checked in, we were told that the rooms were on separate floors. Duh. Come on guys. They were able to fix this, though it required lengthy putzing around at check-in. Second is the harder one: as many other people have complained, the bathrooms are tiny, like what I'd expect to see in a Salaryman hotel in Japan, not a luxury resort. In general the rooms are not enormous, though certainly adequate and what are you doing in your room anyway when you should be exploring the island?Finally, the food options in the hotel do not encourage staying on the property. There are two overpriced celebrity-chef places and a VERY overpriced breakfast buffet. We've had better and better-value dining experiences even elsewhere on Waikiki.Otherwise very nice experience.
user_name:
billrosenblatt
New York City, New York

review_body: This review is based on 3 stays, over the course of 7 months. The employees (front desk, pool towel person, valet, and overnight housekeeper) are rude and treat people different based on how they look. I like my room, and property location, but there’s other hotels that can give you location, comfort, and the thing that Alohilani is lacking, customer service.

My husband and I along with our 3 kids (6, 4 and 1 yr old) loved our weekend staycay at Alohilani and cant stop talking about how much fun we had!!! The service was top notch on all levels. We enjoyed the delicious food everywhere we ate through our 2 night, 3 day stay. We tried the lobby lounge for breakfast, Swell pool Bar for lunch and Lychee for brunch. The kids loved the Keiki pool and the Cabanas were heaven! The location was perfect for us as we walked to the zoo with the whole family one morning and also walked around to shops along the strip. The kids were obsessed with the amazing fish tanks in the lobby lounge and loved dancing to DJ KK Saturday night. We will be back for sure! Thank you Alohilani!!!!

This was my second time staying at the newly renovated Alohilani (used to be Pacific Beach Hotel) and it will not be my last! Both times I received high level service, from the check out guests to the pool deck attendants. Everyone is friendly and goes out of their way to make the stay comfortable. I stayed in a room facing diamond head and you really can't beat this view. you can see the ocean on one side and all of diamond head right out side the lanai. so incredible. one of the best views in waikiki.the pool deck is also not to be missed! the food is delicious and there's live music at night.will definitely be back!

Taxi driver called this hotel boughetto and i couldn't think of a better description. The lobby is opulently grand and stunning but unfortunately that's where the positives stop. Upon entering their highest class of room; ocean front, you realise there is no way this is a 5* hotel as advertised everywhere online and even their receptionist informed me that's not a real standard, they're actually 4*. The bathroom was the size of a shoebox, literally you can't enter and close the door without shimmying around the toilet. The room was clean and otherwise unimpressive, the view was pretty spectacular in fairness. After checking in we went down to the pool to grab a drink and some food, this is where things got strange, the guests at this place were really the bottom of the barrel, loud obnoxious and classless are the only polite words i can think of. We had a group of guys taking pictures/videos of my wife while we were sat by the pool making really sick comments. We spoke with the staff to let them know we felt uncomfortable and their response was there is nothing they could do. Slightly incredulous, we simply left and checked into the Ritz for the same price as our room. The ritz to mention was absolutely spectacular and couldn't fault them on anything. Service, rooms, facilites and environment were all top notch and couldn't be beat in waikiki. This place is really just a tourist trap designed to look like a luxury destination hotel but the reality is holiday inn levels of service and quality. In fairness to their management they did not argue when i told them we were checking out 2 hours after checking in and they arranged a full refund of the booking fees without hesitation. I think their employees know the standard of their guests and understand they misrepresent themselves as luxury when really it's basic at best with a great location.

Excellent customer service, that was a perfect place to stay for my special 60th birthday celebration, wonderful view at the corner between Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach, enjoyed the privacy, and love the quality of their toiletries.

If you're looking for a great place with great service, located in the heart of Waikiki, then look no further. I have made several trips to Hawaii in the past and hands down this was the most enjoyable experience yet.

Nice hotel. Descent location. A bit pricey. Could have gotten the same room directly on the beach at nicer hotel for quite a bit less than what I paid. Room small and bathroom tiny..... Smallest bathroom I’ve seen even for cheap motels.

I did a lot of research when traveling to Oahu for my birthday. If you are looking to stay somewhere special and splurge a little, this is definitely worth it, especially if you have a Hawaiian license. For 275 (with tax), we had an ocean view King size room. The room was super clean, the view was amazing with a small deck and the beds were SO comfortable. We also had complimentary Mai Tai's we enjoyed in the chairs in the infinity pool overlooking the city. It was also "after hours", around 5 pm, so they let us sit there for free and provided us with towels which was awesome. This deal also include FREE parking. We had a parking pass and with a rental could move around the island worry free. In addition, we could use all the amenities, even after check out and they even checked us in 3 hours earlier; this helped us stay for 2 full days and only one night. On top of all that, the hotel is BEAUTIFUL. Decor is amazing, staff is so kind and the oceanarium is great. We got to see a fish feeding with one of their divers and there was a ton of activities and other deals provided. A great place if you are with someone special and also a great place if you have a family. This place accommodates both.

Everything else was the WORSE experience ever. This hotel is RACIST and I felt discriminated. I’ve never felt so humiliated in my life. The Asian lady doing Leigh’s Friday at 1:30 told me and my 8 year old daughter we couldn’t join because there was not enough flowers when there was a table with so many flowers. “Because there were not enough” or more likely because were Hispanic and not white or Asian like the other people making Leighs. At the pool everyone else was getting served but us. How come the group of Asian influencers got VIP service when they barely consumed or probably didn’t just to give you a good promo on IG. How come the white family in front of us ordered and ate. How ever I had to stop a server in order to get acknowledged and served. Sat there for over an hour no one approached. If we were there it is because We can afford it and we don’t want ANYTHING FOR FREE. This is exactly why when the manager approached to offer we didn’t even asked for anything she brought us stuff. Which was good on her behalf but not enough for all the BS your staff got us thru. Not to mention on our last night my husband took my 8 year old to eat at the ramen place and it was 9:45 and they told them they were not serving them because it was too late. When you close at 10pm. It’s a child that’s hungry where’s the compassion the care for your customers. It’s funny how a Colombian couple that we met at the pool felt the same way. DISCRIMINATED FOR BEING HISPANIC. I reported everything and NO ONE CARED TO ANSWER !
user_name:
Maps23671915800
New York City, New York

review_body: The title says it all. The rooms are not soundproofed in the least. Stay here if you love the sound of traffic. Stay here if you love hearing the cleaning room door open and slam shut a billion times per day. Stay here if you love low ceilings. Stay here if you love ridiculously small bathrooms. Should have done the Royal Haiwaiian of the Halekulani instead.

I stayed at the Alohilani for my honeymoon this month. From the moment we pulled up and checked in the staff were all so friendly and helpful.We had a partial ocean view room which also had views out to the mountain so we were lucky with both. The room was clean and very well maintained.The pool and spa were great and the food and drinks at the pool bar were also delicious.Location is an added bonus, steps away from Waikiki Beach.I cannot fault this hotel.

Suzy at the pool was phenomenal. Not only did she provide excellent service, she pretty much planned our entire trip during our stay in Hawaii. She told us about all the local hotspots and hidden gems around the islands. She gave us recommendations for activities around the island that weren't "tourist traps". The hotel was great. Friendly staff. Was blown away by the indoor aquarium. A bit overwhelmed by the number of kids in the pool, but we got over it. Will definitely be coming back. Hopefully, Suzy will still be working if she hasn't already started her own travel/tourism company.

This hotel is very nice! Their staff were all very friendly & helpful! You can conveniently walk across the street to the beach. Lots of stores & restaurants are located in walking distance as well. They have a nice infinity pool, jacuzzi, & kid section. They provide water pouches for you to fill up at their water stations. We all loved it!

We stayed for 9 days at the Alohilani Resort. We stayed in an Ocean View (King bed) room and it was very comfortable. There was a partial ocean view, and we could have upgraded to a Premier Ocean View for an extra US$120 per night, but didn't think it was worth the extra money, as we could see the ocean and the mountains from our balcony. Breakfasts were included in our deal - breakfast box from the O Bar (fruit, muffins/bagels, yoghurt and snack bar). Thank you to Marlene for looking after us each morning at the O Bar - she was very helpful and friendly.The only downside was the service at the Swell Bar. We waited for a server to come and take our order. When this did not happen, I went to the bar to order. I was totally ignored and everyone around me was served. I ended up asking to be served (I am a woman 60+ years old). This happened on another occasion, and my husband came over and stood by my side. He was served immediately. So, I can only surmise that the staff do not want to serve older women at the bar. Therefore, we did not return to the Swell Bar, but took our money and custom to other establishments outside the hotel.We ate at the Morimoto Restaurant on one occasion, and the food was fantastic. We had Peking Duck as a main and it was cooked perfectly.Overall, it was a great hotel - but quite expensive. Was it worth it? For us it was!

On the first day we were greeted by Sarah at the front desk. She is a very positive/happy person and she went out of her way to ensure we had the room we were looking for. Unfortunately, I tend to rub people the wrong way with my requests for details/specifics (it's my OCD nature.....I think my mom potty-trained me too quickly or something:-) and Sarah responded like a professional and made me feel like it was no problem at all. This set the tone for our experience at Alohilani Resort and the rest of the staff followed suit during our stay.We have stayed in Waikiki probably 50 times in the past 20 years. This property looks to be one of the OG hotels of Waikiki (been around for awhile) based on its external structure but it has been renovated and modernized so it's definitely in-line with the better hotels in Waikiki. We have have found our new go-to home away from home in Waikiki.

First I have to say I haven't stayed at this hotel yet. It is the old Pacific Beach Hotel. I did want to comment how how amazing the transformation of the lobby area is. We were going to Morimoto Asia restaurant where the Waikiki 24 hr fitness was. The restaurant is fabulous! To get to the restaurant from the garage was a little bit of a maze as we were sure we were in the right hotel. Just keep going toward the ocean and eventually you will find a sign pointing you to the right elevators. IDK if the hotel room elevators will take you to the restaurant but there was an specific Morimoto elevator to go up. Well you have to see it to believe how beautiful this property is! The oceanarium is still there and looks new. Everything looks so new! I can't wait to stay here for a night or two just to see the rooms. This is not the best review but i just wanted to send a "shout out" for how beautiful this property is now.

Very disappointed at this hotel. Have stayed 4 years ago and it was great. We stayed in an Ocean Front room which was more expensive than other options, and found it very cramped. The bathroom is so small you have to squeeze up beside the toilet to close the door, the giant sized cabinet takes up half the space and you need to stand inside the shower/bath to dry off as there is no room outside the tub. The noise from other guest rooms is ridiculous, /doors slam all day and night, they do not lock unless slammed. The sliding door to the balcony did not have lock or latch just a hole with a large screw to put in it and did not close fully. The staff don't seem to care at all. We had to turn A/C off so we could sleep the noise from them is like a rocket taking off. The refurbishment has been cheap and nasty. The pool area is interesting either windy or in the shade for most of the day. A big space but not ideal to spend much time there. Across the road to the beach for a swim is a better option. On the plus side the hotel has a great location, it looks beautiful from the check in counter but that is where it ends. We stored our bags on arrival until our room was ready, we were offered someone else's luggage twice before they bought the correct luggage out and we were not offered any assistance so struggled to the lifts with our 4 bags. don't be fooled by the photos shown on their website or on their bio, not at all what we had. Not a good experience at all.

I have just had 10 days in Hawaii and stayed at the Alohilani Resort Hotel. Fabulous Hotel. One of the best I have stayed in. Very much appreciated the champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries they gave us on arrival as we were there to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Very thoughtful. The facilities, the room, the view, the staff were just top. Made our holiday perfect.

We had a disappointing stay at alohilani. We where given a room with a interconnecting door and the noise from the connecting room was ridiculous. The neighbour left his tv on all night, very loud, to the point where we had to ask the front desk and security to turn it down. You could actually hear the tv from the elevator. We could also hear the person on his phone all night and I won’t write what you could hear, especially for a child. Upon talking to numerous front desk people about it all I got was “we are sorry to hear that!” And that’s about it. I asked about room change but nothing eventuated. Very hard with a 5 year old. As for the room cleanliness, the bathroom floor had mould in the corner and looked like it hadn’t been properly cleaned for awhile. We booked a partial ocean view room, and on arrival was told it’s a view of about 10% so we upgraded to a higher room for $10per night, which didn’t make a difference all you could see was a better view of the buildings.The up side to this hotel is definitely the location and pool area. Both are great

Proximity: Hotel is on the strip & close by everything, easy walk to the beach & restaurants.Room: Yes, Ocean View room is actually partial ocean view but as long as you know that going in, you are happy with the room.Staff/events: The day we arrived was around a holiday and they had an event for the guests. I was able to make a Haku crown with fresh flowers for free, get a 15 min free massage, etc. Loved this! Staff was friendly.Pool: True that the pool is cold in the winter, but it is beautiful! Jacuzzi overlooks it, so get there early before the crowds to check it out.Rented a car & drove to other parts of the island- this is a must to see the best beaches and hikes.Note: In February weather can be hit or miss in Oahu, one day was rainy and chilly another day was sunny & warm.
user_name:
niquee2
Brooklyn, New York, United States

review_body: I booked a hotel room a day before my arrival. However, due to an emergency reason, I am not able to cancel for a full refund. As a "5-star" hotel, they refused to refund me despite the fact that I had just booked the hotel less than 24 hours ago. They have a very rigid cancellation policy that will make no exceptions to anyone. Thanks for making my day that much worse Alohilani.

It's good. room is very clean and comfortable and pretty! location is good too. but..I hope the information will be better. Also, I feel sad because I have to leave the water on the first floor every time and the disease is leaking. When the elevator is closed, the sound can be heard in the room, making it uncomfortable at night.

Special thanks to Paul Garcia, Arrival Experience Manager who made sure that our room has amazing views of the beach. This modern design hotel is just a minute walk to the beach. The restaurants is super delicious and also the infinity pool looks out to the ocean. Also super thank you to Mackenzie Farley, Expedia Concierge who booked our helicopter Honolulu ride.

Amazing place with great staff! Outstanding customer service. You have anything and everything at your fingertips. Absolutely loved my stay and would definitely come back! Highly recommend, give them a try!

What a turn up for the books. Waikiki and in particular this hotel was fantastic. We upgraded to a Premier Ocean View Room and what a view. Absolutely stunning. Rooms have been refurbished and are very chic. Absolute beachfrontage right in front of the surf. We loved this resort and would highly recommend it.

I would like to give 5 stars, but the hotel is disappointed me in some case. When I checked in, the waiter was a little arrogant. The room is noisy, that may because the room is next to an elevator. However, in general, the hotel is good. The breakfast is delicious, and the room is clean. The performances in the bar are great. When I checked out, Jane was very enthusiastic, and I may come here next time because of her good service.

disappointing ..cannot understand how this hotel could be rated 5 star without any in room dining or service..the bathroom was the smallest encountered in any waikiki hotels...the view is pleasing but the morning honolulu health department visit to the homeless persons area directly on the beachfront is noisy with high pressure water blasting equipment and leaf blowers promptly every morning at 7amno wakeup call required...

I recommend this hotel and will return, but must warn others to not book until the pool deck construction is completed. The pool deck setting was completely ruined by earth shattering sound of jack hammers - non-stop, the entire week, just on the other side of a fence by the bar. The pool staff were wearing protective ear plugs. Hotel sort of made it up to us the first day, as we were asking bartender about the source of the noise and another staffer swept us over to one of the cabanas and offered to let us use it for free to enjoy lunch "further from the noise". This was appreciated. Rooms were clean, beds and linens comfortable, bathroom small, but not impossibly, Morimoto's restaurant was delicious, poolside menu was yummy (buddha bowl my favorite), downstairs hallway scented with perfume which I liked, lei-making class was fun, fish tank and divers feeding twice a day was cool. Location across from nice protected beach. We had changed to this hotel from horrible experience at major brand name hotel nearby where we had dirty conditions and almost zero service (think heiress Paris). Please check with hotel before booking. Jack hammer was so loud, probably violated OSHA regulations.

Do not use we paid extra for upgraded rooms and got dog box’s the bathroom is so tiny you have to cram in between the toilet and shower to open and close door - see pics :( and the reception is nice but the rooms finish is cheap and peeling in many places also they have just started renovating next to the poolSo all you hear is construction noise and jack hammers from early morning and throughout the day. When we complained they said it was not construction just ‘beautification’ :/. So dodgy and definitely not the 5 star price we paid more like 3 star under renovation!

Modern, very clean and comfortable. Perfectly located for beach access. Breakfast buffet in Lychee, however, is grossly overpriced at $33.00, plenty of other options nearby. Overall experience positive and do recommend.

Great location, attentive staff, pool great , rooms clean . Close to restaurants , shopping and beach We had partial ocean view , we up graded from original room , managed to haggle got $10 off per night. Don't forget to ask for free mai tai vouchers . We didn't receive them , bartender mentioned them so I asked at reception.

A highly recommend hotel for all it has to offer. Our comfortable room had a stunning oceanview on the 14th floor and we thoroughly enjoyed the lanai. We dined in both Morimoto restaurants and liked it so much we went back for a 2nd meal, highly recommended! The lei making course was excellent and a great way to immerse into the Hawaiian culture. All in all a wonderful stay at the Alohilani!!

My spouse and I enjoyed staying at Alohilani Resort in early March for a winter sun-break. The weather was sunny and breezy but we managed to enjoy the warm sunshine at times on the beach and found the resort's private sun deck to be a great place to enjoy the hot tub and Swell Pool bar. The hotel staff were incredibly welcoming and attentive - especially Janice, Nikki, Mikki and Jones on the fabulous pool deck Swell Pool experience. Our room was clean, fresh and bright and the bed was incredibly cozy and comfortable. Although the hotel doesn't offer room service we found many options for each meal, including the hotel's amazing restaurants. Our room also featured terrycloth robes and slippers, a spacious closet, a two seater dining table and minim fridge as well as two deck chairs on the small private lanai. The bathroom was tiny but clean and effective. The room cleaning staff were incredible, including Rita and all the other housekeeping staff on the 16th floor - thank you! We also had the pleasure of meeting the front desk Director, Adrian, who made our stay top notched! We look forward to our next stay at Alhohilani Resort.

I was staying at the Alohilani in February of 2019 for a work conference. My phone was left behind in a closed banquet hall where I was with work colleagues and hotel staff. Shortly after leaving, I realized my phone had been left behind. I notified the front desk that evening and they said hotel policy is for cleaning staff to turn the phone into security and I should back in the morning after the hotel had been cleaned for the night. However, to no avail, the phone had not been turned in the next day.Later that afternoon around 2pm, I get an email from my icloud account saying my iphone has "been found"... the phone was pinging to a location outside of waikiki. I called the phone, it rang and rang (insead of going to voicemail like it had earlier). I was now in an uber on my way to the location of the phone. I arrived, and found that it was pinging to a storage unit 2 miles outside of waikiki. I called again a second time, and the phone went to voicemail, and as I'm standing in the stoarage unit, it stops pinging the phone. Meaning the phone was in the building at the same time as I was standing in, and whoever had it, was clearly not intending on returning it. The storage unit staff would not help without contacting the police first, so I did. I notify the police who decide to investigate. Mind you, my work colleagues and I are all visiting Hawaii, none of us are renting a storage unit, and they were the only other ones who couldve have access to my phone. I notified the hotel manager upon return that I believe a hotel employee may potentially have taken the phone instead of returning it (because I had no plausible explaation as to how the phone was at a storage unit), and asked if they'd be willing to review their security footage. Jenny, the hotel manager said she would get back to me...the day went on, and I did not hear back from the hotel manager. Having realized the phone was taken by someone from the resort and was pinging to a storage unit, I changed the original message which stated "cash reward for this phone if found" to something along the lines of "this phone is stolen, please return immediately." The following day at 630am, my boyfriend gets a call to his cell phone from someone stating that they "found the phone, and would return it if they could get the cash reward." This person was in the hotel, on their way up to our floor, which is odd given there are two different towers in this hotel and I don't know how he knew which tower we were in. He asked for the exact room number. Within seconds a man arrives at the door. I asked him who he was, he stated his first name. He hands me my phone, and the cover is missing, the glass screen protector is missing, and the sim card has been removed...I asked him who he is and how he found the phone. The man is clearly nervous and delays answering questiosn with "uhhh, uhhhh". I keep asking him, and he states he found the phone 2 nights ago while cleaning (the night the phone went missing!).... and then he still had the nerve to ask me for a cash reward. What kind of hotel employee request a cash reward for a stolen item?!?? I went downstairs and notified the new hotel manager who said he will look into and get back to me... and the morning progressed, and he did not get in touch with me.I also notified the police that this phone has now been returned since the police report had been filed, and I'm not even more concerned, because clearly this person tried to steal the phone (why else remove the sim card, cover and protector). Also, why put it in a storage unit?? Are there other stolen goods there?? I also googled the number this hotel employee called us from and was able to get his last night from a simple search. I notified a 3rd hotel manager at this point, as the overnight manager had left. Guess what they said?? "We'll look into it, and get back to you" I literally managed to do most of the heavy lifting in locating my phone, this person states he is a hotel employee, confirmed that he "found my phone" 2 nights prior when cleaning, and clearly did not follow hotel policy to return all lost valuables to security, instead, took out my sim card, cover and protector and had it sitting in a storage unit 2 miles from the hotel. Clearly this person had intended to sale this phone as a new phone.... At no point did hotel management call me back. That was my day of departure and I asked for an update and the best they could tell me was "it is a person who works for a 3rd party vendor for cleaning our hotel..." This is $1000 phone. This is the equivalent of taking a watch, jewelry or any other valuable item. They stated they were going to open an internal investigation. I find it absurd that at a "5-star" resort in Hawaii something like this could happen, but I find it even more absurd that this hotel did not take ownership and were not proactive about communicating with me. Transparency with your customers should be a priority, especially when it comes to criminal activity on your hotel property by a hotel employee. DO NOT STAY HERE!! There are a lot of options to stay in Waikiki, there is no need to stay at a hotel where you can't rely on the staff to not steal your stuff (3rd party vendor or not). Also, the hotel managers did not call back or update me at any point as they said they would. They even took my cell phone number, but not once did they call. I literally spent almost 1.5 days of my trip dealing with this. This was meant to be a relaxing business trip, instead, I'm trying to figure out how and why a hotel employee stole my phone. If I had not gone after the phone myself or inquired further, it seems they would not have even bothered and hope to sweep this under the rug.ABOUT THE HOTEL ITSELF:-small pool and 1 hot tub which is a insufficient size for the number of guests this accommodates, gets very crowded fast-extremely expensive drink and food at the pool compared to other pool bars in the area. Talking ~$15 for one mai tai.-very, very loud!! our initial room was on the 9th floor, not even directly facing the pool, (which is open from 6am to 10pm) and music is on always, so afternoon naps are hard to come by. Music was literally blasting into the room at 6am. They did give us a quieter room on the backside of the hotel eventually, which I appreciate.The only pro about this place is the Morimoto restaurants, but you dont need to stay at the hotel to eat here. Just call and make a reservation on your own. You don't need to go through the hotel concierge to manage to get a table. The location is close to the beach... but then again, so are all of the waikiki hotels.

My wife and I travelled from Australia for our fourth trip to Hawaii and the Alohilani was our favorite hotel of all our trips. The rooms were spacious and beautifully appointed. Location was perfect and the service from everyone was first class. We will definitely be coming back.

Alohilani is a great hotel to stay in Waikiki. I have stayed in many hotels and I can assuredly say that this is the first time that I slept comfortably and used the washroom without total scorn. I was able to put my clothes in the closet, sit on the balcony and use the table in the nook. The property is well kept and staff are extremely polite ans helpful. Affordability could be an issue but if you can stay at this facility you will enjoy your stay in Waikiki!

We started our babymoon with 3 nights at this wonderful hotel. We landed on a Friday evening and took an uber to the hotel. Even with rush hour, it just took a little over half an hour. The location is great. Just a block from the beach with great food and shopping all around. Upon entering the hotel, the lobby was very impressive. Ami, one of the managers on duty, checked us in. She was very sweet, but yet professional. She found out we were in town for our babymoon and upgraded us! We were in room 1767. It's a corner room where you can get the ocean AND mountain view. It was breathtaking. If at all possible get this corner on any floor. Also after a few minutes of getting into our room, a plate of fruit and macaroons were sent up to congratulate us on the baby! The treatment was completely first class here.They also give you water pouches that you can fill with water at any of the water stations in the lobby. But if you find a need to get any snacks or drinks for the room there are dozens of ABC stores within a block of the hotel. Marukame Udon is also about a 5 minute walk away. A must try. There's usually a line wrapped around outside, so it's hard to miss. Also, we rented a car once we arrived from the Avis location at the international market shopping area a couple blocks away. Self parking at the hotel is $35/day, so if you just need a car for the day you can pick up early in the morning and return the rental car in the evening to avoid the parking fee at the hotel. The Avis mentioned has a very late return time, but I would recommend prebooking a car. We went during low season and lots of people were turned away at check-in who did not have reservations. Great start to a wonderful trip!

This is a lovely, recently updated hotel with a modern vibe in the heart of bustling Waikiki. The rooms were nicely appointed and very clean. Housekeeping does a really nice job always. The views of the beach and Diamond Head are wonderful. I was truly impressed by the quality of the food (and I’m a *really* tough critic, particularly when it comes to dining). We ate at O Bar almost exclusively when we ate at the hotel (our two year old loved the oceanarium), and whether it was breakfast, lunch or dinner every meal was absolutely delicious. Fresh ingredients, immaculate preparation, and good service always had us looking forward to our next meal there. I highly recommend the kale chicken Caesar. We had it everyday for lunch. Where this property really shines, though, is its staff. From the moment we arrived, we found the staff at Alohilani to be truly exceptional. They are consistently warm, welcoming, professional and effective. Of course, even in a group of this caliber, there were standouts. Without question, the one who made our stay so special and left us with such warm memories of Alohilani, was Eddie at the Bell Desk. We travel a lot and almost exclusively stay at five star properties, and yet we cannot remember another hotel employee who went so far above and beyond his job than Eddie. Somehow from check-in through the duration of our stay, Eddie made us feel like we were his personal guests. He was at once our bellman, our concierge, our local friend with all the great inside knowledge of the city, and even someone we could count on to help us wrangle our VERY active toddler. For example, one night at dinner as my husband and I were lamenting not being able to eat our entrees because we were constantly having to run off to chase the baby, here came Eddie, on his way out for the night after finishing his shift, who scooped the little one up and started cheerfully bouncing him and distracting him so we could eat in peace for a few minutes. (Incidentally, our toddler found Eddie so endearing he’s been asking for him ever since we left.) Just when we didn’t think Eddie could possibly do any more for us, he even went so far as to call some of his contacts at the next hotel on our Hawaii itinerary to ensure that when we checked in there we would be well taken care of. He was undoubtedly the highlight of our trip, and we were truly sad when it was time to say goodbye. Additionally, Jill, one of the hotel managers was wonderful about fixing any of our concerns, and Guillermo at O Bar is a gem of a man who always took great care of us and made us feel special. The ladies who run O Bar for breakfast are also lovely. We miss their smiles already! We would like to extend a huge thank you to Eddie, Jill, Guillermo and the rest of the staff at Alohilani for making what was to be essentially a short stopever stay, into a trip that we will never, ever forget. Mahalo.

service was excellent the staff all good, the room was good, the view of the beach amazing and so easy to go to, it’s was a nice weather to have night walks down the shore and enjoy the hawaiian sunset

My boyfriend and I visited the island for a week and this was by far our favorite spot! We were greeted with amazing customer service from Kelley the minute we pulled up to valet. Our room was cozy and welcoming and the staff made sure to make us feel at home. We visited the concierge desk to inquire about activities. Jake helped us book an open door helicopter ride which was by far our favorite part of the trip! The views are Breathtaking! He was very insightful on all the local shops as restaurants around the hotel. Don’t forget to check out the infinity pool and the upstairs bar! If you and your loved one are visiting the beautiful island, this is definitely the place to stay! We are already planning our next trip and will be staying here again!

I believe it was overall okay.Breakfast Buffet, initially I thought that I would have it there all mornings but instead, I only had it once. Content and Cost of USD40 per person did not match very well.Variety of the food did not seem to measure up to my expectation, in some way.I god 37th Floor, had a nice city-ocean view, and noise seems to dim a bit, but you could hear family noise from hallway and veranda. In March, there seem quite a lot of family with kids traveling.My room had a bath tub, twin beds, coffee machine .... One favor Alohilani did for me was to hold the postal package at the hotel before my arrival. That was extremely helpful.Coin laundry is available at the lower floor.Pool seems to be crowded during the day. It was still a bit chill during March, so I did not go into the water, but saw the infinity pool and thought that was beautiful.It does not seem they do any room service / food in the room service.It was convenient to every thing from attractions / zoo to transportation to catch to Ala Moana Center.

Me and my husband loved the grand entrance, the view from diamond head was breathtaking but the best part was our experience at the pool. Cold towels, Sunglass cleaning (unexpected but wow), facial misting which the Pool Manager Nikki was superb at servicing. Her bright smile and warm spirit and tips to check out the island were greatly appreciated. Her staff rocked it. My favorite part of the day at the pool was the chocolate chip cookie brownie! Yum! We will definitely return to this hotel.

From the check-in to the gym to the buffet breakfast and the beds. This place was faultless.We had the pleasure of stay at Alohilani for our conference and it was excellent. Even the conference facilities were great.The fish tank is awesome as is the live entertainment. Also Julie provided great service at the bar. Also make sure you try the $10 burger for lunch special. It was great I am looking forward to coming back with my family.

Overall great resort. Would definitely stay here again. The only downside were the extremely small bathrooms. We also upgraded to a full ocean front view as this improved the overall experience significantly.

My room wasn't available at arrival but as that was at ten AM I wasn't surprised. Room was available when I got back there later at around three thirty PM. Hotel recently renovated and condition of my room was good. Had a corner room on the back tower about half way up. Room was billed as ocean view and had a balcony facing diamond head with a very good view and a window on the front over looking the ocean. Had pretty good views from the balcony. Hotel is directly across the street from the beach and is centrally located along the beach. Bedding was a bit soft for me as I prefer a harder mattress. Wasn't particularly cheap so I only rate value as average, but I don't regret paying the money. You get what you pay for.

The Alohilani is an amazingly wonderful resort to visit but it was the staff that made it special for me. Everyone was so kind and helpful. Most amazing was Valet Maka who saved my trip. I lost my wallet full of vacation cash and he found it and ran it across the street as I got on a tour bus. I appreciate the extra effort he took to find me after I was out of sight on the bus. I am also grateful for his generous spirit and honesty. This was the beginning of my trip.i It would have put a damper on the trip if I had lost the wallet at this point.In addition, Maka had also been really helpful to my mom and me when we arrived at the Alohilani. He answered a bunch of questions to set us in the right direction upon our arrival. His excellence set the Alohilani apart from the other resorts for me. Mahalo Maka. You made my trip.

This was our first visit to Honolulu, and definitely loved our stay at the Alohilani. Clean. Great location. Beautiful view from the pool deck. And we loved the nightly live music. Would definitely stay here again.

This was a great location in Honolulu, the restaurants in the hotel were fantastic and the pool area was great! The room was a little bit small but the views were great of diamond head and the water. There is a very impressive fitness center in the hotel and we loved the live music in the lounge!

This is a FIRST CLASS hotel will ALL the amenities. The pools are great, the Restaurant Buffet is GREAT. Great food selection, great service & excellent taste, The beach is 'just across the street', along with access to a variety of other restaurants & shops. The rooms are VERY CLEAN, spacious, and comfortable. Never a long wait for elevator access and the attached parking garage is great for those with vehicles.

Gr8 hotel front desk very helpful after we were given the wrong room they straight away moved us to an ocean view room on a higher floor which made our holiday. Rooms are very bright and spacious and the lobby and pool area are fantastic . Staff could nof be more friendly and helpful right throughout the hotel. Special shout out to Jones the pool attendant who went the extra mile everyday to make everyone feel welcome and special.

Alohilani is a newly renovated (in 2018) hotel in Waikiki. The facilities are great. Clean and well maintained. The staff are fantastic and all welcoming. We were given an early check-in (9am) without additional charges. The concierge - Stefan was the best. He sorted all our activities and worked out an insane discount. The restaurant are pricey but we prefer not to eat at hotel restaurants. It would have been great if the hotel gave hotel guest discounts. All in all, it was an unforgettable holiday. Thank you Alohilani!

A wonderful hotel, excellent location, the decor was lovely, the staff professional.The hotel was well suited for couples, families and those traveling alone or on business. I really like that the hotel was quieton what would be a busy part of Waikiki.I highly recommend this hotel.

We booked with luxury escapes, and the package included 4 free cocktails, daily breakfast, and $150 room charge. The breakfast box was wonderful and very generous. The bed was extremely comfortable. Staff were all very friendly. The pool area was absolutely amazing, the view was to die for. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

We booked with costco travel. Transportation included. The structure, layout, style, service is world's above the previously Pacific Beach Hotel. Breakfast buffet is a steep $33 a person but worth doing once. Pool deck, swell bar and live music are a great way to spend down time. Ocean view rooms are worth the extra money. Bathrooms are small but nice. House keeping is extra friendly and helpful. Indoor Aquarium is fun for the kids and they have a kids pool separate from main pool. We rented mopeds for 4 days and traveled all over honolulu , waikiki, waiphu, and south oahu. Parking is free almost everywhere and only $5 a night for mopeds at hotel. Loved this resort and will return.

Came to celebrate our engagement! Ended up feeling like just another number. We live on island and wanted to come experience this highly rated resort. We thought maybe we would have felt special here if only for a few days. I payed plenty of money for the room, food, parking, etc. No special attention was payed to our experience. My fiancé and I were treated like another number. sad and disheartening. It felt like flying coach and asking for an extra bag of peanuts you get the bag but then you also get a pissed off flight attendant. I just thought maybe the hotel would have at least acknowledged our engagement in some small way. It’s nice going to a hotel and having the staff welcome you and make you feel at home and making you feel special if even for a moment. That didn’t happen...

that was such a nice time for us with my family... everybody was so friendly. it was pleasant stay for us..if i go Hawaii again I would stay at the same place for sure. the infinite pool was beautiful...

Our family of 4 (2lids under 10) and my 65 year old mother stayed here for around a week in sept. The rooms were comfortable, with functional but small bathrooms.The hotel is close to Waikiki bean, towards the bottom end of the main strip. The hotel is side on to the beach, so the ocean view rooms are on either side of the second building, and have partial views of the ocean.The pool is amazing, which is an attraction and the fully equipped gym is equally great. We never ate at the hotel, other than pool snacks at lunch (pizza, sandwiches etc on offer), as the prices are ridiculous compared to other eateries outside on the strip and in the malls. Drinks, especially cocktails, were great, but again, very expensive, but that’s what you get in Hawaii. I can’t stand the expectation of waiters and bar staff for tips! Yes they are underpaid and live off tips, but I’ve travelled to mainland US a number of times and going to Hawaii for the first time in over 30 years, it’s clear the attitudes of the local service staff are very expectant without always being friendly or grateful (not all, but most). It put me off Hawaii overall.All that said, if you’re going to Waikiki, you’ll love this newly renovated resort, it’s very clean and well maintained. The other staff were very helpful and accommodating especially when we needed to stay most of the next day when our flight was delayed to midnight. They allowed us a late checkout in our existing room at a reasonable additional cost.Enjoy!

The hotel is beautiful, we loved the huge aquarium in the lobby. Our room was nice and clean, newly renovated, great location, very close to the beach, and shopping, and the best part was the dining experience at Momosan downstairs.

This hotel defies description. Right from the get go, this hotel goes above and way beyond to ensure its travellers are their number one priority. From tthe ease and efficiency of check- in, to their refurbished and extremely comfortable rooms, an activities program that has something for everybody and a perfect location in Waikiki.Perhaps the most impressive part of this Hotel is its staff. Never ever have I stayed at an establishment with such an outstanding level of customer service. Nothing is a problem. No request not acted on. In my entire stay, every staff member from check in, housekeeping, bar and restaurant staff and in particular the staff on the pool deck, greeted me with an Aloha, a hello and a big smile. I'd like to make particular mention of Nikki the Pool Experince Manager, whose bright, bubbly energy and smile lit up the pool deck. Along with Jonesy, Janice, Shellsea and Stef, absolutely nothing was a problem and they made sure my friend and I were looked after like royalty. Big smiles, engaging humour, a genuine interest in their guests made for a fabulously relaxing holiday. I'll be back to Alohilani and plan to make it my hotel of choice when in Waikiki.

Just got back from Hawaii last night and with the fresh memories I wanted to write this. Alohilani was the cherry on top of a great vacation. I will separate this review into: Amenities, Night Sleep, Customer Service, Location.Amenities: As advertised Alohilani was renovated and has an outstanding fitness facility on premise, that is great for keeping fit even on vacation and is so convenient to use. The Tennis Courts were also fabulous we didnt play as we are not big tennis players but they looked great. The different bars are great for the different tastes and moods of the clientele. The O Bar is a beautiful welcome and waiting area, and the Swell Bar at the pool is great for your mid day beer and even for a late night relaxed vibe. The prices are not cheap but they match every other bar and restaurant in the area. The Lobby is breath taking and fresh makes you feel relaxed as soon as you step in.The one area they are lacking is with bedroom amenities. For a 5 star resort you expect to have certain things such as: robes, champagne flutes, a mini bar, etc.This is the only limitation and things such as the coffee and toiletries seem a bit cheap foir the status of the hotel. Night Sleep: We got a gorgeous Partial View King Bedroom on the 38th floor. When we opened the door it felt like the pictures on the website, it was lovely. The bed is super comfy and the pillows are too. Adored the balcony to have our morning coffee and the amount of storage space was very appreciated. The bathroom is nicely divided between toilet/shower and sink which is good if you need to get ready at the same time, great lighting too my makeup was on point throughout my vacation. However, the bathroom is very small, and there is no space to hang the towels and the toiletries are a bit on the cheaper end. Feels more like a 3 star hotel in the shower than a 5 star.The walls are very thin. We could hear everything our neighbours said and do. Thankfully they were a family and not partiers so the noise wasnt too too bad but it is definitely something that takes from the experience. Customer Service:Here´s where the 5 star review lies. What a spectacular service!! Everyone is super friendly and attentive to our needs. When we arrived to the front desk Jane made our vacation amazing from the start, she was supper professional, attentive, sweet, everything you can expect from the industry and more. She helped us get the perfect room and guided us through the ins and outs of the resort always with a smile on her face. I lack words to express how amazing she was. If I could write a whole review on her I would. The servers at swell bar were ok, some of them are very nice and attentive while others seem to just be doing their job. LocationRight on the heart of waikiki the beach is merely crossing the street and you can walk to all the bar, restuarants, shops and amenities. If you´re looking for more of a nature resort this is not it but it is the best for the city vibes mix.

The hotel is beautiful, we loved the huge aquariums in the lobby nice, our room was nice and clean, newly renovated, great location, right on the beach and shopping, and the best part was dining at Momosan, great comfort food

The hotel to say the least was disappointing. We expected a 5 Star and got a 3 1/2 Star. Location was great though. Service was seriously lacking though. Maid service needs work...hardly any vacuuming. Bathroom seriously small. Will not say again.

First time staying at the Alohilani Resort. The overall service was excellent. The Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was very clean. The pool and and fitness facilities were great. I would highly recommend the Alohilani, to anyone wanting to stay in Waikiki.

I highly recommend staying at this hotel! It is a quick walk from the beach as well restaurants. The hotel is very clean and has updated rooms. It has a great infinity pool as well as a hot tub as well. The hotel staff is very courteous and accommodating. I highly recommend this hotel!
user_name:
Justin H
State College, Pennsylvania, United States

review_body: We especially appreciated help from the concierge team in booking excursions, renting a car, and even re-booking an excursion when the pickup time was missed. Beautiful hotel, delightfully close to walking on Waikiki Beach.
