Wait times at check in desk was 10-20mins.Every time we called concierge there was no answer and our message was never returned the whole seven nights we were there.Majority of staff not friendly.Our first room on 39th floor, the shower water would keep coming out the bath tap instead of shower head. The constant noise of a fan or air conditioners above us was unbareable to sleep with.Our phone was not turned on when we arrived so what was the resort fee for if phone isn’t turned on.Pretty disappointed as we spent all our savings on this trip before we have our first child and expected 5 star accommodation but didn’t receive it.I think the fact that the staff weren’t friendly when things went wrong made us more upset because we are people that understand that accidents happen and sometimes things don’t go right but when you pay a lot of money for 5star accommodation you expect kind and understanding staff.The positives of the hotel is that views were lovely and the pool bar was very nice and relaxing but unfortunately I will be telling my travel agent to not sell this hotel.

I have stayed in two different room categories, three rooms and two towers during my seven day stay here and the overwhelming feeling my husband and I had was that this is not a five star resort. I had split my stay and stayed at a 4.5 star hotel and then came back to alohilani feeling quite underwhelmed. The pros of this hotel are - location (not as central as Moana but still in a great location). Maccas next door , Burger King around the corner comes handy as there’s no room service- generally clean rooms as they are new which was a big drawing card for me when researching - Doug at the front and some other staff were helpful with helping us get around. - momosan ramen downstairs is some of the best ramen I have ever had. Didn’t have Morimotos but would assume it’s just as good - beautiful mesmerising aquarium tank which my baby enjoyed - one bell man kindly asked if we needed a cot which front desk didn’t. - abc store downstairs which was convenient - two complimentary water for first night. they give u bottle bags to refill downstairs. I guess that is a good initiative to cut cost and also be eco friendly. Negatives - - front desk , upon check in , asked if it was a special occasion. We in fact was celebrating our anniversary but nothing special was done so no light touches of anything here. - biggest disappointment: The interior of the rooms are very basic and cheap. Yes they are new but it’s not five star quality. The bathroom is so tiny and the toilet in one of our rooms literally touches the door. The rooms are also extremely noisy/ not sound proofed well that I could hear every god damn time the toilet flushed next door in our room (during our second part of our trip) in the poolside tower. By this time, I was so not bothered and had enough of this hotel I just copped it. No room service is a big fail. The buffet only opens for breakfast. Housekeeping have been inconsistent during our stay. they don’t provide body wash gel but body wash soap. This is a meant to be a five star property. We had soap as well as body wash gel at our other 4.5 star hotel. Housekeeping also shoved small rubbish on the floor behind the toilet instead of picking it up. Tip - ask for towels from the pool and then go to the beach. But if u are in the seaside tower u have to walk to the other tower to get it. no robes and slippers are also a big fail. I was disappointed by this but more disappointed when I saw alohilani posting photos of people on Instagram that had robes and slippers?! I’m confused. Do they only provide it for people who stay at premier ocean front rooms? I would love to know the answer to this?! I stayed at partial ocean and ocean room category rooms and we didn’t get it? I don’t understand this at all! No kettles or microwave in room. If u are a parent trying to sterilise ur babies things this will be hard! U will have to request it.YOU have to ask for toothbrush and toiletries here!!!!!!! The other hotels we stayed it brang it to our room upon check in! Without asking! No shaving kits or cotton buds provided or offered at alohilani. House keeping knock at your door and literally yell throughout the corridors at 7-8am in the morning. This was horrible. I could even hear from my poor proofed room one person in another room yelling back “too early” to housekeeping!!!!! Tip - u must put a door sign to avoid this. Before I stayed here, I read that there are two towers one of which is “brand new”. I asked a question on this forum and alohilani said both r renovated towers - true but one is definitely more better built than the other. Tip - Book a room in the tower closest to the beach. It is better done than the other tower which had the pool and we had the actual air con unit in the room next to the bed - It’s truely eye sore! Also the ceiling is exposed painted concrete in this tower and so ugly and cheap looking. I read that the fitout of this hotel is cheaply done and I agree. The bath has a 70s shower curtain. One word-gross. not five star quality. As someone else has pointed out in their review, The quilt / blanket is not covered!!!!!! I really don’t understand this!!!!! Had a late night snack and drinks at the aquarium bar and the lady took my bill & tip but didn’t take our dish away For a good while! Staff seem uninterested in this part of the hotel and I have come during different times of the day. Other observations: Pool - the kids pool was good but filled up w children very quickly so there’s no room to sit if it’s a hot dayThe adults pool was great I saw other kids in the spa and I believe that’s not in line w pool rules however it was not managed on the few times I was at the pool. They have kids movie nights and Lei making classesConclusion - Compared to other hotels, there are No personal touches or effort from staff to remember ur name or greet you. This is a big disappointment for me as I believe the staff make the experience in five star properties. I actually will remember Doug as he was a top guy! And some other staff who have been here for 40 plus years that seem to care about their guests. I would say if you could get a good price for this room than it’s not bad , it’s sufficient and clean and otherwise good however the noise and quality of the rooms were a huge disappointment.I was looking forward to this hotel the most. if you are looking for five star and want a memorable stay, maybe look at Halekulani or prince hotel and you will notice the difference as I have.

My husband booked this resort for my 50th birthday. We found it to be a great choice, including friendly staff, clean rooms, and great location! We did notice reviews commenting on the small bathroom - overall, yes compared to most, but is a huge bathroom necessary on vacation? The heated toilet seat was nice :) Lighting could have been better. Slightly disappointed with no room service. Overall, we would certainly recommend this hotel, for the Waikiki area.

I am a regular in Honolulu and this place is by far the best resort I have stayed in. The location, staff, and amenities are exceptional. The rooms are clean and up to date. The pool area has amazing views and the staff there is so helpful. My favorite girl is Janis. She was super nice and very attentive. She kept checking on us and gave us helpful tips for the area. Her and her coworkers were definitely over the top when it comes to hospitality. The Music in the lobby in the evenings was awesome.

Stayed for five nights at the Alohilani for a conference. Partial ocean view king room. sixth floor. As promised, there was actually a very decent partial view of the ocean. Room was bright and appeared recently renovated, however I am concerned that the fixtures/room appointments may not stand up to the repeated stress of hotel guests. already some outlets, fixtures, handles, etc... were appearing worn. Bathroom was quite small. Shower was basic but with adequate water pressure. No tub. I stayed here alone but feel like it would be quite cramped with more than one person. The interior and public areas of the hotel were very nice. Beautiful aquarium in the lobby. ABC store located right next to the elevator was very convenient. Hotel is directly across the street from the beach, although the beach is extremely crowded. Surprisingly, no room service (quite unusual for 4-5 star property). Never received new glasses from housekeeping despite setting used ones out. Within walking distance of more restaurants than one could possibly eat at in five days. Pool area was nice although the pool itself looked a bit worn. All-in-all a solid choice if you want to be in the heart of Waikiki and aren't focused on a leisurely beach vacation.

I went to Waikiki to destress and get away for a few days. The staff at the hotel were totally unhelpful and added stress to my vacation. The checkin process may as well have been a machine/computer. On check out I had issues with my bill that the reception staff were totally unwilling to help with. I was also never informed that there was no room service even after asking.

This is a beautiful hotel. Yes It is across the street from the ocean but well worth it. My wife and I me the pool guy Jones and he was the nicest person. He understands customer service and went out of his way to make my wife and I feel welcome. we will definitely return to the hotel because of him. This hotel is a hidden treasure in Waikiki.

Sorry about the length of this review, so much to cover... We chose the Alohilani after looking at the reviews for almost every hotel in Waikiki over and over (like you are probably doing right now). Every hotel, to include the Alohilani, had some really bad reviews that worried me but the location is why we finally decided on booking with them and I just hoped the rest would be ok. We've been here for 4 days now and I've had the chance to see some of the other hotels as we walk around and shop so I'm 100% positive we chose the right hotel! Let's start with the location: the Alohilani is across the street from the beach where you can book surfing/paddle board lessons right there, a 5 minute walk to the Zoo, a 30-40 minute walk to Diamond Head crater and 2 minutes from every kind of restaurant you can hope for (from low priced Subway/McDonalds to mid priced sandwich shops to higher priced everything else) basically this is an absolutely perfect area. Now I'll tell you about the hotel itself: it's beautiful and my room is amazing. It has an oversized king bed, huge tv, nice dresser and a comfy loveseat that I can look at the ocean from if I don't want to be on the small but big enough for us balcony. Though you may not care... it has a heated toilet seat in the bathroom... I didn't care until I used it and now I've googled how to install one at my house. It also has a bidet that I'm not sophisticated enough to try. I read reviews on the small bathroom and yes it's smaller but how much room do you need in a hotel bathroom?!? I'm on the 17 floor and the water pressure couldn't be better for the shower. I also read reviews on how horrible the elevators are so I'll talk about that. Like other reviews said, there are only 3 elevators so I'll talk about my longest wait time: I waited just under 1 minute once I hit the button (yes, I timed it because of the other reviews) and it stopped twice on the way down to pick up other people. It took me 2 1/2 minutes total to go down to the lobby... that was the longest wait so if that's horrible to you then it is what it is. The pool is smaller but it was never really packed, the hot tub is smaller but it was only packed a couple times. The Ocean is 100 feet away and was never packed. The live entertainment in the bar is really nice. The gym hasn't been too busy for us and there is a wide array of equipment (bikes, treadmills etc...). The front desk staff, specifically Landon, has been nothing but excellent and helped us out a lot. One last thing and then I'll shut up ;) Having an ABC store in the hotel is amazing. It's open 7am-midnight I think and the prices are waaaay lower than I would have thought they would be. They have snacks, booze, beer, food, soda, gifts, clothes... basically everything. Good luck choosing your hotel in Waikiki, I hope I've helped.

Lovely quite new hotel with good facilities, nice fittings and a couple of well-rated eateries. But the noise is too much. Can expect it from the 5th level pool and recreation area but starting at 6am with resort-wide Hawaiin music too early and is not enjoyable especially when fresh off a long flight. Handy location by Waikiki beach and all activities.

My husband and I stayed at Alo'Hilani resort for three days, four nights and all I can say is WOW. A stunning resort and CLEAN! Everyone was friendly and welcoming which made the stay so relaxing! We booked a cabana on the pool deck which was absolutely beautiful. Nikki and Rachel were so helpful, they attended to our every need! Their service really shined through, me and my husband felt like VIP! We will definitely be staying here again next year! Cannot wait!!

Nice hotel, with helpful staff and room service, and good public spaces. The infinity pool looks great with lot of people sitting around it last two days, but not many people actually using it as the water is totally cold.

Impressed by the decor and style of the lobby and furnishings. Fantastic location! The housekeeping and Bell staff were awesome and room spotless. The rest of it stunk. The front desk and guest service staff were useless and very stuck up. Not accommodating at all. There is also no room service at the hotel which we found odd for this class of hotel. Not great options for eating. Only one expensive breakfast buffet, 2 Asian restraunts, and 2 bars. Not even a coffee stand with quick bites. ,he resort fee everyone seems to charge...well this hotel had no business mainly bc it's not a huge resort. Pool was very small on 5th floor and there is a gym...but both of these should be standard and inclusive. Nothing EXTRA or amenities to warrant a daily resort fee. We stay at alot of hotels and this is not up to the class and service they claim to offer.

We came in from a 6 day Airbnb condo stay which was more expensive and problematic. From the moment we arrived we were impressed. The staff was very accommodating, and helpful. We knew the building was recently renovated but they absolutely hit a homerun. Our room was spacious and always impeccably clean. We had a balcony, and could hear the ocean at night. The headed salt water pool was really nice, though there was several youngs kids to navigate through. When we headed for the edge pool we quickly realized it was not heated, but the huge jacuzzi easily made up for it. There was even a batting cage and tennis courts on the 9th floor roof. The Japanese restaurant was reasonably priced yet very high class.Walk through the lobby and out the side door and you are looking at the beach.Wow, we can't wait to go back!

A celebration for the mural artists was held here as a grand finale. They did it up right with 2 bands that played everything from the Eagles to traditional Hawaiin music. Beautiful setting, comfy soft seating, spectacular view. Mikki, their pool attendant did an impromptu hula dance in her uniform. Even in shorts, she was so graceful and elegant as she danced. Should make her a regular feature!

We stayed in room 1752 and I have to say Annie our housekeeping made it a great experience for us.She was a really big help and answered to all of our needs.We plan on coming back and hope she’s still there.I didn’t get the pool staffs name but he was also nice well they were all great.My type of customer service.You all made us feel so welcomed and mathea thank you as well for checking up on us through text!THANK YOU ALL WE WILL SURE BE BACK!!!Winnie&Glenn Miyose

Overall, everyone here was exceptional. Front desk seemed overwhelmed upon arrival, but it was probably because of the conference held there. The pool staff was AMAZING! Jones and Mikki were so sweet and really took time to make us feel welcome. They catered to us and we really felt cared for (esp our one year old). We will definitely come back and stay here when we return. Worth every penny.

We went to this hotel for our honeymoon never had gone to Hawaii before. Hotel atmosphere was great, pool service, view and food was great. The rooms themselves could have been improved upon slightly but they were kept clean daily. Valet service very helpful as well as they recommend great spots to us many times per day! Breakfast buffet slightly overpriced but definitely had a wide variety of foods.

It’s newly renovated and that alone makes it a standout on Waikiki. I’ve stayed in seven other properties and most haven’t seen capital improvements since the late 90s. Here the rooms are standard size and unremarkable but they are clean and new, decor is updated, and beds are comfortable. Location is good, service is fine. Would definitely return here over the Hilton, Outrigger, Westin, or Marriott.
user_name:
SafariKBFamily
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Best hotel in Waikiki. Best service, best stuff. Everyone is willing to help. Hotel rooms are modern, stylish clean. Definitely come again. Especially like the two sides window, very good for view the ocean and dimond head in the morning.
user_name:
Passport29796676752
New York City, New York

review_body: We loved our stay at this beautiful hotel. Super clean rooms with a beautiful view of Diamond Head. The saltwater pool was so relaxing and Nikki and her Crew made sure you had everything you needed. Would definitely stay here again and my son got to meet Chef Morimoto and eat at his restaurant which was delish!!

Although Honolulu and Waikiki beach are very busy, our stay at Alohilani was very relaxing, with the updated rooms and facilities being a treat! The rooms are very comfortable, although our bathroom was on the small side and the toilets can be loud when flushing (we could hear other rooms flushing around us too). The pool area and bar there were fantastic to go and relax and the bar staff were very friendly and also gave great advice on things to do on the island. The front desk/reception were always very kind and helpful also. The GIANT aquarium is something to behold, and the food at the Swell bar at the pools is very good! We did the buffet breakfast also and there is a great range of options, the omelletes were great and the pastries very good too!

the Alohilani Resort is a great place to stay in Waikiki, we loved how close it was to the beach and also the position being closer to the park end which meant it felt a little less crowded and busy. We were able to walk to and from Diamond head which was fantastic and the beach across the road was lovely for swimming. The room was very nice with a great view of the ocean and mountains, the staff were all very helpful and friendly. It was our wedding anniversary and we were surprised with a fresh fruit platter and bottle of champagne which really made our stay. We definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

Let’s start with the good things. It’s in a great location, close to the beach and shops. It’s clean and recently updated with a fresh and modern vibe. The aquarium in the lobby is definitely a nice touch. The concierge was very helpful and the pool area was very relaxing (despite being a wind tunnel). Now the not so great. We booked a beach view room and when we got there we were informed that the room was located on the side of the building. This meant that we had to crane our necks over the balcony to see the beach. Apparently, we needed to upgrade to a frontal beach room which would give us a full ocean view. In other words they overcharge for a partial ocean view room. There is also no elevator security (you don’t need to swipe you room key to access your floor). This is concerning as there is entry to the hotel from an ABC store located on the main strip; across the road from which, there is a congregation of homeless people looking for shelter in the evening. Perhaps the most disappointing part of the stay however, was that I left a bag of shopping behind and when I called to see if it had been handed in, they said nothing was found. So either someone on staff has treated themselves to a dress and hand cream, or unobservant employee thrown away $100 worth of shopping. Either way, not impressed. Overall, it was a pleasant hotel, clean and modern, but would probably stay elsewhere next time and get more value for my dollar.

We visited the restaurent Morimoto at this newly renovated hotel . We arrived early , so we have a chance to explore the hotel . The lobby was spectacular , grand , spacious front desk area .The most impressive is the bar area , where we had a drink. Modern , hip hop with an oversized Aquarium with a displayed of all kind of tropical fish. Remind me of the Mission Impossible movie of the restaurant that Tom Cruise blowed up the Fish tank ! We also visit the pool area,new and nice , crowded lots of kids . We asked to see a room , but was politely told the hotel was full and cannot show us . We may give a try in future. The location is convenient , right on Waikik

I haven’t even finished my holiday here, but I am just so impressed with this hotel. It’s gorgeous from the lobby to the room. Massive fish tank at the bar is delightful. Pool area is to die for. It’s huge and a perfect setting with an infinity pool. The staff are great too. I just love that I am in a 5 star hotel, with 5 star service and the staff are so friendly and relaxed. No pretense here, no suits behind the bar or at the bell desk or anywhere, but still very professional. LOVE IT! My beachfront room is beautiful and the bed is comfy and the room is clean, it’s just a very small bathroom, but hey I’m only in there for a shower, and it’s still a big enough and comfy shower, so it’s my only gripe but a very minor one. Highly recommend and I’ll be checking this place out again when I return to Waikiki.Hint: I also booked the beachfront room with a fantastic deal through Hawaiian Airlines, so worth checking it out for the best deal I’ve ever had. Thank you Alohilani for a wonderful stay so far!

The hotel, rooms, pool, and restaurants are all incredible. However, there were only 4 elevators to service the 39-floor main tower. We had to consistently wait over 5 minutes every time we wanted to get an elevator to/from our room. Also, we were mislead by a concierge to stop by for a "welcome package" which turned out to be a sales pitch for timeshares at the Modern Honolulu (the sister hotel). I didn't appreciate the subterfuge in that interaction.

This review speaks mostly to the quality of the guest rooms. The lobby and amenities were all up to par, beautiful aquarium and a nice pool and deck. The room felt like something I would expect from an “express” style motel or hotel. The duvet cover did not close shut, so after sleeping the actual comforter was exposed by morning, which is gross as this is the comforter others sleep with. The shower was tiny, didn’t have a door and had just one mini little corner shelf to use to try to balance toiletries and razor, didn’t work. After our first day, housekeeping came but left our dirty beverage glasses in the room which was odd. No robe or slippers available. Only trash can in the room was a little one by the toilet. $35/day resort fee which felt high, given the quality.

so glad we booked this hotel! the location is perfect as it is one block off the "main strip" but right next to the ocean and Kuhio beach park. it was nice being close to the action but 1 block away for reduced noise and chaos. our room was freshly updated with partial ocean view on a high floor. we had a great lanai balcony to overlook the city / water which we enjoyed in the morning for coffee and night time for sunset drink. the bed was very comfortable with pillow top, and the pillows were comfortable with fresh linens. the room had a mini fridge with ample space to house drinks/snacks. I also appreciated the daily tea and coffee with in room keurig machine, as well as the reusable water bottles given to us at check in. the pool area was nice and well maintained. we did not use the pool much but the service and poolside staff were outstanding. the lobby is grand with a nice bar inside with fish tank. the decor is well done, tasteful, elegant. the only "snafu" we had the entire time was a credit that was supposed to be on our room for food/beverage which was accidentally charged instead of placed as a credit. at the of our dinner at morimoto's restaurant (attached to hotel) it was pretty embarrassing that I had to leave the table to go to concierge and call 3 times to figure out the credit. finally a manager added the room credit as well as an additional $25 for our trouble. this was a nice touch and all was made well.

Yikes...where to start. The Alohilani Resort bills itself as a 5 star property but it is anything but. What you see in photos does not represent the actual product once you are checked in. Some highlights and (mostly) low-lights from our stay: PRO: Happy Hours at both bars. Prices still a little high, but it's Waikiki. It is what it is.CON: The pool is abso-effing-ly freezing. During the day. With the sun up. The wind cuts through the two towers like a valley, creating a chilling wind tunnel that makes the pool deck unenjoyable. PRO: Sipping a craft cocktail or tropical drink in the jacuzzi or infinity pool watching the Hawaiian sunsetCON: The infinity pool is FREEZING despite the fact that it's supposedly heated. Maybe if I was in Antarctica the pool would feel warm, but not in Hawaii. As others have mentioned, the jacuzzi is SWARMED with kids, despite posted signage. There is absolutely NO regulation or enforcement. The staff advised us that security has been told but they do ABSOLUTELY NOTHING, so be warned. If you don't mind kids in diapers splashing pee and poop infested water into your drink, this is the place for you. PRO: Centrally located and right across the beachCON: So is pretty much every hotel in Waikiki, and most others don't overcharge you for a subpar product. PRO: Lots of dining options on property CONS: All of them are overpriced and not very good. Even Morimoto's two restaurants are underwhelming. You are better off walking a little ways from the hotel as there are much, much, better dining options (i.e. Tiki's, Arancino, Maui Brewing Co, Cheesecake Factory--yes, even Cheesecake Factory!)CON: Bathrooms are TINY. Like really tiny!

Just a block from Waikiki Beach, this property is so very welcoming. From valet, to the divine lobby scent, friendly registration and such very comfortable rooms. Very clean, contemporary design with great service. I look forward to my return-but this time for a vacation!

My partner and I had four great nights here and were well looked after by the staff, especially the Pool Experience Manager, Nikki who was awesome with her bubbly persona and making sure we were taken care of and having a great time. Beautiful hotel, amazing pool area and views of the ocean. I especially liked the extra little attention to detail and surprises. Sun glass cleaning, cold face towels, cool refreshing facial sprays, hula and lei lessons all contributed to the experience. There is a gym and batting cage available also. We are looking forward to coming back.

My sister and I are currently on vacation at Alohilani Resort in Waikiki & the rooftop pool is exceptional! It is quiet and the views to the beach are superb! We have had the best service by a staff member by the name of Jones. He is so welcoming and friendly and he also come around this afternoon and cleaned everyone’s sunglasses. He ensures we are ok and goes above and beyond to make us feel comfortable. He is a breath of fresh air and makes us want to keep coming back to the pool! A very big thank you to Jones for your exceptional service!

Place was amazing. Straight across from Waikiki Beach. Morimoto’s restaurant also a plus in the hotel grounds. Walking distance to everything you need to see and do withing Waikiki area. Rooms were very comforatble and spacious. Clean, looks like it is newly renovated. Aquarium by the bar a plus. Recommended hotel when visiting Honolulu.

This hotel was really great. Spotless, amazing location, and extremely nice employees. Our room was spotless, had a really cool bathroom (with heated toilet seats) and a great lanai. We had a partial ocean view, which was fine because we were only there for 2 nights. My favorite thing about this hotel is the pool area. There are tons of seats and it looks very chic. The pool is on the smaller size, which can feel a bit cramped if there are lots of kids there. I took the sunset yoga class on Tuesday night, which was lovely... However the front desk staff told me it was at the gym, so I accidentally walked into an ongoing workout class. I checked with the gym staff and they directed me to the tennis courts, where the yoga class would actually take place.I'm not sure if I'd return to Oahu again, but if I do, I'd definitely return to this hotel. I'd also recommend it to anyone traveling to Oahu looking for a chic, comfortable hotel.

There were so many hotels to choose from and I wasn't quite sure what I was looking for - I found this gem and couldn't be more pleased! We had an ocean front room with a spectacular view of Waikiki - literally 60 steps from the beach. The restaurants were exceptional as was the service. We ate at the swell bar (pool side) and the restaurant just off of the lobby. Ordered fish tacos, cheese board, crab cakes, etc...and we ate at their Japanese Restuarant - which was also exceptional. This hotel has it all going on!! The room was beautiful! Newly updated, comfortable bed and quiet. Would certainly stay again.

We always stay at another resort in Waikiki but thought we would give this place a go after the recent renovations. View is amazing, sunsets cocktails pool and chill. The area around the pool is great all the staff are friendly. The bathrooms are too small, no robes in rooms. Please take the kids with nappies/diapers out of the spa!! Are you kidding me I am not happy to sit in a spa with your baby like, could management please address this as it is already your policy.

This review is specifically for Ami S. who went above and beyond the call of duty to help me! I had submitted some paperwork for some business back home before I came to HI and thought everything was fine. I got a message about the paperwork once I was already on vacation and had to re-fax some things. The work station in the hotel's lobby had a printer that wasn't working. She tried to troubleshoot it for me and when it couldn't be immediately fixed, she took it upon herself to work things out from her office. She faxed the paperwork for me and left me copies of it with the confirmation in my hotel room later that same day! She was prompt, detail oriented, and an absolute pleasure to work with and this made my experience at this hotel that much greater!!!

My girlfriend and I we're on vacation for her birthday. We stood at this hotel which was amazing but what made this hotel one of the best hotels i have ever stood at was one person Nikki The Pool Experience Manager. I rented the Cabana from Nikki for Saturday night and when I told Nikki that it was for my girlfriend's birthday she went above and beyond I'm talking chocolate covered strawberries, a birthday cake and she song Happy birthday as well. She checked on us to make sure we had everything we need and after she left she had her assistant Amanda make sure as well. So THANK YOU Nikki for make our stay worth wild. Will be definitely be booking another stay here.

My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in January for our honeymoon. We had incredible service from the front desk as well as the valet service. We were surprised to see that they did not have room service nor that the main pool was heating, and there was so many people flocking to the hot tub because of this it made the pool area a little hard to enjoy. We did a couples massage and everyone at the Island Spa was great. Overall 4 stars, and probably would stay there again due to the location and price, room cleanliness and attentiveness of the staff.

We stayed in the recently refurbished Alohilani, the pool and spa area was lovely but on a windy day watch out!!! The pool is gorgeous looking over to the beach but a bit cold for my liking so I used the spa. Drinks at the bar are priced too high even at happy hour. The rooms are not 5 star but clean and modernised and bathroom small but we managed fine. Location is good an easy walk to the main strip, we walked to Ali Moana shopping centre a few times and also walked to Diamond Head and back a nice 12km. We enjoyed our stay here.

This hotel recently opened as a top-to-bottom renovation of an older original hotel. It's too bad they didn't finish the job in the rooms and neglected to think about security.First, the rooms have incredibly tiny bathrooms. The toilet and shower are in a separate room so small you almost have to climb over the toilet to get in because the door opens into the room in front of the toilet. Outside there is a tiny vanity with a single sink.The door to the hallway might have been replaced in the renovation, but it didn't fit properly--there was a significant gap all around it judging by the light coming through. Noise from people in the hallway came right through the door.The door to the adjoining room was obviously original judging by the door hardware, and it had zero soundproofing qualities. The people next door were clearly audible speaking at a normal conversational volume. When they laughed and played music they might as well have been in the same room with us.In terms of security, after we checked in, we discovered that the door to the adjoining room on our side was unlocked. That is a major fail on the part of housekeeping.Even worse, the ground floor elevator lobby has a door leading directly to the street, and this door was unlocked most of the time. The elevators don't require key card validation to operate so anyone could walk in from the street and go to any floor (including the pool) without passing any hotel staff or requiring a guest key card.Now that is a very serious security fail!After we had been there for a week, someone (presumably a member of the hotel staff) entered our room while we were out and removed the hair dryer. WTF. We spoke to the security manager about this, but we realized he wasn't going to do anything when he didn't take down any details such as our room number or name. It was just like "whatever."This hotel brags about it's lobby with a huge wall-to-wall fish tank, but what a sparse and uninviting space. We didn't feel like sitting in the lobby bar even once it was so boring and cold..

A lot of money spent on a refurb; on arrival room was not ready but no problems we were able to check the luggage in and go shopping, the rooms are nicely appointed the bathroom extremely small but I guess you dont live in the bathroom. The view was nothing short of magnificent totally unobstructed, we did have to remind housekeeping twice that our room hadnt been done at 3pm.Hallways are quite noisy.Felt it was a security issue that anyone could come in off the street and access any level of the hotel including the pool deckStaff were lovely, had an issue with one concierge staff member was utter laziness but that was addressed with their reception staff Needed some extra firm pillows = they did my neck in

This resort/ hotel is very nice, warm n classy. Right across from Waikiki Beach. In the center of everything. Adjacent to ABC store for anything you might need. There are 2 towers to choose. Price ranges on tower you stay in. We stayed in the side facing Diamond head. Great views. I personally like highest floor, away from elevators. There is a Lanai for breakfast n views. Beautiful views. Has workout room, tv, WiFi, laundry facility, coffee maker n frig in room. Buffet available and continental breakfast at bar with good food/choices. Huge indoor aquarium for viewing. Pool with cabanas available n bar outdoors too. Family friendly. Walking distance to different restaurants, mini mall. Walking distance to park, diamond head. I really enjoyed myself. The staff was friendly n courteous. There is an on sight Pleasant holidays staff to help you. A must try.

Can't say this was a good experience from a "resort" perspective. Average at best. The location is great right in the middle of Waikiki, however the resort itself needs to up its game.Firstly, front desk staff are not the came across a bit arrogant. Especially, when asking for assistance with issues.Our biggest issue was when the room next door to us was clearly smoking in their room. The rooms have the old-school connecting doors and the smoke (which was something other than cigarettes!) was coming into our room. We advised the front desk to be told they would notify security. Upon returning to our room later, it was even worse so clearly nothing had been done. We again advised the front desk and requested a room change if they weren't going to address the issue. The initial options the front desk gave us were to move to a room that would not be as nice. Advising them this was not going to be acceptable, it was a less than impressive response almost like a "nothing we can do to help you" one. After having to push the issue we were eventually given a new room that was acceptable. The room was not ready yet so we were advised they would monitor the progress and contact us when the room was ready. Upon the daily check-in time (3pm) when rooms should be ready we had not heard anything so went back to the front desk to check. Zero follow up had been made and we had to request them to organize the room for us - almost like having to check in all over again.Second issue was on checkout we were double charged for the breakfast package every day! We travel a lot all over the world and almost never get incorrect invoices on checkout. To be double charged something from our original booking - not even an additional change during our stay is very poor. Check your invoices on check-out.Other comments:The pool is not very impressive. Zero coverage such as umbrellas/shelter/shade unless you pay their ridiculously expensive rates for the cabanas.The rooms, while "renovated" are still quite old fashioned/dated. You can also clearly hear toilets flushing from neighboring rooms.As there are balconies, expect to have smoke from people smoking blow into your room even though rooms are non-smoking.Breakfast selection is limited. Very little vegetable options apart from salad leaves. If you like vegetables for breakfast and not just eggs, meat and fruit, you may struggle.On the plus, and a positive, the gym is very good for a hotel/resort gym. New equipment and good range if you have a gym routine you need to keep going while away, the gym will have everything you need.If you are looking for a Waikiki/Honolulu holiday, the accommodation is OK. However, if you are looking for a "resort" experience then I can't say this hit the mark for us.

Modern, clean and sleek design. The oceanarium was a lovely touch. We love the infinity pool overlooking the beach and city. Great place to relax and a stones throw away from the beach. Various activities were provided such as lei making and hula dancing.

We booked this place for long weekend birthday, I read this place was remodel and the pictures on the website was very attractive, very good location, beautiful view, nice stuff, fair price. highly recommend.we defiantly be back again

At first, I did not like the location of the room too much, so I called on the phone and made another room.They have a good view and I like them for 5 days.Citibook was really cool.Thank you good service

Had an enjoyable stay at this resort! Gorgeous property. New, Modern, Hip, Trendy spot. Great couples traveler spot! Big thank you and Aloha to Eddie the Bell Sergeant ! Very kind, genuine young man. He spent a good 10 minutes to give useful information in regards to shuttles provided, things to do, told us which concierge and valets to see to cater to our needs. I asked him about the resort amenities fee which I could not figure out what that is but he gave us detailed information on how to make use of what is provided. Heads up it’s $45 a night!! Overall great experience and what a well-connected man he is! Service is about going above and beyond their job and this guy is definitely an embodiment of it! Shoutout to Jenny at Swell pool for being prompt, and attentive! Great service!

Checkin was horrible. Lady argued with us on everything. For example, our written reservation confirmation from the hotel promised us free welcome drinks. She was adamant she couldn't give us the drink tickets. And yet other guests got their tickets no problem. We had to ask her how to get to our room, where the elevators were, where the pool was, etc. All basic information that should automatically be provided to a first time guest. On the other hand, checkout lady (Renee I think) could not have been nicer. Eagerly and pleasantly helped us with baggage check, parking, etc. And gave us a big, sweet hug. Great lady!

we had a wonderful time at the 'A lohilani Resort. It was convenient for the beach, staff were helpful, cheerful and willing to help. We would recommend the resort in the future. concierge was exceptionally helpful. many activities to do during the day if you did not wish to go out of the hotel

We were guests at your resort January fourteenth thru January seventeenth 2019.The facility is a beautiful hotel, well kept and very clean. we have one comment for improvement which is to install holding bars in the shower stall which would be a good safety enhancement.We are already thinking about another visit when we can.Mahalo and aloha, Allene and Bob Hill.

Thank you to the amazing team at the Alohilana Resort who made my birthday celebrations just fabulous! Jane on the reception desk ensured a smooth checkin and the rest of the hotel staff continued on with exceptional customer service during our stay. Beautiful resort - can't wait to visit again with my family - WELL DONE!!

This hotel is newly renovated and it has been done very stylishly. It is modern, clean, chic and comfortable. It provides great bathroom products, a beautiful pool area, gym, spa, bars, everything you could ask for in a luxury hotel. The staff were efficient but overall I found this hotel soulless, without character and the staff lacking personality. It is a very good hotel but needs A more personal touch. Having said that I do think this will be addressed because I do get the feeling they want this to be the best hotel.

The best staff I have ever experienced at a hotel as well as it being a brand new renovation. The staff were amazingly accommodating. The new renovation features a spectacular aquarium within the lobby bar, and the rooms are external hard modern. You will not be disappointed.

We had high hopes for this resort given the reviews and prices. The entrance is quite spectacular and you know you are in Hawaii. The check In staff are excellent; efficient and friendly. I really don't know if we were in a renovated room but it was quite dated and uninspiring. The worst part of the room is the bathroom. It is tiny!!! Don't have any expectations of a nice spacious bathroom. I'm not sure if it was our timing, but we happened to be there whilst there was a school group. This made it almost impossible to get into the lifts at peak times and there always seemed to be a crowd of teens in the lobby. Not what we expected. The pool area is great. No problems getting a lounge and the atmostphere was great. The Resort is set back from the beach so the view isn't that great from the pool.The staff are attentive and friendly. When we go back to Waikiki we won't stay here as it doesn't match our expectations of a good resort.

Chic, fresh, bright and modern in every way. Comfortable beds. Nice bath products. Pool is nice and views are decent even though not right on beach. A REALLY GOOD AFFORDABLE BOUTIQUE like hotel steps from the beach baby!
user_name:
Seaside35877043076
New York City, New York

review_body: We recommend the Alohilani Resort 1000%. Location. Staff. Aloha spirit and beauty. Gym. Pools. Convenience. Alohilani hits on all cylinders. Recently renovated and the architecture is pleasing. Great value. We enjoy the Diamondhead side. Worth the small extra price.From the moment you arrive, the staff is attentive to your every need. The Lobby aquarium is beautiful. Infinity pool, lap pool, cabanas, fire pits and lounge areas are all so very lovely.

Great location within across from wakikki beach, clean rooms, nice pool. Updated rooms with small bathroom. My family of 4 enjoyed our first time here but probably would not return as we were affected by their affiliation with “Diamond Resorts” which caused us to have a terrible sales presentation experience that we would not forget. In writing this review we are sincerely hoping Alohilani will not direct customers to have to go through such a terrible experience during a vacation stay .

Our recent stay was very pleasant and the hotel has many pluses, including nice views of ocean and beach, clean and functional rooms, a lovely pool area, a good Asian noodle restaurant, and an ABC convenience store. Yet, certain aspects should be looked at by Management for improvement: The pool spa was full of little kids making it unattractive, the concierge desk was into selling high priced excursions, even time shares!, there was no room service, and no one would even know how to get food ordered for the room. Additionally there are no materials in the room outlining services, menus, etc. You basically have to find things on your own. These are things that can be improved if there is interest to do so.Overall our stay was memorable in a positive way and would return to hopefully have an even better experience.

Stayed 2 nights Dec 27-29 2019.Booked an Ocean View room and it was exactly as pictured when making the booking. It offered a fabulous view of the beach and town. The room was well appointed and very comfortable. The décor was attractive and modern with fridge and coffee maker. There were 3 pools, one on a lower level for mainly kids, the infinity pool and a large hot pool. The temperature of the infinity pool was a little cool for my liking so it was great to have the option of the hot pool as an alternative.The décor is very cool throughout all aspects of the hotel. The aquarium in the entrance lounge is enormous. The seating is comfortable and modern. We would have liked to have spent some time in the bar on the pool deck with the comfortable seating and fire pits. However, it decided to rain so instead we went to Morimoto for dinner. The location of the hotel is excellent. The main shopping and restaurants are just a casual stroll away. Across the road is the beach. It was very busy when we ventured over so we didn’t spend too long there, preferring to lounge back in the comfort of the pool deck. Service throughout the hotel was excellent, particularly around the pool. Plenty of towels. There were lots of activities you can participate in, including ukulele lessons and movies under the stars.Overall this is a great choice for a modern yet comfortable stay in a central location in Honolulu. Will definitely be back.

Booked a luxury escapes 8 night stay here - beautifully renovated hotel. Rooms (we had premier ocean front rooms) were lovely and amazing views. The kids (3 teenagers) had the double room which was a good size and our king was also a good size. The bathroom in the king room was v small and really only one person could fit at a time. It is a slight negative but we didn't come here to spend time in the bathroom. We could smell smoke through our air-con a few nights in a row. I did mention it to reception and they sent maintenance straight up to change the filters of the air con. Not sure that was the problem - I think it may have been another guest smoking on the non smoking floor. You do hear noise from the early morning leaf blowers down below which is so annoying but not the hotels fault and I put up with it for the view. Pool area is nice and a good alternative when coming from the beach - if a little windy at times.Slight negatives- leaf blower 7am-8am most mornings (not directly the fault of the hotel but maybe the glass doors are not sound proof enough- very hard to get the phone enquires answered - for the smoke I had to go downstairs and we ended up taking our bags down ourselves on checkout as I rang out 3 times when trying to get the bellman- gym not signposted well and to me is in a strange spot overlooking the top of the fish tank - no natural light at all.- our breakfast was a breakfast box which contained the same ingredients every day for 8 days but I suggest this is more a luxury escapes issuePositives- amazing views from premier ocean front rooms- well set out and sized rooms (apart from bathroom size in King)- service was excellent at reception and the O bar and pool bar- location fantastic! Convenience (Beach, ABC store, just one step from the madness of the big hotels but one step away, morimotos fantastic)Overall would definitely recommend and we would stay here again.

This Resort even smells amazing! The staff is wonderful (especially Renee) We spent 9 nights here, and you really don’t need a rental car if you’re staying here and enjoy all that Waikiki has to offer.We spent lots of time at the pools and even enjoyed two Disney movies under the stars poolside on Sunday nights!The Breakfast Buffett offers something for everyone, and the fresh fruit is to die for.Ask the front desk for a boogie board and they’ll likely be able to let you borrow one for the day. Take pool towels to the beach for day use and exchange them in the evening.Enjoy a drink and snack at the bar while taking in the serenity of their 280,000 gallon oceanarium!We didn’t want to leave!

Loved this resort. The staff were so helpful and friendly from the check in staff, to anyone you bumped into in the elevator etc. They offer some great resort activities for no extra charge and the resort itself is pretty amazing. Great infinity pool that has water views of the beach. Food was reasonably priced and tasty. The foyer of this hotel is just amazing! Loved it and want to go back!

My husband and I recently stayed for 4 nights in a Premier Ocean Front Room(1621).Do yourself a favour and book this hotel. Recently renovated the hotel directly opposite the Kuhio Beach Park just down from Dukes Statue towards Diamond Head provides excellent accommodation, location and service. Our hotel room looked exactly like the photo on the website, where we sat and watched the surfers morning and night and of course the amazing sunsets. The beds were like sleeping on clouds with pillows to match. We even slept with the doors opened all night and found there was no street noise just the sound of crashing waves. Our only comment about the room is the size of the bathroom. Whilst extremely well appointed with ample vanity space and great shower there is little floor space. The pool area( 2 pools one for children and a wet edge pool for adults and children over 12) was sensational . A great place also to watch the sunset. My only comment here was the large presence of children under 12 in the adult wet edge pool. This should be the parents responsibility to adhere to the pool and hotel rules and use the other pool provided for children under 12 and to consider other guests. The pool attendant was as vigilant as she could be and explained it was something the hotel was working on to address. Pool Bar service was efficient and friendly. They also have another level to the pool area with cabanas, table, chairs lounges fire pit. The hotel is within walking distance of all the favourite food places in Waikiki and there is an ABC store in in the lobby at the front of the hotel . Surfboards etc can be hired a block away at reasonable prices ( cheaper than the beach). A dream stay from check in to check out, highly recommend Alohilani.

I only arrived today and already I’m in love. The lobby has a fresh welcoming feel with a very cool aquarium situated in the bar. The rooms are clean and fresh, a nice breeze enters the room with the balcony door open. The pool and bar are a great place to relax. The fitness centre had all the equipment I needed.

We were in Hawaii for over two weeks and spent our last couple of nights at the Alohilani. We booked a partial ocean view and had a decent ocean view from the balcony. The hotel is newly refurbished so everything is new and clean. The location is great, right in the heart of Waikiki. It has two awesome restaurants on-site with lots of others close by along with an ABC store. Nice pool area and bar along with a very cool aquarium in the lobby. I would say it is a very solid 4 star, the downside is the the rooms are fairly small and so are the bathrooms. That being said we thought the service was excellent and beds were very comfy. Yes, we would stay at this hotel again.

I made my reservation for my honeymoon here. Due to an American Airlines delay we got in the next day. I of course called and they said no problem. I told them my flight would arrive early and if we could please have an early check in. They said yes. Upon arrival the room was not ready. They said it was being expedited and took my cell and said they’d text us right away. 2 1/2 hours later I got a text. They brought us to the room. It was not the room we reserved or where promised. It overlooked the parking lot instead of the ocean. When I asked they told me “our” room was occupied. They gave us an inferior room with no alternative. We were stuck so we had to make the best of it. Called down for a seat at breakfast the next day after checking hours for buffet and was told 10:30 it wrapped up. Went down at 10:10 and it was closed. Lame. That afternoon had a reservation for a massage. Arrived 10 min early and was told they were running a half hour behind. Canceled it. Management was nice however clearly overwhelmed with other guests. Pool was nice however overrun with kids splashing everywhere. Had the hotel been $300 a night i would probably have expected lesser service however at $900 a night you expect an experience. Here we had a bad one.

Sorry grammar and spelling....just getting it all out as it comes to mind.Staff were friendly with the exception of our check in lady (she didn’t give us a run down on anything about the hotel or charges and allowances....said we didn’t have breakfast included but we found on our return from holiday that we did as well as credit to our account which were not applied).The interconnecting rooms only allowed for a king bed per room not a king and two double beds in other room. They provided a rollaway bed free of charge because of the inconvenience.Note that suites do have interconnecting rooms available albeit only a small number.The rooms themselves are smaller than Moana but given the amount of time spent in them and the interconnecting room config, it didn’t matter. The shower and toilet were in one room and sooooooo tiny. You had to step in the shower to close the door before you could go do the toilet. Rooms were clean and modern. Perhaps not as luxurious as depicted on the web, however still perfect for us. Ceiling height is quite low which prob adds to the small feel. There is a fridge, but no food or drinks stocked. No room service either. Rooms were serviced every day, however I don’t believe sheets were changed at all during our stay. View was great. Had visual of beach as well as diamond headToilet flush noisy and you could hear other apartments flushing toilet.Room doors not sealed well so you can hear lots going on in the corridor (didn’t bother me as we were at end of hall so not much happening, but might be more loud for those near lifts).We viewed a suite when we were there are they are sooooo much bigger. Bathroom is huge and rooms are much bigger. They had various activities during the day such as lei making and yoga, and kids movie by the pool once a week…although the daily activities didn’t change, so once you have done it, there is nothing much else to try.Gym was amazing with plenty of machines and weights, but it is on a level that doesn’t have any windows so a bit crappy with the outlook. Nonetheless, we attended every day. I didn’t try the breakfast buffet as it was expensive and as previously advised, we were told it was not included. Pool bar staff were great. Pool area and facilities were amazing. It is spacious, clean and comfortable. The sunset views from infinity pool was amazing. Pool was cold.Drinks and food at pool area were not cheap but the exchange rate didn’t help. They also tried to charge a fee for serving party of 6, but were welcoming and removed that charge as I noted we were two families.We unfortunately experienced a child drowning in the pool which was horrible and put a dampener on our holiday, however the staff were AMAZING. They stepped into action immediately with CPR and followed all necessary procedures. Following the incident they provided complimentary food and drinks due to the trauma. A let down was the charges they kept taking off our credit card without our authorisation. We gave our credit card on check in for bond, unaware that when we requested our food drinks etc within resort to be charged to our room, that they would take it immediately off our card. Normal practice is to pay at end of stay. Prob with them charging card was that we had credit card fees and a bad exchange rate. Upon realisation that this was occurring, we requested that the credit card be removed which it was. Great laundry facilities. Lots of washing machines and dryers.. clean and tidy There was no security with access to the hotel levels which was a little concerning as anyone off the street could enter. Great range of ages staying at the hotel. Location is perfect. Right across the beach and within walking distance of everything. Not sure if it fits the name of luxury hotel with the size of bathrooms and no fridge incidentals, bathrobes, slippers, room service etc, . In all, I would definitely recommend and return, however am much wiser on room sizes and also on charges to credit card.

Super Modern, clean, great location. We faced the water. The View is absolutely beautiful. Nice little balcony. Surfer watching, colors in the water, people watching and rainbows! Desk staff was friendly. My favorite touch was the orchid to pin in my hair daily. Easy walk to some fun restaurants, bars and waikiki attractions.

Newly renovated and modern decor. Convenient location. Would stay again. Morimoto and Momosan are downstairs. Easy walk to beach, international market, beach walk. Pool is very cold, just walk to the beach instead. ABC store located inside hotel. Pool deck is nice with cabanas. Swell bar closes early - maybe midnight.
This hotel was fantastic and conveniently located. The food in the bar café was excellent as well as the brunch on the second floor.The staff was courteous and friendly.I had a wonderful experience.

Had a great trip, beautiful views near everything walking distance to the beach. But what really made our trip was one of the most charismatic bartenders at the pool bar on the 5th floor Chad He went above and beyond to make sure we had a great time and a great drink or special if the day in front of us!

Wow. My boyfriend and I like to staycation when we get the chance so we have been to quite a few hotels. This one is personally on the top of my list. I have worked in the food/beverage/hospitality industry for quite awhile now and I am very impressed with Alohilani hotel. Every staff member was so very welcoming and accommodating. I made special arrangements weeks in advance to plan a couple surprises for my boyfriend’s birthday. Everything went perfect. Way above and beyond my expectations! The hotel is beautiful. I don’t even feel like I’m in Hawaii. I recommend the O bar for a cool view of fishes in a large aquarium. Great food and drinks as well. Again, everything was amazing. Mahalo Alohilani!! We will be back soon.

I chose this hotel from the pictures I saw online &, if honest my gut instinct & I most certainly was not disappointed. I arrived on December 21st for a 12 night stay. My room had the most amazing views of the ocean on one side & diamond head & some high rise properties which at night looked great lit up, on the other side. I was on the 20th floor & had an end room so had the best of all views. My room was bright & airy. Bed so comfortable & the shower was amazing. I had my own balcony where I could chill with cold juices after a long day being the tourist. had my own fridge as well which was a nice touch as I could stock it up with cold drinks & snacks. If I had one tiny little gripe it would be for a bigger fridge!! :-) Please please for my next visit :-)The reception area in the hotel is huge & so elegant. The bar on the ground level is nice & chilled to unwind & have a few snacks & the dining room itself is huge. I only had breakfast there as I was out most days & the choice was exceptional. Smoothies, all types of fruits. Croissants, cold meats &, as we say here in the UK a good old fashioned fry-up!! Crispy bacon, varieties of sausage, I particularly liked was the Portuguese sausage, scrambled egg & so on. If you fancied an omelette the chef would make one whilst you wait. So many choices & I must admit a made the trip each morn a couple of times for breakfast :) A good variey of Japanese foods as well as a fair few guests were from Japan or of Japanese origin.The staff in the dining area were ultra friendly & helpful. Indeed after a couple of days I was chatting to 1 or 2 as though I had known them an age. An amazing feature whilst eating (& also on the ground level bar) is a huge aquarium with all types of colourful fish happily going abut there day. Great to see. I did a day trip to Maui. A day trip to the Big Island. A day trip around Oahu & I have to say such a big big thank you, sorry Mahalo :-) to a diamond of a lady named Monika in the Concierge Dept. She organised my activities brilliantly & it is her I really have to thank for making my dram trip a reality & such fun. A thorough professional with a warm heart who, after roughly 7-8 months of emailing arranging my holiday I felt she was more like a friend. To the Alohilani Resort you have 1 hell of an employee there & I hope Management are aware of this. Dedicated. Professional. Great lady. I loved my visit to this hotel & Hawaii so much I aim to return within the next 12 months & will certainly be staying here again (costs permitting of course) Each staff member was friendly & answered any questions I had. Even the cleaning room people were great & I chatted to 1 or 2 of them also. No airs & graces from the staff. Treated you as you would like to be treated yourself, pleasantry & respectful & smiley. Thank you to each & every one for making my stay the most memorable. I must cut down on the Blue Hawaiians though. In that heat they were so cool & went down way too well!! haha. There is a walkway next to Reception which takes you through to a few shops & an ABC store which was ideal for day to day purchasing of cold drinks, foods etc... A lovely (Swell) pool area & nice seating to relax in the sun if that is your cup of tea as we say :-) Cabanas are located here which can be hired out. As I was out being the crazy English tourist most days I never got the chance to sample this area but will endeavour to do so on my next visit.

My family & I loved staying at the Alohilani resort - a very beautiful contemporary hotel. The lobby area is stunning & downstairs features a bar with a huge tropical fish tank. The pool area is bliss & the cocktails were amazing. The view from our room was spectacular. The location is across the road from the best swimming spot on Waikiki beach. The only disappointment we experienced were the breakfast boxes included in our package - the buffet breakfast should have been included. Also the air con was very cold so we had to sleep with the door open which was very noisy. I had a great experience at the spa - very good massage. All in all an enjoyable stay

The lobby is lovely , the rooms are just ok for the price . The rooms have been renovated but as soon as we stepped onto the carpet , we knew the rooms and building were older .Seemed to lack anything beyond ok for me .No extras , also very very noisey with all the delivery trucks , bottle pick ups etc .Did not have the best sleep .Location is good , Matsumoto bistro was very good .Would look for another spot for sure next time !

The customer service at Alohilani is really good! The rooms are spacious and clean! Mathea at the front desk made my hotel experience great! I will be staying here when I come back to Hawaii for sure.

Aloha! Stayed a couple of weeks at the renovated resort hotel. It’s interesting to read many reviews that all share similar experiences. There were many positive experiences, which were off-set by some of the challenges the resort faces if they want to truly be a top rated hotel.ProsThe staff made the difference. Any issue we had was taken care of, which we appreciated. Very helpful front desk, Renee, thank you. The pool side team, Nicky, Gabby and Rachel were fun to talk to. Great energy from the servers and poolside teams. Wade and Renee also provided breakfast coupons to take care of several issues early on.The location is great for walking around Waikiki and close to many restaurants, coffee shops, etc...Morimoto is fantastic! It is opposite Waikiki Beach, but you have to cross Kalakaua, this hotel is not directly on the ocean.The renovation of the hotel makes it one of the best in Waikiki. Other hotels need to follow their lead, as many of the big hotels are dated.The room cleaners were friendly and always had a smile on their faces. Food and drinks in the pool deck area was very good.ABC store on site is convenient Water bottle filling stations excellent idea and very popular with guests.Opportunities The rooms are good, but not great. As it was an old hotel and renovated, structural work remains the challenge. Noisy Generators from my first room, required me to get a room change, after my first night, which was appreciated. The 2nd room had a problem with the toilet and safe, but it got resolved quickly. The balcony doors are old and dirty. Many reviewers speak about the size of the washrooms. They are the smallest I have ever seen in any hotel I have stayed in. Not a lot of room at all. If that is important for you, be aware of it.The pool area is not well laid out, but it’s aesthetically lovely. Not enough loungers in the sun and as a result, people are having to lie on the sofas. The team should enforce the one hour rule to avoid people saving their chairs for hours and not being used. Instead of the expensive cabanas, they could open up the space more. The pool was very cold and unable to enjoy. Over the holidays, lots of families and little kids in the hot tub, which also wasn’t enjoyable. Internet in the pool deck area was very poor. As its part of the resort fee, management needs to get this fixed. The beachside tower ocean front over looks the homeless shelter area, which is out of the control of the hotel, but noise levels can get high at night as a result. Overall, the hotel management has a lot of work to do with the rooms and pool area to make it a great 5 star experience, if that is what they are advertising for and aiming to achieve. Perhaps they should stop trying to get awards and focus on what guests are saying. They are not the Ritz or Four Seasons. They are not Prince Hotel or Royal Hawaiian calibre. A hotel rated on TA as the around 25th best in the city isn’t worthy of Conde Nast awards. Continue to fix whats needed with the infrastructure and the items people are talking about.We were there for 16 nights and were thinking of leaving, early into our stay. I’m glad we stayed, but it was only a good experience, not great.

Air conditioner was very loud. Can hear neighbouring room washrooms. It’s communicated so it’s not a surprise but I’m just not a fan of the separate daily resort fee. Just include it in the price when the booking is paid for.

My husband and I stayed here for two nights while in Waikiki. We were lucky to get a room on the 39th floor overlooking Diamondhead and Waikiki beach. It was incredible to watch the sunrise over the mountains from the porch each morning. The room was simple and clean--the view really made it special. The pool area was nicely done and a great spot to get a drink or some food, but there were a few downsides. Because of crowds, it was difficult to get a chair with a view of the pool or the water. Additionally, by the afternoon most of the pool area was shaded by the other buildings around the hotel. it made going in the pool a bit less appealing. Overall, we loved our stay here mostly due to the fabulous view from our room. It's a bit pricey, but that seems to be the case for most of the hotels in Waikiki. It's a clean, nicely done hotel with friendly and accommodating staff. In spite of the price I'd recommend this hotel if you're in Waikiki!

We booked this hotel because we thought that is 5*, but its not. Its a fake advertising.The location is good, on the Waikiki beach. The lobby is nice. And that are all the positive things.The check in: we waited for 30 min because they couldn’t figure out what to do because we made the reservation through Expedia. So, after all the traveling we need it to wait more. When i asked about a restaurant they don’t have yet opened. Room service, not yet working. So at my question how are you a 5* hotel they answer, we are not. So what do you make of this?There is no water in the room, nothing in the minibar...The guy at the concierge when i asked him to make a reservation at Nobu he said “what is Nobu”.The bathroom of the room is a miniature.So, a nice hotel for a 3-4*, but no way that can sell it as 5*

Hotel is not as nice as pictures how to be. Paid for ocean view and ended up getting a building view. Went to staff and ask them why we only got a partial view, when we paid for ocean view and they said that is ocean view. Booked two room, one ocean view and one partial view. Both room have partial view with mainly other buildings.

We have just spent four nights at the Alohilani - we first visited in March this year. This time we were given a partial ocean view room on the Diamond Head side of the building which isn't as good a view on the other side, so I have to admit to being a bit disappointed. But the room was a good size with plenty of storage, bed comfortable and the empty fridge was great. A chair of some sort in the room would have been good - it seemed strange not to have one as there was plenty of room for one and on reflection I should have asked for one. I always ask for a kettle and it took two calls to guest services to get one this time. The pool area is beautiful but it took me three attempts to get a sunlounger, so I ended up going to the beach instead for a couple of times. Finally on our last day I got smart and grabbed a sunlounger early. People were putting books or hats on sunloungers and then leaving the area - so that was annoying. The pool is mostly shaded by 3pm at this time of the year, so it's best to get in early if you want full sun. Overall it was a good stay, not sure I love it as much as I did in March, but the shine is wearing off the new renovation, so not sure how long the pristine white vibe is going to last here.

We traveled to Hawaii to celebrate our Mom’s 75th Birthday...first to Honolulu for a few days then to Maui. While in Honolulu, we stayed at the Alohani Resort on Waikiki...the best choice ever. The staff was wonderful- the. Ensured our stay was perfect - recommendations for restaurants, shops, drives, and local art and fun places to visit. The Resort has a pool area - so cool! You could see Diamond Head and the beach from there. The rooms were modern, comfortable and really clean. The beds were so peaceful to lay on - fell asleep and had restful sleep (it could have been from her lag and the fun we had all day!). My Mom felt special - we told them why we were there and they had some amenities waiting for her there. They made her feel like Ohana. The staff were wonderful every day. They all seemed pleased to meet you and make your stay outstanding. They don’t have room service but they have a place downstairs for full meals or another for small bites. It has a huge aquarium there - gosh the fish!! The hotel is located in a convenient place - close to shopping, exploring the beach or going to Diamond Head! We loved everything about the place! Highly recommend. The hotel had been renovated and you could tell!! Wow! So gorgeous!

My daughters and I had a wonderful week at the hotel. The central location allowed us to get around with Ubers and on foot easily. The new modern rooms were clean and comfortable. The pool and pool deck were always clean and the poolside service was impeccable. We look forward to a return visit!

Nothing wrong with it, if it hadn't promised to be a "resort". It isn't. Location ok. Rooms comfortable. But "ocean view" was "ocean glimpse if you hang off the balcony", there is no room service, the rooms are really noisy from street noise, the servicing of the rooms was variable and the pool is tiny. So, as a hotel it would be 4 out of 5. As a resort, not so much.

The Alohilani exceeded our expectations. Extremely clean & in a perfect location, with the Beach just across the main drag.A short walk to the shops & restaurants (including Dukes) in one direction & the Aquarium (with its' Luau) & Diamond Head in the other. We had a Wheelchair Accessible room with roll in shower, with an Ocean View (on the west side) in the front tower, which was perfect for us. Although not an Ocean Front room, the view of the ocean was still spectacular as we watched the surfers, sunsets & even rainbows. An ABC accessible via the lobby was extremely handy.

Like any of the hotels in Waikiki they see you coming a mile off and it’s all about cash. You are not even aloud to grab a luggage trolley to move your own luggage “due to safety concerns”. The gym is a square room with no equipment and it costs $3 USD to run the washing machine. For the price this place is a rip off. For an extra $30 per night you can get a partial view of the ocean.

We stayed for 14 nights Great accommodation very modern and very clean, pool area was fabulous, beds were so comfortable, gym was great. So close to the beach, restaurants. We stayed with our two teenage children and had two rooms they were interconnecting which was great. Loved our stay and would highly recommend.

The hotel is very nice, fairly new. The room was small, bed was too soft, and even though it's not right on the ocean, it's across the street, ocean view is not direct view, more like partial. When I inquired they said that direct view was called oceanfront. Doesn't seem right to me, i payed for full ocean view and in my opinion got partial ocean view.

We stayed here almost 30 years ago when it was the Pacific Beach Hotel. The property had a full transformation and reopened with the current name in late 2017. Everything still feels fresh and the overall vibe is hip and young. Location can't be beat - DIRECT in the heart of Waikiki - with the beach steps away (across the street), restaurants and shopping galore. Rooms are fresh and compact. Everything was clean and worked well. Beds were super comfortable. Spring for at least the partial ocean view. The hotel also boasts the once renowned "Ocenarium" - a giant tank with lunge / bar attached just off the lobby. Greta place to sit and watch the fishes ...The salt-water pool is pretty hip and one can sit in the infinity edge and gaze at the sunset over Waikiki Beach or sit in the jumbo-size hot tub to do the same. We only stayed one night but wish we stayed longer. STAFF were extremely helpful and accommodating.

Resort great staff very lazy and unhelpful a simple request was a big bother to them they all acted like public service works no care no responsibility on many occasions like asking for gluten free bread it was a straight NO when they had it down stairs they should have said I’m not sure I’ll find out

Stayed 3 nights with family in 3 different rooms. Great friendly staff in all areas. Great rooms, location and service. Our family forgot a bag when leaving and staff made sure we collected to return to Australia with us as we stayed in Hawaii longer. It’s a central location to all you could need. Enjoy the pool or the beach is over the road. Loved our stay. Would recommend and definitely stay again.

We stayed here for three nights right before Christmas. We had booked a partial ocean view and it was well worth it as you are located right across the street from waikiki beach. Rooms are decent size but could use fridge/microwave, especially since they currently do not have breakfast included despite several restaurants at the resort. Nice touch is the heated toilet seats. The pool is on the 6th floor and is an infinity pool. Towels are provided. The only issue we had was that we had to call for housekeeping twice to get our toilet unclogged because they didn't show the first time, but the problem was quickly resolved once maintenace arrived. For the price and location it was great for us.

Excellent location of hotel. It is located right across the beach. Convenient walking distance to all restaurants and shopping. Also, convenient location to church. Excellent customer service, clean rooms and great pool!

My family stayed in the older renovated tower. I was blown away at their modernization of the old rooms. It is a must see for anyone who remembers the old pac beach hotel. I would love to see the new t

Hotel is perfectly situated right beside the beach. Check in was super friendly and efficient. Room was nice - modern furnishings and really comfortable bed.Bed was located straight in front of door. Door was so badly fitted that I had to put a towel on the floor to try and block out the light and noise. Spyhole on door functioned like a spot light - the light outside came right through, so had to block this also.What is it with room signs that can't simply say "do not disturb". The first night, I'd put the room sign up but had the housemaid knocking at my door at 9am. Hotel pool and surrounding area was overcrowded with children. I had to put furniture against the door between my room and the next one, in order to stop the door rattling with every movement from outside.People going to the pool area use the same elevators as guest rooms so the elevators took an inordinate amount of time during the daytime.Hotel bar was like a night club - really load music blasting. Maybe it wouldn't have been empty most of the time if people could sit and have a drink and chat. The food in Moromito restaurant was good but service was poor. It took ages for someone to take the order then not everything ordered arrived, including a drink.Overall, the hotel was OK but definitely not worth approx $300 per night.
