The hospitality at the Alohilani is definitely the best I have experienced in all of Hawaii! From the greeting at the front desk and the vibe in the lobby all the way to the kindness of the bell men and house keeping. Everyone is willing and happy to speak to you if you have questions and give you the best advice on things to do in town and on the island. The rooms are gorgeous and very clean, plus the views of Waikiki beach are unbelievable. If you are staying in Waikiki stay here. Great service and great experience overall!

My husband and I came here to ring in the new year. It is a beautiful hotel, but with all the one-way streets along Waikiki, it gets confusing on how to drive into the main lot. The hotel isn't on the ocean, but it is literally a 1 minute walk to the beach. I liked the convenience of the hotel to the beach, shopping, and restaurants. There are plenty of places to eat nearby and lots of ABC stores (one inside hotel too). The beds at this hotel are extremely comfy! Our partial ocean view room was nice, and we even got a good view of Diamond Head. The room also came with an empty fridge which was awesome. Upon arrival, we had some chocolates in the room and some portable water bottles. One thing that I noticed was that there were not many counter tops to place your items. (Example - I stayed in a room with 2 queens. There was only one table in the middle of the two beds. The bathroom was pretty small, so there wasn't a lot of space to lay out all my belongings.)One huge complaint I had about this hotel was their unavailability over the phone. No one picks up the phone when you're calling the front desk. I had to call front desk whenever I needed a request from housekeeping. It was really inconvenient when I had to walk downstairs to make my request. Besides that, this hotel is clean, modern, and close to the beach. Note: Hotel fees: $35/nightOvernight self-parking: $30/night (This can add up, so plan accordingly)

The room was very comfortable with great sea views.The staff were very friendly and helpful and really first class.The reception area was huge and the pool area was well operated. We booked a cabana for an afternoon with personal waiting service from loungers in a shallow pool.The only problem was that they hotel bill used a lousey exchange cross rate of US$.61 for the NZ dollar which made the stay expensive.Just saying!

The hotel itself is lovely, although they claim to be 5 Star - it is definitely not.The location is amazing, we had a partial ocean view room and we could see the sunset perfectly from the balcony.The room is a decent size and it’s one of the most comfortable beds I’ve ever slept in at a hotel.Now to the reason for the poor rating: The Pool area.The hotel charges a $40 / day resort fee for which you get a refillable water bottle, WiFi and access to the pool.The pool area is OVER RUN buy kids who it seems the parents can’t supervise and the hotel staff don’t enforce the rules. There was literal babies in the hot tub, still in nappies! It is GROSS! According to the hot tub rules, there should be no kids under 5, no kids over 5 without supervision and no more than 10 people in the spa at one time, the first day there was about 30 crammed in there.. kids and adults.. some of the adults were drinking out of GLASS in the spa.. another big no no.. when the staff approached I expected for them to enforce the rules for people’s safety.. they did not.. they actually just offered a couple in the spa if they could take a photo for them.The next day we tried again, I literally was kicked in the face by a child who was crawling over me (in the hot tub) to try and jump to the pool (again against the rules to do this and very dangerous) the mother did NOTHING and we complained to the hotel manager, she was lovely and to be fair they did waive the resort fee but we weren’t able to use the pool at all for the whole time.To bring this all home, when we returned to the hotel the next day from the beach (the only place we could swim) there was a kid coming down the elevator on a stretcher, he was blue, turned out he drowned in the pool area! Like he wasn’t breathing! A woman gave cpr and they found a heartbeat but who knows if the kid survived, it’s heartbreaking but the hotel needs to enforce the rules and the out of control kids need to be watched by parents.So overall, if you have kids this is a great place to stay, if you are looking for a couple getaway look elsewhere.

We had a great time at Waikiki.The hotel is exactly like the pics on the website.The rooms are very clean We had a Diamond head and ocean view and it was beautiful room We desire stay one day more and thanks God! the hotel have rooms available.Just I wish that the hotel have room service.I was impress how a 5 star hotel like Alohilani doesn’t provide that service ..Anyways we had a great time on NY Eve !!..We will be back for sure..maybe next month or so.The hotel make our stay perfect.And it was in a great location too.

On a positive note, the location is good if you have an ocean view room. The hotel is new which given its cheap fit out and furnishings is important as it will deteriorate quickly. Breakfast was a joke at $40 per person. Cheap supermarket white breads, canned fruits, greasy sausages, and awful coffee. Ocean front room is ok, albeit cheaply fitted out, but the bathroom is teeny. Housekeeping banged on our door at 8:20am while we were sleeping to make up the room. Very disappointing. If we hadn’t prepaid for 3 rooms for a week we would have checked out the next day.

We just stayed at the Alohilani last week for 4 nights. The hotel itself was very nice. The room was small but that is probably to be expected based on the Waikiki location. The reason I rated the hotel only 3 stars was because of the incompetency of the concierge desk. We stayed over New Years Eve and no one at the concierge desk or front desk could give us any information on New Year's Eve festivities at the hotel or Waikiki. We looked at the hotel website online and found there was music and drinks at the O'bar and also saw advertisements in the elevator. Why none of the staff was aware of this is questionable. We also found out from our waiter at a restaurant outside of the hotel that there would be fireworks on the beach. Again, the hotel staff did not share this with us. In addition, we asked at the concierge desk about activities and hiking in Oahu. The only advice we were given was pamphlets on a luau (which we told them we had no interest in) and whale watching. They also kept trying to tell us about restaurant deals when we never asked for restaurant advice. When we called the whale watching company, we were informed that they had not started whale watching tours yet and did not expect to do so for at least another week. When we asked about hiking at Diamond Head and if parking would be available, we were told parking would not be an issue. The parking lot was full when we arrived and we had to leave and park somewhere else. The concierge staff also were not able to give us information about any other hikes. Again, the waiter at the outside restaurant was helpful with many other suggestions. The fact that a waiter was much more helpful to us than the multiple different concierge members we spoke to at the hotel is very disappointing. On a separate note, we had a food allergy issue at one of the restaurants we ate at in the hotel, Morimoto Asia. We had informed our waiter of our son's multiple food allergies which included sesame seeds. He assured us that the food we ordered would not contain these items. The dumplings came out with sesame seeds on top. Luckily, my son noticed and did not eat them. We informed our waiter and other then him seeming to be confused, he did not give us any other response. I am not sure what the relationship between the restaurant and hotel is but since it is on hotel property, I am including this in my review. Overall, I would NOT stay at the Alohilani again given the wide options in Waikiki. I would expect more from a hotel in this price range.

We arrived at 0600, way to early to check in. The front desk staff were amazing. Very friendly and helpful. They let us place our bags in a holding room until we could check in, this allowed us to go for a walk around the area. The front desk lady rang us when our room was ready so we came back at 1100-the room was amazing. Level 16 with ocean views. The room itself was very neatly appointed, roomy with a large TV, compact ensuite and plenty of storage for our bags and things.There is a travel agent-bookings desk downstairs-they were very helpful and honest about activities to do for us to get the most out of our holiday.The hotel itself is very central, a block away from the Dukes statue-where there is a bus stop for the tourist trolley's right next to the beach and bath areas. Restaurants and bars everywhere, walking distance to everything in the Waikiki beach front area.The food in the restaurant/bar area was not very good and way overpriced. Breakfast box unappetising apart from the fruit. Coffee machine in the room was a nice touch and coffee not too bad either.The bar at the pool was the same. The bar tender was swearing with some of the lads at the bar-very unprofessional and inappropriate Chad.The pool area is lovely. The cabanas looked perfect was very expensive to hire, and I didn't quite understand why you had to hire pool lounges in the pool itself. Spa was warm-great views of the ocean between the buildings.I would definitely stay here again. Front desk staff were so helpful and nice and made things easy for us to sort out.

Thank you to Sina for her great customer service. After a 10 hr flight she was able to place us into a room at 8am without having to wait until 3pm, the hotel’s customary occupation time. All of our requests that we had previously made by email became reality including a rollout trundle bed. The service was seamless. The warm Hawaiian welcoming hospitality was personified by Sina. Marlene at the OBar also did an excellent job with our breakfasts. Well done to the hotel and we will be staying here again.

****I don’t have kids, so maybe this review will be biased in regards to one specific thing***My spouse and I stayed here before this resort was remodeled. It’s BEAUTIFUL! The rooms are a decent size, the bed is amazing, the lobby is super nice, the bars aren’t bad, we haven’t eaten at the restaurant yet but it’s by Morimoto so I’m sure it’s good. There are two pools and a hot tub. (This is gonna be where my bias comes into play). One of those pools is a kiddie pool. For kids!! The other is a regular pool which, sure, has a ton of kids in it. however, most of the children have been in the hot tub. Like, A LOT! With floaties on and climbing around the walls of it, which by the way just drops off, infinity pool style to a shallow moat-like area. Kinda dangerous. And when I say kids they range in age from a few months to maybe like 10. I’ve counted at least two a day (the same family I think) kids who are visibly wearing diapers NONE of which should be allowed in a hot tub for any amount of time let alone the hours that they are in there for. Not even grown people should really stay in one for longer than 30 min or so, but the adults in there, perhaps parents, perhaps not didn’t seem to care. And why would they when you can have your cocktail in a glass container in said hot tub. Again, drunk adults, glass, hot tubs and kids don’t mix well. And mind you the hot tub isn’t huge and there’s been an average of about 15 adults and kids in there at one time. It would be one thing if there was no kiddie pool, but there is. And not one kid has been in it. This may be a family resort but if your family doesn’t include an out of control child, you shouldn’t have to deal with someone else’s when all you want to do is relax. The staff doesn’t seem to care about any of this. In fact they just offer to take pictures of them. So if you have kids and you like for them to simmer away in murky hot water with about 20 other humans then book your stay now, otherwise I suggest an all adults place where biggest worry you will have is if people can handle their piña coladas. Ps I’d include pics but I’m not down for sharing pics of people I don’t know in suits. Especially children

We were staying in a 1 bedroom suite with an adjoining room for kids. Suite is beautifully appointed, modern and clean. A partial ocean view mean you see a bit of the ocean between 2 buildings in front of you. Suite 3959 and 3955 are rooms on the very top 39 floor. Our first night there it was really windy and our balcony glass doors were banging from the wind. And on top of that there was this loud rumbling sound from the roof we thought caused by the wind as well. If you know teenagers they sleep through anything but it was so noisy even they could not sleep. Next morning, I asked to be moved but manager on duty said there was no other suites available but they will get someone to look at the doors. I though ok maybe I’ll just have to get earplugs. During the afternoon we were resting in the room and the rumbling from the roof was so noisy it sounded like we were riding on a train and I’m not exaggerating. I texted the manager and Jill called us back. We ended up downgrading from our suite to a regular room since no suites were available. Jill was very understanding and did not charge us for the first night as we got absolutely no sleep. I’m sad we had to give up the space and the luxury that came with the suite but it is definitively quiet now. No wind. No rumbling. I want to acknowledge that Jill stepped up and made our pretty horrible situation to a decent one. I wanted to give more stars but can’t due to the lack any greeting and direction from the front desk Japanese guy when we checked in. I didn’t get his name but he should not be working at the front desk. Also disappointed the first manager we spoke to did not offer any remedy. So my advice, don’t stay in the partial ocean view suites or rooms on the 39th floor until they have fixed the old balcony door and address whatever is making that noise on the roof.

Loved it, great location across from the beach!! Super easy access to everything.Only 'small' downside small bathroom and not enough seating around the pool to watch the kids.Overall stay was outstanding would definitely stay again

Location was excellent for a family with 2 young children being close to restaurants and the beach. The hotel had extremely friendly & helpful staff and the pool areas were excellent especially the children's pool area. The hotel also offered some great cultural experiences. Our room which was a Diamond Head/Sea view and was functional although on the smaller size and as has been mentioned the bathrooms are extremely small. Despite these small cons we had a great time at the hotel.

it's not a 5-star but 4.3 star hotel.the view from the room is not that good exept the ocean front rooms.we stayed at ov room but the view was not that nice.in Waikiki,only the ritz-carlton is a 5-star hotel.ハワイのオーシャンビューは、お部屋の'端っこ'からでも海が'少し'見えればオーシャンビューとくくるところがあるので、注意した方がよいです(POVにしときなよってよく思います)。The ModernのOVもひどかった(;_;)

It started with a completely inexperienced receptionist that mistakenly tried to charge my card 3x for the same room inadvertently. The whole check in process was a mess. Come to find out the hotel doesn't provide in room service, how is that possible in this day and age, no in room entertainment either. A gym if you can find it, we loved our stay at other sister properties but this place is at best a 3 star property. My recommendation is find another property that has a professional staff and the proper services for the price point.

I was expecting a 5 star hotel not a 3 star hotel. I had high expectations but I was mislead from the pictures on their website. I booked an ocean view and I got a partial ocean view. I was told that I’d have an angeled view of the ocean from my balcony but most of my view was of the city. I was extremely let down by the view I had. There’s no room service which is odd because every 5 star hotel has room service. I waited almost 20 minutes for my food at the pool bar and by the time I got my food my fries were cold. To be fair I was compensated for my inconvenience but I should have not waited that long for steak and fries. The only upside of this hotel is the staff. I was greeted with a friendly smile by Doug one of the valet staff and had a very friendly, smooth check in process with the supervisor Chanel. Kapahi, a bellman who assisted my friends and I to our rooms was genuinely apologetic with our situation about our view and he made us feel appreciated. Nikki, one of the pool bar employees was really helpful and friendly. Security guards Alika and Phil was kind and helpful. The battery for our door had died and Alika was very quick to assist us, he was friendly and he recommended great scenic locations. The battery for the hotel rooms safe died and Phil was quick with changing out the batteries and sincerely apologized for our inconvenience. I would’ve gave a 1 star rating if it weren’t for the hotel staff. If you don’t mind paying 400 dollars a night for a 3 star hotel then this is the hotel for you.

For sure a 5 stars rating! Simply nothing to complain about. The outside pool is amazing and we loved to watch the sunset from there. The live acts in the evening hours were outstanding! Room is beautiful decorated.Thanks for these beautiful days!

First time back at this hotel since the renovations. Good job with the renovations - totally new, modern look. Updated rooms - great! Location of hotel is perfect - close to everything - beach, restaurants, shopping, etc. Familiar faces of some of the workers from previous stay...staff were very friendly at check-in, restaurant, etc. In particular, one of the workers - bellman, Kap, was so helpful. Great rapport - really has the "aloha" spirit - genuinely seems to like people, and he provided us with many suggestions for great restaurants in and out of Waikiki and helped arrange our car service. Although, he was a bellman, he made sure to tell us - "don't hesitate to ask if I can help with anything". My husband loves to fish and during his conversation with the bellman Kap we learned some interesting information about the tides, moons, etc. and where to charter a boat on Oahu and also on Maui. Enjoyed our stay - hope to be back soon.

The hotel was clean. The valet and house keeping customer service was impeccable. Valet was $38 per day and I believe self park was $30 per day. Location was close to everything, right in front of 24 hour McDonald's for your late night munchines.

The service at the Alohilano hotel was outstanding. Such a friendly and warm welcome to Hawaii. All facilities were clean and new. ABC store downstairs was a bonus. Lovely pool and deck area. A bit noisy, but that is due to the Waikiki location. A lovely positive experience.

While every staff member to whomwe had a chance to speak was very helpful and friendly, the room cleaning service throughout our 4 night stay was terrible. Hair on the bathroom area floor was never cleaned even after our polite comment to the hotel about cleaning when the toilet seats were found obviously not cleaned. This is something they could improve and let’s hope it will be. On the other hand, there are structural issues that won’t be improved unless they do another renovation. You hear every word of conversations from your next door. There was a party in our next door even after midnight unfortunately. The bathroom area of our room in the taller building is super tiny. The relatively small city sized pool and also the whole pool area can get very crowded because of the large number of the rooms. The main pool was filled with children. Since it was in a high season, the room charge was around $650 a night and a 4 night minimum stay wasrequired. The second star was given because of the hotel staff members who made our stay pleasant despite all these challenges. Good luck with your search!

It’s been awhile since we’ve stayed here, but the renovations are amazing. Love the updated look. Still same great staff as always, so personable and friendly they make you feel like family. We always get great service from the bellman, especially Kap. He’s the man. Always greeting everyone, and going out of his way to help us out. We will definitely be back again.

Hotel was ok. Room was ok bathroom was super small. Air con in room was very noisy. Breakfast was terrible. Very expensive with very poor options for the price you pay. Plates were still dirty under the buffet.

The hotel is stylish, modern and has an energetic vibe! The hotel is bright, friendly and very chic! The main lobby area where the O bar is has a 3 story aquarium that is spectacular and keeps the kids busy while you enjoy food and drinks. The breakfast area is also next to the aquarium adding to the already exceptional buffet breakfast. The hotel is located directly across from Waikiki Beach and is minute walk away from superb restaurants both casual and elegant. The pool area is one of the coolest hotel pools I have ever seen, My wife and absolutely loved it. The view of Waikiki Beach from the pool at sunset is gorgeous. My wife and I felt so classy here and our kids were totally entertained by the kids pool and free movies offered each evening at the kids pool. We loved the fire pits and couches near the pool and the view of the city inspired many group photos.

This is my 3rd trip to Hawaii. During my previous trips, I have stayed in good hotels along the Waikiki Beach but Alohilani by far is the best. For one, I love the hotel's elegant minimalism. Secondly, I love the idea of getting water with you refillable containers downstairs by the elevators (very environmentally friendly). Thirdly, they have the best bed. Their bed and pillows deserve a shoutout because I love my sleep and they delivered that to me. And lastly, the beach is just so near the hotel that it is super convenient. I will definitely stay here again when I get back.

Stayed 4 nights. Lobby is beautiful. Very clean. Nice design. Very good breakfast included and very nicely appointed gym. Pool area is very cool. Rooms are nice but bathroom is the tiniest I have ever seen in any hotel!! Got locked out on the balcony one night because of a faulty lock on the sliding door. Didn’t have my cell phone and had to scream at passerby’s below to rescue me from having to sleep outdoors on cement all night. One annoying thing is the workout out kind of hip hop playing loudly in the lobby area - the same 60-75 minute play list for 4 days in a row at 5-10 dEcibels too loud was a bit much.
user_name:
DrAndyNYC
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location opposite main waikiki beach. Hotel was Pacific Beach Hotel but had major make over. The pool area is excellent with a kids bearded pool area, spa, large outdoor bar/dining and main pool. During peak times it’s hard to grand a seat so get to the pool early!Hotels foyer/lobby has a large aquarium which the kids loved.

We recently spent 8 days at this resort and had a lovely time. The hotel has been renovated to an excellent standard and situated in a most convenient location opposite the beach and in the centre of Waikiki Beach shopping/dining area.Everything was very clean and the staff friendly and helpful.The pool area was well patronised and had a nice view of the beach. The pool was quite shallow by Australian standards. There was a bar and food service available there also. There didn't seem to be any room service although very close to restaurants.

We visited after Christmas. Hotel and room was very clean. We felt comfortable and enjoyed our stay. The bathroom was on the small side, just shower and toilet. Outside was a single sink. Lobby was classy with lights and music. The hotel an ABC store which was good and bad. Pool area was small but it had a nice touch with lighting, furniture, music, and location. Across the street was the beach and shops and restaurants were within reasonable walking distance. The door has gaps that let in noise and sound from the hallway. But overall, luckily our neighbors were quiet and we were able to get a good night's sleep.

We only stayed here for one night. We had been staying in kauai and had to catch our flight out of Honolulu back to LA. The hotel looks very new, sleek, hip and clean. But the rooms are nothing special. Clean but not like the comfortable beds at a W. No real amenities with the room except a coffee Keurig style machine. Matter of fact, the room was small. We got a double bed room for our two little kids and us. It was fine... not great. The pool is very sleek but not heated. So our December dip in it was chilly. I will say, the pool area is great but being 5 floors up and getting the funnel effect from surrounding buildings makes the pooll area windy. It gets cold. The best part of the pool was the woman who greeted us and set us up. Super enthused and helpful. We ate there and the food was fine... not great. For the 800 bucks the room was i'm not sure i'd stay for a long stay at the 'Alohilani. Why? For that much money i think i could almost stay at a five start Waikiki resort with much better amenities.

I just double check the recipe for my trip, and I realized that they charged me the "Guest Valet Parking fee for four days" which we never used during our trip. we only rent one car during my entire trip from Dec19th to 22th, and I parked my car to the parking lot without any help from their staffs. They should charge us the self-parking only instead of the valet parking. If you can check the pictures I uploaded for this review, you can see they charged us the valet parking from our hotel check in date: Dec 18th (which we haven't got a car yet). When I asked them for the parking ticket, they never explained to me the difference between guest self-parking and valet parking. After we came back, I sent several emails as well as making long distance calls to their manager and staffs, they just simply and rudely replied me that their record showed we used the valet parking. We had a good memory at this hotel, and I don't want to ruin my experience because of this! I wish they can see this review and improve their service, and give us a formal explanation.

The staff is by far the best part of our stay, especially JENNY who works the rooftop pool bar!She gave us a list of food recommendations on our first night, and we had the best meal ever. Make sure to visit Uncle Bo’s for dinner. Super friendly and fun. The rooftop bar is beautiful and filled with comfortable seating options from couches to fire pit tables and great music!The infinity pool is beautiful but very very small and FILLED with small children splashing and screaming. I recommend an age limit of any kids under 10 should stay in the kid area. For us, it’s fine because we have kids and get it, but wouldn’t recommend this place for couples. Another question, why are the beautiful cabanas not next to the pool? They are on the opposite side of the rooftop?The location of the hotel is great, but the elevators take forever. So don’t call an Uber until you’re in the lobby. It’s nice to not be in the heart of Waikiki so it’s a bit quieter which was nice.Jenny was by far the highlight, but the amount of kids in the infinity pool needs to be addressed.

I forgot to post this review when I got home from Waikiki. My fiancée and I stayed at Alohilani for 5 days for my birthday. While we visited the hotel it was under renovation but that definitely didn’t put a damper on our stay. We stayed in a room with a partial ocean view and a partial view of diamond head. I really enjoyed having the best of the both worlds with the views. The room was very clean and was very well tended to by the excellent staff. The check in process was smooth and easy the staff was very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is right in the mix of the things, the beach is literally across the street. There is also plenty of shopping and dining options nearby. The pool area was exceptional, definitely a great place to chill and kickback. Attached to the hotel was the ABC store my fiancée and I were in there everyday, great place to get just about anything you need. All in all I throughly enjoyed my trip, and we will positively be back especially because I see that the renovation is now complete!!

We stayed at an 'ocean view king room'. This is the most bizzare '5-star' hotel experience that I ever had.- no central A/C. There is a noisy a/c unit in the room- bathroom is a joke. It's tiny and ugly. Look at it!- did you expect slippers and bathrobe? Ha! Not here.- parking is a pain with narrow turns. Also, you cannot enter the building from a parking garage- 'ocean view' room means you can see ocean by peeking from the tiny balcony. Your room just faces another building.

Alohilani Resort was amazing! The location is perfect and the property is so beautiful! If you have a special event contact Jonathan Cohn - so helpful and great to work with. The pool deck is awesome - Jenny Kim was our exceptional waitress and pool manager Nikki is so fun!

Advertising looks good but hotel doesn't meet all standards. Walls paper thin. No good cafes close by.No security. Staff so-so. Would stay elsewhere next time and advise others to look at something else.

Staying at the Alohilani Resort was a highlight of the Hawaii vacation. Exceptional quality and friendly, helpful staff. We were transferred from the Hilton hotel due to plumbing problems [alternative arrangements made by Hilton before our arrival]; what we received were better accommodations than we would have had initially. The Alohilani Resort had an amazing poolside ocean/beach view and sunset. A great hotel/resort stay--one of the jewels of Hawaii.

Stayed 4 nights at an ocean front room. Amazing room with a great view of the ocean. Hotel location was easily accessible to everywhere, cross a street it's the beach, just grab some towels from hotel pool n you are set. Casual restaurant morimoto downstairs serves great authentic ramen as well. Highly recommended, would definitely stay here again if in Waikiki.

The room was pleasant and clean, and the staff I came into contact with were friendly, professional and helpful. The hotel is well located for exploring Waikiki and offers good amenities, most of which I didn't use to be honest. The bar with the aquarium (I can't remember its name) was not particularly comfortable, but the service was good.

This was an alternative, available over Christmas so we booked it. Have no regrets since it’s a great hotel, nice staff, and clean. The pool area is a bit to small if I have to say something negative.

We were really looking forward to our stay at the Alohilani and were not disappointed with the hotel itself, it is beautifully presented and we did feel quite spoilt staying there. The pool was lovely, rooms were nicely laid out and very clean. However, we did have some poor experiences which dampened the overall view of our stay. I had requested a high floor room with an ocean view. I understand that this was subject to availability, but we were only allocated a room on the 7th floor (out of 17) and it was right down the end of the hotel, above the pool. So there was a view, but it was only a sliver/side view once we stood on the balcony, and it was extremely noisy being that close to the pool. We could hear the outdoor music blaring through the wall all day and night. To be honest, I feel we were allocated one of the worst rooms purely due to the fact that we had booked through Expedia and got a cheap room rate. They offered us an upgrade to an ocean front room for $130 a night but I thought that was a bit ridiculous, so declined. The noise we experienced as part of our stay here was probably the worst we have endured in any of our trips to Hawaii. We usually stay in resorts right on the beach (eg. Outrigger, Sheraton) with no side road next to it, and boy what a difference this made. The road noise was ridiculous, even from the 7th floor we could hear so much. They have done a terrible job of soundproofing as it is an older hotel that has been renovated. With our door closed we could hear the splashing of the pool, people in the pool, the pool music, not to mention the people in the hallway or the rooms next door. We heard them coughing and sneezing, so loud it sounded like they were in our room. So needless to say, we had a terrible sleep. I had to resort to playing a white noise app on my phone to try and help. The most frustrating part was them trying to charge us for the complimentary mai tais on check out. I am glad my husband checked the bill carefully or we wouldn’t have noticed!! They refunded this charge but then also took a $400 credit card authorisation for a reason unknown. This maxed out my credit card at the end of a long (and expensive) trip to Hawaii leaving us almost stranded and unable to pay for our onward accomodation in Sydney. I was pretty distressed about this and tried to call them from the airport to enquire what had happened, but was just on hold for ages and couldn’t get through to anyone. I need to contact them to resolve this if it does not reverse in the next few days. It was a really frustrating way to end our stay and definitely left a bad taste in our mouths. It was certainly a nice hotel but due to our overall experience, I am not sure we would return.

Clean, small room. Nowhere to put suitcases. Tiny bathroom. You can barely close the bathroom door without it hitting the toilet. No fan in the bathroom. We are on the 20th floor. Sounds like the middle of Times Square in our room. Trucks, honking, cars noise from next door (heard an entire conversation at 4am as well as the radio). I need a vacation from my vacation. Been here 2/8 nights. Getting earplugs today.

Room was nice and the view amazing. But WAY too noisy. We could hear everything from outside. We could also hear the elevator bell and every doors closing on our floor. You can’t possibly be a 5-star hotel and be so noisy. Also, when you have someone call the room to tell us there is a welcome package available, it is nice to actually have a welcome package and not a salesman trying to sell you all the crappy tour around the island so he can get his bonus. Not a welcome package. Finally, the pool is almost always in the shadow. We arrived at 1:30pm. The only place that was still in the sun were the sofas. No luck, we were told to leave to go by the pool (already without sun) because there was something else planned at the bar ...So this hotel looks good, Ocean Front Room have great views but that’s it. Too pricey for the quality of the rooms.

We had requested adjoining, quiet rooms for our group of five and lucked out with a corner room and the room next to it, away from other rooms. Very quiet and with gorgeous views of the surfers and waves. Enjoyed the food, drinks and ambience at Momosan. A+!

Customer service was amazing, from the front desk to all staff we encountered!Our room was on a high floor and we had a great view!We spent a lot of time by the infinity pool having birthday cocktails.AND.... The prosciutto pizza with essence of truffle was delish!!! We had it twice during our stay. Hotel is overall comfortable and great location.

Extremely disappointed in level of professionalism and service. From the concierge staff trying to upsell time share and inflating costs of tours and activities for a price you have to “pay to get” to the rude bar staff over at their O bar in particularly Alice who turns around only to start bad mouthing their own customers whilst making a drink it’s a shame the hotel amenities are excellent however lacking severely on service. There seems to be a lot of family staying - the walls are thin and you can hear everything. I.E A cry, cough, sneeze and flushing through the rooms across and next door. For the price, I would recommend elsewhere as the rooms/bathrooms are also small (partial ocean view as a couple)

Trip of a lifetime! Had to change hotel at the last minute. India was very helpful and provided superior customer service with a lovely gift for our 20th anniversary. This new hotel has exceptional service, great location, and an array of activities. Will definately be returning with the family next year.

Quick trip. In 4pm Sunday. Out noon Monday! Checked in and warmly greeted by superior check-in team. The agent was awesome. I think his name was Landon. The hotel is fully remodeled- spectacular remodel. Wow! Last visit not done. Upgraded $150 to ocean view 16th floor. Stunning views. Room excellent. Amenities very good. Slippers and robes✨...Japanese toilets. High end. Oddly mine was broken and detached from wall / floor when used. Maintenance team was in room next door so I told them. Then advised front desk to not rebook room until fixed. Will I come back? YES. I am in HNL often. This is now where I will stay. Do I want the toilet to not detach from the wall? YES

This was our third visit to Waikiki and we took advantage of staying at the Alohilani as it is newly redone and because of its prime location. Initially I was disappointed with a few factors (no robes in the room; no microwave which I needed for medical purposes; and two onsite restaurants were closed for private parties 2/4 nights I was there). I reached out to the hotel manager, Matt to let him know why I was disappointed. Within hours of sending my email, I had robes and slippers declivered to my room as well as a microwave. Matt went out of his way to make sure we felt valued and respected. I didn’t think I’d get a reply to my email and I was very pleased with his timely and caring response. There is a certain feel you get when someone really cares about making you happy and Matt nailed this! Thanks Matt!The rooms are nicely done and comfortable. They did a great job with decor. We had an ocean view room which had stunning views of the ocean and beach. We loved the filtered water stations in the hotel and the gym is nicely done. The infinity pool was a hit with my kids and the Swell bar at the pool is a beautiful place to have food and drinks. The views are breathtaking from there. Some mentioned the noise in their reviews, but everywhere on the strip is a bit noisy. It’s a very popular and busy place! All hotels I have stayed at in Waikiki are about the same in that department. I didn’t find it overly disruptive or difficult to sleep though. We will definitely return to Alohilani because of our positive service experience. Barbi at the front desk is also wonderful as was our room attendant but unfortunately I forget her name.

Recently stayed for 8 nights as part of a luxury escape deal. Loved the added inclusions & the $200 to spend at the resort. Great friendly staff & amenities onsite such as water filler stations are a bonus. The swell pool bar is stunning with great sunset views from the infinity pool. We upgraded to an oceanfront room which was quite small with a lot of street noise. I would recommend a higher floor. Overall a nice change from the previous Pacific beach hotel.

We spent 4 days at this resort and found the location to be brilliant, the rooms nice and well appointed and the staff very friendly and accommodating. Certainly not cheap but nothing in Waikiki is. Having an ABC shop in the resort was great and the pool was beautiful.

jUST RETURNED FROM Hawaii & what a wonderful place to vacation - we were referred to stay the refurbished Alohilani Resort Waikiki Beach - pre to staying we advised this was a special celebration trip, well dont expect anything special from the hotel, and the additional charges when you check out are insane - upon check in, we asked about the ocean view room, and were offered the upgrade, which we believed was FREE or the special celebration occasion, well it was not !! So disappointed, also the only hotel to ever stay at that does not acknowledge any celebration, no card, no free upgrade , in fact you get nothing. The best thing about the hotel was Dashnee who checked us in - she is delightful, the rest of the staff are rude, and in fact the conceierge team has to be the worst of any hotel globally - the arrogant young guy with the attitude,needs to be taught people skills - I did not appreciate him at all, and in fact the concierge team we felt could offer very little in any info needed, we booked a vehicle, which you are better off going direct to Enterprise at the Marriott hotel, and what fabulous service the marriott and enterprise teams offered, Alohilani you should send your staff for lessons in customer service. If you want to sleep in from a long flight forget it, the cleaning staff yell non stop up and down the corridor from about 7am - no idea why that is needed - so no sleep in at all - the pool staff, they are dreadful - there is no service, we attempted to spend some time at the pool, it was dirty, they dont remove dirty plates and glasses, we waited for 30 minutes for any form of service, and were then told to go to the bar to order - not sure why they have staff if that is the case - we also requested a pool lounger cover, that never happened either and the pool staff are unfriendly and unhelpful very disappointing, also be aware this pool is freezing, and many make comment on this - the hotel needs to look at add glass paneling around the pool to stop the wind - beautiful setting with freezing pool water and terrible staff. Also hiring lounger to sit in the pool is honestly beyond us. The Ocean front rooms are lovely, just remember if they offer a upgrade it is not FREE, they make out like it is - and also the rooms are very very noisy - the location of the hotel is perfect, just such a pity that the staff are 1 star and that we were so let down in requests that we made to make this a special trip, you really should look at what other hotels offer and learn - we requested a few times to chat with the General Manager, who was always in his office but not available to guests - what a pity -

Stunning resort with friendly helpful staff. Kids absolutely loved the pool and the beach was just a 30 second walk away! Room was spacious and had a fabulous view - loved having evening drinks on the balcony.Would definitely recommend!

We stayed for 8 days in an ocean view room which one other reviewer correctly pointed out - wasn't really an ocean view. That said the room was gorgeous and clean, the pool area the same - top notch. The horizon pool itself was stunning and great service pool side - a particular shout out to Nikki as well as the poolside facial I had - free on mondays! These little touches make this hotel feel like the boutique hotel it packages itself as. The SINGLE drawback was the so-called concierge service which is nothing more than a time share sales desk. This really irked me. For a hotel of this standard, I expect knowledgeable restaurant suggestions, and hassle free advice - not to be sold something. Even emailing the concierge in advance I did not receive a reply - again this is not a concierge. If you want suggestions, I would ask the front desk.

Hotel is in the perfect location for all Waikiki fun. Pool was fantastic and rooms are clean and updated. Loved the aquarium. Staff very helpful. Concierge could have been more helpful, they didn't even know where the starbucks was and its on;y two blocks away.

We had a banquet function here and were blown away by the staff! They were extremely accommodating to our requests and provided such great service to our guests. I wish I could remember all of their names but I did catch Victor & Mel. If you're looking to host a large event I would highly recommend!

We stayed overnight at Alohilani as we were having our holiday party at the hotel. First off, the banquet and catering team did such a fantastic job of running our event and taking care of our every need. Rhoderika helped us with all the planning and was also there the night of to ensure everything was perfect. Jonathan and his amazing banquet team (Mel, Cheri, Victor and everyone who worked that night) executed everything flawlessly all with fantastic aloha spirit! Mahalo!!We were also given a fantastic room that had both a terrific makai (ocean) and mauka (mountain) view. Not too long after we checked in we received a text from Mathea to ensure everything with the room was great (it was!), which I thought was a very nice touch. After our holiday party we ended up having a drink at Swell Bar, and Chad and the other gentleman working that night were very friendly and provided excellent service. Thank you!

Beautiful newly remodeled resort hotel, with large rooms and excellent views. Extremely courteous staff that will go out of their way to please. Great location away from the crowds of shoppers. Kuhio beach across the street not as crowded as Waikiki beach.

We booked the Ocean view room for a family of 3. The hotel is located in a fantastic location with the beach just right across the road. It is also walking distance to many eateries along Waikiki and you can walk to almost all tour/shuttle bus pick-up points from the hotel. We had 3 free drinks for our hotel stay and had a relaxing time at the lobby cafe. One can feel the hustle and bustle of Waikiki at this hotel as it is always crowded at all times. The downside is that the hotel does not provide amenities such as toothbrush, toothpaste and we have to grab them from the ABC store at the ground floor. The ocean view is also a little disappointing as we only get to see the ocean by looking out from the right side of the balcony. Other than that, we had a great time staying at Alohilani!

It was one of the most pleasant vacations we have had so far. The swell pool is awesome, my son loved it so much that we spent most of our day just enjoying the view from the pool and hang out at the jacuzzi. Our server Janice was awesome. She made us comfortable and welcomed us with Aloha. Very clean environment... and the complementary water on the side kept us hydrated. Very friendly crew. More power to you guys !!!! Aloha... we will definitely be back!!!!

Everything is right near the hotel, there’s even a McDonald’s across the street fro those late night cravings lol. The hotel is super fabulous, and so is the beach. Zoo in nearby location and more. Honestly a 100/100 rating. For a 5 Star hotel

Beautiful hotel with a staff that knows what their doing. The customer service was spectacular. The way the hotel words it’s ocean view rooms is a bit deceiving. They need more than one hot tub as it was always too packed to use. Outside of those two issues, my wife and I had a lovely stay.

great hotel, good staff, great location few steps to waikiki beach and commercial areas and bus stops. a full service restaurant could have been added inside the hotel. The pool and jacuzzi was awesome!

I loved this hotel. It was clean and the staff is super friendly and helpful. The room was clean and spacious. Access to the beach and shops easily from the hotel. I slept really well and for the first time ever with the curtains open just to take in the sights of waikiki

Great Resort, fantastic views from the balcony, the best sunset view ever from the restaurant, close to everything - shops, restaurants, bars, beach, bus stop not far away. Not all tour pickups are from here, but not far to walk to where you need to go. Downside is most of the kids are not in the kids pool, parents bring them to the main pool so there are not enough lounges around the pool and lots of kids in the pool while the kids pool is empty. I enjoyed it so much I am booking to go back

Very centrally located. We had an ocean view from the side, was beautiful. The hotel is very clean, elegant, the pool is beautiful, the huge aquarium in the lobby is impressive. It was our first time in Hawaii and we had a great time. Check in, check out was smooth and fast. We booked activities at the hotel, they were fantastic as well, a bit pricey, but it is Hawaii.

Perfectly situated to nearby Waikiki Beach and local amenities, including shopping and restaurants, the airy, minimalist style of ‘Alohilani Resort Waikiki Beach is both soothing and impressive. At ‘Alohilani Resort Waikiki Beach, guests step into an oasis of calm, where local culture and cuisine provide a glimpse of traditional Hawaii amidst a glittering 21st-century city.

We loved the location and our room. It was a little pricey, but we were very comfortable. The hotel restaurants were delicious and we were able to walk everywhere! The only issue we had was with concierge. Everytime we wanted to book a car or tour, the staff member would grill us so hard to sit through a 90 minute promo for a time share. It was incredibly uncomfortable to decline and put a sour taste in our mouths. Eventually, anytime we wanted help, we figured it out on our own. But otherwise, we loved the bar, pool, and overall location.

Excellent location, close to Waikiki beach and ABC store.Wonderful staff with excellent service. Great food and the Momosan barLoved the daily activities.My family absolutely loved it! We really enjoyed our stay at Alohilani :)

I spent one night at Alohilani and had a great time. It's in a great location, the pool was beautiful and not too crowded and the breakfast buffet was delicious (so many options!). Staff was all very friendly and helpful.

This is third time we have picked this hotel because of it’s a wonderful, beautiful hotel. They have a beautiful 5th floor infinity pool and hot tub next to it. Below the pool & hot tub is great place to hang out with several couches and chairs and fire pits. It has Marimotos restaurant and they added Momos this year were you can get a good lunch or dinner. Across the street is the beach. It’s a couple blocks from the international market which has lots of stores and a wide selection of food! We have stayed at the Royal Hawaiian but they haves tiny pool and a lot less night life. Cheers‍♂️

I have never stayed in a hotel this bad. We checked in and it took an hour because they claimed we owe them $300 when in reality we prepaid true whole trip which included all the fees. The lady checking us in wouldn’t get the manager and only got the manager once we were frustrated. Tiffany the waitress was rude and we couldn’t deal with her we told her to just stop and at that point she was surprised someone told her to stop being rude. No room service or any kind of service, the staff aren’t equipped with dealing with clients or have any previous customer service experience. This hotel is a nightmare to deal with! Couldn’t even provide up my Uber order or get me scissors. The staff was so rude That I had to tell them not to speak to me in that toneZ Your better off staying at Sheraton or Hilton and spending another couple of hundred dollars rather then dealing with this hotel. I would never comeBack wish I gave it no stars.

Lovely hotel. Great staff and excellent service. The pool is amazing, it's a great spot to relax if the beach is busy or if you want to relax on a free beach chair instead of the sand. Our room was spacious and relaxing, wifi had excellent reception and room was clean and had everything we needed. Overall would definitely recommend staying here if you're visiting Waikiki.

This hotel was very clean, modern & met all our needs. The buffet breakfast was so fresh & changed daily. The hotel features an amazing pool, tennis court, gym facilities, restaurants & I will be staying here again.

We had a nice time here at this resort. We live on Maui and frequent Honolulu at least 3X a year Checking out different hotels every time. It was nice to see your new hotel on the strip close to the zoo, oceanfront and w/ a rooftop pool. Since we do like to frequent other properties we probably will not be back but if there are special kama’aina deals for people who live in the islands then maybe we will return. Some items to be addressed: Pool needs to be warmerGet rid of that tacky slushee Maitai machine - gross tasting! Pool loungers should be complimentary if not sold out. Saw empty day after day was getting quite annoyed. Hot tub was unComfortably loud with a terrible slurping sound. Not relaxing at all.

The resort has undergone a full makeover and definitely puts it up there with the more renowned hotels in Honolulu. The views from the infinity pool area were a photographers dream. Restaurants, especially the Japanese located on the main strip opposite the beach was sensational. A gestation of flavours that would satisfy any top food critic.

Everything was amazing, the staff we so accommodating and polite... true aloha. I felt valued there as a customer! The room we stayed in was recently renovated and really nice. My overall experience went beyond my expectations. I will definitely be back!

Hotel is modern, clean and beautiful. Valet service was great, large, open drop off area. Rooms were nice and clean but a little on the smaller side. Pools are nice but get very crowded. Staff was friendly and helpful.

We stayed at this resort with a baby and 3 adults and found it very family friendly. The amenities such as the pool and dining areas were lovely and clean.The location was right across from the beach and a 5-10 minute walk down to the main strip. There were no issues with noise congestion from the streets.Only issue I found was prior to our stay, it took staff more than 5 business days to respond to my enquiries/requests for a cot and microwave which made it frustrating to prepare and pack for the trip.

We booked this holiday through a travel agent so everything was paid upfront, Hower upon check in they requested our credit card to charge a one off fee of $300 for incidentals. However throughout the course of 3 days I noticed irregular and significant charges being put on the credit card all in all a total off $5000 was deducted. After we queried the service desk several managers without much result, we dealt with Adrian Perez who took the initiative to solve the issue. It did however take 48hours to get the money back, and we lost almost two days trying to solve the issue with our credit card provider.The hotel has recently being renovated and the lobby looks amazing, unfortunately that’s about it.The bathroom was tiny, no room service, no mini bar. The pool area is always over crowded and the pool not all that impressive. It does have a great gym.The refund for the incidentals will take 3 to 4 weeks so I am hopeful that this goes through without a hitch.

They call looking at ocean in little from corner of the belcony as a full ocean view room which they charge extra so just take the standard room and ocean is right cross the street. We just wasted extra money to get a tiny ocean view luxury.

Lobby is vast and open. Rooms are nicely done, view I'm sure makes a huge difference. It is not a new five star resort so ceilings are low and tubs are foot deep. Overall - not a bad place. I would stay there again. There are not that many new hotels on Wikiki to chose from. Ritz is nice but different price range. So for my $ I would go back to Alohilani.

Hotel was brand new renovated but the bathroom was way too small, Amy was nice enough to upgrade our room to the TOP floor. Staff was all very nice and helpful, we had dinner at Asia Morimoto, it just cannot compare to the one in Napa.

The website shows a luxury resort but the hotel offers basic rooms, basic room amenities, a dark and crammed semi-chic pool overlooking a street. Checked in for a night and checked right out. Excellent tourist-class hotel in a somewhat decent location. Some of the staff very welcoming and trying hard, but something is off.

This was a beautiful hotel. It was so clean and the staff was really nice. My only complaint was that they allowed kids at the pool even though there was a separate kiddie pool. The pool ambiance was really not appropriate for kids.
user_name:
Michelle D
San Francisco, United States

review_body: So on my first day (very jet lagged) I left my almost brand new designer sunglasses at the pool. I knew exactly where too. They were found by pool staff & handed in. Most often items are lost & never found but Alohilani obviously has honest friendly & attentive staff!! Thank you so much, so impressed. On the hotel refurb, I was concerned but pleasantly surprised. Decor is stunning!!! Bathrooms were still meh..... tiny & shower curtains not impressive. Wouldn’t hurt to supply shower gel & some simple amenities like water, cotton buds, wipes etc. Beds & pillows are so comfortable, rooms are clean, our view is stunning Ocean Diamond Head Views from the 36th floor. Loved the pool area, such a great holiday chill vibe. Nikki was fantastic accomodating a group of 11 & finding sun beds for us all. Stunning infinity pool.Location is great too except can be a little confronting seeing so many homeless people on the promenade when walking to beach / shopping district & quite scary at night. So sad really. I’m not understanding any of the negative reviews as we have had nothing but positive here at Alohilani, decor is beautiful, staff are amazing. I would definitely recommend

Excellent service from a warm and friendly team who were never too busy to help and always welcoming. What a magical experiencee was had for a family holiday. Mahalo for the service & experience.We'll be back.

I paid for 2 ocean view king room we checked in at 630pm and checked out around 7am the following morning. So getting a view I guess really wouldn't of mattered. But I paid for it and I received a view of building roof, building structure and parking garage. Rooms are small, bathrooms are small but thank god they had a heated toliet seat. Beds are super comfortable, resort fee is a joke especially for us not sure what it is for just another way to create bs revenue. 38.00 to valet the vehicle per day and 30.00 if you self park.
It is a very lovely place.Employees are also very kind.The room is also very clean.It is close to the Waikiki coast and close to the zoo.The high floor has excellent views.I want to visit again. :)

It was a little disappointing with the hotel provisions. We had to call for kettle, shower cap, slippers, bath robes, tooth brushes and cups. And the bathtub was grey in color at the bottom. The breakfast spread has been the same for the past three mornings, and I am dreading for the next two mornings. A lot of corners were cut if this is really to be considered a 5-star hotel.

Resort had amazing attributes like the pool deck and lobby - however some of the money put into these could have been better spent by adding a few more design features into the room. Washroom/ shower were very small and there were no minimal amenities in room (no wine glasses, no water in room, etc.) Staff were friendly and location great!

The Alohilani has recently been fully refurbished (their grand opening was in May 2018) and it shows. Beautiful entry and foyer plus stylish bars and restaurants plus the huge aquarium. From the time we arrived during the very early morning the staff were wonderful. They gave us an early check-in to our room on the 32nd floor with a view of Diamond Head and the ocean, it doesn't get better than that. The room was tastefully decorated and fitted out. It had a pod coffee machine (not a great fan of the coffee though, but we are fussy Australians when it come to coffee). The only fault, if I am to make one, is the lack of a kettle and toaster, but it's certainly not a deal breaker.Location is superb. Walk out of the lobby and you're at the beach. It's far enough away from the bustling middle of Waikiki, yet on a few minutes walk to it. Perfect on both counts.The pool area is fabulous with an infinity pool plus another pool for children. There is plenty of lounging area plus the bar and it's seating. There are also cabanas you can hire for that perfect relaxing environment.There is free wifi, which in my opinion is a must these days (any hotel that charges you for wifi are ripping you off)There is an ABC store in the hotel for all your needs plus the famed Morimoto Asia restaurant and it's cheaper sibling Mosoman. Both were delicious. Our check-out was in the early hours of the morning (4am) and again the reception staff was terrific and the Concierge was very helpful weighing our luggage for us (we had to double check after our extra purchases during our holiday that we didn't exceed our limit).All in all I would thoroughly recommend the Alohilani and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

CONSPool never heated - can’t swim in it on most days. Happy hour menu sucked. Staff had no idea what was on Happy Hour either (there is no menu so make sure to ask) No one ever goes to the bar at night from outside the hotel, nothing going on at Swell. Kinda sad for how beautiful the pool setting is.Only a buffet option for breakfast for $39- no a la cart available. Why limit your guests to buffet only?Only options of Asian or Asian for restaurants(Asian fusion or ramen). Bathroom in room was not nice - very very small. In room TV was basic cable. Stayed for 10 days and no staff tried to get to know us. Also could not get a late check out.The hotel is a 3 star dressed up as a 4.Charge a $35 resort fee - would love to know what that actually goes towards.. PROsModern, new hotel. Great location. Had a great view of Diamond Head and partial ocean.Toiletries were nice quality Cute activities around hotel dailyAmazing gym facilities - modern gym, workout classes included, rooftop TRX gym station, tennis courts, baseball batting areaIf staying more than 5 days, I would highly recommend the city bike program, BIKI bikes. We paid $15 for unlimited 30 min rides for a month. Used the bikes to get around Waikiki, go explore Chinatown and Honolulu city :)

It was an amazing place. The service was great and the staff was very nice specially the cleaning staff. They did a great job. The room was great and had a great view. Location was great. The pool was really nice.

Beautiful hotel but lots of hits and misses. The positives - great foyer and wonderfully modern rooms. Clean and well appointed in the bedroom and mostly in the bathroom (will come back to that later). The hotel was most helpful to store a piece of luggage for us while we were travelling to another island but this was against their usual practice (very odd) but when I got the hotel manager involved he was most helpful. The pool and pool deck is amazing and their staff works really hard as serving their guests and are just wonderful and attentive. The daily resort fees means you can take as many beach towel as you need either for the pool or down to the beach just across the road. Also having a laundry onsite is a great convenience for the hotel guests.As for the negatives unfortunately there are many -1. No room service. For a 5 star hotel we are absolutely astounded by this.2. Bathroom amenities - no shower caps nor q-tips. This may be a tiny thing but other 4 star hotels supply this as standard. This comes across as stingy and mean from a hotel who is charging a lot of money.3. Attention to detail part 1 - we tipped housekeeping well each day but had to ask for shampoo and conditioner twice during our 6 day stay.4. Attention to detail part 2 - there was no service/info book in the room. We had no idea what facilities was available in the hotel as there was no information in the room. No idea where the fitness club was, which floor was the pool deck. what time is breakfast being served, where is the laundry? NOTHING.. You had to ring the front desk each time you have a question.. not very satisfactory nor efficient. 5. Staff engagement seems low - other than the pool staff and the front desk, they don't seem to be too happy to greet guests. Perhaps they are a bit over-worked?6. Breakfast quality and choice was poor - we did have breakfast one morning with two free vouchers. If we had this as an added extra to our daily room rate we would not have been very happy. One of the most unimaginative unexciting buffet breakfast we have ever experienced in a 5-star hotel. Again all the serving staff was so glum and non-friendly it was just sad.7. This is a big one and I have left it till the very end. I visited the hotel concierge desk to enquire about renting a car and obtaining a few day tour information and while the staff member was looking up the info to give me a quote another member of staff injected himself into the conversation and started to offer me discounted rates to any of the tour bookings if I would spend some time attending a session and listen to a presentation on other available resorts and their offerings - ie "other timeshare apartment/hotels"!!! Basically this man was trying to use this hotel to sell other timeshare deals. I can tell the original staff member was not happy nor comfortable with this and he did not engage at all with the second man. I have never been in a high-end hotel where they would allow this to cheapen the entire customer experience. I was so shocked and surprised I never returned to the concierge desk again. This is such a shame as we were warned about these time-share discount deals on the street of Waikiki but we never expected to have to deal with in our own hotel by one of their own staff!Overall - we did love our room and the hotel is beautiful. We just wish they spend some time fixing the little things and it would be just a magical place to be.

We island hopped over from Kauai (where we live) to Oahu for the weekend to watch Bruno Mars in concert and stayed at the 'Alohilani for 2 nights. We watched a couple of YouTube videos on the resort before we arrived (because we are vloggers) to get an idea of what the hotel would be like. The resort was so much more than we expected. So clean, fresh, new and inviting. They did such a great job renovating this property! The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating. This is our new go-to hotel when staying on Oahu. We would definitely recommend to friends and family!

Had a 4 night stay recently and the hotel was perfect, Loved the big Aquarium wasvery special,Very clean hotel and staff where Awesome, Would stay again and without a doubt would reccomend this hotel.

Do not ever stay in this hotel unless you can afford to stay in their premier rooms. We are stuck in this musty smelling room with a view of garbage cans and a parking lot. The smallest bathroom I’ve seen and even though requested a tub not able to provide such a thing. The pictures online look like paradise. The reality is much different.

This is our second time staying at the Alohilani. Both times we were so impressed with the service and amenities provided for families. The restaurants are great choices for families that want a "fancy" yet kid friendly dining experience. We also loved the O Bar. Perfect lounge spot for our kids while the adults got to taste some delicious cuisine and enjoy a glass of wine. The pools are perfect. The location is great since its right next to the beach, zoo, and International Marketplace. Love this hotel!

This was my 3rd trip to Hawaii, Absolutely loved this resort. Great Location, Rooms were lovely and clean. Pool was great. Walking distance to everywhere was nice and quiet. Had a ocean view room and was the best thing to wake up to.

This hotel and all the staff are incredible. Our stay consisted of relaxing by the pool, beach and venturing out for activities. at all these times the staff where so helpful and accommodating. This was the best experience i could have imagined

The staff and management at Alohilant were incredible to work with for our annual gala, especially the catering manager who worked with us for several months to help pull off the event. Great team and very professional and accommodating. Our guests had a wonderful experience and we received many positive comments about how beautiful the ballroom looked, which was transformed into a white and purple themed wonderland. Highly recommend their staff (GM, Catering Mgr., Chef, etc.) if you're looking to host a special event! (Check out the rooftop bar, pool area and cabanas--not to be missed.

They didn’t have the room I booked and they tried to give me two opportunities a worst rooms with separated beds, or to pay for an upgrade also with separated beds... insane. Two hours eating in the front desk...

Well located and fully equipped - - service was fast and customer oriented - - the aquarium was so beautiful and there were activities that were fun. The beach is just across the street and the shopping is great - - poolside

Close to everything.. Near the beach and bus stops.Nice pool and lounge area, and infinity pool was very inviting.Rooms nicely furnished. Good Internet connection.Staff friendly and helpful. Would stay again.

Beautiful hotel and the OBar was the perfect location next to the famous aquarium. The food buffet was delicious and the variety satisfied all tastes. The choices were very high end with lots of seafood selections . This is a great location for a party gathering and can also be an intimate evening for a couple.

it was very nice expierence in hawaii with staying your hotel.especially, spa in pool was so nice to relaxing body from the tiredand breakfirst was sooooo nice and it's never missed and best staffs in whole

The hotel is so conveniently located on Waikiki beach as well as close to many stores and restaurants. Our room had a balcony with a partial view of the ocean, which was just amazing! The bed was medium firm and comfortable. The room was very clean and the provided collapsible water bottles that can be filled with water from fountains located in the hotel. Bathroom had no tub, but the waterfall shower head was great. They provide the brand malie for toiletries and a complimentary Mai Tai drink during the stay, which is a nice touch. The swell bar and pool on the 5th floor is an excellent way to hang out with people or lounge around. Pricey, but we loved our stay and would book again.

Kapena is a very disrespectful and unprofessional employee of this hotel and if you come to this hotel you will feel nothing but disgust as he is one of the first people you will see while going into the hotel. If you plan on paying money to stay at a nice hotel and see the beautiful oceans go to another hotel where the employees with treat you with Aloha and Love. KAPENA if you do not enjoy your job in a customer based industry then leave but do not ruin it for others!!

First off, it looked nice but somewhat sterile. Lacking greenery and images or paintings on walls etc. To me is was a cheap fit out... albeit nice enough. It was as a reasonable location and close to one end of the main Waikiki Beach. Not great for local shops or cafes, you need to walk a wee way for that.Having two restaurants nearby at the end of the hotel was great but they are not IN the hotel. Those were good but expensive if your money conscious. The food inside the hotel was highly average as was the settings. The hotel had no room service - this absolutely shocked me and highly annoying since after midnight the ABC store nearby is closed too. No Mini Bar even more weird... this is the USA and that is not at all an American thing to do. They are normally all about service and to me this was highly lacking. Staff were so so, one minute good like concierge, but some desk staff not so good.Pool area cluttered for the amount of people in the Hotel, possibly too small.If it was not for the beach and two japanese restaurants i would have moved after a day. Not my idea of a Waikiki holiday with the service and ammenities lacking as they were.

Great hotel and good facilities, just lacking the maps to find the pool, laundry, spa and eateries. Information displayed in lift not correct and welcome drink not received. ABC shop on bottom floor really good to shop at, breakfast items cheap and walk straight to the beach.

Alohilani is an amazing place with really good location, friendly and professional staff, and a nice overall settings. The only problem with this place is the price that does not match the expectations you have in mind while you reserve.

Staff was amazing! The free classes the resort offered were great (well, I guess it’s not free when you think about the resort charge...) Location was great, cross the street and you’re on the beach, lots of food nearby, you could walk to shopping etc.If you know a lil about Hawaii you probably know it’s expensive, so I’m not gonna fuss about how pricey every lil thing like food, parking, drinks etc is, just know you gotta have some shmoney.Room was always clean, I have no clue what kind of sorcery they use to get the sand out but they did and they have great toiletries available.All in all I would stay again and I would recommend it.If you wanna see pics I’m @ brokeassgirltravel on all social ✨
user_name:
Broke Ass Girl T
Kansas City, Missouri

review_body: This was not the original hotel we booked for our one week visit to Honolulu but it was quite lovely. The strong points were the gorgeous pool area with upholstered, umbrella-ed seating by the bar, the lobby bar with the endlessly fascinating aquarium, and the attached award winning Japanese restaurant. Our room had two excellent(and I mean excellent) queen beds with feather pillows, a small table with two chairs, a huge TV on the dresser and an Asian toilet which provided much entertainment. We had quite a spacious balcony and a limited sea view. Our air-conditioning worked perfectly and the room was spotlessly cleaned. We had only two negative comments, being no clock/radio and no room service. I'm sure there was a logical-to-the-hotel reason for this but these are both essential to me. We weren't positioned quite where we wanted to be on Kalakaua but we learned the city buses ran both ways on Kuhio, just one street away. We received a bit of special service when we mentioned it was both our birthdays during our visit. I would definitely stay here again.

The location and appearance of the resort was exceptional. The staff and service were very friendly and helpful. The rooms and lobby were always immaculatey presented.Couldn't fault anything at all with the overall experience.

We loved this hotel. We were lucky to be upgraded after they initially assigned us a double queen room instead of the King size we booked. All credit to them, they reassigned us to a wonderful king size room on the 17th floor to make up for the error. They delivered a beautiful fruit platter, bubbles and two monogrammed Bubbly glasses which we were told we could keep as a momento of the holiday, The staff were lovely, the pool area was classy and a great spot to watch the sunset. We received breakfast boxes each morning as part of the deal which gave us a pastry, scrambled eggs, bacon and fresh fruit. A great start to the day. Awesome central location across the road from the beach and near to excellent shopping.The room was very clean and the bed was super large and really comfortable. The bathroom was rather compact but clean and perfectly adequate. I wouldn't say luxurious but a really comfortable stay, well positioned and very clean. Would certainly consider again as an option if we could get a good deal on price as was the case. We booked via treat me luxury escapes which was$2700nz for 6 nights. They did try to add a resort fee at reception but I argued that we had paid that as part of our deal because that is what I was told when I booked. It was all inclusive. Watch out for that as this also happened at The Modern Hotel and I think believe this is very normal. Make sure when you book any hotel via any of the sites that you are not going to get stung an additional resort fee. Double check you are being charged an all inclusive fee.

Walking down Waikiki, I came across this gem with my fiancé. After a long day, we went straight to the bar for some drinks and food. The whole staff made us feel welcomed even though we weren’t hotel guests there. We sat at the bar and got tended to by Jarrison. He was so friendly, made great conversation, and his smile was very contagious! The drinks and recommendations he made for us were perfect. Our favorite was the Kalakaua smash. The food here was great also. On top of that you get a view of Waikiki beach which makes you realize that you’re enjoying every second of your vacation. I will be back here next year and as a hotel guest! Hopefully our favorite bartender will be there too!

Pool is gorgeous with an even more gorgeous view of the beach... buildings do cover the entire landscape but what’s visible of the Waikiki Beach is wonderful! Of course with a beautiful view and beautiful weather comes a beautiful drink and that’s what we got!! Our bartender, Jarrison, was friendly and funny yet professional the entire time. He made us feel comfortable and gave us great recommendations around the island to visit. Our drinks looked amazing and tasted even better. He recommended the egg salad sandwich and it was something I’ve never experienced definitely worth a try! Wish I saved a pic of them but I only snapchatted it. Liked this place a lot and thanks to Jarrison for being our bartender that day!

The Alohilani was the perfect place for our recent trip to Honolulu. I prefer hotels/resorts with unique personality/ambiance & tend to stay away from the major hotel chains. Waikiki in particular seems overrun by these mega-properties, most of which have been there for years and some of which look quite dated. I was excited to find the Alohilani & learn that it was recently renovated. Almost everything was top notch. The service was great all around. Jane, who checked us in, diligently searched to find us the best room available (and managed a free upgrade on room type). Everyone at the pool (and pool bar) provided great service, offering us extra towels or anything else we might need. Even the staff we would pass in the lobby, halls or elevators were very friendly and offering of assistance. The room was of good size, the beds were comfortable, the amenities nice (big tv, mini fridge, plenty of toiletries, Keurig coffee, etc.). Our view, a Diamond Head Overview on the 28th floor was spectacular. The hotel lobby was pretty spectacular. Location also very ideal; close to everything but just far enough from the craziness of central WaikikiHaving said all the good, I want to add a few caveats (not really negatives, just things to be aware of). The hotel bills itself as a 5*, which is quite a stretch. No turn down service, no room service, no mini bar, paper cups (not ceramic mugs) for coffee. There was also a general lack of information/documentation in the rooms. Where is the ice machine? Where do I get water for the flasks? Pool hours? Schedule of activities? None of this information was provided. Much of it was on signage near elevators & such but when you are hauling suitcases at check in you aren't exactly catching all those details. There should at least be a binder of services in the rooms. These things don't really matter much to me but should be noted.One other consideration worth mentioning is the room categories. As many others have pointed out, these can be a little deceptive. "Ocean View" rooms are on the sides of the building(s) pointing toward the city with the ocean visible at an angle. "Ocean Front" rooms, of which there are very few, are the only rooms directly facing the ocean & the rates for those rooms are substantially higher.
