We were fortunate to get a good room with a good view on a higher floor. Overall, we loved our stay & would definitely stay there again. Highly recommended!

Newly renovated hotel on the southern end of Waikiki. Impressive entrance and lobby gets you in the right vacation mindset. Front desk staff is welcoming and quickly checked us into the hotel. The ocean view rooms were spacious and clean with a lanai that provided a partially obstructed view of the beach/ocean. The walls are a bit thin and conversations in the adjacent room can be easily heard, but the large comfortable bed and large LCD TV made it a perfect place to get some rest after a long day shopping, exploring, or laying out at the beach or pool. The pool area was a bit crowded so get their early for the loungers, it is likely the nicest in Waikiki with a large inifinti pool, hot tub, and kids pool. The fitness center is actually a membership club with great with modern equipment and machines. The location is great, a short walk to the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and plenty of options nearby to shop or eat. Traffic can be bad but its location helps to avoid some of those problems being on the southern end near the zoo (which also has some cheaper or free parking options).Areas of improvement, guest services was difficult to reach from the room and many bathroom amenities were available only on request. I had a rude encounter with the Bell Desk who was visibility annoyed with an inquiry. I ended up asking the neighboring Hyatt Regency Bell Desk for the same information. A great option but with so many options at that price point, I am likely to try others the next time I visit given the issues I encountered with Guest Services and thin walls.

Our family visits at least twice a year and this is our preferred hotel. It’s convenient in so many ways!!! Located close to Waikiki beach, our favorite musube spot, an ABC store on site and has 2 family friendly pools. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. My kids know Adrian by name and come looking for him once we arrive. After each stay, I try to find an excuse to book again!

We just left after a three night stay and were so impressed by the quality and location of this hotel. It has a classy and modern, sophisticated feel as soon as you walk in. The guest service agents at front desk were so kind and friendly. Our room was a partial ocean view, but that meant we got to see the city and mountains on one side too, so we were very happy. We looked at a ton of properties before booking and this one is the best. We literally took the elevator down and were at the beach in seconds. It was convenient for shopping and restaurants too. The pool and pool bar were very nice, though I will say cocktail service was a bit slow. Our only negative experience was with one of the concierges, she was quite rude and seemed to want us to leave as soon as we stepped up to ask a few questions. She was the only negative staff interaction we had, everyone else was friendly and helpful.

Very updated resort! If you spend time at the pool, you will need to get up there early to get a lounge chair. AND .. if you do get up there early, bring your breakfast as they do not serve breakfast on the pool deck. For those of you who stay in the beachfront building, the pool is on Floor #5 (there are no signs). You may have to ask where it is. The restaurant in the hotel IS AMAZING (Mosimoto).

Unpleasant experienced at hotel O Bar. Staff was rude and wasn’t really wanna help me. Overall satisfied hotel’s amenities especially the fitness room. I enjoyed my room very clean and partial ocean and Diamond Head view.

Very nice hotel renovation, lobby and public areas are well done. Beautiful windowed fish tank in lobby bar. Breakfast buffet did not disappoint. Pool deck and bar are well appointed. Pool water was cold for me and I missed it being beach-side but I understand this is not typical in Waikiki.

I come to Waikiki often on business and with all the recent strikes I wanted to find somewhere new and quiet and I am so delighted I found Alohilani! With business travel I usually try and use points but this was worth it!!!!!! The rooms are so spacious and modern for Waikiki and I got a complimentary upgrade to ocean view room upon check in which was an incredible surprise, the free mai tai vouchers at check in were a great touch as well. I visited the pool deck one day and Nikki was INCREDIBLE, she made sure our experience was anything but ordinary. We had the perfect pool day, insane views from the pool deck and such amazing hospitality from Nikki and team. The pool menu for food and drink did not disappoint either! I also wanted to mention the location!!!!! Insane views of the ocean/Diamond Head depending on where you are. 30 second walk to the beach or a few minutes walking to anywhere in Waikiki. I also loved momosan and morimoto right on hotel property, they were delicious and soooo convenient. I am anxiously awaiting my next business stay here in this modern chic hotel and can’t wait to see Nikki again at the pool!!! I love the Alohilani!

The location is a great, the beach is right across the street. Self parking option is available and easy to find the parking spot. The pool is a little small for the size of the hotel. The room size is comfortable.

The hotel is at a great location and the room is clean, reasonable size and bright. If you are sensitive to noise, ask for a higher floor. The staff at check was very pleasant, pool staff just OK. I just wished that the bathroom would have K-tips, shower cap, etc... The soap was very nice, but my son forgot his shaving and I asked for those cheap discardable razors. They looked at me like I was crazy- no they did not have them! Not a big deal, we could buy at the ABC stores, but for the price we paid, did not included breakfast and they were just missing small details of convenience, especially as being rate at a 5 stars. Also, please have the beach towels more convenient located, like at the lobby. We had to go to the pool area to get them.

Me & Channing have gone back twice in September & October for Halloween. Just a beautiful hotel right in front of Waikiki beach. We got the ocean view room. We love it! The staff is awesome, pay attention to details & super friendly. We spent the most time at the infinity pool. Suzie & Stephanie at Swell the pool area were wonderful servers. Had them both times. They are customer oriented & just take great care of us. We would come back again just for them. You got to ask for them if you go there & also rent the chairs in the infinity pool it’s so worth it ($10 half day/ $20 all day). There is no room service but it encourages you to get out of the room & there is plenty of yummy places in & around the hotel to choose from.

Unfortunately the pool bar staff were completely unproffessional allowing their freinds and relatives to enjoy the facilities. My husband didn't sign off the tab which we didn't realise was a problem as they had our room number however this was percieved as avoiding a tip and from then on the pool staff didn't serve us, laughed and made derisive comments. After this was escalated to the duty managers on 3 occassions - after nothing was done about the behaviour I asked to see the hotel manager - he never attempted contact. The food & beverage manager offered us a complimentary cabana on our last day however we were made to feel so uncomfortable we declined. We stayed on the 10th floor which flooded and were moved after quite a while to the 15th floor of the front building. This was after an unsatisfactory room was offered a room in the back building, which had noisy aircon and not as nice. My silk dresses were water damaged however the hotel had them drycleaned (on checking the bill they charged me but upon me asking they promptly removed the charge). The hotel holds significant funds against your credit card and only releases them after 2-3 weeks - be warned. The managers who were pleasant but lacked leadership and competency. Be careful not to stay on the 5th floor as this is where the entry to the pool area is and would be very noisy plus smelled damp. The food at the O Bar and service was great. The front seascape building is the best and would stay in even numbers as the view is better.

All the previous complaints made here still apply- poor pool service, events being held in the pool area and no sound proofing in rooms and mediocre staff. Shame really could be a great hotel but it seems feedback just receives the generic responses and no action

If you’ve ever been to Waikiki Beach or Honolulu you know that a vast majority of the hotels (including the 5 star resorts) are tired and dated at best. I know that cost of labour, materials and goods are are a few reason why but with over 9 million people visiting the Hawaiian islands every year I’m always surprised at this. Last week my partner and I visited Waikiki and were pleasantly surprised by a gamble we took on a booking a newly renovated hotel called ‘Alohilani Resort Waikiki Beach (formerly Pacific Beach Hotel). Upon arrival we were immediately impressed with the extensive addition/renovations of exterior of the property. Urban, contemporary and chic are a few adjectives that come to mind. The hotel now looking more like W or Modern hotel nestled in the Hollywood hills than its predecessor Pacific Beach. As you drive into the vestibule you’re met with Aloha spirit valets and bellmen all offering top notch service but with that casual Hawaiian hospitality that immediately makes you feel welcome - Ohana style(family). From there you enter giant wood doors into a sweeping, spacious and contemporary lobby where you’re greeted by amazing staff at the front desk. The MOD Amy who was helping another guest overheard our check in and recognized my voice from a call I placed to her the night before, requesting a higher floor and room that had a diamond head and ocean view. Not only did Amy deliver on her promise of a great view but graciously upgraded my partner and I to a Diamond Head Seascape Corner room suite with a breathtaking view on the 25th floor(2566 to be exact) - thank you Amy! This was high touch service at its finest! The room was very well appointed in a modern yet Hawaiian style that included an updated bathroom, contemporary furniture, crisp white linens, comfy bed, fluffy pillows, modern LED flat screen, Kurig coffee maker, recyclable water bottles, amazing sitting areas and a lanai with a view to die for! Let’s talk about the pool, pool deck and bar. I want to give this a 10/10 but the only drawback is that the infinity pool was freezing cold. We were informed by pool deck staff that the heating pump wasn’t working properly and that they were working on a solution to fix it. Nonetheless we ended up at the beach each day as the ocean water was much warmer and enjoyable. Had the pool been warmer, we would’ve gladly stayed and ordered cocktails all day long! The layout of the pool deck is reminiscent of something you’d find in Los Angeles or Miami and includes high quality loungers, lounge chair covers, towels, fruit infused water etc. Secondly(and I’m hoping this is something they decide to reenforce) that there are no minors under 18 allowed into the infinity pool or jacuzzi. Before you comment on this, please know that there is a children’s pool just steps away that I sincerely feel should be kept for minors only. If your a gym/fitness lover, this hotel is for you! One of the perks included in your daily resort fees is for the Island Club and Spa. The equipment and space is truly like a smaller version of equinox! I give this a 10/10Now for the restaurants. Truth be told, we had every intention of trying both but unfortunately never did make it to either although we did hear from other guests that we made friends with and from other locals that both Momosan and Morimoto both amazing! Perhaps a guest incentive like a 20% off on your first visit would be a motivator. We did however have a few snacks poolside from swell bar which were all clever and tasty! Finally at time of check out we provided some constructive feedback over our concern for the cold temperature of the infinity pool as well a few housekeeping things(halls and rooms not being vacuumed throughout week) and our checkout agent quickly and sincerely apologized and offered to take care of the resort fees(which we didn’t even ask for). We were surprised and delighted by this gesture as we did end up paying a $50 day fee to rent chairs and umbrellas at the beach each day, and felt very compensated! Overall our stay was highly enjoyable and will definitely return to this property!

very enjoyable stay, friendly staff, very comfy beds, great pool area with great food and pool chairs overlooking ocean. Great to be able to use towels for beach. Great location. Best porters to organise taxis, transport etc

The second we arrived we were greeted with a welcome and a smile. The customer service lady on checkin asked us what was the reason for our visit. We advised we were on our honeymoon and she congratulated us and gave us an upgrade. Within 30mins of arrival we received a txt message asking if everything was ok.We arrived back to the room on the 2nd night to find champagne and strawberries for us. Concierge was lovely. She arranged airport transfer confirmation for us. Perfect location right across from Waikiki beach. We would definitely go back.Thank you so much for an unforgettable experience.

Lovely hotel in the middle of all the action! Great fun place to just relax after a long flight to Hawaii. Loved sitting on our balcony, cocktail in hand watching the street life and beach below. The staff was welcoming and very helpful. Did not eat at their on site restaurant, but it looked very inviting. Loved the nightlife in the area. Comfy bed and overall great hotel. Seemed very safe! Want to return some day.

We checked in for our honeymoon at an oceanfront room with a balcony and we were not impressed with the quality of the room. The bathroom was EXTREMELY small and we went down to the front desk to see if we could be moved but front desk didn't seem to understand our request. We decided to leave. Besides the quality of the room, the hotel does look like a fun place.

Great location in the heart of Hawaii, the property is exceptional with its décor and includes a great range of daily activities on offer for young and old. Includes a kids pool away from the adults pool which was a nice solution for all.

I must say, I wasn't thinking of spending 5 days there at first. I changed my mind after spending a day in there. If you are in the military looking to use TLA, I have to recommend this place. I used 5 days of my remaining departure TLA Here and I must admit the experience have been nothing but wonderful. Everything in this hotel looks elegant and luxurious. They have plenty of things to do there for guests. Lei flower making, infinity pool, jacuzzi, movie under the sky while lounging or swimming in keiki pool. Decent price foods and drinks in the bar makes it an excellent choice for tourists. The staff are very friendly and welcoming. They provides free Mai Tai upon check in. Free towels and water in swimming area. Unlimited soft drinks after first purchase. Rooms are spacious and excellent even for partial oceanview. I tried both the king bed room and the two queen size beds and both work incredibly beautiful. Parking for government rate includes 50% off making the cost only $15 a day which I must say is another excellent gesture by the hotel. Rooms have keurig coffee/green tea maker which is an added plus. The lobby were incredible in my opinion. It's hard to explain until you actually see it for yourself. However, I can almost assure you that you will not regret your stay there. Even Hilton hotel doesn't match to this hotel in my opinion based on my recent stay with them prior of coming to this hotel. Something to add, be aware that they do have occupancy tax besides the resort tax. However, it is still worth the value and experience in my opinion.

I enjoyed my three day stay. I had a easy check in and checkout.Everything right at your finger tips. Breakfast was $33.00 for the Buffett. There is also a store in the building called ABC that sells anything you might need during your stay. The beach is footsteps away from the hotel.

Room: I booked oceanview double. The view did not disappoint. Had a great view of the ocean from the balcony-perfect for watching the sunrise. Do note that the pool is on the 5th floor so if your rooms are close by, the music from the pool will not be a relaxing experience for you. The bathtub drainage could use some work but otherwise the bathroom is clean-their soaps are luxurious and the sizes do not disappoint. Some guests don't know how to be courteous and will let doors slam-that can get annoying, especially when such behavior is accompanied by wine-loving cruise-ship ladies. Also, the doors have a bit of a gap so lot of noise enters from and to hallway. You need to request slippers-they're so soft and fluffy. Wish they had a robe... I usually have back pain when I sleep but during my entire time at Alohilani, I never had any back issues. I slept like a corpse-very relaxing!Pool-If you're coming from the Beach Tower, get off at 5th floor and go through the door marked "Exit". That's how you can get to the pool without having to go through the lobby to get to the pool through the other tower. This is also where you go to pick-up towels to use at the beach.Hotel: Cross the street, the beach is there. Love the lagoon-like walls-keeps excess waves out and it's very non-swimmer/kid friendly. The water's clear and clean enough you'll see some fish here and there (I've had better luck here than trying to find fish at Hanauma). Eats: Plenty of eateries nearby. Eggs n Things is over-hyped, not worth the wait. Go to Cheeseburger in Paradise for cheaper breakfast deal. Isayuma Musubi is nearby as well for a quick bite. Momosan Waikiki's ramen is better than what I expected-it's not the most authentic Japanese ramen but it is enough for my very-American palate.Staff: Everyone is amazing. I had put in note that I was here for my birthday weekend. They had chocolate-covered strawberries and wine delivered to my room with personal note. Whatever requests I had, the housekeeping attend to it within minutes. Front desk is always friendly and helpful. Utilize the Concierge services. I wanted to horseback ride but the one I tried to book was already packed. The Concierge introduced to me a lesser-known program and was able to book a slot for me, all in less than 10 minutes. We ended up having a private-like experience. They're very knowledgeable about the programs they introduce you to.

The hotel has a fantastic location close to the beach and in walking distance to shops and amenities. Staff are so professional helpful and friendly, always willing to assit you. They make you feel so welcome and go out of their way to make sure you have an amazing holiday. They assisted us as to where we need to go to get our tours and are very knowledgeable about what you can do or are willing to find out. Amenities are outstanding OBar has great atmosphere with coffee, drinks and very relaxing atmoshere. The aquarium gives a very relaxing feel. The Swell bar and pool area caters for your every need.They even have a kids pool and play area. We tried all the eating places and all had fantastic food and service. Having the ABC shop in the hotel makes it very convenient to get snacks and caters for all your needs.We highly recommend the hotel and we will be coming back as they made our holiday so amazing. Thank you to everyone at the hotel for making our stay so wonderful.

We had booked a post cruise hotel with Regent cruise line at Waikiki, the hotel was the Royal Hawaiian. However, Regent was right on top of things and changed hotels for us when they discovered some Waikiki hotels were just hit with a massive labor strike and the Royal was included. They weren't exaggerating either--- Wow, one group was in front of the Westin Moana Surfrider and they must have numbered over 200. These folks are pretty rhythmic, so with real drums, plastic 5 gallon gas jugs and other makeshift musical instruments they really do a job. Particularly when some of them lead a chant or singing. You know you are getting close to the action blocks away.So Regent had gotten us into a very nice waterfront hotel that was not on strike. Good on them. This hotel, the Alohilani Resort. We ported in Honolulu just before dawn, so we got to the resort very early in the morning because these cruise lines usually like to kick you off the ship as soon as possible to make room for the new load coming on board before noon. But we were fortunate in that the Alohilani said they could put us in a room right then, however, if we wanted to wait some time in the lobby they could find a better view for us. Hey, we took them up on the right now offer and certainly couldn't complain. Nice sized balcony, looking right at Diamond Head not that far away and lots of ocean view to the right. So the rays of the setting sun were right on Diamond Head which is pretty colorful that time of day. The Alohilani has recently been greatly refurbished with a name change and all. It is very clean, modern, quiet, with a staff that certainly is very friendly and very accommodating in every way. The room itself was about average size for a high end hotel, and the bathroom was mediocre. Air conditioner took a little getting used to but it was okay. Beds were super. The buffet breakfast was complimentary under the package we had, however, it was a full hot breakfast and perhaps the best prepared we ever had in a hotel. The T.V. was huge with a large selection of channels including our favorite news channel MSNBC. A year ago we got stuck in a La Quinta Hotel in Boulder, Colorado that didn't have MSNBC, I wrote to them about it and they said they would take in "under advisement" LOL. The Alohilani and complex is adjacent to Kalakaua Avenue which is adjacent to Waikiki Beach. We enjoyed the first day at the hotel but on the second day our flight didn't leave until shortly after 10:00 PM. Check out time was 11:00 AM. I went down to the desk to discuss this, believing we could maybe negotiate a few hours more in the room. Fortunately, they have a rate structure which allows a lot more, $30.00 per hour or $60.00 until three in the afternoon, or $100.00 until six in the evening. We took the six, giving us two entire days in the hotel and on Waikiki. Only hotel I've ever ran into this lenient. The lobby is large and modern with a huge two story aquarium that has windows all over the place. I actually felt pretty sad having to leave this hotel and Hawaii. We would have stayed longer but had to get back home and get ready for another cruise. Hope we get an opportunity to return to the Alohilani. Thank you for a great stay.

Friends invited us to Honolulu and booked the Alohilani Hotel which had not long been refurbished and re-named.This hotel is about 3 blocks from central Waikiki, good restaurants, shopping, it provided all that we wanted, staff were more than accommodating and the small things were no trouble.I would stay again.

The Alohilani Resort Hotel is right up there among the most easy going hotels we've ever stayed at apart from two issues. 1. Avoid getting a room with adjoining doors as they are not sound proof.2. You can hear the toilets flush from the surrounding rooms.We didn't need to include breakfast as there is an ABC shop located at the front of the Hotel, a McDonald's restaurant over the road, Eggs and Things within 30 meters and a hamburger & breakfast restaurant 20 meters in the opposite direction. The Hotel turns the bar into a light breakfast eating place if you prefer to eat in.During our stay, there were three very loud protests at each of the Sheratan Hotels which were in the heart of Waikikiki Beach well out of earshot of the Alohilani. Apparently it's a nation wide protest set to last for a long time to come.All the staff were extremely kind and helpful. Monika at the concierge desk went to all lengths to organise our flight to Hilo on the Big Island for our helicopter flight over the Kilauea volcanco Round trip for the day including an open door helicopter per person was about US$450.We used Charlies Taxi's Ph: 1808 233 3333 for transfers between the Alohilani and Honolulu airport at a set price of US$29 total for four passengers.And then there's Morimoto restaurant in the Hotel which we loved returning three times during our stay.In closing, between excessive cheap shopping at the Outlets and the beach across the road, we had a ball.

This is a really good hotel, well located down at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki Beach, right near the statue of Duke. It’s a short walk to the beach and close to the important amenities.The hotel has recently reopened after a major renovation so it is all shiny and new. Fantastic aquarium in the lobby and a really nice pool with a bar that creates a lovely atmosphere, especially at sunset when they light the torches.The staff were very friendly and obliging, housekeeping was good and the level of service was high.One disadvantage is that it doesn’t offer room service, but there is an ABC store right in the hotel and plenty of eating options right on the doorstep.We will stay there again

We stayed at the hotel for 8days for our 1st time in Hawaii. The hotel location is very convenient just opposite to the beach, maccas and 5mins walk to the main shopping & restaurants area. The hotel looks awesome they have big fish tank at the Bar near reception and my daughter love looking at it everyday we walked pass. Hotel got great schedule where every Sunday night they have outdoor movie night, the kids love swimming while watching the movie. The staff and service is great. Highly recommends it and we would come back to stay again.

We had a great stay at the resort. Staff was very friendly and the place was very clean. Great location right across from Waikiki beach and restaurants. The pool and hottub were great. The pool staff were very friendly and attentive. I would recommend staying here.

The service was not particularly nice. We arrived on a wet, rainy day close to noon time. While we understand that check in time is at 3pm- which is quite late by international standards- they could have extended a bit of courtesy. There were no available seats in the lounge (because it was raining, I guess), we were told we’d have to order something to sit at the bar, they had no umbrellas they could let us use. We had to walk out in the rain to get lunch while waiting to check in. No suggestions on where we could get lunch without getting wet. Got back at 1:30 (wet and tired) and there was still no room. Girl at the check in counter rolled her eyes as I asked once again if we could finally check in. For a pricey, supposedly upscale resort, they don’t offer anything beyond what you pay for. Very basic bath amenities (no shower cap, no bathrobe), no courtesy bottle of water (they give refillable containers but you have to get water on the ground floor), no umbrellas (it does rain in Hawaii too).

This hotel was awesome, everyone in the staff treated me very well, to ensure my stay was pleasant and enjoyable. The GM took the time to met me and ensure I was happy with my stay. The director of Front Office ensure we had an awesome room, with a beautiful view, Jed the Director of Vibe, ensure I was happy with all the amenities of the hotel, and Chef David. Finally "Chico" ensured my stay was nothing less than perfect. Everyone was friendly and warm and I will recommend that this is the place to stay when in Waikiki. I will be back again.

I booked a room at the Alohilani to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. They have excellent Kamaaina deals and it was a bonus to have Morimotos and Momosan on site so we didn't have to venture far for a delicious meal. Amanda checked us in and made us instantly feel welcomed. Our room had a beautiful partial ocean view and was gorgeous. We also received drink vouchers to their bars. Five starts all around!

Most amazing resort experience we could have had in Waikiki!! Located towards the east side of main drag, we were walking distance to all of the shops, restaurants, bars and sight seeing around the area (we walk a lot back home, so it was easy for us 1-2miles leisurely). The resort makes you feel right at home and safe in the middle of the Vegas-like atmosphere of Waikiki beach. We were lucky enough to have the beachside facing rooms with 180 degree views down the shoreline. Friendly staff that is helpful and available if you need anything. We mentioned needing a bandaid and they were able to provide one immediately. Some of the amenities we found made the stay first class:- water refill stations 24/7 on first floor- towels for beach avail at front desk/pool desk- ABC store in resort- Kureig coffee machine in room that staff refills twice daily- turn down service!!!!!- mini fridge in room- cooled towels served at pool on hot days- fantastically located near lots of the Waikiki attractions- close to Diamond Head Monument if you’re up for hiking- Biki Bike rentals walking distance from the resortWe enjoyed dinner at Matsumoto’s conveniently located in the resort. Best enjoyed at sunset. Try Hula Dogs around the corner, if you’re looking for a quick bite. Shirokiya Japan Village Walk is an Uber ride away to the Ala Moana shopping center. Huge variety of Asian cuisine and $2 beers/$8 pitchers til 9:30pm. A lot of little things added over the weekend to make us feel right at home and wanting to come back as soon as possible. The friendly staff and great location is the best combo you can get in this kind of paradise.

very accessible for persons with mobility issues. ADA room was excellent (Oct18). Restroom doors are heavy & assistance may be required (as is the case for 99% of restrooms across Waikiki). Resort Staff excellent and very helpful.

check in needs to be quicker and breakfast included with room needs help. service people have to write down too much information and have to keep explaining the choices. otherwise, everything was great. loved the rooms, especially the beds. also, loved the pool and bar.

Check-in was very disappointing when we walked up to the counter with our suitcases the lady just asked us what did we what. When going to pay our room lever we were quoted $30 a night in February and they tried to charge us $35 a night. When I questioned this the girl argued with us and then told us to wait we waited for about 10 minutes and she came back on charged us the $30. When we made our booking back in February we requested a king size bed but we given a room with two queen size beds . When I ask why we have been given this rain they said they were busy and didn’t have any king size bed and that we should requested a king size bed . I said to them we could request this back in February when we made the booking . We were told there was nothing we could do because all the king-size rooms had been booked out. Once we had finalised our check-in and we were on our way to our room I realise I hadn’t said anything about a breakfast that was included when we asked reception about breakfast she told us it wasn’t included in our package and it was clearly written on our paperwork that it was . By this stage I’ve had enough and said to the girl you tried to overcharge us for our room Libby you haven’t given us a room we requested and now you’re saying breakfast is not included . I must say the Second girl that helped us out was very helpful and got us a room with a king size bed for two days later she also sort it out at breakfast and we could have breakfast every day . Besides the trouble of checking we did have a wonderful stay at the hotel and would recommend it to other people.

Great location and lovely hotel. Easy in and out for driving and easy walking to food, beach, shops etc. I was there to see my son off for a deployment and will stay again when he returns! Fitness facility great and pool area lovely. Rooms very quiet and clean.

We wanted a great experience for my first time visit and second visit for my husband, a very nice higher end of hotels instead of something minimal, this place gave it to us. We enjoyed our stay, close to all things within walking distance away or a trolley ride.

The big question for me is whether the Alohilani is a 4.5 Star or a 5 Star resort. Here are the facts: great location very near beach and shops, including an ABC store next to the lobby; the lobby itself and the huge shark tank are fantastic; helpful concierge service; good guest services including the pool bartenders (great place to hang out); very good updated room with good beds (the building itself used to be the Pacific Beach Hotel), refrigerator, Keurig coffee maker, etc., very nice gym, infinity pool; but the bathroom is very small for a 5 Star hotel, 11am checkout (you can buy extra time for $20 per hour), there is a "Resort Fee", and the ocean view from my room had a building and the church blocking much of the view. But overall its a great experience and in conclusion I'm giving the Alohilani a 5 Star review.

This was our first visit to Waikiki and when searching for accommodation, we struggled to find fresh, modern looking hotels; instead finding that our searches came back with rooms that looked liked they were stuck in 1999. Alohilani Resort was the exception with a newly completed refurbishment and a host of resort features that really appealed to us. Upon arrival our expectations were well and truly met. The staff were welcoming, the lobby was stunning with the coral artwork backdrop, and the decor and styling delivered a dreamy yet sophisticated beach vibe.Our ocean view room was decently sized, clean, well presented and comfortable. The great decor styling from the hotels main areas were also reflected in the room. Our balcony delivered a breathtaking view of the water and our king bed was very comfortable. We did notice that the rooms facing Diamond Head seemed undesirable and basically overlooked a carpark so highly recommend you pay the extra to book an ocean view or ocean facing room to reap the rewards of the outlook and cool sea breezes. Alohilani Resort is perfectly located with easy access to the beach, esplanade shopping and dining and walking paths. The ABC Store downstairs was very convenient and we opted to dine at Morimoto Restaurant located at the front of the hotel on many occasions during our stay. The pool area although beautiful, was always crowded and we found the swimming pool overrun with too many children. We did enjoy having Swell Bar by the pool and recommend the fish tacos from the menu. To note, you will need to wait awhile for service though as many (not all) staff seemed to be busy doing not much. In the late afternoon, you can take a seat in the outdoor lounge area with the sunset dropping in the background and live acoustic music playing - the perfect setting to end your day in the sun. As a final note, we stayed during Hurricane Lane and were highly appreciative of the efforts that Alohilani Resort's management and staff delivered during this period. We were kept well informed on weather updates and the team generally did their best to make the stay as enjoyable as possible given that we were advised not to leave the hotel for two days. Top marks - well done and thank you.

This is a Top Notch Hotel with very friendly and helpful staff in a great location close to transport and straight across the road from the beach. It was very clean with an excellent pool area, we would certainly stay here again if we returned............................................................................................................................................................

The hotel is at a good location, the lobby looked great, and the rooms were pretty comfortable. Things fell apart from there though. Two things to keep in mind while reading my review. 1) I booked my trip via Priceline 2) the hotel was “completely booked” due to a dentist conference being in town.  I paid extra for the “ocean view” and got the room below ( picture attached) . 1st picture is the view from the room. The second is from the balcony. I called the reception who confirmed this was indeed classified as a ocean view and NOT partial ocean view. What do you all think? I also asked for a king bed but received two “queens” which in my opinion was likely more full beds. They said sorry but the hotel is full. I couldn’t help to feel I got the short end of the stick for getting a discount on the rates by booking via Priceline.
user_name:
JasonNewyorkcity
New York City, New York

review_body: This past weekend Boys To Men Mentoring was graciously hosted by Matt Grasso, the General Manager of Alohilani Resort. Our organization was honored and wowed by the absolutely breathtaking experience; it was such a wonderful way to conclude our stay on Oahu. The Alohilani is truly a paradise within a paradise. We were also touched by the genuine care we received by the employees. Charles in the vallet was tremendously helpful when I lost an item, and everyone at the front desk was attentive and welcoming, true embodiments of the aloha spirit. We are so very very thankful to Matt Grasso and his amazing staff for supporting our local charity and being such generous hosts.

Thanks for the staff at Alohilani resort for a great stay. The service was nice and the room was clean, although slightly noisy however, it appears that is true everywhere in Waikiki. After the first night when I mentioned the noise level to the staff, they immediately tried to rectify and offered me a different room. Overall, great and worthwhile experience.

We recently spent 6 nights here in a Diamond Head Ocean View Suite - and it was a great experience. The hotel has recently been renovated and has a very fresh and modern feel. View was to die for, but the big plus for us were the pools. The kids pool was around 1m deep, so even our 3yo could walk the entire length, whilst the infinity main pool had amazing views of Waikiki Beach. The location was spot on, just a short walk to the main area of Waikiki and across the road from a great beach. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Overall this is a well priced hotel with 5 star bar and pool area. Stunning setting and quality of sun loungers etc. The new renovation is lovely and the rooms are very nicely designed with fantastic beds. The restaurant downstairs is fabulous. The gym is the best hotel gym in any country we have stayed in. The cons would be it is across the road from the beach so lots road noise and leaf blowers early morning. There are chairs and umbrellas that you can hire so no problem there ($25 for two hours). However quite a few people live in the adjacent park and are very noisy at night screaming etc. so we didn’t sleep well despite the bed being super comfy. The air conditioning despite being new is odd and quite noisy. Most staff are polite and helpful but checkin was awful with huge queues and stern staff. Needs resolving ASAP. Would I stay here again? Maybe - it is well priced and has a contemporary fitout which is very smart unlike most of the tired hotels on the beachfront (I’ve stayed in them all over the years). If you surf it’s across from Queens surf break so super handy for the surfing traveler.

My fiance & I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. I don't usually write reviews for restaurants or hotels but I couldn't help but do so, Especially during the hotel strike that is going on. We looked into a few other hotels but were glad we picked this one. Its a great bang for your buck. The staff was beyond attentive and friendly. Every single room service or maid we passed in the hallways said aloha. The food at the pool was solid, we got the BBQ pizza, and the Mia Tias were great. Also little did we know there was tennis on the roof. There was also a really nice gym that had a great mix of machines and free weights. We ended up staying in and around the hotel alot more than normal. Again for the money, you can't beat the experience, the staff, or the location.

The hotel is very modern and clean, it is literally across the street from the beach. There is an ABCstore on site for anything you could possibly need, which is very convenient. Friendly and helpful staff. I would stay there again

This place is amazing with a really hip vibe. Upon entry you are greeted with a gigantic and mesmerizing fish tank. It is from floor to ceiling. The lobby area is very comfortable and white and bright. There are several different seating areas varying from open to more private and quiet. They have a nice but small bar area and a wonderful restaurant upstairs. They also have a very nice open and fun outdoor bar area overlooking the ocean.

Beautiful property at a fair price. I would highly recommend Alohilani Resort Waikiki Beach to family and friends. The Oceanarium really adds lovely ambiance to the restaurants and lobby area. The rooms are clean and relaxing and the overall décor is modern with a touch of Hawaiian sophistication. The beach is right across the street and there's lots of amazing shopping close to the hotel.

We spend 4 nights at this hotel. The location just 1mins away from wakiki beach. And we got a free drinks at the bar. The bed is so nice and the room is big. We have our own balcony to see the wakiki beach. The endless swimming pool is awesome. We can spend whole afternoon lying around.

This is my new favorite hotel in Waikiki. The hotel is gorgeous with amazing facilities and a comfortable rooms. The staff was not only friendly but very accommodating to our needs. The bed was like a cloud, the food stellar, and the pool a dream. I will return.

We stayed here from 11 to 21 October 2018 in a partial ocean view room.While the hotel has gone through a refurbishment and it looks amazing, it definitely is not a 5 star hotel.Pros:Stylish refurbishment – very light and airyGreat location – across from the beach and within walking distance to everythingCleanGreat beds and pillowsRefillable water pouchesThe gym looked very well equipped (although we didn't use it)Cons:On check in, no information was given to us about the hotel amenities ie breakfast options, what level the pool was on, hours for the pool, where the laundry was located or that there was even tennis courts (I found this out by reading another review on here). If check in staff do not want to provide you with this information, there needs to be information packs in your room. The lifts do have screens with some of this information but quite often the lifts are very crowded and you cannot see the screens.The breakfast buffet is ridiculously priced for what it is (US$35). We either ate at restaurants outside or bought some things from the ABC store and had it in our room.In the 10 days we were there, the pool area was hired out for 4 separate events which meant we could not use it. This is not acceptable to paying guests especially when you are charging such a high "resort" fee.Too many unsupervised kids in the infinity pool. Perhaps make the infinity pool adults only?While booking some tours one afternoon, one of your staff was trying to sell us, what I can only assume, was some sort of "time share" where we could attend a "meeting" for an hour and we could get a discount on our tours. Again, totally unacceptable!! We wanted to catch The Bus to Diamond Head one morning and on another day, to Pearl Harbour. Not one person on your tour desk could tell us what number bus we had to get or where to get it from.Perhaps in the future, if people can't use the pool and would like to go to the beach, you could provide fold up chairs and/or umbrellas as part of your "resort" fee? I'm sure guests would have no issue with paying a refundable bond on the return of their chairs/umbrella? Something to think about.While I seem to have a lot of cons, overall, we had a great stay but improvements are necessary.

Perfect location for a quick swim at Waikiki beach without having to stay ocean front. Modern hotel, very friendly staff and clean rooms. A bit loud due to road noise, but still fine. Location is the main reason to visit.

Worst bed I have ever slept among hotels I stayed. I expected much better quality bed and bigger bathroom. Some site shows this hotel as 5 stars, nut it is far from it, so disappointed. The picture on the site look much better than the actual property.

WOW! The views from these rooms are amazing. Staff was great and ridiculously friendly at any time of the day. My 2 little ones loved the pool and the short walk to the beach. The lobby is one of the most beautiful lobbies I have stepped foot in. They have an aquarium in it! Overall a great family experience

Great ocean views with exceptional proximity to the beach and shops. Rooms were very clean and nice, with a decent sized balcony. Staff were very friendly in all our encounters, the pool area was a great place to spend a day - with lots of options for relaxong.

We loved our stay there. Location was a quick walk to all. Aquarium was great to watch when they feed fish. Pool & hot tub was nice with a view. Loved the waiting area when you're waiting for you ride. Loved the Maile shampoo, conditioner and lotion. Especially lived the heated toilet seats & bidet. Was our first experience with one & are looking to get one for our home now. Beds & pillows were very comfortable too. Overall we love this hotel.

Room was of average size, though the ocean views description a little misleading; had side ocean views only. Nonetheless, room was clean and tidy and house keeping very efficient and friendly.Handy for Waikiki beach as it was over the road so not so much need for the very small pool on level 5. On the day we looked to use the pool with just a few guests present it looked full.Breakfast was very pricey, and we were aware of some guests who received free breakfasts as part of a Luxury Escapes deal. If we'd been offered a discount of some form we would have eaten in the restaurant, but found much better value elsewhere locally.Avoid any rooms close to lifts however, they ping loudly when one arrives one the floor. We could here this from our rooms half way down corridor.

may be japanese people like this complete cool and uncosy style; the airconditioner in the roomis minimum 20 years old, running with incredible noise, blowing the cold air directly into your face, really

My new favorite on the Waikiki strip. Enjoyed my stay from the beginning to the end. The lobby of this hotel felt like you were entering a grand Las Vegas hotel... in Waikiki. Customer service throughout the hotel was top notch! Our room was clean but a little dated. I’m guessing our 30th floor hasn’t made the remodel just yet. Overall, very satisfied with our stay and will definitely be making a return trip in the future.

Lovely modern hotel across the Road from the beach. Beautiful infinity Pool and Bar area but prices were very expensive and food was minimal. Also breakfast was $35 a head at hotel but other hotels in area offering breakfast at half the price. Breakfast should be cheaper as you are already paying top price to stay at this hotel.

From the moment of arrival until the moment of departure you feel the Aloha Spirit at the Highest Level of accommodations and hospitality! Amazing amenities and right near the beach and shopping! Will return again very soon and many times thereafter!!! I'm hoping to go to a LUX Event there soon that used to be at a different 5-star property but it'll be amazing at Alohilani Resort Waikiki Beach!!! Fingers crossed!!! :)

We booked for a Sea view but got the side of the beach instead. Still nice but not what I was expecting, The room was huge and clean. Staffs are super friendly. Only a few steps and you're on the beach. Parking is 30USD per day not sure if it's high in the area though.

there should have been room service. Bathroom way too small for this level of room. Not enough sound proofing between rooms and balconies. Room doors close too loudly and are disrupting. Room too expensive for what was provided. Terrible value for money.

Lovely hotel right across from the Waikiki beach the views are amazing. We treated ourselves to a seafront room. Minor comments - the alerts noise of the lifts are too loud and should be addressed, whilst the bathrooms are small they are ok but maybe could do with a second peg on the door. First class service from the staff well done.

Do not stay at this resort. It’s not like other resorts. The service was awful. They are not attentive to guests and take no responsibility for making sure guests are satisfied. Pool bar service was terrible. Reservation was messed up, they charged us for Breakfast after making a big deal and saying we could not take advantage of the breakfast buffet which was ridiculously priced by the way. Even other hotels in the immediate area had reasonable priced breakfast. Bad experience. Do business elsewhere! We got completely ignored in the lobby bar on 2 separate occasions. We have nothing good to say. It’s way overpriced for the experience and service.

This was the first time I was in charge of all the planning and logistics for my company's VIP Summit - a 4-day event that included a cocktail party (at Morimoto Asia on the resort property), breakfast and lunches, and 3 days of workshops.Every person I worked with was professional, detail-oriented, and flexible in meeting our needs. Miju Kim was our first contact and escorted us through the resort, meeting rooms and sleeping rooms with amazing views! Irene Park held my hand through months of refining plans, changing needs, and last-minute requests to meet our clients' needs. During the Summit, Mel and Cy were our in-room catering managers. They were never more than a text or call away! Our clients from the mainland as well as Hawaii were delighted with the quality of service and food and beverages - especially the complimentary mai tais offered in the O Bar with an amazing 2-story aquarium!The newly transformed spaces are beautiful Japan-inspired designs that evoke the beach, ocean, and mountains in subtle and soothing colors and furnishings. Whether your are a couple or family, or company seeking to have an extraordinary experience in Honolulu - the Alohilani Resort at Waikiki Beach is the place to be.

We love staying here the rooms are clean great partial views from balcony so close to the beach the pools are awesome staff are very friendly and helpful great value for money food and drinks reasonably priced.

We were staying in Honolulu for just a few days before making it over to Kauai, and I have to say that it was hard to leave because we had such a great experience! Our room had a killer view overlooking the ocean. The staff was so nice and helpful, the gym was super clean, we played tennis on the roof which was super fun, hanging out at the pool was relaxing, jacuzzi was nice and hot, and the best part was the hotels location from the beach. Not only is it right across the street BUT you have a very calm and gorgeous swimming area that feels like a swimming pool. I highly recommend this place! We will be back again.
user_name:
carindabenson
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel was a three star when developers came along and totally renovated it. It’s recently been reopened. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would return. There are two towers - the beach front one (which we stayed in) goes to 17 floors. The back tower (with pool in between the towers) goes to approximately 39 floors (this tower has gym facilities in it and a great gym). I’m going to rate this hotel on pros and cons:Pros:Tower 1 (beach side room 1501) had amazing views to beach and pool. Across the road from the beach. Room was clean, spacious. Daily clean. Amazingly comfortable bed and pillows. Pool was great to have but had many cons. Fabulous to have a water fountain to fill your bottle up continuously. Hotel gives you water pouches. ABC store in the Hotel. Superb location. Well equipped gym. The bathroom has a bidet. Decor is light and tasteful. Cons:Shower pressure was weak. Paper thin walls - could hear Neighbours talking, kids crying, their TV and dryer. Air Conditioning is noisy and you can’t control it - so it was either too hot or too cold. Pool area was great but many times hired out for private events e.g. two weddings and a Gay Pride party, which meant - no seats, no umbrellas and slow waiter service. It was also a very windy area hence we spent a lot of time in the beach. Another drawback for this area was they hired out Cabanas for $175 for two hours (could have been more) and they were hardly ever occupied. Plus pool side loungers could be hired and they were not occupied all the time either. Yet when they restricted the area due to events- guests were still not allowed to occupy these areas. Balcony doors old and hard to open. As far as price goes - it’s not the top but close.

Our family of four stayed 11 nights at the Alohilani Resort and it was fantastic! The hotel is beautiful, and the staff and service are great. The location is fabulous, right across the road from a great beach and an easy walk to the shops. Would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to visit again!

Please fix the jacuzzi. It was very cold when we were there and it would have been nice to use for the time we were there, especially since I hardly ever get to have a staycation. I have four kids of my own and was looking forward to a great get away

I hesitated at first to book this hotel due to the numbers of negative feedback's here. Well, I am so glad I booked this hotel!!! I flew from Singapore to Honolulu and reached the hotel exhausted. I'm surprised on how ground staffs treated their visitors so warmly. Peeps are so generous and very friendly. That immediately made me fall in love with the place & of course the people. They even gave me 4 voucher for Mai Tai's (while waiting for my room)! Woohoo! Got into the room and I had amazing beach view from the balcony! And best part was the infinity pool! GOSH! Couldn't ask for more! Thank you all and I'll definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends and family! Will be back soon!

Our stay at the resort was nothing less that excellent! The beauty, the cleanliness, the location, the amenities...all excellent! Will definitely recommend! We did not want to leave and a big shout out to ALL of the staff - we didn't were satisfied with them all!
user_name:
pgmdds
New York City, New York

review_body: We had 24 hours in Waikiki and so my travel agent booked us into the Alohihani. The motel is nice enough. Great location to the beach. All round all ok. Except. The bathrooms were so small you had to leave the bathroom to be able to dry yourself. And watch the $39 USD ‘resort fee’ on checkout. When I asked what was this for she just replied it’s a resort fee. Well I paid to stay here so that should be fee enough. Will staying somewhere else next time.

We came to this hotel to celebrate our 20th anniversary! We had an amazing time, the bed was nice and soft but firm, very clean rooms. The only down fall about this hotel in NOT room service, but they had nice restaurants and the ABC convenience store was right there attached to the corner of the hotel. You would enjoy staying at this hotel.

As a 1st timer to the hotel, quite a good choice as the venue renovated before. The lobby and the restaurants are good. The pool a bit a small though. Most of the staff are cheerful and willing to help. The room was ok but the washroom a bit small and the bathing water pressure not strong enough. Overall, can visit and stay if you prefer a decent and renovated hotel.

First time staying at the Alohilani and I will definitely be back. Great and easy arrival experience. Clean and well set up guest rooms with a super comfortable bed. Loved the pool area and prompt and friendly food and beverage service along with the pool team. Location was handy and desirable being at the quieter end of Waikiki, beach right across the street and easy walking distance to everything in the Waikiki area you might want.

Spent 5 nights here. What a wonderful experience we had with the facilities, staff and location. The rooms are well appointed. Housekeeping completed daily by friendly staff and attentive to our needs. The Guest Services Team was always accommodating and remembered our names. The Bar staff were friendly and the fish tank is great, especially when it is feeding time. Highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Honolulu.

I booked a room with partial ocean view, but the room that was guided was too low to be able to see anything at all. When saying that claim, it was said that there is a good room in the same category. I wanted you to guide the room from the beginning.

Had a stay from 10/8-10/15 and had a wonderful time had it not been for a few glaring issues:1) Pool Music - Not only was the selection of house and EDM unnecessary for a pool with visitors not looking to party hard and families, but for me and my girlfriend, we were looking to relax. Who wants to listen to Calvis Harris nonstop for hours on end? Only on one day was it suitable for a light BPM music you could relax or drink to.2) Pool Hours - We has a beachside room (aka facing the side street and on the corner viewing the pool. Still ocean view however). We had to put our A/C on high to drown out the music playing to 12am and kids making noise up to the same time. We would have been fine with a 11pm music cutoff time and a 11:30pm pool closing time. It doesn't look like they enforce those policies at all.3) Pride Week Kickoff Party - I had no problem with the event but there was NO, ZERO notification in our stay that this was happening. There were people who bought access to the pool with a pink bracelet but those party goers were not staying at the hotel. They had no privilege to taking over chairs reserved for guests only.4) Eating at the O-BAR - We went down for a small bite to eat and a beer. We're greeted and then given menus. Everything seemed fine as we were the only two people eating or at the bar. When we finished, we couldn't find our waitress for more than 10 minutes. Additionally the bar manager looked less interested than turning his back away from the bar and taking care of our bill. Seemed like our waitress went to the back to probably be on her phone. Other than that, towels and sheets were routinely changed and fresh. Our drinks poolside and downstairs were all perfect and the food selections were great as well.

We stayed here because we attended a wedding at Halekulani and we stayed at alohilani for the weekend. Everything was comfy and very bright white and clean. Would stay here again and like to see the pool and gym they have here. Until next time

Beauty new refurnish hotel, nice swimming pool. I have found the concierge staff are not very friendly and helpful, all they do is make the booking for you, however, the valet parking staff are so helpful and friendly. Also not enough information for the guests to know the hotel amenities or activities. The good side of this hotel is the location and clean. Overall not a bad hotel but long way to 5 stars.

We were to stay at the Moana Surfrider but due to the strike we decided to change hotels and had 24 hrs to determine which hotel in Waikiki would be a good alternative. While not on the beach (they say 60 steps but it’s across a busy road - but don’t be concerned - it’s easy) this hotel ticked all the boxes. Definitely splurge for an ocean front room. The view is amazing. The hotel staff are excellent and very welcoming. The on-site bars and restaurants are very good. The room is nicely appointed. The reviews have talked about how small the bathroom is - and they are not exaggerating- they are really small. As long as you can handle that - you will love this Hotel.

This hotel is beautiful, staff and service was great. We would definitely stay and recommend to friends to book this establishment. The location is absolutely perfect. The beaches are beautiful and close to hotel.

I have been to Hawaii many times. This hotel is in a great spot close to the beach and shopping. The view from the pool deck is wonderful. The pool area is great for having a drink by a fire alone, with friends, or a loved one.

I recently stayed there for a conference even though I live on this island. I was impressed by how it was transformed into a beautiful, chic hotel. I'm also glad they kept the huge aquarium. I had the corner room with the view of Diamond Head and the Waikiki Beach. A first class hotel with friendly staff and luxe decor. They also have a great breakfast buffet. It's kind of expensive for breakfast, but with the international variety, it'll last you until dinner time.

Fabulous location right across from the beach, or you could hang out at the rooftop pool instead. Easy stroll to shops - food or clothes. Safe, clean and modern hotel and super friendly staff. We had a wonderful family holiday with our teenage children.

Decided to stay at this hotel as it was just renovated. Location is great and across the street from Waikiki beach. We normally stay on the opposite end closer to retail shops and found it less hectic and congested which was nice. Rooms are spacious enough and our ocean view was a sliver between buildings. The rooms were nicely appointed and had a mini fridge. We had an issue with our water quality on the first morning and it was rectified by the afternoon. We couldn’t use the bathroom but management made up by not charging us the resort fees. The room was very cold and could not adjust the temperature. We had to turn it off or open the lanai doors.The big problem was the elevators. There is always a long line waiting for people to go up or down.The rooftop infinity pool was cool but small and overcrowded. Not enough chairs for guests and lack of sunshine due to the buildings. Breakfast buffet was good. A big step up from Holiday Inn. Our package included a Kona Coffee press but the servers/management never heard of this. I had to persuade them with details on their website to prove it to them.

We found the hotel personnel to be friendly, courteous and efficient. Receiving an email from the reception and manager was a nice touch. It was a lovely room and bedding was excellent. Recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a lovely experience in Waikiki.

Advertising of rooms is misleading eg ocean view is really from an angle. Rooms are goldfish despite the renovation. Bar and Bell staff were excellent. Breakfast was overpriced. Surrounding noise at night was loud.

Giving a huge shout out for the AMAZING staff at the Alohilani Hotel who led our +500 person annual fundraising banquet and +100 person morning retreat in September 2018! Starting with the attentive and spirited catering sales manager Rhodericka Miranda, she was so wonderfully helpful, wise, and good natured! Give her a raise! Then there's Miju, Irene, and Sakae who were oh so helpful with the room bookings and accommodations of our crazy requests (that we'll rethink next year!). And then Jonathan and Melanie the captains of the evening banquet and morning retreat! So calm, efficient, and listened and attended to our every need. But for the awful parking situation (which I pray will be resolved next year!) the event was great! God bless such an amazing staff!

Amazing place to stay. The staff are so friendly, nothing is too much trouble for them. Rooms are extremely clean. Central to everything. I can not recommend this hotel enough and would differently stay here again!

Very friendly staff, clean rooms we enjoyed the pool area and batting cages. if your traveling with your family they are a kid friendly resort . I highly recommend staying at this location. very close to main street of shopping and dining

Alohilani is a beautiful and clean hotel with an "Aloha" atmosphere. Have been staying at the Alohilani for the past two years and prior to that for many years at the Pacific Beach hotel. No plans to switching hotels. Also love the brand of lotion, shampoo and conditioner, "Malie". Also, loved the Mai Tai coupons!

Great stay at the Alohilani! Everything was clean and every staff member was friendly and accommodating. Room was a good size and the renovated rooms were super clean. Loved the 39th floor balcony view. The location is basically at the heart of Waikiki with so many things within walking distance. Would definitely recommend if you're willing to spend a couple extra bucks per night and for other things like parking etc.

Overall we loved our stay here – it was convenient, very clean, modern and a good location. The pool is a little small for the size of the hotel and I do believe management should review the process of having to pay additional money for the sunbeds in the pool – as often these were the only ones available. The main pool should also be made child free - its extremely dangerous with children in it. Upon check in, we clearly advised we wanted to pay for our incidentals with our travel card (to avoid horrendous bank fees/ exchange rates), regardless of us advising this, the reception team took the money from our credit card meaning we occurred bank fees etc (which is what we didn’t want). Upon check out the lady was apologetic and advised we would get refunded the full amount including the bank fees etc. It has now been 3 weeks and over 5 emails have been sent and I haven’t received the money back. It’s such a shame, as this has put a downer on our trip, therefore I will not be staying here again..

We decided to do a staycation for our anniversary this year. The 'Alohilani Resort was fantastic! We received a free upgrade, a personal note and small bottle of bubbly along with glasses from the hotel. I received daily inquiries about how our stay was and if there was anything that could be improved upon. Thank you so much for a wonderful weekend.

Perfect location perfect resortPerfect food n drinks amazing infinity pool..gorgeous sunsets Extremely comfortable beds 20/10 didn't want to leave thanx for the memories will definitely recommend to everyone who is going to Hawaii

Even the locals in Hawaii like to take "staycations" in Waikiki every now and again. Whenever I do, my first choice is ALWAYS Alohilani Resort. The rooms are beautiful, comfortable, and always have a great view no matter which part of the hotel you're in. Their lobby is hands down the best in Waikiki - especially having a free welcome mai tai under their 3-story fish tank with live music! Their new pool deck is so tastefully done, and is a great place to relax away from it all. I always look forward to the next opportunity I have to stay at Alohilani - highly recommend to tourists and locals alike!

Very impressed with the Alohilani. Staff & service fantastic. All their facilities are excellent. Rooms are a standard size & balconies a little small . But beautifully decorated & has everything you need for a pleasant stay.The restaurant in the resort "Momoto" (think thats the spelling) is a must do!
user_name:
Louise N
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: We made a last-minute booking at this resort - we had 10 nights in Hawaii, and booked the first 5 nights at 'Alohilani. After checking in and seeing the room, I went straight downstairs to the lobby and extended our stay for the full trip. The whole hotel has been re-styled, and it looks super good. The rooms are modern and large. Most hotels in Waikiki are slightly outdated - I think 'Alohilani is probably the most contemporary hotel on the beach (the Ritz is great, but much more expensive and not on the beach itself. There's also Trump hotel, but I'd rather punch myself in the face than stay there). We had a corner room in the rear tower, which gave great views of the city and beach. The front tower would have even better views. It was super affordable relative to other places. The pool area is large and really nice. The foyer is also pretty spectacular. Staff are super friendly and helpful. There were just a couple of cons: The bathrooms are really small. For us, it didn't really matter - but some travellers might object. We had dinner one night at the pool, and after sitting and waiting for service for a few minutes I ordered at the bar. The guy behind the bar looked a little uneasy, and I found we got daggers from the waitress who's area we were sitting in for the rest of the night (I'm assuming because we wouldn't be tipping her). This might be an American peculiarity, but it's a bit tedious for Australians. Minor objections, though; for the price, and the location, this modern hotel is very hard to beat. 100% recommended.

The Alohilani is a very airy and fresh property, with lovely rooms that have been tastefully decorated. The lobby and lobby bar have a real “wow” factor!The few concerns we had though were: noise from the lift is extremely loud with the “dings”’it makes as it arrives, and can be heard down the end of the hall away from the lift well. Also the noise from the street is very loud, as the rooms do not have sound proof doors. Lastly and most concerning, during our stay another hotel guest suffered a serious medical episode by the pool and not one of the staff working on the pool deck (pool attendants, wait staff, bar staff etc) were trained as first responders. The guest required immediate help and it was up to other hotel guests to provide assistance as the staff stood around and watched. It wasn’t until some of the hotel-trained first responders arrived that anything was really done by the hotel staff. It was very concerning to note that in a pool area with children etc, no one is trained as a first responder.

As 5th October 2018 was our last day in Hawaii before heading home, my wife and I decided to go for some last minute shopping at the famous Waikele premium outlet. Approached the concierge and they told us to liaise with the shuttle transportation at the lobby. We reached the guy around 12:30pm and he told us we were quite lucky as the last shuttle out was at 12:45pm. He took down our names and when he called the driver, he told us that the bus was full and didn’t have any spot on for us. He later on advised us to proceed to the concierge for other options.We were attended by Ms Allison at the concierge but she was not so knowledgeable on this transportation stuff and told us she will refer us to her colleague Mr Yuki who was just two tables away. When we approached him, he was so unhelpful, rude and sarcastic. He just snubbed us off by telling us that he has got nothing to do with transportation and told us to refer back to the guys at the lobby. I even noticed Allison looking on at us in dissatisfaction about this rude Mr Yuki’s response to us. Having a rude and not helpful staff like this really tarnishes the image of this wonderful hotel. I come from the airline industry and having people like him in the service or customer industry was TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE. I did not know if he was being like that because we were Asians but noticed him attending to the rest non Asian guests so friendly. Furthermore he snubbed us in front of other guests in the concierge. I should say it was his good day because I was getting angry and wanted to fire him off on the face but my wife stopped me. We got so mad and decided to have breakfast first. At the restaurant we met an elderly friendly Hawaiian couple and they advised us where else to shop if we could not go to Waikele. I went back to the concierge again to have a word with Yuki regarding what happened earlier as I was still not satisfied by his cheap treatment but I think his lucky star was out that morning and he was not there. I was then attended by the awsome Mr Jacob a.k.a Mr Jay. He was totally the opposite of Yuki. It’s like meeting gold(Jay) instead of garbage(Yuki). He apologized for his colleague’s treatment on us and went all out to help us. He called up a few transportation companies and tried to slot us in while still entertaining us with his charisma and jokes. But unfortunately all were full and then he told us we can either take a cab which will cause a bomb or public bus which we decided not to as we wanted to do a lot of shopping. Even Allison came over and spoke to us stating she didn’t like and disagree with the way Yuki handled us and apologized as well. Though we were disappointed, we were still happy and decided to use an Uber to and back from Waikele.Just like to highlight to Alohilani management to employ more professional, friendly and unbiased staffs like Jay and Allison instead of sarcastic useless ones like Yuki. I believe this hotel caters for a lot of tourist from Asia, the place we are from as we are paying equally the same as the other non Asian tourists and demand to be treated the same too. If without us, the hotel won’t have business. So our humble request is please up your standards on this and reward or appreciate Jay and Allison for their help and understanding. Besides this, all the other staffs in this hotel treated us nicely.

This hotel is super expensive, has hiding fee. We ordered a two beds room up to 4 guests. The price was raised much higher than expected after the order was placed. The customer service stated the price before check out was based on 2 guests. They need to charge extra guest fee. We chose 3 guests before check out. Why didn't they show the extra guest fee before check out? We felt it is cheating. Be aware of the hiding fee!The elevator is super loud and scaring. We were unfortunate to be close to the elevator and being woken up during sleep at night.

The hotel is conveniently located, well maintained, clean and everyone is super friendly. The pool and fitness room tend to be very busy as expected. The view of the ocean from the balconyalong with hearing the waves was very relaxing.

Stayed in a partial ocean view on the 10th floor. Like many of the reviews here have mentioned, the rooms are very modern, clean and just right for a vacation. Stayed here for a week and couldn't have been more pleased with the selection, especially at the rates.Pool area is on the smaller side but it does have an infinity pool that attracts a lot of the guests, so get out early for a good chair. Was told that the bar area in the pool is open until midnight, so drink on! Cabana's looked nice but I am sure they charge an additonal fee to use. The best feature about the pool area is that they give you beach towels you can take to the beach and bring back after you're done by leaving them in your room, that was sort of cool. I think the main reason I initially booked was due to the location and it really did not disappoint. The beach is across the street with restaurants, shops and high-end stores all in walking distance. The most important, of course, it the ABC store downstairs that has everything under the moon. Food, drinks, souveniers, beach items, etc. everything. If you spend $100USD or more during your stay at any of these stores, they give you a free gift. They are on every corner so it's very easy to spend $300, which is what we did. Save you receipts. Overall, great location, great rooms, couldn't have asked for anything more with a great stay.

Beautifully renovated resort hotel in prime position in Waikiki.Friendly staff. Excellent pool and bar facilities. Restaurants - first rate.Close to everything in downtown Waikiki Rooms are large with very comfortable high-end bedding. We had ocean view room and the views were fabulous. Would definitely return to this resort hotel.

Probably one of the best places we have stayedThe rooms the service the activities are all includedIn the evening they have "the lighting of the torch" by the poolThere is always an artist singing at the bar and even at the poolThe staff are so helpful

My wife and I stayed for over a week and found the facilities to be first class. Everything you need is here with some quality food, try Moromoto which is attached to the hotel, excellent pool area and gym. The service was friendly and professional. The location is ideal with everything you need close by.

Hotel & staff were great, not entirely happy with the Resort fee on top of the room fee. Bi cleaner, Renee at Reception & Gabby at the Pool area were great, please pass this message on to them, as it would be appreciated.

I was enjoying my stay here but tonight I got to my room to find I had been locked out because the dinner we had charged to our room this evening had not been paid for.I am sorry but surely you pay your bill at the end of your stay. Instead they locked me and my son out of our room. Then when we got into the room they rang me and woke my son up to tell me they had tried to charge the dinner to my card and it had not gone through and asked me to come downstairs.I really do not understand why this hotel is expecting me to pay my bill half way through my stay.I gave them my passport and Amex card at check in. I have found their behaviour this evening quite insulting. It’s a shame as the lady at check in was really nice and helpful.

From the start, 'Alohilani embodied Aloha. Upon booking, the 'Alohilani contacted us to confirm our reservation. Our check in with Joi was very smooth and easy. She was welcoming and followed up with us to make sure everything was meeting our expectations. Our room had the most amazing view. Imagine lying in bed and just looking out over the glorious ocean. The bed is very comfortable, the television is huge. Our bathroom was ridiculously large -- I don't recall ever having a hotel bathroom that large before. Water pressure--great. Shampoo/Conditioner/soaps -- these are from the Maile (there is a store in the resort) and are absolutely amazing. They've chosen a very neutral scent. I don't think anyone has mentioned the heated toilet seats. It's totally unexpected, and quite frankly amazing. They have a wonderful staff dedicated to teaching about the Hawaiian culture. During our time, we met with both Summer and Andria, who taught us a lot about Hawaii and Aloha. I was able to make a traditional crown lei (haku) with orchids and hibiscus. My husband and I both made orchid leis and ti leaf leis. The 'Alohilani proivdes these supplies to you during these lessons, and your lei will be more beautiful than some of the pricey leis that you can buy around Waikiki. We had also noted an activity from a previous week that was not on the schedule... the E ala E, which we were very interested in. Summer actually added it so that we could participate. Every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday is a torch lighting ceremony on the pool deck, and that is worth going to see. We were celebrating our anniversary, and the 'Alohilani really did that in style. We are particularly grateful to Summer for the amazing picture she got of us in the ocean. We came back from our anniversary dinner to find that picture and orchids laid out in a heart on our bed.Dining at the 'Alohilani is good, but you will find it's a touch expensive -- but let's be honest here: dining in WAIKIKI is a touch expensive, so the prices at the 'Alohilani restaurants are not out of line.We did participate in their Hawaii Legacy Tree experience on the North Short, which I do recommend highly.
