Hawaii will leave a lasting impact on you, why not leave a lasting gift to Hawaii in return?The 'Alohilani is directly across the street from Kuhio Beach, which is a part of Waikiki. It is within walking distance of many many things...depending on what you consider walking distance. We did walk from the Hilton Hawaiian Village to the 'Alohilani, and we also walked down to the Outrigger Canoe Club. That said, those are long walks. In the Beachside Tower is a very well provisioned and convenient ABC Store (you'll find they are a bit like Starbucks in their presence in the Waikiki area...and you'll be grateful for that!)If we went back to Oahu, we'd definitely stay here again. The focus on the Hawaiian Culture, the location, the amenities are definite contenders.

We stayed the The Alohilani recently and really enjoyed our stay. We had an ocean view room, and while you could not see the ocean from inside our room, you had a good view from the verandah. It was also nice and quiet. The rooms are spotlessly clean, modern, comfortable beds and good air conditioning. Its the quieter end of town (down towards Diamond Head) which meant that the beach was also quieter than closer into the centre of town, but still lots of shops and restaurants within minutes. While not beachfront, the beach is directly across the road, so just a few minutes from your room to the beach. The hotel facilities were excellent, particularly the pool which had poolside bar and food service and beach towels available. It was also open for long hours. The view from here across the city, mountains and ocean is also really nice. The gym was also good. The rooms were serviced daily and to a very good standard. Beds made, bathrooms cleaned, rubbish removed, fresh towels and toiletries daily.

Stayed here for our honeymoon. Great room but empty fridge no English tea in the room. No kettle. No shower cap jus simple shampoo and soap I am aware of the bathroom being small. But it is extremely small! You can barley turn 360 inside. the toilet takes up 85% of the space alone. Never seen a bath tube as small as this one!!! The pressure from the shower is nonexistent. Air con is v loud turns on and off, the street is v loud. Next door must of turned on the tap and it woke me up in the morning. I saw the lamp flickering every time the fridge motor starts up. The safe is half hanging off the wall! Suppose to be a safe!?Room is not very sound proof. Swim pool is lovely but spoilt by loud children having a good time. Would be better if they had a adult only pool/area.No service around the pool area... what a disappointment Other than the location is great and the bed is comfy. It’s definitely not a 5star standard

I am unsure how this hotel got a 5 star rating. Positives: Public areas are very nice with a great pool and fantastic location right by the beach. Rooms are a good size and bed is very comfortable. Negatives: This is the only 5* hotel I have stayed that DOES NOT have; shower caps, mini bar, dressing gowns or room service. No water in the fridge (although they do have these branded plastic bags you can fill up) not ideal if you are out for walk and want it in yr handbag. The shower and bathroom area is tiny and shower is overhead so unless you want a wet head you do need a shower hat. Only two small water glasses provided and given there is no room service you would think they would also have a wine glass as well. I asked for help with the coffee machine and the housekeeping person who came just gave me a new machine, didn't speak English on any discernible level and left with me no better off. The breakfast room is dark and dingy and at $35 pp +tax & tips I wouldn't want to use it.Staff: on all occasions (except check-out) they were terrible. Concierge didn't even know the basics of tourism in Honolulu (eg bus to Ala Moana centre you need exact $2 fare)/ On arrival no offer to help with bags, check in I asked if resort fees were included only to be told you pay on check out. Housekeeping very random: One day no bath mat, inconsistent every day.I would say this is not a resort hotel but a factory line to get you in and out with the most minimal extras in your room to enhance profit. They pay lip service to good service.

Amazing pool area with beach views, providing the best of both worlds. Amazing & friendly staff made the experience so much better too! Delightful sweeping ocean views from our room. Will definitely stay here again.

We stayed in this amazing hotel for 5 days, this renovation far exceeded our expectations when we arrived. Friendly staff only to happy to help, fantastic facilities and great location to everything would highly recommend to anyone wanting to vacation in Waikiki

The pros - nice location, close to the beach, oceanviews from some rooms, beautiful pool area, very strong Mai Tais!, close to pick up points for local tours, and also close to public bus stops, public areas attractive, no noise from adjacent rooms.The cons - very very noisy airconditioning, no room service, only soap, shampoo, conditioner, boy lotion provided in bathroom, noise from the pool area at night, the carpet is new but looks so old - bad interior design choice.Look the pace was fine, I just don't think it was worth the money.

Highly recommended due to hotel's cleanliness, location, and great service at current pricing. The location allows for easy access (most within walking distance) of surroundings (beach, shopping, dining, and even a zoo nearby) to nearby surroundings.

We asked for a lot: to be checked in early, for towels in the wrong place, to have the valet hold our car while we checked in. They were GREAT. Irene@frontdesk deserves a promotion for dealing with me.

We came here after being majorly disappointed in another resort we had booked on the Waikiki Strip and fell in love. I instantly regretted having booked the other hotel and wished I had booked this one for the entirety of our trip because it truly enhanced our Hawaiian experience. The rooms are spacious and have the comfort of a modern yet relaxing beach bungalow and the lobby and pool area were immaculate and impressive. The service was friendly and helpful. It was truly a beautiful experience.We had lunch at Momason which was delicious, made use of their laundry (every mother’s dream come true), enjoyed our lovely, spacious, and relaxing room and view, and liked the extra touches like the reusable water bottles and bidet. We had hoped to make better use of the beautiful pool but it rained heavily during our stay (but can see how it is an amazing and chic hangout spot). We had a toddler with us and know that he would have really enjoyed the kiddie pool and artificial grass area, weather permitting. Signage could have been improved (the pool and laundry area are a bit hidden but that also made it feel a bit more mysterious like it was a secret spot). We also would have really enjoyed room service (ie Momason in our room) rather than dealing with the cranky toddler in the restaurant during nap time. The shops could be improved as most remain vacant (a Starbucks on site would be stellar!) but having an ABC store on site was very convenient.We plan to utilize their late check out ($20/hrs) before sadly going back to our original dark and dated hotel which is sadly non-refundable. Having retreated to this hotel, albeit for only 1 night was so worthwhile, especially since we spent a lot of time indoors due to the weather. We have stayed at many hotels on the Waikiki strip (8+ and all 4 stars and up) but this is my new favorite. Great location, beautiful facilities, great service, and lovely details. This will be our go-to Waikiki resort going forward!

Location was great, right across the street from the beach. Ocean view rooms are located on the side of the building, so if you want something truly ocean view, I would call and confirm. Service was great, staff was very nice and accommodating.

Beautiful Hotel. New, clean and friendly staff. Waikiki Beach is right across the street. Loved the location of the hotel and how newly renovated it was. The infinity pool was great and the views from the room were spectacular!

My Ladies and I stayed here for a night to explore Waikiki and experience the high life. Lol we definitely felt the luxury vibe because the resort was very beautiful and the outdoor pools were amazing. The staffs were friendly and the rooms were nice and clean. We walked across the street to the beach during the day and shopped the many blocks worth of stores at night. We really enjoyed our stay and the Waikiki experience we had!!!

Previously stayed here during renovation in April 2016 when only rooms had been refurbished. All completed now and the Resort has a stunning infinity pool, lobby and bar area with huge indoor saltwater aquarium. Great gym on 3rd floor and two tennis courts with two baseball batting cages on the ninth floor. Rooms, although not large, are comfortable with a great bed. Close to beach and all Waikiki has to offer.

PRO'S: Stunning lobby & pool areas, beautiful! Front desk staff excellent. Excellent gym w/ top of line equipment. Verrry good beds. CON'S: Tiny,tiny bathroom for a 5 star resort. Toilet way too low to floor. Stingy with coffee pods. No refreshments or even bottled water in minibar. Chairs on deck very uncomfortable..they need cushions.

The hotel was newly renovated and it looks like it. The rooms have that modern feel and a smart toilet. The pool area is cool and the bar food was good. The drinks were overpriced and had barely any alcohol in them. The hotel is separated from the beach by the main strip so they overcompensate with the pool area.

We enjoyed our stay in this hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We could walk to a variety of restaurants, the beach and the shops. We were able to organise a number of tours through the hotel as well as airport transfers. Our room was clean and very comfortable.

We loved our stay here. Excellent establishment in great location. Rooms are clean and in great condition. Amazing aquarium you can get lost in and water stations where you can fill your bottles. Beautiful pool area with infinity pool and sunset views.

We have stayed at this hotel before the upgrade to the pool area, the upgrade is beautiful with a wet edge pool and lounge areas. The location is great, easy to walk to Dukes, the International Markets and other shopping. And the beach is right across the road.

No drinking water, no in-room dining, room still not ready at check-in time, terrible untrained front desk attitude and unprofessional concierge service. How did this hotel even earn its 5 starts? Totally scam.

We just returned from a wonderful holiday and stayed at Alohilani resort. The rooms were clean and spacious, the staff were attentive and friendly. The dining options throughout the hotel were great - the Swell Bar served great cocktails and food and the atmosphere was suitable for everyone from couples to families. It didn’t hurt having an infinity pool with views of the beach, city and mountains. Morimoto was superb! Fabulous location opposite the beach. My only complaint was the holiday was way too short!

Alohilani is committed to making their guests feel welcome and they succeeded in every possible way! This was our first family holiday together and we cannot thank them enough for going that extra mile to make this an unforgettable holiday! From the infinity pool, kiddies pool, the great cocktails and excellent gym facilities - the family was well catered for. We also ate at Morimoto Asia which is located within the hotel complex - we had a table on the balcony overlooking Waikiki Beach - great view and the food was amazing! Some of the best Asian food we've had. We're already planning next years holiday. Steve, Christina & Sophia, Sydney, Australia

Checkin was smooth, rooms in awesome location. Pool was amazing and relaxing. Staff was very helpful. Rooms were cleaned daily and restocked. Beds comfortable and beach feet away from entrance. Convenient to stores and amenities.

Excellent property and location. Everything about the hotel was amazing except for the rooms. Was given room 322 at first which was dim and had very little natural light. The window was only 1/4 way down from the ceiling and it only overlooked the roof of a lower portion of the hotel. Apparently, this is a room that all the staff knew was a room that is not recommend, yet we got stuck with. The only way to get a better room was to pay an upgrade fee. Washroom I'm there room was small. You can't close the door without doing some body contortions.

My family and I loved every bit of our visit to the Alohilani Resort. Our only complaint is we couldn't stay longer. The rooms were amazing, the food was great and the staff was top notch. It didn't matter what time of day they were extremely accommodating and they always said hello with a smile. Made us feel like family. I can't wait until my family and I can visit again! Mahalo

This hotel has just had a major renovation and what can i say it is amazing. We stayed in the second tower which we had city, partial ocean and mountain views. Rooms were clean and we had 4 of us in the room which was no issue. Heaps of room but please note hotel rooms in Hawaii are smaller than Asia hotels.The hotel has two towers with restaurants/ bar and an amazing infinity pool/bar/lounge area on the fifth level. The bar on the ground level has an incredible aquarium.The staff were great very friendly and helpful i have recommended this hotel to friends travelling to Hawaii and they all loved it. I would stay here again on my next trip to HawaiiThe other great thing is that this hotel has uninterrupted views of the ocean and location location location it is on the main street in Waikiki and is in a few minutes walking to shopping restaurants cafe etc etc

Pro: we got here a bit early (12:30/1ish) and they said our room was ready early!Plot twist: it wasn’t the room we booked!:-o We were informed they didn’t have any king bed ocean view room. Only queen.Apparently they have an overbooking policy and have to option to provide us a room lesser than we reserved. I’ve been to hotels that were overbooked and I’ve been given upgrades because of it but never downgrades. I was offered an upgrade at an additional $200 a night however! That didn’t set very well, 5 minutes of me telling them this wasn’t acceptable and they suddenly found a room.When booking this hotel I read about the recent renovation, talk about putting lipstick on a pig. Cheap from the paint to the furnishing and linens. And small. In contrast we stayed at Hilton grand vacations last year and loved every minute of our time at the hotel which greatly enhanced our overall time at Waikiki. Large rooms, a quiet pool without cabana nazis (alohilani wanted $175 for half a day in one of theirs and gave us the boot even though all 4 or 5 of them were empty). I figured we probably paid a lot more for the room last year but went back to discover it was even a little bit cheaper that what we paid this year. In summary, don’t stay here, much better options out there. Personally, next time we will go back to the Hilton we enjoyed so much last time!

The new re-branding of Alohilani is amazing! The pool deck with infinity views of the ocean are a must during your stay, and Morimoto's downstairs brings something special to this end of Kalakaua Avenue. Great value and easy access to Waikiki beach.

We absolutely loved our 4 night stay here! We arrived around 10am and headed to the hotel to drop off our bags knowing that check-in time wasn't until 3pm, however the wonderful receptionist Renee found us a room that we could check into straight away! We had an Ocean view room on the 32nd floor with views of rhe ocean and Diamond head. We were also given free drink cards and a bottle of champagne to enjoy! The room and facilities were modern and beautifulWe loved using the pool area! The hotel is in a perfect location, with only a road separating you from a beautiful, safe swimming area. There are a multitude of eating options nearby, and an ABC convenience store is attached to the hotel itself! Alohilano is central to everything in Waikiki without being in the very busiest of areas! Definitely stay here! The staff in general were great and always checking in to make sure we were enjoying our stay!

This is the hotel for those that have been dying to find a more modern relaxed hotel on Wakiki beachfront without compromising on the location or the quality of the rooms. Waikiki is so popular most hotels do not feel they need to improve on their standards and they will still be fully booked for most of the time. It is such a delight to find one hotel that breaks out from that mode. It is new, convenient and fun.

Alohilani is right in the middle of everything! But a few minutes away from all the noise.Beautiful, newly renovated hotel. Would highly recommend for a family or couples vacation.The staff is great as well!

Location was excellent. A mere 100m to the beach but tucked down a side street so away from all the noise. The rooms were great and had amazing views of the beach and Diamond Head. The staff were really accomodating and always helpful. There wasn't a wide variety of places to eat at the hotel but you were only a short walk to awesome eat places like Cheesecake Factory and Duke's. The concierge were exceptionally helpful in booking some really great island experiences and tours. My only really complaint was that the air conditioner in our room was really noisy! It was too hot to leave it off but the noise kept disturbing our sleep as it cut in and out.

Our stay was excellent! It was verified clean, friendly and beautiful! There is only a road between you and the beach. Plenty of shops and food places! Also check out their pool area, it is amazing! Definitely recommend!

Fabulous location in central hub of Waikiki. They initially botched our reservation and gave us a room which we hadn't booked ( 2 queens rather than 1 king) but Amanda at reception was fabulous and we were upgraded to great room on 17th floor looking down the beach. Food and drinks ok and pool area good but loses the sun behind the front tower for a while in the afternoon. Would definitely stay there again as the location is fab and staff are really pleasant.

Visited this property 30 years ago known as the Pacific Beach Hotel and was amazed of the remodel and upgrade to this hotel. It is truly a resort destination and would definitely visit again in the future.

We loved staying Alohilani. The beach was right at the door step and ABC mart is on the first floor which was really convenient.Loved the view from the room. However, we booked ocean view room expecting to get full view but if you want full ocean view you have to book premier ocean view room.

Very clean and friendly staff. Made my first trip to Hawaii a awesome experience. Close to shopping, entertaining and restaurants. Will definitely keep in mind for future visits. I would definitely recommend.

They have done a great job renovating this hotel. Lovely modern colours and very clean and comfortable. The only let down was the size of the bathroom. It was so tiny that it was difficult to close the door.

This is absolutely not a 5 star hotel. In fact, I’d even say it was an average 4 star hotel. The hotel-supplied pictures here and on the website are nothing short of deceptive, as too is the lovely lobby area (which is clearly designed to make people think they’re getting a certain type of experience which never actually materialises). Like other reviewers have said, the hotel lacks many basic amenities required to be considered a 5 star hotel. Where do I start? “Breakfast included” is a voucher for black coffee and a basic sandwich. The bathrooms have a 1970s-style shower curtain that you’re constantly wrestling with as you try to shower. There is no shower gel - just a manky cake of soap you have to prise off the non-existent shower ledge each day after it’s gone hard. There are no q-tips or cotton balls. There’s no clock in the room. The door to the balcony must have been missed in the renovation along with the shower, as it’s still a 70’s style sliding door that keeps jamming and jack-knifing each time you try to open it. You have to pay if you want to lie on a lounge in the shade by the pool (and I mean PAY - like over $100 per day). And given the ratio of sun lounges to hotel guests is about 1:1000 (i.e. you won’t get one unless you’re at the pool by 5am), we almost considered paying so we could at least lie by the pool. But bring your own water to the pool though, as the pool bar ran out of jugs for me to fill up when I asked for one (and no attempt was made to find one). And then when I attempted to fill up my bottle at the water fountain, I was warned like a child by one of the attendants to make sure I didn’t let the top of my bottle touch the fountain opening. Overall we felt quite angry that Alohilani had misrepresented itself so badly. And at over $500 a night, it’s just not acceptable.

The location is overall beautiful with the beach just minutes away out front. The staff at Alohilani were all accommodating and very friendly. My server Suzy at swell pool greeted me with a big smile and made sure I was taken care of ultimately. She gave excellent service and we will definitely be coming back due to the service, view, and the beautiful comfortable amenities.

Everything is just there. Night time quiet for sleep even though you are on the main road.Easy access for bus to attractions.Great pool facilities. Guest laundry. Most importantly knowledgeable staff and helpful.

Love this hotel, the staff ir professional and always ready to help. Excellent location, bech is just in front, all kind of restaurants around, and if you go shopping there are almost any kind of stores around. I will definitely come again.

A perfect location with beautifully appointed rooms, friendly staff and a hidden gem - the pool area. Great bar facility by the pool and the aquarium is really special. Don't forget to get the towel from the pool to take to the beach.

We booked this because it said it was a 5 star hotel. Both about this hotel is 5 star. The room was filthy, the towels shed on you, the sheets are 100% polyester, there’s no room service, no clock in the room. The parking garage is only attached if you enter on the 3rd floor. The rooms are loud, the hotel is loud, there is no kid friendly food. Don’t waste your money here like we did!

This resort is an amazing addition to Waikiki. Most of the places are tired and old where Alohilani is fresh, new and open. Service from staff was outstanding fro check in to any queries or questions, the concierge who helped us plan our adventures and checking out was fantastic. Rooms were beautiful and spacious. We stayed in the Beachside building which is the old building but revamped and updated. Beds were comfortable, good balcony overlooking the beach. Only downside was it was not the greatest lighting at night and the bathroom didn't have a fan so it got muggy and extremely hot really fast. The pool area and service was beautiful. Have to get in early for good seats that don't loose sun throughout the day. Fitness area was lovely, Great equipment and fitness room. Very rare to stay somewhere that even has a quarter of the facilities at Alohilani. Buffet breakfast was good as well. expensive when it's not included in your stay, especially when you have to convert it to AUD. Overall stay was beautiful. I would highly recommend this resort if you are after a luxe escape..

We have stayed a this hotel several times in its previous incarnation as the Pacific Beach Hotel. We chose this hotel in previous visits because it was right across Kuhio and Waikiki beaches, and their rates were lower compared to other beachfront hotels in Waikiki. They recently renovated the hotel, and the interiors are amazing. it's a very modern, coastal look, a far cry from its former self. Just the lobby itself and driveway is airy and welcoming. The rooms have also been renovated so they do not have a kitschy old Hawaiian feel, but still warm and welcoming. Of course, your ocean view still depends on what type of room you book and where of the 2 towers you get assigned to.A really nice new improvement is their pool. We never went to the old one, but this new redesign on the 15th floor is inviting, with chaises for sunning yourself, and lots of lounge seating on a lower level to the pool, but still accessible to the pool. There is also a bar nearby for your Mai Tais and Lava Flows. The pool itself is not so big, and the chaises tend to be all occupied so it could be a little challenging to find your spot by the pool.The staff is warm and welcoming. The room rates have gone up considerably to pay for all the improvements. This is still a hotel I will recommend, since its accessibility to the beach, restaurants, and shopping is really a strong feature. If you like relaxing at the beach and pool during the day, and eating out and shopping when the sun comes down, then this hotel is one of the ones that will serve that purpose.The only food outlet in the hotel we went to was the Morimoto Waikiki restaurant, but that will be another review.

Amazing service! Exactly what you would expect from a hotel of this calibre. Everything was so easy,... from the ABC store downstairs, to the Swell Bar at the pool!Great time drinking cocktails and enjoying nibbles around the pool,... and we loved the breakfasts in the O Bar.Would definitely stay again

I stayed at the Alohilani Resort 3 nights while in Oahu. It is clean and modern with a fantastic pool area. If you want views Waikiki beach, make sure you get a room in the Beachside tower or a higher up room in the Surfside tower. It is in a good location to walk down Waikiki beach and even walk/hike Diamond Head. We ate at the O Bar most evenings, due to the tropical storm, the pool area was closed. There are 3 other restaurants in the premise but one is only a breakfast place and the 2 others are more Asian cuisine and not as laid back. My only complaint is the wait service at both the Swell Bar pool area and the O Bar were subpar. These people have the potential to make really good tip money, but just don’t seem to know how to be a server. The front desk staff, the environmental service workers and bell hops were fabulous. You will enjoy your stay. I highly recommend this hotel.

Loved the new pool deck , excellent customer service. We appreciated late check out service and pool amenities were appreciated. Please continue to offer local residents the opportunity to have staycations in the state they call home.

I had a very enjoyable nine night stay at the newly renovated Alohilani Resort. But like many other reviewers, I must emphasise to anyone considering booking, this is NOT a five star resort. It is a very good four star property. My flight was delayed so I arrived well after midnight. The lobby is beautiful, but there was no one to help with bags and the woman who checked me in was not very welcoming. I asked if I could have some room service and was told that the hotel did not offer room service. I asked if I could get some bottled water delivered to the room - the answer was no. Five star? My biggest issue was the lack of information provided about the 'resort'. There is no in-room compendium or directory describing the hotel facilities, etc. I lost count of the number of people who asked me where the pool was. It was evident that I was not the only one who lacked information. After three days of staying there, there was finally a calendar of activities posted outside the elevator. For three days, I didn't realise there was sunset yoga, fish feeding, etc. The rooms are very pleasant. Not large for a 'five star resort' but it is Hawaii, so that is fairly standard. The beds were very comfortable. There was no kettle, mini bar or 'for purchase' snacks. I get that there is an ABC shop in the lobby, but a five star resort would have a few in-room options. The bathroom was small with no bathtub. Besides the very basic amenities (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap) there was nothing else befitting a five star resort... no large bath towels, no bathrobes, no slippers, sewing kit, q-tips, etc. I found the staff very hit and miss... some of the pool staff were fantastic like Jenny and Gabby. Front desk staff were very curt. The valet/doormen didn't want to know you if you arrived or departed by Uber, but were pleasant if you were on foot or travelling by taxi. The pool area is well done... great outdoor eating area, comfy sun lounges, good and reasonably priced food. I would suggest there be a minimum age for the main pool. There is a kids pool but it goes unused and all of the little toddlers scream and cry in the main pool disturbing all of those travelling sans children. Why have a kids pool? It's nice to see an old hotel get a facelift... many more hotels in Waikiki should do the same. They've done a great job on this old hotel, but I would recommend the Alohilani as a great four star property. If you have five star expectations you will be disappointed.

Loved this hotel! The beds and linens are super comfy. We had views of Waikiki Beach , part of Diamond Head and the mountains behind us. Spectacular views over the city at night, right up into the hills. Perfect location for wandering the main shopping and restaurant area and the beach of course. Pool area is beautiful, with the infinity pool disappearing into the blue water of the beach beyond. Good wifi. We found staff to be very courteous and helpful. Definitely will stay here on our return.

an outstanding renovation and update of this hotel. It was a last minute decision to stay here and we are glad we did. Had a super early check in (8am!) , lovely helpful staff, welcoming, helpful and very hospitable. The staff at the pool bar were outstanding, yes, pool chairs are hard to get sometimes, but the wait is worth it. Best pool in Honolulu. Open until 11pm, outstanding views, food, service and gorgeous large pool as well.The staff knew our drink orders after 3 days, even our 16 year olds, amenities are great, it was busy, and will get busier as people start to realise how great this place is. The rooms are clean, spacious, weird layout in the bathroom to have the vanity outside of the bathroom(the bathroom is very cramped) but who goes to Honolulu to stay in their room. We only had one issue with housekeeping in the they did a rushed job on our room one day and compared to the rest of the trip, the room looked like it hadnt been done. No big deal. SMall bar fridge, no kettle just a coffee pod machine which you can use for hot water. WE didnt have breakfast at the hotel as we arent breaky people but we did have coffee and croissants in the cafe areanear the aquarium which was fantastic.Highly recommend this place.

Stayed here for 4 days and loved the vibe of the recently renovated Alohilani Resort.Staff were friendly and helpful and the venue is in a great location across from the beach.I have stayed in other hotels along Waikiki - but I liked this hotel the most as it is light and breezy with a good vibe.Pool area is great and head into the pool area for a cocktail and enjoy the sunset.NOTE: bathrooms are small in the Diamond Head rooms - but as you spend most of your time at the beach - i am OK with that :)

We holiday between Asia and Hawaii a lot , however the cost of hotels are becoming increasingly expensive in Hawaii and you don’t get bang for your buck like you do in parts of Asia. We took a deal for the Alohilani and the hotel has gone through a revamp recently but it still lacks some of the basic amenities that you find in hotels all over the world for the same cost. Our room cost approx AU$430 per night and it’s just a basic motel style room, the bathroom is very small and no facilities to hang your own washing and no shower cap so my wife doesn’t get her hair wet. There is a big TV and lots of channels, as well as an empty fridge.We opted for, an ocean view room, which is good, but it’s a side view., we could see the surf, but some mornings were loud from trucks outside.A breakfast box is included, which consists of some scrambled egg, a danish and some fruit which hasn’t changed any morning. Coffee is supplied in your room in the way of pods, but you only get two a day and powdered milk. Buy some half and half from the supermarket if that’s your thing.The pool area is nice, but small and unless you get there early, it’s difficult to get a spot. The beach is right across the road which is great and nice and safe for the kids.You get some water bladders in your room which you an fill on certain floors, however the tap water is safe to drink and not too bad.The layout is very nice and even it has some issues, I would recommend it.

This is not a five star hotel. This is a 4 star hotel with a recent renovation and a nice lobby and pool. There is a distinct lack of reasonable amenities, even when asked for ( no cups, kettle, adapter, razors, or firm pillows.) Bathrobes, slippers, tea and dental kits have to be asked for. The concierge had no real knowledge of local restaurants and tried to sell us a time share package! Bath tubs are too small to actually bathe in and the water pressure from the shower is almost nonexistent. There is only one light in the bathroom and from every angle other than directly in front of the sink, it is just a naked halogen tube light. No overhead lights in the bedroom area makes it very poorly lit. The front desk agent who checked us in was aloof and apathetic. We were never offered assistance with our bags. All in all it has acceptable comfort and cleanliness, if it was marketed and sold as a 4 star property it would be of good quality. As a five star property it is disappointing at every turn!

The resort should pay attention to hiring people that like the public and that interaction pleases the rather than burden them. I payed over $3,000 to stay there. I didn't get what I paid for from a couple of employees.

some rooms are noisy with outside deliveries from 5am. Need to fix this as we won’t stay again if given same room. Grab’n’go breakfast is good. Pool area is beautiful with more than adequate pool chairs.

Rooms were tiny and not suitable for 4 people and luggage which is what we booked in.Bathrooms were even more disappointing small.Pillows were fluff and not supportive in any way.Staff were advised of these issues and provided no suitable recommendations / changes for these issues.

Stayed here for 5 nights with my sister and her friend and it was great. We had a room with a view of the Waikiki shore and Diamond head and it was amazing!! What separates this hotel from the others lining up Waikiki is their "Oceanarium". It is a huge aquarium full of marine life on full display right next to their lobby bar. Feeding time is the best time to go and have a look at the fascinating displays of reef fishes. It's so colorful and fun to watch. The staff are all helpful and cordial. This hotel is also centrally located so you can walk to other restos and bars. I would definitely stay here again.

the hotel is very nice in the front , anything are nice , but if during the night is kind of loud outside so you can hear the noise and I think the garbage truck is next to the hotel , so the morning is loud , and I think I need to bring my own pillow , the pillow is to high for me

My friend and I stayed 7 nights. We loved the hotel's location and amenities. Worth the money but be aware of renting a car during your stay, as parking is expensive at the hotel ($30-38 per day) and considering it's convenience to the beach, public transportation and uber, it may be best to simply skip on renting a car unless you plan to travel the full island. Other than that we loved it there and had no complaints. It was super quiet in the hotel (no thin walls or thin windows), so we slept great, as well. Try not to let the ABC trinket store downstairs take all of you're money...they definitely got us!! lol

Came here for a business trip, and decided to upgrade to a high floor (35) with a great view of Diamond Head. Balcony was a plus, so I could kick it and watch the surf. New, no-frills rooms. Great to have a fridge.Words of caution:- At 99% occupancy they are by-the-book sticklers for the checkout time. I paid $20 to stay one extra hour (to check out 12 pm instead of the usual 11). "Check out" is taken literally. At 11:50 AM, I heard a sharp knocking from housekeeping, to remind me to vacate. - No place to really change or shower after you've checked out, so you'll have to look elsewhere if you're looking for that kind of amenity,

Amazing experience overall. Would recommend to everyone who is interested. Staff is friendly and welcoming without being overbearing. Concierge recommended great trips that were once in a lifetime experience.

We stayed for 14 nights and was very pleased with our visit. Amenities cost was a lot higher than last year though. The concierge, Abbie Johnson was outstanding again. She always makes our stay more pleasurable with new and exciting excursions. Our Maid was exceptional too! She always pleasant and prepared our room perfect while we were out.

we had a great stay. Concierge was especially helpful they recommended several restaurants and made reservations for us. Hotel view of the beach was everything we hoped it would be. We can't wait to come back.

This hotel is at the "quieter" end of Waikiki, down by Prince Kuhio (PK) beach. We had a "standard" room with 2 queens. First, the bad...number one, the mattress on one of the beds had some bad springs and was collapsed towards the foot end. Upon report of the issue, it was rectified immediately...but probably should have been caught before we got to the room in the first place. Second, we were in room 219, which is right above the Momosan restaurant...and they play music till past 11pm. That would be fine for most people...but not with two small kids. There was also a lot of street noise. Again, resolved immediately upon report. Now the good: Pretty much every single other thing. Aside from the noise, the room was nice. Well appointed, with a mini-fridge, Keurig, and pleasant smelling Malie toiletries. Room 219 was also right off the elevator, super easy. The parking garage, like many hotels, is cramped but not too hard for a Nissan Pathfinder sized car to maneuver in. Great service throughout the trip, including multiple check ins through text, which was a nice touch.Tips: -Parking garage is near the Seascape Tower. The elevators on that side of the hotel are suuuuuper slow. In the middle of the lobby there is a single elevator. If you take that elevator to the 3rd floor, you'll exit to the meeting/banquet rooms...go down the hallway and you'll be in level C of the garage. If you're parked higher than that, you can walk into the garage and there is a 2nd set of elevators that will take you to the other levels...still faster than waiting for the Seascape elevators. There are parking garage entrances on both Liliuokalani and Kuhio Streets, in case one is busy.-There is an ABC Store (I know, big surprise) attached to the hotel. If you are in the Beachside Tower, you can cut right through the store and end up at the elevators, instead of walking half the block then going back through the lobby and down a hallway. Conversely, that is also your fastest beach access.Enjoy your stay! We did =)

A very easy on the eye hotel. Clean and pristine, great use of natural wood and furnishings. No complaints other than the bathroom which has no storage. If you book make sure you pay the extra for an oceanfront room. You get the afternoon sun and magnificent views and sunsets. The pool area gets busy there before 10 and spend a few hours then head on over to the beach across the road. Burn off the calories in the well equipped gym.

Amazing hotel for the price. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for an affordable place in waikiki. This place was very clean and I loved having the ABC store right down stairs. This was very convenient. Cant wait to be back!

Great, location, superb service and facilities. All staff very welcoming and helpful. The room was modern, spacious, clean and equipped with everything we needed - except an electric kettle and real mugs, which were supplied happily and immediately. So glad we chose this hotel.

Booked a partial ocean view that had a massive brick wall that blocked virtually the entire view unless you stood in the very corner of the balcony. Forced to upgrade and greatly increase the cost of my stay. The lobby and pool area are well done and recently renovated. The rooms show their age, they are small, with tiny bathrooms, and dated A/C units that are quite noisy. The signage is inconsistent. The elevator advertises the breakfast buffet at $35 dollars, but you pay $40 when you get there. The pool hours are listed as 8 am to 10pm even though it's open til 12. No one on staff was able to get a first aid kit to touch up a light scratch from a days adventuring.

The new Alohilani resort was a lovely place to stay, in a great location. The activities and facilities of the hotel are one of the best in Honolulu. They also have a large aquarium in the lower bar where you can watch fish feeding along with flower lay making and numerous other activities. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful throughout our stay. I would happily stay here again!

We chose this resort motel on the advice from a travel agent. we were upgraded from a partial ocean view to ocean view. not sure what the difference is...We were on the 12th floor and did have a gorgeous view of Waikiki beach right across the road from our lanai.Our two older daughters came with us so we had two rooms, the cost was quite high, especially with resort fee on top (another $600) for ten days.Bed very comfortable and sheets changed every couple days, as well as towels and unlimited access to beach towels.We didn't really eat much at the resort preferring to venture out. We did get some free cocktail vouchers though for mai tai's.Mini fridge with nothing in itconcierge was helpful when planning day trips and bus time tables etc. We were in Oahu when Hurricane Lan hit. evertything closed for three days, shopping, tours, the lot. the storm never hit Oahu and I feel cheated that three days were wasted.bad luck for us. I would recommend this motel for luxury, but would have preferred too stay in apartment with kitchenette .

We decided to stay at this hotel because of their summer special of get the 4th night stay free. It's a beautiful new hotel close to the Waikiki beach and central area, and the staff was very friendly and helpful, even checking in every few days to see how things were going. There's a big fish tank in the O bar area which is fun to watch.The only reason for point deductions are because the room air conditioner was too strong. We had a maintenance person come check, but they said everything was fine, so we ended up turning off the AC more or kept it at a very high temperature. If you don't mind a strong AC, this hotel is great!

We stayed at this hotel when it was the Pacific Beach Hotel many, many times. We decided to return to stay at the newly-renovated Alohilani. We loved it! The staff is super friendly and embodies that "ohana" spirit. The hotel looks beautiful and the new pool deck is super. They now have an infinity pool, which is very cool, and a spacious pool deck to enjoy drinks and food as well. The food is very good on the pool deck as are the drinks. They also do the traditional Hawaiian torch lighting ceremony with hula dancing, which is very enjoyable and a must-see. It's very relaxing to watch the show, have a cocktail and take in the great view. We definitely recommend spending time at the pool and on the deck.The newly-renovated rooms are more modern and now have a thermostat.The location is very good as it's right across the street from the beach.While we are partial to this hotel since we've stayed there many times in the past (when it was the Pac Beach), we definitely recommend this hotel to long-timers and newcomers with its new renovations, new offerings, location and very friendly and helpful staff.

Beautiful resort with amazing customer service. I stayed here last minute for a work trip and will be coming back for my next trip for sure. It is modern, luxurious and very clean. Great views and vibe!

I stayed at the Alohilani resort 8/31/18-9/6/18. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is very friendly. Great location. The room was very clean. I just wish I was told more about the hotel when I checked in. Was not made aware of the location of the pool, gym and other amenities.

Very recently renovated, once the Pacific Heights Hotel, is now a fresh and refurbished ‘Alohilana (the name attracted me, I’ll admit), which is situated in a perfect location on Waikiki Beach. It’s right across the street from the beach and a few minutes walk from Honolulu Zoo and the Kapi’olani Regional Park. Inside the lobby, you will be greeted by many lovely staff in their crisp uniforms, a slightly subdued and professional Hawaiian set of clothes. The lobby is open and fresh, in the lobby bar the grand oceanarium which remained a beautiful feature from the previous hotel.The hotel has a lovely gym, pool area, pool bar, set of shops and restaurants. The pool bar menu had a nice selection of foods and while we did not eat at the other restaurants because we wanted to venture out to eat, they had great looking menus. The rooms are clean and modern, although pretty standard. The Malie bathroom amenities are worth mentioning as they have been my favorite so far at any hotels or resort I’ve stayed anywhere. The smells are fresh and the lotion is rich and thick, unlike other hotel’s watery mixtures. You’ll get a coupon for a free gift with a purchase at the shop in the hotel. Well worth it.

Do yourself a favour and go to this hotel well situated, safe Staff super you can have a buffet breakfast but also a light breakfast Enjoyed every moment ask the staff for information on anything A walk to beach and down the street.Convenience store in hotel if want to.Body surf just north Will be back!!!!!!

Hotel was beautiful and had a great location and view. We got a great military discount, but for the price we still paid we expected way better service. At check in we were told nothing about where the pool was or our elevators, and at the pool we waited literally hours for poolside service and still received none. Hotel could have been nice but overall not what you’d expect for a 5 star hotel/for the price. We also told the staff it was our anniversary and did not get any acknowledgment at all.

This hotel was really beautiful. You will love the location. The infinity pool is a must see. The aquarium tanks are a focal point, very peaceful and serene. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Stayed here for 5 nights. Good service. Not great...but good. Room was clean and well appointed. Property had many activities. Restaurant was mediocre. Lobby bar closed at 1030pm....poor for a resort in Hawaii. Front desk staff was only OK. Banquet staff was excellent. Pool staff also did a better then average job. While this property is not bad with so many other choices from major hotel brands with world class service I would probably not stay here again.

Looking for a snack and a drink one evening just before 9pm, we walked into the Alohilani Resort Waikiki Beach complex.To our absolute delight, they have a Happy Hour between 9 and 10pm for both food and drinks.We chose three different Happy Hour food specials, $8 each,Pipikaula croquettes - dried beef and Yukon Gold (potatoes).Makaweli sliders - 3 mini patties, Brioche buns, cheddar cheese an pickles.Yakitori - 3 chicken skewers and teriyaki sauce.Bottle of Kona Brewing Longboard lager $6.Glass of chardonnay $7.The three specials were very nice.There was also a solo singer playing songs in his native Hawaiian language with people getting up and doing the hula.A nice finish to complete a wonderful day in Waikiki.

[I base my reviews on my personal experience, so this was a 5 rating to me (for a Premier Ocean Front king ONLY) and I will absolutely be back. However, I can totally see how people may give this hotel a lower rating especially if they’re not ocean front.]Why shouldn’t this be a 5-Star hotel? Let’s start with the CONS (which are mainly things I honestly don’t care about as a traveler, but you deserve to know): No greeting with a welcome drink, but instead two mai tai vouchers for the bar (where you explain that you’re expecting and ask if your husband can have your shot instead while you drink just the juice and you’re told TWICE that next time, you’ll get charged for such a request after your original nice server said it was absolutely fine!!) while Embassy Suites is a 3.5-star hotel with welcome drinks and a free alcohol-included daily Manager’s Reception. Just sayin’... I was told that they’d make my stay special since it’s our babymoon and we arrive to a plain room (no note, no sparkling cider for me or wine that my husband can drink, no flowers, no dessert, no nothing aka no 5-star touch). Speaking of drinks, they give two refillable pouches for water in each room with the refilling station located all the way down on the first floor instead of daily bottles of water and if you need ice, the ice machine is only located on odd numbered floors—not the even floors. Odd indeed... We were in Room 8-23 in the Beachside Tower and its bathroom was different from the website in that the vanity was crammed in the bathroom with the shower and toilet, so you can’t close the bathroom door without the bathmat towel catching the door and if you don’t close the toilet seat, be prepared to drop things in it while you get ready in the morning. There is no way two people can get ready in this bathroom at the same time. Also, there’s only one sink because the right side of the vanity is blocked by the toilet. (There’s no mini bar or microwave if you care about that kind of thing and just your basic toiletries—face soap, body soap, shampoo and conditioner, and lotion. No fun shaving kits or shoe polish or Q-tips or cotton balls or nail files. The face tissue isn’t soft and the towels aren’t fluffy. Although the body scrub pad and fluffiest hotel slippers ever are nice! Oh, and let’s not forget the bidet which my husband loved.)It should also be noted that this is not really a “resort” in my book because it isn’t very expansive with many amenities. It’s a smaller, pretty, newly renovated, very clean hotel with a couple of useless shops with the exception of the ABC Store, and a very unique and lovely aquarium wall bar. They have an activity calendar with yoga, aquarium feedings, live hawaiian music in the bar, etc. The infinity pool is modern and pretty with cabanas, but it doesn’t face the ocean or anything. It’s located on the 4th floor with no signs on the Beachside tower side to tell you how to get to it. (Other than needing towels for the beach though, there’s no need to spend time at a pool when the ocean is steps away...) Finally, a potential major problem to some may be that the hotel isn’t located at the water’s edge. Instead, the beach is on one side of Kalakaua Avenue and Alohilani is on the other, so when you’re on your lanai, you can definitely hear tour buses, motorcycles, leaf blowers, etc. mixed in with the actual desired sounds of the waves crashing. Also, the sea wall didn’t bother me in the least from the lanai, but it may be an eyesore to the extremely picky traveler. I didn’t hang out at the beach in front of Alohilani, but I imagine that the sea wall may be nice for those who want to play in more shallow waters or annoying to those who want the waves to hit the shore naturally without the wall stifling them. Because I’ve only stayed at some 5-star hotels and only primarily care about cleanliness (and the view if I’m paying for it), I don’t mind the above other than the fact that I’ve stayed at lower star hotels without a lot of these issues, so I’m unsure what qualifies Alohilani as a 5-Star, quite frankly. With that said, on to the PROS (assuming you stay ocean front!): very clean and fresh feeling (due to the new renovation) and THE VIEW!! My goodness!! Their ocean front rooms are true ocean front with nothing blocking your view. I’m not sure if it’s the time of year or my eyes playing tricks on me, but I swear Alohilani’s location makes it so that you have the perfect view of all of the colors of the ocean. When I stand on the lanai and look to my right at hotels that are actually on the water (like The Royal Hawaiian), their water appears a sea foam green color—still pretty, until you look straight from your lanai or to your left and see gorgeous turquoises, blues, greens, and hints of purple. Another blessing is being able to see the unblocked sunset to your right from your lanai. No need to clamber for a spot on the beach. You can watch it privately from your own room! When the sun rises, you get a view of the sky painted pink as well. If you get hot while on the lanai, you can still clearly see the ocean from the comfort of your bed. In fact, the second you swing your door open after checking in, you can see the water immediately. What a greeting!For around $100 less than other 5-star hotels (probably because they are truly 5-star...), I’d feel extremely lucky to be able to return one day. Clean room and a breathtaking view?? What more could you ask for?(Again, I never photoshop or put filters on my pictures. The view is just that gorgeous.)

We stayed at the Alohilani for 8 nights and I can definitely say this is not a 5 star hotel.The positives - it’s brand new, it has a beautiful bar complete with an aquarium, it’s a clean hotel and had a comfy bed. It also has an in-house laundromat that you can use for a small fee and the location is perfection. The negatives - the bathroom is tiny ! So tiny that when you open the door it almost touched the toilet. For a five star hotel you expect slippers, robes, shower caps, q tips, wine glasses, room service etc - you get none of these - it’s as if they are trying to save every dollar they can. The air con in the rooms are extremely loud and so are their lifts ! You hear every single sound from your room and the balcony doors are not sound proof. In the morning you will wake up to the sound of the cleaners yelling at each other from either ends of the hotel hallway.They have a shallow infinity pool that is overrun by children and so is their spa. Getting drink service is not easy whilst laying by the pool. When we checked in no one told us where the pool was located or how to get there (there are two buildings in this hotel) overall customer service was really not that great - we kept having to ask for things that should’ve been explained at check in. The pool area was booked out twice for a private event so expect to be kicked out. Was it worth the money we paid ? Absolutely not. Would we stay there again? Only if it was the last place available and even then I would have to seriously think about it.

We had a partial view of the ocean from our room on high level on RHS of hotel and it was great - sunset views were great from the balcony. Pool area is cool as is infinity pool but not many chairs - so keep in mind. Also great at night up there. Staff v helpful and friendly. ABC store at exit to beach is super handy and I ended up buying fruit from there most mornings for b’fast (then sat on the beach to eat - fab!)Fantastic location - walk straight out and onto beach and right in centre of the action. Would stay here again and def recommend

I wanted to take a moment to compliment your staff member (Ms Lisa Alvarado) on her superb customer service skills. I phoned the Alohilani this morning with some queries and was lucky enough to get her on the phone. Ms Alvarado was just lovely, so warm, helpful and genuinely invested in my family having the best experience.When booking from so far away (New Zealand) this kind of customer service gives such confidence that we are coming to a fantastic resort with fantastic staff.We are beyond excited to be staying at your beautiful resort and l already have such a wonderful first impression of the Alohilani courtesy of Ms Alvarado.Maholo and see you soon.

We stayed in a one bedroom, oceanview on the 17th floor. The view was breath taking and the room I can not fault. So much space and the service was amazing. They serviced the room twice a day, replacing towels and. doing a tidy up and bed turn down with beautiful flowers on our bed every night. We had plenty of free water in the fridge every day and also tea and coffee. They had a couple of really good breakfast options and both were faultless. The position was perfect also, easy walk to everything. Can’t wait to come back

We stayed here for 7 days and unfortunately it was during Hurricane Lane. So we lost 2 days bc the island was shut down. It was very challenging for food & snacks. The Lychee restaurant was open for a quick meal of a chicken salad sandwich, a very small salad and a cup of soup for $40 for 2 people which my Husband thought was insane & felt taken advantage of considering the circumstances. $4.00 for a can of soda which was ridiculous. we didn't get to enjoy much BC of constant rain & winds. The time I did get to spend at the Infiniti pool was short but nice. There is a lot of kids running around so its not very relaxing when your on your honeymoon. we had an ocean view with private lanai which was nicenice for day & night lounging. The bathroom was very small but quante. It had a bedit. the TV was nice size. Beds were comfortable. Location is convenient right across from the beach and walking distance to shopping & restaurants. We spent a lot of time in our room due to Hurricane lane. The sun came out very rare in 7 days and rained everyday. The last day was sunny but we had to check out by 11am. I called to the lobby and they gave me an extwntion to 6 pm so we could enjoy the day with no fees. I thought that was generous. I also got some fees taken off my bill BC of all the inconvenience. Adrian (manager) was very generous. I would stay here again for sure just stayed at the wrong time.

Location is great being basically in the middle of Waikiki and close to shuttle buses although most of the tourist attractions shuttles didnt know of the Alohilani but did know of the Waikiki Beach Resort over the road (which is very much older). It's a mixed bag with the Alohilani; Some really nice amenities and two good restaurants, great infinity pool and cabanas, good gym. The room we had - superior partial ocean view was very comfortable with dreamy Kings size beds BUT NO ROOM SERVICE. Absolutely No Room Service at all. If you want to eat in your room you basically have to leave the motel and go to the McDonalds over the road. WTF?... So what if you want to have a drink in your room? NOTHING! No wine glasses or even glasses to use for water?? No Mini Bar, No Glasses if you actually buy drinks elsewhere and bring them back to your room there's nothing to drink them with and no openers - thats no wine bottle cork screw and no bottle openers at all?? WTF is this place supposed to be 5******??? - It's like they dont want you to eat or drink in your room. We came across many other guests from the Alohilani at the nearby McDonalds complaining about the lack of room service meals. - Pathetic service. During the week we stayed at the Hotel the Infinity Pool area was closed off twice for private parties. I know they make money from this but one of the positives of this hotel is the Infinity Pool area and to have it closed off to us 2 out of 6 days is unacceptable.Would I stay here again? Most likely not. Over priced for what this hotel offers. Our next holiday to Waikiki will be at the Hilton Hawaii Village. Lots more to do, better restaurants & bars, room service and mini bars.

Your hotel was amazing, we only stayed for two nights but would definitely stay there again in a heart beat. Perfect location, super helpful and friendly staff! Pool area is awesome could spend days there and so easy with the beach straight over the road. We had dinner on the last night in the hotel at the front and that topped of our stay perfectly Highly recommend this resort!

Nice hotel, fantastic swimming pool and fabulous rooms. Only complaint I have was the noise. Our room No.314 opened out above the service area. We did not appreciate the bottles being emptied into the rubbish bin early in the morning or the rubbish bins being collected early in the morning. We had asked for a quiet room. Would I stay possibly, but would definitely want a quieter room location.

What a difference this hotel is with 7 years ago! Loved everything about our stay, maybe only not that it was too short! Room and bed was very comfortable, staff friendly. The pools and relaxing areas are great and it's a very short walk to the beach.

Book this hotel! Stayed here for 6 nights in August 2018! Across the street from the beach the location cannot be beaten. We stayed in a King Ocean view room, spacious, clean, comfy bed and it was great having the option of sitting on the couch or the balcony and watching the waves. The Malie Organics Koke’e Collection Bath Amenities are so luxurious you will want to go to the store at the hotel and buy some to bring home with you! So many great dining options at the Hotel.We loved Morimoto and had some great food at the O bar and Swell Bar. They have a great gym facility, batting cages and tennis courts if you want to stay fit while on holidays. Big Thank you to Shanel (front desk) and Gabby (Swell bar) for making our stay so enjoyable! For us there is no other accommodation option in Waikiki.

This hotel is amazing, recently renovated and the rooms are just beautiful. The pool overlooks the beach , perfect for sunset drinks.We stayed during the hurricane warning and the staff were so accommodating in providing information and ensuring we still enjoyed our stay.Would absolutely stay here again.

We left a popular hotel down the road because the ac didn’t work and overall was just bad. I wish we could have stayed here from day one but we didn’t know. We were so exhausted from no sleep the previous night plus an 8 hour flight and five hour time difference. When the taxi pulled into alohilani I felt like we were pulling into a resort in Miami. Wow! I knew right then this place was right up my alley. We were there early and they let us check in early. Thank goodness! Very nice receptionist! We immediately went to our room - it was bright - lots of light- clean as could be and we were so happy the AC was ice cold! We immediately got into our bathing suits and headed to the pool called swell. Walking out to swell it felt like something off a tv show. We sat at the outside bar- had a really cool bartender named Brandon. We ordered Tuna dip- a fruity drink for me and a beer for hubby. The Tuna was so good and hit the spot. The pool is absolutely stunning! You can see the ocean from the pool. It was Just what we needed after being at the hotel down the street. This was more of an adult pool and hotel in my opinion. Not as many kids as the hotel down the street. The bed and linens were comfortable ~ they have laundry facilities on site where you can wash your clothes- nice shower and ice cold AC. Staff was exceptional and this was my favorite hotel out of the three we stayed at in Honolulu!

Lovely hotel, very modern compared to most other hotels in Hawaii. The only downfall was the Food and Beverage staff were quite rude. Making us not really wanting to go down the pool but didn't matter we were right across from the beach :)

Hotel is in a great location, easily accessible and near restaurants and entertainment. Waiting on front desk for check in or inquiries was usually a wait and not always pleasant. Food from hotel was mediocre. The evening entertainment pool side was a wonderful treat.

The room view looked like the online advertisement. The room was clean. We really enjoyed the pool lounging area. Staff were very friendly. Convenient location. The kids enjoyed the lobby aquarium. Decor was modern & fresh

Really nice, clean and gracious hotel. Right on the Waikiki Beach. Walking distance to shops, restaurant and more. Beach side of hotel have view of the beach. The staff is amazing. They offer trips to see anything. Nice clean rooms and bathrooms have bidets.

I stayed here for four nights with a group. The rooms have been recently remodeled and are very comfortable. The balconies higher up have side views of the ocean and, on one side, Diamond Head. I did not use the pools but others in our group said they were very nice. Several in our group had massages that were very good. I used the fitness center which has ample exercise machines, free weights, squat racks and cardio machines. I would stay here again.
user_name:
Barbara L
Saint Paul, Minnesota, United States

review_body: This hotel is very nice. The swimming pool is just beautiful. The staff too is always listening and responding the best they can to arrange everything! I cite particularly Adrian and Renée but they were all great !

Loved that we received a complementary small bottle of wine for our honeymoon and that they were friendly and extremely helpful with tours and transfers and information given about the tours were spot on.

Family of 3, stayed 9 nights in a Premier ocean front room with two queen beds. Great beds, clean spacious room with a wonderful view overlooking the beach and the sea. the hotel has a very special atmosphere, The wall behind the reception is so beautiful, the details in the lounge, the furniture, the giant fish tank, the deccor makes it so special. The staff was exelent. The hotel is so close to everything you need - shops,restaurants and the beach. Even got an ABC store inside the buildng. Wish we had stayed longer. We vill be back.

Very impressed with the friendly helpful staff. An aloha with a smile is what I was met with everywhere at the Alohilani. Room was clean and pleasantly decorated. Entertainment at the pool bar was great. Would definitely stay here again.

I stayed here for 4 nights on a conference. The resort is well located right across from main Waikiki beach and a short walk to shops. Also easy to catch a 40min shuttle to premium outlet ctr, or short taxi ride to Alomoana main shopping mall. Service was great, pool area is amazing! Views spot on. The beds and pillows..soo comfortable, you will be torn between chilling in your room or soaking up the Hawaii spoils. But don’t worry,A dip in the ocean is bit a 2 minute walk away!!Couldn’t fault the Breakfast buffet, you must try the French toast!If you stay here definitely dine at the Japanese restaurant above. Beautiful sunset views,Great cocktails and superb Japanese cuisine.

Plane delayed because of engine trouble, was put up free of charge by Qantas at this hotel - absolutely no problems with Qantas, they were great - however on checking my credit card back in Australia this hotel debited from my account the hotel stay that was covered by travel voucher from Qantas. On contacting hotel they said it was their mistake and would reimburse, four weeks later still waiting....A more positive review might have been forthcoming if it wasn’t for this biggie!!!!

The hotel lobby is beautiful but needs decent air conditioning.Compared to the other hotels we stayed at in Hawaii, the information provided on check in is limited. There is no map or information given about the hotel amenities either by check in or in an information folder in the rooms. The rooms are exceptionally clean but small. The bathroom is so small that the bathroom sink/mirror does not even fit and you have to get dressed in the actual hotel room itself. Fine if it just you and your partner but I wouldn't want to be doing that if i was staying with other family or friends.The hurricane alert went off at 6am in the morning, despite there being no hurricane. Being from Australia we actually had no idea what it was and had to call reception to find out.The pool area is beautiful, but the pools are small.Overall it was a decent hotel but certainly not 'luxury' as it promoted to be.

I recommend checking the fine print before booking a room at the Alohilani, because apparently even an impending hurricane (Hurricane Lane) isn't sufficient enough reason to cancel a reservation without a one-night charge + taxes and fees of over $300. Obviously, had I known that there would be a category 4 hurricane approaching Honolulu, I would've cancelled sooner, yet BOTH my flight (Alaska Air) and rental car (National) were a breeze (no pun intended) to cancel with no charge, despite both of their policies that don't allow for last min cancellations. They both obviously were fine making an exception for a ****ING NATURAL DISASTER!!!To be clear, I made this reservation from a 3rd party, which I RARELY do because of situations like this, but hotels.com is NOT responsible for this nonsense. Hotels.com customer service called the hotel themselves (while putting me on hold) and confirmed to me that it is only the Alohilani reservations department that can authorize a full refund this close to check-in. They also told me that if I called the hotel that they'd just refer me back to Hotels.com. This is an absolutely ridiculous way to squeeze $300 out of someone who was forced to cancel a trip to Hawaii because of the approaching Hurricane Lane. What a sham. I can only assume that if they're doing things like this that they likely also squeeze money from their guests in other shady ways. Read the fine print, because these guys have no shame. I'll NEVER book a room here again.

So - I personally think Alohilani is one of the better hotels on the Waikiki strip for numerous reasons. I don’t want to talk down on any other hotels but I can say all the plus points of Alohilanis NEW* (August 2018) upgraded, remodeled hotel. Firstly it’s so clean and this is a major plus point for me, with so many tourists around Waikiki - sometimes trash is inevitable, but the team at Waikiki make sure their hotel is spotless 24/7, without feeling like there are staff hovering around you - the rooms are always made up and ours included robes, chocolates, a majorly nice welcome at check in, a superb close car park attached and then everything we needed in the hotel whilst filming. We had a beautiful gym, new and stylish outdoor setting - infinity pools overlooking the beach - cabanas, amazing food and one of the best açaí bowls I had on the island (which was surprising to have in a hotel and not a hole in the wall type place) we loved our stay and the fact it’s 39 floors high allows you to watch the sunsets and sea the clear skies and deep blue seas from most of the rooms. We will absolutely, definitely return back hereJay H & Olivia J

After a very active holiday in Hawaii my husband and I booked in to the Alohilani Resort looking for a well needed relaxing few days in Waikiki. The service was 5 star and rooms very comfortable. The best sleep I had for weeks. The best part was the Expedia.com team in the foyer. We could decide what we wanted to do for the day on the day and they made it happen at a cheaper price. They were amazing. This type of service and comfort is perfect for any luxury holiday. The only major issue which will stop me from staying at this hotel again is the out of control kids in the pool area. After a day of activities you want to relax by the pool with a cocktail in your hand. Well this would be perfect if kids weren’t bomb diving around you and running around the pool. Yes there are pool rules but definitely not enforced or monitored. We tried on serveral days and times to have a relaxing drink in the pool or spa to be welcomed with a swarm of kids who were out of control. We stayed for one drink and had to leave. The hotel needs to get this sorted and have an adults only section.

The hotel is in the most amazing location right across from the best swimming beach. It looks great from the lobby and entry, but the rooms are a little dated which is disappointing for the high price they charge.

The rooms were great. Very nice. Pool was also great. Food and beverage could have been better by making better family style restaurants and better service in the bars. Still an excellent stay. Would stay again

it was very close to the Waikiki beach, room condition was great, very spacey, view was great(diamond head and ocean view room), welcome drink was great, pool was crowded but the service was nice. Stayed with two kids(4 and 3 yrs old) they had wonderful time. spacious parking lot. We had to wait at the lobby to be checked in(only two staffs were working) during that time there were not enough couch at the lobby (not at the bar area)

Absolutely beautiful!Right from the start we were looked after.Staff friendly and always were happy to help with organizing tours or finding great places to eat! Facilities were second to none.Would definitely come back with the family.Thankyou Thankyou Thankyou for such an awesome holiday!xxxxxx

Fully renovated & renamed hotel. The place looks great! Love the new infinity pool. Rooms were very spacious. Excellent location, right across the beach and close to walk around Waikiki and fabulous Diamond Head/Ocean view!

We are return guests and we love to stay at this hotel, we find the staff are really friendly and the hotel is close proximity to the restaurant and beach! The room rates are little high end and the resort fees are not ideal as they are approx USD 30 per day. I would definitely recommend this hotel! Good families

Pool is beautiful and so chic. Relaxing and overall just pure classy stay! Restaurants are also very relaxing with an array of Japanese food and breakfast buffet is so diverse and yummy! Need to revisit real soon!

Stayed for three nights, having spent time in Maui. It is a nice hotel, that is starting to show its age. Not sure what you need to have to be a resort, but from what we experienced in Maui this falls short. The location is great, the staff friendly and very helpful. Paint peeling of the walls in the bathroom, shows that people are either not looking or don't care.

Loved staying here on vacation to Oahu. It is right across from Waikiki beach and walking distance to the Royal Hawaiian Center. The infinity pool was one of our favorite parts of the hotel. Would highly recommend.

Very clean hotel in a great location, plus stellar customer service. The night of August 1st we were on a United flight that was turned back mid flight due to a maintenance issue. We were put up in this hotel. We did not pack a car seat for our 2 year old toddler because there would be one at our destination on the mainland. So I inquired with the valet dept about any taxis or ubers that offer car seats. I interacted with Chadwick. He informed me that there weren't any taxis that offered seats. He then told me he had a booster seat for his own child that he could let me use. However, my toddler isn't big enough for a booster. He then explained that he also had a toddler car seat which was hard to remove, but would do so so that we could use it for the drive to the airport. He explained that he could call a cab driver he knew to be there a little early & would return the car seat to Chadwick. Chadwick not only had the taxi there on time, but installed the car seat for us. As you know the drive to the airport is not short so having this car seat to keep our child safe was beyond important to us. Chadwick went above & beyond for our family...without us even asking him to do so, true aloha spirit.BrandyKalaheo, HI

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this beautiful, clean, convienently located hotel. Every one of the staff members was extremely helpful and hospitable. We were made to feel like part of the Ohana. We will definetly be back. Mahalo!

I LOVED the Alohilani Waikiki!! The name is hard to pronounce but the hotel is stunning! A sophisticated boutique feel with a Hawaii flair. Our room was lovely overlooking the ocean and Diamond Head, very comfortable beds. The room was not huge but very nice with a balcony and fabulous view. I loved the poll area....great service, food and drinks with a wonderful pool and view....Not huge but VERY cool! Everyone who worked at the hotel was friendly and helpful...Wonderful location...across from the street from the beach and great shopping and restaurants were all around us. I will stay again!!

An amazing new boutique Hotel in the center of Waikiki. We had a wonderful suite with a balcony facing the mountain. The suite and the bathroom was very spacious and the decor very carefully picked with earthy colours. Perfect location just off of waikiki beach. The pool is stunning and the staff very friendly and always tried hard to make our stay as comfortable as possible. There is a huge fish tank in the lobby and the whole concept is great. We will defo come back the next time we are on Oahu.

Had an amazing stay at this modern and beautiful hotel. Loved working with your cultural coordinator Summer. She taught me how to make a lei for my birthday and really made me feel special. It was very interesting learning about Hawaii’s culture and I can’t wait to come back. Your staff at the hotel made my vacation very memorable. Mahalo!

Staff need better customer service es to explaining all it's available amenities. I had to figure out what was offered and where everything was lacated within the resort. Also bathrooms were a little too small. Same for the rooms. Full ocean view rooms are more like partial view

Excellent location, directly across from the beach, beautifully presented and every room immaculate and pleasing to the eye, always clean, perfect pool, friendly staff always, truly unforgettable experience, thankyou

My family and I visited Hawaii and stayed in this beautiful resort hotel. Loved it! The entrance to this hotel is very nice and spacious to accommodate the many cars and vans dropping off hotel guests. You walk in through large wooden doors that remain open giving open air feel to the hotel entrance. The registration desk personnel were extremely nice and accommodating. They have even incorporated text messaging to personalize your stay and ability to reach them for whatever you need. A large aquarium is also on full display in the main lobby at the O Bar. The aquarium was beautiful. Room: This hotel has two towers. We stayed in the larger tower in the standard Diamond Head Ocean view room. It was comfortable and kept pretty clean. My only issue with the room was the bathroom--a little tight for space. The toilet also seemed lower to the ground which could be difficult for taller people and those with bad knees. Restaurants: We fell in love with the staff and food at the O Bar. They offered both breakfast/lunch/dinner and made one of the best burgers. Many occasions we ordered food to go and brought it up to the pool bar area (since that bar had a different menu). If you want a quick cup of coffee and pastry, this is the spot to go to. The Lychee bar offered buffet breakfast, but it was ~$40/person. Yikes that's a lot for breakfast. We also ate at Chef Morimoto's restaurant.
