It was delicious, but it was also very expensive for the portions you get. I would suggest this restaurant for very small groups or couples who want the ambiance and experience. If you are very hungry, you might want to go some place else. Lastly, we ate at the Swell Bar (by the pool). They also had some good food, but as I mentioned earlier, the O Bar was more our speed. We did not eat at any of the other restaurants. Pool: The pool and pool area was very nice. There was an infinity pool, hot tub, and kiddie pool. The main pool was always crowded as well as the hot tub. The pool seating area and the hangout area was very nicely furnished and decorated. This was definitely a great spot to hangout out during any time of the day. Staff: All the staff were very pleasant and welcoming. We fell in love with the O Bar staff who took care of our every need. We definitely made some new friends there and hope to see them again soon! I highly recommend this hotel for all types of guests. The location is perfect--directly across the street from the beach and down a few blocks from the main part of the Waikiki drag. Waikiki is very crowded and very expensive. If you have a large family, be sure to plan to pay at least $12 or more per person wherever you go to dine. We did not visit McDonald's or Burger King so I don't know what their prices are like. I will definitely go back to this location on our next visit.

The resort is phenomenal and you are able to relax and enjoy the beauty of the island. Wonderful place to stay with superior amenities. Within walking distance to all the area has to offer. Great access to restaurants, shopping, and most of all the beautiful Waikiki beach.

There is a problem in the bathroom, but the others are perfect.I requested a bathtub but it was disappointing that it was not suitable.Everyone was smiling and kind.The location was also good.I want to stay here again.

It’s a nice hotel, the staff is friendly BUT beware because the pictures online don’t match what you think you are getting. The way that they advertise their rooms is misleading. Not all bathrooms have glass showers and/or bidet (Japanese style) toilets. Ocean view rooms are on the sides of the building so your view will be obstructed or partial at best. If you want a true ocean view room you have to book an ocean front. We were here for less than 24 hours and heard three other customers complain about the same issues we had. I’ve attached pictures of our bathroom but looked at other rooms (two bedroom queens) & one bathroom was smaller without access to the sink/mirror area. I’m a bathroom snob so I was disappointed. We loved Hyatt Centric last time we were here & will be booking with them from now on. Alohilani staff upgraded us to a Diamond Head view which was beautiful, 31st floor. I only like leaving good reviews but when I heard others complain about the same things we saw I felt I needed to.

I stayed at the Alohilani in July 2018 and have found my new favourite hotel! Location is unbelievable, beachfront on the best part of Waikiki beach, you are literally only a few steps and your toes are in the sand.... unbelievable!The pool is breathtaking, infinity pool overlooking the ocean and with a spa section. There are cabanas that you can hire, we didn't but because we were always heading down to the beach for most of the day however next time I will give one a go.The pool area is awesome at night, they have great setting area with firepits and a great bar to sip cocktails.Food was excellent throughout and reasonable priced. We ate at both iron chef restaurants, I definitely preferred Masaman which he ended up eating at once, this was also alot cheaper than Morimoto. I personally wouldn't go back to Morimoto because it wasn't my taste but Masaman was my favourite food in all Waikiki.Rooms were nice and bright, they could do with a few new soft furnishings though. We had a ocean view room which was well worth the money. Next time I would upgrade to the oceanfront room, the views must be unbelievable from these rooms.Service throughout was excellent. You can still tell it's a new property because not all of the shops at the bottom of the hotel are open, however didn't mind me because there's plenty of shopping elsewhere. There's a little delicatessen/market at the bottom of the hotel which was really handy, we bought lunches to take to the beach and wine for the room.Excellent hotel, will be back!

I enjoyed this hotel for several reasons..comfortable beds, good food, great views, excellent service, walk to beach and shops...and low key enough not to feel like you're in a fussy place...If I had to verbalize a con it would be that they do not have enough counter space in the sink area...I would stay there again.

Good and clean hotel. However, we don't get a lot for what you paid. We went for our honeymoon and were expecting a resort-like hotel. Instead, the pools and bathroom are small, there isn't no room service nor even vending machines or food in the room fridge. Also, the parking price is insanely high. The pros are amazing location and good view.

Alohilani has been my go-to place to stay for the past year whenever I’m back in town. Aside from the beauty/amenities of the hotel, the service is unparalleled to anywhere else and constantly amazes me. Janis, at the Swell bar in particular is one of my favorite people to see! She is always kind and somehow manages to remember a ton of things like my drink of choice/friends/etc despite my stay being months apart. She’s is great at what she does and it is this exact kindness that always keeps me coming back.

This was our first visit to Hawaii and definetely your service, accomodations and location was part of our enjoyable stay. Maybe breakfast beyond our budget, but hearty and delicious, but enjoyed it only once due to budget. Wifi worked good and room cleanning was perfect. Lobby music very nice and right volume, elevators very fast, very good.
user_location: San Rafael de Escazu, Costa Rica
user_name:
rgrossm201
San Rafael de Escazu, Costa Rica

review_body: Nice hotel, on edge of waikiki beach, bit of a walk to the main shopping strip but if thats not your thing then this works fine. Good quality and recently rennovated hotel, not really a resort and swimming pool is too small. Very friendly and helpful staffOtherwise clean and comfortable accomodation

Great location, close to most activities on the beach. Great bed and great service. The views were beautiful and i loved the man playing Hawaiian music in the evening. There was Summer who taught us how to weave bracelets. The infinity pool was amazing

Things you need to know about this hotel: 1: This was shocking to find they consider this a 5 star hotel. If you have ever stayed in a 5 star then you will be disappointed. 2: They advertise ocean views. Please understand that you will not be getting an ocean view. You will have to bend over your balcony to and look through buildings to see a part of them ocean. When I complained they let me look at 2 other rooms with "ocean views" but they were no better. 3: To be a 5 star hotel you have to call them and request anything. There were no bellman after my 6pm arrival to help with luggage and take it to the room. This is done today and most 4 star hotels. 4: This is a pretty and clean hotel that looks very modern. I liked the bar area with the very large aquarium. The drinks had very little liquor in them and food at this bar wasn't that great. 5: The rooms were pretty typical of most hotels. Nothing special and definitely nothing extra. I could hear people laughing in the next room and people walking up and down the hallways. I stayed in room 1960. My experience wasn't terrible but it definitely wasn't worth the almost $600 for 1 night stay. This hotel should be a 4 star and sell for $200/night. I personally won't stay here again as there are so much better options.

Hotel was great everyone was so friendly an helpful would definitely stay there again. We had to extend our stay by 1night due to flights being cancelled the receptionist were great no hassle in booking extra night

Great location, right in front of the beach and close to Kalakaua Av. where you can find many restaurants and shops and take a walk.The hotel is new and comfortable, the room well furnished and comfortable; the only thing that can be improved is the bathroom, decidedly small for the needs of 3 people.

Friendly service, newly renovated clean facilities, convenient location right in front of Waikiki Beach, nice swimming pool with jacuzzi and sunbeds, ABC Mart on the first floor, McDonald's and cheeseburger just across the street, good value for money!

This was our first trip to Hawaii and first stay at the Alohilani. We were extremely pleased with all staff members and their helpfulness. The bell hops, customer service counter, bar staff, etc.. were all very friendly and bent over backwards to ensure we had a good stay for our anniversary! Expedia has an in house concierge service there and the prices offered were lower than those comparable online prior to our trip. We want to give a HUGE shout out to Abbie and Michelle from Expedia, working at the Alohilani, for such great and friendly service. The two of you played an integral part in helping us get the most from our trip, THANK YOU!

This was a beautiful well designed resort the service was fantastic the staff friendly and couldn’t help enough nothing was too much trouble I would stay at this resort again the time spent there was just fantastic

We stayed at the Alohilani hotel for two weeks to celebrate our 10 year anniversary staying in an ocean view king suite. We regularly visit Hawaii so were excited to try out this newly renovated luxury hotel which sadly didn’t live up to expectations and is far from the 5 star hotel it claims to be. The good• The hotel is styled nicely. If you want photos for your Instagram to make your friends jealous, then you will get them here. However you’re in Hawaii so everything is Instagam worthy, you don’t have to stay here.• The bed is comfortable• There is lots of storage space to unpack all your clothes• The reusable drink bottles are a nice idea, but they leak so make sure they stay upright• The TV is quite large and swivels so you can watch it from the little couch• The location is good, but so is the location of 60% of the hotels in Waikiki. Waikiki isn’t that big, you can pretty much walk anywhere.The bad• The bathroom is tiny. The vanity area is a decent size but the shower and toilet combo are so tiny you have to stand over the toilet to dry yourself. There also is only one hook to hang one towel, the other has to be hung on a railing over the toilet but it’s set so low that when drying (eg not folded in half) the towel hangs over the front of the toilet• The walls are paper thin, you can hear your neighbors• The doors are super heavy and no one holds them as they close so you constantly hear doors banging from as early as 5.30am as people get up for day trips• The noise from the live music at Swell bar at night is so loud you can’t hear anything but it. They also closed off the pool from 2pm until 10pm one day we were there for a private function and the music playing was so loud until 9.30pm it sounded like we were in the middle of a rave. When we complained about it we were just told it was for a fundraiser and they would be done by 9pm but they didn’t stop until 9.30pm.• The building is a smoke free building however there are no signs anywhere about this so EVERYONE smokes on their balcony. We spent most of our 2 weeks calling the front desk to ask them to tell people to stop smoking however nothing ever really happened and it got to the point that we couldn’t have our balcony door open.• The pool area is open to the general public so is over crowded. It’s also full of little kids and not the relaxing pool you see in all the photos, more like a pool on a cruise ship. There is a designated kids pool however when we checked this out there was no kids in there, they were all in the infinity pool.• There is really nothing in the room you would expect in a 5 star hotel and if you want something you have to ask for it. For example, there’s and ice bucket but no wine or champagne glasses. There is no showercap, no robes etc.• There is minimal security, you don’t need to swipe to go to your level in the elevator so anyone can go anywhere in the hotel.The uglyThe service at this hotel is atrocious. We’ve stayed at other 5 star hotels in Hawaii and the Alohilani doesn’t even rate 1 star compared to their service. When walking through the hotel, staff will not smile or hold doors/elevators for you if they’re in front of you. If you ask someone for help you don’t get it and no one proactively goes out of their way to make sure you have a great experience.Some examples:On check in, we were not welcomed, not asked if we had stayed there before, not told where anything was, not given any information about the hotel. It was very transactional, how can I get through these people and onto the next. This is fine, however not for the price of the hotel and for a 5 star hotel.We went to the guests services desk and asked them where were nice places to take photos around the hotel as it was our 10 year anniversary and we’d hired a photographer to mark the occasion. The response we got was “I don’t know, this is only my third day. Maybe ask someone else”. Again, if this was a true 5 star hotel we would have gotten a “congratulations, what sort of photos are you looking to take, casual, formal etc and I’ll find out some great places and get back to you”. As far as we could tell guest services just handed out maps of Waikiki. We walked past the front desk and valet every day at least twice for 2 weeks and not once did any of them smile or acknowledge us. Our biggest issue with the Alohilani was with the Swell bar and it’s management. In January, 6 months before our stay, we contacted the Alohilani and told them we were looking to host a private formal dinner for 5 people and asked if they had a suitable venue. We were connected to the manager of the Swell Bar at the time (Ryan) who we went back and forth with over a 1 month period locking in what was promised to be a formal 6 course degustation with matching wines for $178pp. Four weeks before our event (and since we hadn’t heard from anyone at the hotel to confirm our event), I contacted the manager to find that he no longer worked there. After a week of chasing different people trying to get someone to contact me, the new manager (also called Ryan) sent me the bar menu and said to pick something from the assortment of pizza and sandwiches if we wanted to do an event. I sent through the menu and quote I had been sent by the previous Ryan to be told “we don’t have a chef so we can’t do that”. Disheartened as this was to be the highlight of our trip, I asked for Ryan to confirm what they could do for us otherwise we would need to book another venue. After a week of chasing Ryan to call me back, he finally emailed and said they could still do the event and that my husband and I could meet with the new chef when we arrived at the hotel, the week prior to our event.When we met with the chef and Ryan, we were told that there was no way the menu that was promised to us could happen and that the chef we were meeting now wasn’t even going to be there the day of our event, and that “the guys who will make the dinner aren’t that skilled so can’t do anything too complicated”. We were assured that they would send us a revised proposed menu that day which wouldn’t be as complicated as the first one however would still make our event special for our guests. We chased the new menu for 2 days and received it only 2 days before the scheduled event and were so disappointed with the new menu which was basically sliced watermelon, sliced tomato, a salad and then sliced pineapple. We emailed Ryan to advise him that we were disappointed and would not be going ahead with the event however all we got back from Ryan was a “ok”. No sorry, no bottle of wine sent to our room to apologise for leaving us with 2 days to re-plan an event our guests had flown 10 hours to attend and had already received invitations for – nothing.If you want to spend lots of money but not get the experience you’re paying for, stay here. If you want to get a 5 star treatment stay anywhere but here. If you want cool Instagram photos, just go to the Swell bar without being a guest, everyone else does.

First impressions: Great. The newly renovated front driveway is really nice and welcoming. Even more welcoming than that is the front desk concierge staff. Specifically, Akemi. She, along with everyone us was more than accommodating to our room requests and simple check in process. BUT..........a couple days after we checked in (we had a 2 week stay), we decided to do something nice for the housekeeping staff and leave a tip to establish rapport and to just be nice people. And so, after leaving that tip, we left that morning and came back with fresh towels, made beds, and such. HOWEVER, we also noticed probably the WORST POSSIBLE SIN ANY HOSPITALITY OPERATION COULD DO EVERRRRR. ITEMS WERE MISSING FROM OUR ROOM. YES, I COULDNT BELIEVE IT EITHER. The most expensive item that was taken was a $300 dollar tub of cosmetic cream that was actually a birthday gift and was left in the bathroom as soon as we checked into the hotel. At first, before we decided to tell the manager and front desk staff, we flipped the room over just to make sure that before we reported it, we weren't being idiots. But low and behold, it was nowhere to be seen. So we reported it to the front desk and even went downstairs to talk to the manager, PAUL. But for whatever reason, I guess when things like that happen, it must be protocol for them to not care whatsoever. They treated the situation as if it was no big deal and gave us the feeling that they genuinely did not care, especially, the MANAGER AT THE TIME, PAUL. He really seemed like the situation was nothing. We explained to him that we really did not care honestly how expensive the stolen item was. It was the fact that it got stolen and made us feel so violated and invaded. And who knows, housekeeping, or whoever else has access to the rooms could be stealing items from other tourists staying in the hotel. I mean, were on vacation and decided to stay 2 weeks in your hotel PAUL. But of course, they did absolutely nothing to remedy the situation. Even just an apology would have made us feel better, but not even that courtesy was there. Just ridiculous.If you want your things stolen out of your hotel room and feel like you're not a priority whatsoever as guest in the hotel, welcome to Alohilani Resort. Otherwise, you'll be much happier to stay at any of the other 50 hotels on Waikiki Beach. I hear their staff doesn't steal from guests.Also, shoutout to PAUL, the manager we spoke to. Keep it up bro, keep treating your guests like that. You're a needle in a haystack buddy.

We had a great time!! Everyone was friendly, personable, welcoming. Complimentary champagne (with glass to keep) and chocolate strawberries was a very nice touch. Pool, bar, dining and concierge services were all more than accommodating. Overall, fantastic experience!

Love the decor here. Neutral burlap inspired designs. The room is very clean and modern. We had an ocean view room with a balcony. The bathroom is a bit small and toilet has a bidet. The pool is on the roof plenty of room for everyone. We dined at Morimotto restaurant which is just ok. We ordered the garlic shrimp, pecking duck, chicken wings and fried rice. The hotel is in a perfect location, it's right in front of the beach and in the heart of waikiki beach shopping.

A wonderful hotel and like others we have stayed here 10 years ago and loved the location The rooms were large, beautiful and clean. Staff were exceptionally polite and helpful and the pool is amazing. We had just come off a 7 days island cruise which was disappointing and were delighted that our stay at Alohilani was just perfect.

The newly renovated Alohiliani offers modern facilities in the best central location. From on metres away from Waikiki beach to a small walk to the international market place, it is a perfect location to base yourself while you enjoy the best of what Honolulu has to offer.Check in: there was a small queue but the ladies at reception were friendly welcoming and efficient.Hotel rooms: small but good use of space, fully renovated and comfortable bed. When asking for a waterfront make sure you ask for front ocean view.Hotel facilities: excellent reception, lobby, restaurants, bar and pool area. Pool is smaller than I excepted but amazing view once in the pool.Overall service: exceptional staff that really make this hotel above what you would expect from other hotels. They went above and beyond making sure we were happy with the service.Totally recommend this hotel for anyone who wants someone in the heart of Waikiki with a modern twist.Enjoy ciao

Fantastic hotel, staff, and service. Beautiful view of the ocean from our balcony. What I like about the hotel is once you check in the service manager text and make sure everything good with the room.

We had and AWESOME experience!!! Your staff was very friendly and accommodating. The décor and atmosphere is very sophisticated and trendy. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE the bath amenities...love Malie products. Enjoyed the food and drinks. I've already recommended your hotel to several friends and my colleagues at the Fairmont Orchid. I hope to return to your property again and again.

Had a nice relaxing time at this property. The staff was very friendly and welcoming, the hotel was recently refreshed and modernized and the location in Waikiki was great! The pool and lounge area looked inviting however, it was very crowded so opted not to go down and use.We experienced one incident that was unappreciated when Housekeeping knocked and then proceeded to enter the room even though we hung the "do not disturb" sign on the door. Thankfully, it was not too early in the morning but we did want to sleep in.Overall, it was a nice stay and we would return if there is an opportunity.

We have stayed at this hotel many, many times when it was the Pacific Beach Hotel and loved it. It's located Diamond Head end of Waikiki and directly across from the beach. Restaurants, shops, ABC store and McDonalds on your doorstep, with a short walk into the heart of Waikiki, ideally positioned. The rooms and the lanais are large. We've stayed after the renovations have been completed, wow, how beautiful is this resort! The bedding is like sleeping on a cloud, the rooms are beautiful and the bathrooms have been completely modernised. The resort is just lovely, great restaurants, fantastic pool and friendly staff who will go out of their way to make your stay as comfortable as possible. It must be one of the nicest resorts in Waikiki but of course along with this comes an increase in accommodation costs. It's now quite pricey but if you want somewhere extremely lovely to stay, then this is the place.

We were a plane full of unhappy travelers stuck in Honolulu overnight due to mechanical problems, actually new plane, no replacement tires. United Airlines arranged our transfers and overnight accomodations at the Alohilani Resort, right on Waikiki Beach. Despite the number of simultaneous check-ins, the wait was minimal and the procedure the sleekest ever! The hotel is absolutely 5 star; the rooms and view breathtaking, and the staff incredible! The infinity pool, especially at night, is awesome! If I were to return to Honolulu, specifically Waikiki, this would absolutely be my choice for a longer stay! Instead of turning lemons into lemonade due to our delay, we got champagne!

Super friendly staff, excellent interior, rooms are perfect!Right next to Waikiki beach - top spot!Waitresses around the pool were super sweet and kind. Recommend everyone to take a visit to the spa!We stayed here during our honeymoon and couldn't ask for better.

We enjoyed this hotel when it was Pacific Beach Hotel too. It is in a lovely location and the new updated decor is clean and modern. Staff was extremely helpful and nice. We enjoyed our two days at the resort. The pools were nice. I think they should put in another hot tub or two. Way too many people in one hot tub, especially when kids are swimming around in there. The size of the resort warrants at least three hot tubs. Nice roof top pool area though.

Great hotel. Completely renovated.In the middle of everything, you actually don’t need a car to go any place, specially with parking is outrageous on the entire island, everything is around you. Beach is walking distance, so as all the fancy resturants and food trucks and malls..etc..Staff are very friendly. Pool is great as it looks over the ocean.

My family and I stayed here back in 2016 when it was still the Pacific Beach. We had a wonderful stay and was able to enjoy the newly renovated room. The staff was kind and helpful. We were very excited to hear about the major renovations and made it a point to stay here for our next visit. We were so pleased and happy with every aspect of the hotel....appearance, staff, and service! We love the amenities offered please don’t ever change it. You have made it our go to hotel for our annual visit to the island. Thank you for being awesome and making our stay memorable Alohilani!

We decided to spend the final 3 nights of our 3 week trip to the Hawai‘ian islands in the Alohilani resort, with the intention to spend these final days not looking for adventure, but mostly to relax and once again enjoy Waikiki beach and its plenty opportunities to go shopping.Front desk staff was helpful and super friendly, so was every other staffmember, be it the servers at the pool bar, or even every single member of the cleaning staff we met.The hotel has a built in ABC store which offers both souvenirs as well as a decent assortment of groceries and even beach gear.Our room was labeled „ocean view“ or something like that, which meant that our balcony was on the side of the beach facing tower of the hotel, which gave us a nice view towards Waikiki beach, but also the pool area.The room was spacious, the bed incredibly comfortable. The bathroom - just like the entire room - was very clean (and obviously rather recently renovated).The toilet has a bidet and a heated seat ... which is nice, i guess?There‘s a Keurig with to-go cups and a fridge. The AC keeps the room cool without generating too much noise.Hotel WiFi is super fast and there‘s coverage even at the pool area. each nightstand has 2 USB ports for charging your electronic devices.The hotel is perfectly located for you to explore Waikiki beach. It‘s on the south end of Waikiki beach and therefore closer to Queen‘s beach, which is a lot less busy and which is also where most surf lessons happen. Another thing worth mentioning is the relatively large area in front of the hotel where you can unload your car without blocking anyone‘s way. great if you arrive with a rental!Be aware that there‘s a $35 / night hotel fee atop your room charge.We weren‘t expecting to use the (fantastic!) saltwater infinity pool on the 5th floor rooftop as much as we ended up doing. There‘s more than enough sunbeds, so you‘ll likely find a pair for you and your partner. We GREATLY appreciated the fact that front desk staff told us were able to use the pool after the 11am check-out which made the wait for our evening flight even more bearable.You get free towels, and there‘s a bar - cocktails are like 13$, soft drinks 4$.I can‘t really make a call with regards to whether or not this hotel is a great „value“ for what it offers. I just know we greatly enjoyed our stay there, and it was the perfect end to an amazing vacation!

Excellent stay in Alohilani Beach Resort in Waikiki. Very nice and newly refurbished facility. We checked four hotels (4 and 5 stars category)before we decided to stay there and Alohilani was definitely the best one.

Disappointed with the room at the Alohilani Resort Waikiki Beach. As a five star rated hotel it did not meet our expectations at all. It began with our room being incorrectly booked as a twin room, although we had stated on the booking our request for a king bed (reasonably important as a newly engaged couple). The hotel could do nothing to rectify this and we are currently in a room with two beds. The beds we do have a very comfortable, despite the miniature pillows (??? Where does one even get mini pillows?).The room has no mini-bar or in room menu; no alarm clock; no bottle opener; none of the items you would expect for a five star accomodation. We are disappointed to say the least and will be cutting our stay short, moving on to another hotel tomorrow. The pool facilities are very nice, although a little hard to find. I recommend staying elsewhere .

We had a wonderful time, staff were extra helpful and friendly. Will definitely be staying again. Hotel was close to beach and the view from our partial sea view room was lovely. Bar and pool area was excellent, even though the cocktails were a little expensive.

it has excellent location and room is clean and modern but there are so many guests so staff service was little slow and sometimes i could not connect with concierge and little noisy especially at nignt

After a week on Maui in a VRBO house rental, we spent 5 days in Honolulu at the Alohilani Resort Waikiki Beach. Housekeeping and cleanliness is the highlight of the resort. It is truly an impeccable property, lovely building design and the detail to cleaning our room was extremely impressive. Thank you! Every day, housekeeping arranged our son's stuffed animals and blankets on his bed, a very special touch! Pool amenities were good. Poor service by servers, greater than 15 minutes to bring a single drink. The pool rules seemed to change every day, one day, we needed to give a card to order order a drink, the next day, no card needed, we could open a tab and close out with the card at the end. Very confusing to have different rules. However, the pool manager was very informative and offered a refreshing face mist while relaxing in the afternoon sun. The concierge Abbie was OK nothing special about her service. We were very disappointed and frustrated to walk and walk and walk with poor directions to the enterprise car rental. If Abbie would have noted, the car rental is located in the Island Colony building, we would have been able to find the location without any problem, but all we received was walking directions on a paper map. Having many interactions with concierges, I was really disappointed with her level of service.

This is the first time for me to become doubtful of the reviews I read prior to booking. Everything I read and all the pictures I viewed created an expectation of what my experience at this hotel would be. 1st of all, let's start with the good things. It is a beautiful hotel. The entry way when you drive up is beautiful in design and the choice of woods for the doors, decking and flooring. 2nd while standing in line a woman comes by offering you ice water and a flower for your hair. (don't be fooled, after her there will be no service) The beds and pillows are comfortable, the soaps and shampoos etc. were excellent. I loved the salt water infinity pool that gives you a view of the Waikiki beach and the Pacific Ocean. The staff at the pool area were always smiling and helpful. Our waitress at the pool area was attentive and made sure our needs were met. The hotel is a great location, steps from the beach! What I have written so far is why it get's three stars. I can not deny those positive things. But, that is where it ends. When something is consistently rated 4 stars and it bills itself as a high end resort with high prices, I expect service not just looks. This is apparently a new company that has taken over this hotel and perhaps the kinks are not worked out. But to the management here are some serious flaws that would need to be corrected before I pay that kind of money per night: there was no bellman to take our luggage to our room upon arrival, I had to stand in line with my luggage and carry my own luggage up; the check in person did not inform us that there was no room service nor did she provide a map or listing of where all of the services were located or even that there were events the hotel was putting on. Her main concern was in asking if I preferred to pay the resort fees ahead of time or at check out. I told her check out and she charged them at that time anyway. After arriving to our room, we needed an additional luggage rack in our room. We called to request and no one answered. We called several times and no one answered. Finally we called the outside line and reach a manager who apologized and then we received the extra luggage rack. We discovered no room service nor any materials that told us anything about the hotel. We went down to the O Bar to get take out. Again it was packed up in nice packaging but we arrived to our room to find an over cooked burger with no condiments! We were exhausted from travel and found an over cooked dry burger with no condiments, then a flat bread pizza that was soggy and inedible, a horrible tasting tomato on it, and a Kale salad for $16 that was a pile of large leaves with ceasar dressing on them, that was it for $16. This was our 1st evening and did not set us on a positive note. Like I said there were no materials or person to explain how everything works. So, I asked the front desk where I could get towels to take to the beach, she politely sent me to the bell desk. The person at the bell desk offered towels but in a condescending tone told me I was to get the towels in the pool area from now on as though I was trying to get away with something. But exactly where is the pool? There was nothing anywhere to indicate where. I later discovered there were 2 towers of rooms on either side of the hotel. The tower across from where I was staying did have signs for the pool area and restaurants etc. But not anywhere on our tower. The next day we looked for the pool by going to the 5th floor but in the wrong tower and finally discovered if we went through an exit door we would find the pool. No signs. Our party consisted of 2 adults and 1 teenager, which is what our reservation was for; in our room there was only enough stuff for 2 people. We asked the cleaning people for more towels, coffee etc. and they begrudgingly left more. 2 people in our party took turns being sick and on one day did not allow our room to be cleaned. This was a mistake, because if you didn't let them clean and resupply on their schedule, forget it! I found the cleaning staff to be snippy, stingey and suspicious. Once we walked in while they were cleaning and she asked us if this was our room? What? I've never had that happen to me before. If you miss the cleaning people, you won't get what you need because either no one answers the phone or they never show up. The one time I succeeded in reaching a person and requested coffee pods they never showed up. We were there for 9 nights. With no room service, a small refrigerator and only a microwave if you paid extra. I refused to pay extra at this point. We were sorry we did not rent a condo! What was the point in paying for a nice hotel, with no room service period! Can't even get complimentary coffee or towels! Upon check out I was asked if I needed a bellman for my luggage or would like to dine at the O Bar while I waited for my shuttle. I told her no, I had taken care of all of that. Why would I call and call for no one to show up? I'd miss my shuttle to the airport. There was no way I was spending another dime at the O Bar for horrible food. Now while, I'd love to find an excuse to stay in Hawaii, I wanted out of an expensive Hotel that sells itself like a 4 star resort to only feel like I was in an upgraded Motel 6. Meaning self service, the only difference was the price, nice towels and a nice bed. So, if you don't mind spending a lot of money to have a nice bed, towels, and a nice pool this is the place for you. If you want full scale service, there are plenty of wonderful full service hotels and resorts in the area. If you do decide to stay here despite this review, expect to serve your self, don't eat at the O Bar, the pool is on the 5th floor, apparently there is tennis or ball cages on the 17th floor, never found them, and stop at the elevator because there are a list of activities listed that are occuring at the hotel, but check the dates because it might be last weeks. Needless to say I am not happy, perhaps if I'd have paid 1/2 the amount I paid to stay here I would have been satisfied. It's a beautiful place, but the engine is broken. Upon my return to Waikiki I will be finding other accommodations. In my opinion, unhappy staff, staff that are snippy and stingey, this is a direct result of extremely poor management. This place has potential but it is far from a 4 star resort. Read the bad reviews 1st! If I had done that I would have chose other accommodations as the other bad reviews I read after I arrived confirmed my complaints. The best part of the hotel was the ABC store on the bottom floor, great food, great service, smiling and friendly staff! If only they offered delivery to our room, the ABC staff that is.

We had an amazing time staying at this hotel! Amazing location right on Waikiki beach, and a very friendly hotel staff who checked in regularly. The hotel was very clean and looked very upscale. Great drinks at the pool area!

The unbelievable service by the staff was amazing. They handled 3 different flights that were unplanned canceled that were booked by the airlines at the last minute with such a positive attitude and worked to accommodate everyone's needs. Wade helped us out with copies of re-booked tickets and bent over backwards to help get our food voucher's taken care of. Tamika was very helpful in addressing our special needs with bag storage and sharing what amenities we could visit in our limited time. The rooms were very nice and comfortable and gave us a good view of diamond head and partial view of Waikiki beach. The food was very good and the service was top of the line.... I would definitely consider their resort if booking a trip to Honolulu on our own.

Loved the property. The lobby is beautifully decorated and welcoming. The staff is wonderful and accommodating. The hotel is centrally located...you can walk to the zoo and all the amazing shopping easily. We had room 1024 which directly faced the water. The room was spacious and the bed and linens were comfortable. The only downside was that the bathroom is quite small but the shower was nice sized and the heated seat and warm water bidet were a nice touch.

The foyer, lobby lounge, pool, and other areas of the hotel were amazing. Go for a room on a high floor and enjoy a gorgeous view of the city. We stayed there for a staycation and really enjoyed our entire time there. We also had a wonderful dinner at the Morimoto restaurant next door to the hotel (which I would also recommend checking out). The best part of the stay was the service. All the staff we interacted with were very friendly and helpful. Often seeing staff in the parkade or just walking around the hotel, and they would smile and say hello, and ask how our day has been.

My family and I stayed for 10 days in one of the suites in the 39th floor. Room was amazing , Service was great, location is prime and I can honestly say that I had a great experience with all the staff we interacted with. They were super friendly and very attentive the whole time. The pool was our favorite spot. We hang out there every day. Thank you Michelette Yamada for such a great and personal service at the pool. We can’t wait to come back next year.

We had the pleasure of staying at this fantastic hotel property in the hub of Waikiki. The service from the grand picturesque front counter was outstanding and even though the property was still going through the final stages of it's refurbishment, the property had that very posh and luxurious feel yet still down to earth ambience surrounding the property. We loved our time there

positives - lovely resort - beautiful foyer - clean rooms - perfect location in Waikiki negatives - overcharge on bill - watch the tree fee , noisy elevators - pool very overcrowded , cant swim easily - very small bathrooms

Let’s start with the positives:1. Beautiful lobby2. Great location3. Comfy bed4. Epic hotel gymAnd now on to the negatives:1. Rooms are not sound proof. You can see light coming through door and as this is the old Pacific Beach Hotel some rooms still have an adjoining door (which has not been renovated). Be prepared to hear every cough, sniffle and conversation in the hallway and if you are lucky enough to have that adjoining door, from your neighbours. 2. Tiny, tiny bathroom with a strange shower design. No door but just a small shower where half is open to the bathroom. The bathroom gets soaked. 3. Noise outside! We were on the 35th floor and as the sliding doors have not been changed since what looks like the ‘60s, there is no triple pane glass to block out the sound and the street sounds below can be heard at all hours making it very noisy 4. Building Details - while the hotel has had a facelift the facade is so clearly 1970s from the old rusted balcony railways, low popcorn ceilings, minuscule washrooms, lack of sound proofing and old yellowed out hardware. Pictures make it look like a 5 but without the beer goggles she’s a 3 at best. 5. Staff - truly not that friendly and housekeeping was spotty.6. No room service - how can you be a five star hotel with no room service? 7. No alarm clock in the room - how strange is this?8. Weak wifi and for a $35 USD resort fee a night, I expect betterThis is a 3 star hotel at best. The old bones show through, service is tepid and the attention to detail just isn’t there. While they have put some high priced lipstick on a pig, it’s still a pig. Given the high price and huge disappointment, I will pick a real 5 star for my next stay in Honolulu. I won’t be back to Alohilani.

Love the new look hotel. It was excellent ( except for the two mentioned earlier) we will be back. Great location. Our room was very clean and spacious and the view from our balcony was exceptional. (37 floor). We loved our stay.

Alohilani is a fantastic place to live the Hawaiian dream. The staff are first class and helped make the holiday one to remember. The location is great being directly across from the beach and right in the middle of all that Waikiki has to offer. We could not speak more highly of the Alohilani and we would recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a great place to holiday.

I highly recommend this hotel for the overall cleanliness and friendly staff. Although I do not have front view of the ocean my view of the skyline and mountain made up for it. I did have a partial view of the ocean

I was in this hotel the last summer in august during my first time in Hawaii.The hotel was under renovation but i could enjoy the brand new and elegant rooms with a fantastic ocean view . I appreceated a lot the elegant and slick furniure .The new lobby was awesome . It has a very central and strategic position .I suggest obviosuly to book high rooms and ocean view .I will come back for sure .

I remember this hotel before it was renovated. It was a moderately priced hotel with a lot of history with the locals. I've been to wedding, birthday parties, and, a long time ago, I was even employed here. I semi-reluctantly stayed here on a friend's recommendation...and I'm soo glad I did. I had heard of the extensive renovations, but when I valeted my car and walked into the lobby, I was blown away. This hotel was completely redone, updated, upgraded and it looks like a completely different property. Of course, the location remains perfect. It's far enough that I felt like I was on vacation from the crowds and loud noises, but near enough that everything in Waikiki was within a short walk. I was on a staycation and ventured out everyday to take in the sights and see what was new in Waikiki, but I always looked forward to getting back to the hotel. The bars on the pool deck and in the previous site of the local favorite restaurant, The Oceanarium, was inviting with comfortable chairs, sofas and tables. There was some great live music...really, really good! So much so that we will return with our friends for some drinks and pupus (appetizers). Every morning, we got our workouts in at the hotel gym...which is an actual gym! Great idea to have an actual club gym on property. Never stayed at a hotel with a club gym on property, but it's an awesome idea for people who like to workout before binging on the local cuisine. Whenever I book rooms, I look for hotels with gyms on property. I've been disappointed by dinky workout rooms with the dingy light and a few rusty, old, squeaky machines, but the gym at Alohilani is NOT that kind of gym.Drinks were stiff and not terribly priced for Waikiki...and there's a Morimoto restaurant on property! Can't go wrong with that!We all had a great time! We'll be back for sure!

We stayed on the 17th floor of this hotel for three nights. We booked two twin bed rooms. The rooms were very clean and spacious. There were lots of storage. The beds are queen beds, big enough for two adults and two children. The shower was fairly clean. But the toilet bowl was too low, at least 6 inches lower than those conventional ones. The water in the toilet bowl would almost touch my bum. I got to lift my bum in order to wipe otherwise my hand would touch my poo in the water while wiping my bum. The room ceiling was fairly low, slightly above 8 feet only. The infinity pool was very small, only good for playing, not for swimming. The deck was large and nice. We did not book for breakfast which would cost $35 per person. We enjoyed our breakfast in Macdonalds just outside the hotel. This hotel is just 3 minutes’ walk to the Waikiki Beach and 10 minutes to busy Waikiki Beach Walk. So it had a good location in Waikiki. There were lots of ABC stores nearby which were like Japan Family Mart or 7-11 though they almost sold everything including spirits and clothes. I will give it a 8.1 rating.

I have stayed at several hotels in Hawaii and in Waikiki and this was by far the best one I have ever stayed at. The Alohalini resort was incredibly luxurious for the price point and can easily compete with other hotels double the price! The food at Lychee (breakfast buffet) felt fresh, tasty and elevated. Dinner at Morimoto was outstanding, and service throughout was on point. The rooms are modern and elegant, and the pool is out of this world! Stay there!

Overall a nice hotel. It would have been nice if they had more cabanas and for free. There’s only 4 and they charge over $100 per day. The food was good but very expensive. Go out to eat instead!!. :)

The hotel was nice, and the restaurant Morimoto was quite a treat.The best part was our Concierge. Abbie Johnson made our stay so much better, giving us great advice on tours to take and greeting us with friendliness and great cheer. She was incredibly knowledgeable about the best tours to take and was a delight to deal with. She helped us with things like when to visit the zoo, pearl harbor, the best snorkeling trip, the best luao to take, a visit to kualua ranch and even things like whether to bring the children to Morimoto.

We stayed at the ‘Alohilani Resort Waikiki Beach last Fall and it served it's purpose for us. We were steps from Waikiki Beach and had a great view of Diamond Head, which is what we wanted. We also liked the pool and pool bar.

We really enjoyed staying at the Alohilani hotel! Great pool, great breakfast buffet, great ocean view! Ocean property, close to everything! Excursion pick ups were only a 5 minute walk to another hotel. Staff was so friendly and helpful! Always a clean room, just a wonderful place to stay!

We stayed at 'Alohilani for 3 nights and 4 days and it was wonderful. The room was nice and spacious and the view was spectacular. When you went on the lanai, you could see the ocean, city, and mountains. The location is also great, since it is in the heart of Waikiki and you can walk to everything. The highlight of this hotel is the amazing pool and pool area. Also, there are free lei making classes everyday, which was a fun experience. The current price is very reasonable and I would 100% stay here again.

This is an upscale property that has a very responsive staff, but has some structural issues that detract from the quality of the stay. The hotel is a renovated property and its earlier incarnation was clearly a lower-level hotel as the bathrooms are VERY small and the sink area is open to the room. There are not enough towel racks for wet bathing suits or wet towels. There is no upscale feel to the bathroom whatsoever. All but suites also lack robes or body wash unless you request them. There is no room service and towels for the beach have to be picked up at the pool, which necessitates an extra stop. The spa also really isn't a spa, just a pair of services offered through the gym. However, the gym is very good for a hotel. They advertise a tennis court, but it's not really protected from the wind and it would be easy to hit balls over the side of the building--you are better off playing on the local courts.On the positive, the staff is very responsive to issues they can address. You can actually text the manager-on-duty, and they are responsive--we had to have a mattress replaced because it was broken (springs damaged)!. The elevators also work very well despite only having 4 for 39 floors (plus a secret two from the second floor up).
user_name:
FrequentTraveler496
New York City, New York

review_body: Reachability of hotel was good, just 25 minutes away from airport. Room was clean and considerably roomier than other nearby hotels. Cleaning service was great, room itself was nice place to stay and view was absolutely outstanding. Quite pricey, but still high value considering what you get.

The renovation is tasteful and the pool deck very nice for relaxing (can be a bit busy).Great views of beach/hills even from side rooms.Very comfortable room, good bed and shower. Lots of Tv channels but no pay options. Strong internet in most areas of the hotel.Insulation between rooms poor as we could hear normal voice level talking in next room. Bathrooms small and low quality toiletries.Very close to the Beach and lots of good facilities Concierge service always seemed congested so didn’t really use - possibly need more staffOverall a very comfortable place for a stay and a nice update to the hotel

The hotel is beautiful, beds ate comfy and rooms clean, staff are wonderful, the pool area is a little piece of heaven, across the road from beach and shops everything you need for a great holiday!!!!

Perfect position on Waikiki Beach, short walk to everything (beach, shops, restaurant, bars) tours are easily arranged with transport with concierge. Rooms are new and cleaned to perfection. We had the best family holiday. MacDonald's on the corner for the kids, ABC shop (convenience store) in building.Wifi free and easy to use. Complimentary water refill station on lobby level and complimentary water on pool level.

Really enjoyed our week stay as a family. Our room was excellent, it was nicely decorated, clean and a large TV (much to my son's and husband's delight!) although lacking a little storage for a family of 4. We had a corner oceanfront room which had a larger than expected bathroom (based on previous review) however I think our room was for people with mobility issues hence the bigger bathroom and rails. Didn't bother us at all as we appreciated the extra bathroom space. Room was fully updated except for the external sliding doors.We had a double queen room but didn't think the beds were true queen size. The beds although comfy were a bit tight, definitely less space than our queen bed at home, therefore didn't sleep as well.View was amazing from our balcony and the hotel was straight across the road from the beach.Resort was nicely renovated. Front lobby, entrance, bar etc was amazing although the layout to get to pools, self service laundry was confusing. You had to ask staff where these amenities were, but better signage / map of facilities would improve this issue.Pool was a lovely area, quite windy at times but great facilities.Little concerned about lack of security as anyone can walk in a take elevator up to the floors. Although we didn't personally have a security issue, we did find someone looking for the pool in the corridor then found out they weren't even a guest at the hotel.Overall a great hotel and fantastic location. loved our amazing view from our hotel room.

Right in the middle of Waikiki and on-ish the beach. Friendly staff would be an understatement. Stacy at the front desk was very warm and kind. Allison at the lobby bar was absolutely awesome, cool enough to want to go out and drink with! This place seemed to have a lot less children than others which is a big plus for couples. The ocean front room was fresh and gorgeous. See picture from balcony.Bottom line I would stay here again.

This was a very beautiful hotel. Staff was excellent and did all they could to satisfy the guest. The rooms were exceptionally clean. I was very pleased with the experience of the concierge . I had an awesome ocean view for the entire 7 day stay.. I must admit $40 per person for breakfast was outrageous.

We have stayed in many hotels around the world and the Alohilani is one of the best. The Aloha spirit in the form of smiles and friendly greetings from the staff- maintenance, pool service to hotel manager are what make this a special place. The facilities are nice with beautiful view and cnice amenities but it is the exceptional derive that stands out. We will definitely make this a regular holiday destination.

The hotel is breathtaking! The wonderful amenities make your stay even more enjoyable. The pool deck is so relaxing and tranquil. Food on the property was A+!!!! I highly recommend this establishment. Rooms were very clean, amazing views, & perfect location for fun in Waikiki.

They have very nice rooms and great beds.On the flip side, money hungry. Continental breakfast is spendy and buffet for breakfast is outrageous $40 a person is ridicules. We went to the Hilton right behind Alohilani (MAC 247) a lot cheaper and awesome food. You should get a lot more, for the price you pay at this hotel.

We needed a fabulous resort to celebrate our 10th anniversary and we are thrilled with our choice to stay at Alohilani Resort. We loved it so much that we feel it's on par with the resort we chose for our honeymoon in Bora Bora. In fact, if you're considering the Alohilani Resort for your honeymoon, it's perfect! We stayed on the 16th floor in an oceanfront room. The view was spectacular!! We had a panoramic view of Waikiki Beach. The beach was gorgeous and pleasant to swim in because it was like an ocean pool. There is a short lava rock wall that surrounds Kuhio Beach and keeps out waves and coral rocks. So you have a lovely, soft sandy beach. The close-up view of Diamond Head from the water is awesome. It is a family-friendly beach and resort. Our room was comfortable with a king-size bed, central air conditioning, mini refrigerator and spa-like bathroom. Amanda sent us a personalized card and note along with a bottle of champagne and tropical fruit platter for our anniversary. Very sweet!! Every staff member at the resort is professional, friendly, and helpful. We enjoyed our time with the resort staff, as they are personable and caring. The pool and lounge area is fantastic!! The pool and hot tub are salt water not chlorine. The cabanas are gorgeous and well worth the prices. We intend to reserve one on our next visit. The bar serves ono food (hello,mahi tacos!) and the best mai tais and smoothies. The pool is wonderful during the day and at night. I enjoyed the convenience of being able to walk into the ABC Store from inside the hotel. It is a nice, clean store with a friendly staff. The breezeway can be busy at times and the valet staff handle it with ease. Check out was pleasant because a staff member approaches everyone in line to expedite their business and offer cold water. We did not want to leave and we look forward to returning as soon as we can.

This is a beautiful hotel in a very convenient location. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a Diamond Head and ocean view - it was gorgeous. Toilet and shower area were not updated, but the sink and vanity area were. That was not a biggie for us. I only wish there were enough towel hooks for every towel. There was only one. Also, although the sink area was updated, there wasn’t a lot of storage space for our toiletries. There is a beautiful bar area with aquarium tank where we had our cocktails. They also had a wonderful musician the evening we were there. The pool area, although small, was beautiful - with infinity pool, poolside bar, and lovely cabanas you can rent. One of the best parts of our stay was breakfast at The Lychee. It was pricey for breakfast at $35 per person. However, I have to say it was one of the best buffet breakfasts I’ve ever had. There was so much variety. I loved the Eggs Benedict and papaya. My husband loved their Portuguese sausage, grilled Saba, and Natto. Although not cheap for breakfast, it was reasonable for the food quality. The only exception to that was the pancakes. I hope they change their pancake batter recipe. Everything else was superb. And Guillermo was very attentive. What would have made it 5 Stars? Maybe more towel racks and shelf space. Also, a sitting area in the room would have been nice. Otherwise, it was a lovely hotel, and I would love to stay there again.

Well worth every dollar. It was a great experience. Wonderful hotel. Beautiful. I felt like i was in the movie Moana.Peaceful and lovely. Recommend everyone stay at this hotel. It is very different experience than other hotels in waikiki.

pro:+ new modern Hotel with nice design+ location (waikikki beach)+ parking garage (direcly on the hotel)+ swimming pool area (modern design)contra:- general expensive (if you decide to have a room with sea view than it get really expensive) - extra costs for garage ( $ 30 per day, self parking)- Some Areas from the Hotel still under construction (the room next to us was rebuilt, every day at 08:00 am they started with the reconstruction works - so we had no chance to sleep in

The hotel location is very nice. Easy to access to anywhere. We stayed upper floor and facing occean and diamondhead, view is beautiful from the room. The room is cleaned up always and comfortable to stay.

Agree with all the remarks about the excellent location and beautful pool area. Neutral decor with various types of woods. Staff was very accomodating and helpful. Easy access to local bus routes which we used to get to Diamond Head and Pearl Harbor. Beats the high cost of tours especially when you dont want to spend all day on a guided tour. Expedia staff very helpful in gving us a map of the city and options for getting around. The children's pool area is a very small lap pool no more than 3 ft deep with very limited area for sitting. Ideal for very small children but not enticing at all for older kids. My only concern was in the cleaning of our room. We slept in 1 day when housekeeping came by and they never returned all day. We came back late evening and just requested clean towels. The following day, they did not replace a soiled bedsheet (spilled tea). Maybe they didnt notce the dried stain? I figured they would change the sheets after a few days. I wouldnt know how the rate and quality of the hotel compares to others in the area. Overall, we were pleased with our stay and would recommend if you want a smaller hotel with simple clean neutral decor, no bells and whistles, and in an excellent. location.

Staffs were very nice . Location is just across the street of Waikiki Beach. We had the Beach Side Room which the balcony faced the street perpendicular to Kalaukua Ave but had a good view of the beach. Property and room was clean. A/C in the room worked great. Only issue we had was that the toilet would refill its tank occasionally which I just turned off the water valve at night other than that, it was a fantastic stay.

The hotel is new and nicely presented however customer service and staff is very poor. there was not communication and lack of communication with the staff at front desk which got very frustrating. The could not understand or answer our questions through lack of knowledge or language barrier. Not up to standard for a five star hotel.

We spent 4 nights here at the end of our fortnight holiday. We were welcomed to the hotel by Quenton who arranged for our bags to be stored, and gave us a pass to use the pool facilities as we were 5 hours early for check in.The pool is great with a smaller kids ppol and an infinity pool with an amazing view over the beach.We had two rooms as we had our 9 year old and nana with us. The pool staff were friendly and attentive and looked after our 9 year old when he went up to the bar for a coke. We used the pool every day and enjoyed the pizzas and beers and cocktails. The gym is state of the art and there are tennis courts on level 9 with a batting cage there as well. the hotel has been completely refurbished and is stunning. In your room there are complimentary drink bottles which can be filled up with chilled water around the hotel. We had a room with a partial view but our view was over the bach and other hotel beachfronts on the strip and was great, so very happy on the 36th floor.The bathroom was tiny, didn't worry us at all just a bit surprised, but was spotlessly clean. Towels were provuided by the pool team if you wanted to go to the beach and you just left them in your room. The coffee machine was apparently great according to my wife and plenty of coffee pods were provided. We dined at the two restaraunts on site and were impressed by the quality of food by both. For the younger family members there is a mcdonalds across the road and an abc store either side of the hotel. The beach is directly across the road and this aprt of the beach is protected by a wall so ideal for the samller kids or anyone not confident in the water. Its a short walk into the centre of town and the cheese cale factory whcih we always go to as it caters for everyone. At the hyatt next door there is a Hertz rental facility if you need a car. A great stay, thoroughly recommend the pool area and the staff were all supreb.We slept so well, even my son commented on the commfort of the beds and pillows. Those small touches really made this a great family break

When we arrived the front desk was very welcoming, the rooms where nice with good views, and a great location of town. Everything was within walking distance. The pool was very nice with great views. I would high recommend this resort and would for sure stay there again. Looking forward to our next visit.

I often travel to Oahu on business and pleasure the Alohilani is completely remodeled. Just one block from Waikiki Beach fantastic location to experience the Waikiki area of Honolulu. The entire property has been remodeled the rooms are brand new and very nice the hotel lobby is fantastic. The hotel has a bar, restaurant, and two pools.I will definitely return and stay here on my next visit.

It's a real pity because the location of this hotel is perfect & it's a lovely hotel with really good sized rooms & a great pool but please be very careful to find out what they are charging to your card & go over your bills!!! The card they asked for on check in for

The hotel is stylishly renovated, very modern and clean lines. The pool area is not big so rent a cabana for extra room, shade, and privacy. The bathroom in regular guest rooms (i.e. - non-suites) are TINY and do not have a tub. Two adults can barely fit in the bathroom at the same time. My husband is 6'2

Perfect location in Waikiki, really cool place but it is not the truly hawaii. You can stay there and spend time to go around the island by car (ask to Expedia desk in the lobby for rental). The hotel is great but noisy during night time.

Our family loved our time at this newly renovated hotel. If felt very glamorous and fabulous, and the staff were friendly and genuine. The décor is welcoming and peaceful and loved seeing the large aquarium wall on arrival. We were determined to experience every part of the hotel in our 4 days there –highlights include:Super comfortable beds (ok, bathrooms small, everyone notes that…all fine).Fabulous outdoor area with soft seating, pool loungers and great bar. It was so fun to have lovely staff come around and offer to clean our sunglasses, spray our faces etc. Bar staff great, with particular call out to Jarrison who looked after us. It was great chatting to other guests at the bar. Pools great fun with Infinity pool having views over beach and water bean bags to relax on. (Yes pool cold when you first get in). We had our 8 year old son with us who wanted to explore: the hotel gym is incredible with all new facilities and loads of steppers/treadmills etc. Then we went and played tennis on the clay courts, used an outdoor exercise training system, and others were using the batting nets. Morimoto Asia – went here for our 10th wedding anniversary. Great being both professional and relaxed. Food superb (must get the ribs and whole crispy fish), highly recommend this, and would advise to book. (Strange note that the bucket chairs are a bit low for the tables, even people next to us asked for cushions)! We also tried the more casual Momosan and this we enjoyed for lunch where we shared appetisers. We also did the buffet breakfast once, and this was the one place in the hotel where I was a bit underwhelmed - $39 and there was reasonable selection but seemed very pricey (kids half price) and nothing was a stand out. O Bar was nice by aquarium for a drink and listening to musicians/singers each night – good holiday vibe. Great location opposite sheltered beach and would definitely return to Alohilani.

The hotel was amazing and the staff were genuinely friendly and caring towards us and our every need. On our last day at the hotel we decided to stay by the pool. Early in the morning we were offered a complimentary Aqua Yoga class and although it sounded a little crazy it was extremely fun. Thank you Mariah from MSH!

Great location and love the refurbishments like the pool deck and nice fireplace cabanas at night. The hotel lacked a hotel feel, missing a lot of basic ammenities which a hotel should have, don’t expect room service.

From check-in until checkout our stay at the Alohilani was amazing. This hotel is very pleasant, in a great location and is/was very peaceful. Though we did not have the time to experience all the amenities provided (we’ll save those for future stays) our stay this time was better than expected. The local people would really enjoy a staycation here at the Alohilani.

The location is very convenient in the heart of Waikiki.Staff, in general are very helpful. However, it is beyond their power to address the problems that prevent this property living up to a supposed 5-Star rating. (this turns out to be an Expedia rating, and not an internationally-recognised hotel rating system) Problems include:Ridiculously small bathrooms.No room service.Only one of the 'Shops at Alohilani' being open for business.The only two restaurants in the hotel are Asian-themed.The Swell Pool and Bar was closed for private functions twice during my four-night stay. There should be dedicated function/event facilities that do not inconvenience guest use of facilities, especially when resort fees are added to room rates. The pool area has insufficient sunbeds for such a large hotel. This matter is not helped by non-guests being able to walk in and use the pool. The only time residency is checked is if you borrow towels. I would say that this hotel is aiming to focus on the Japanese market. In which case, it is going to have to up its game to meet their discerning needs. Staff worthy of credit for their attentive service - Renee at reception and Micah at the breakfast buffet. Thanks to Adrian and Wade for being sympathetic of my issues.

Nice updates to the hotel, friendly staff. The adjoining room does not block out sounds from the neighbor. Our room didn't get cleaned until 5pm. I had to call that they forgot our room.A little pricey for this hotel.Great restaurants!!

To start with, let me say “thank you so much for your excellent accommodation, you guys are awesome!” This is our first time to Alohilani Resort but hey, this nice guy Charles at the entrance guided our way, took care of our 2 cars and helped unload all our luggage then send us out to check in. This is just very welcoming to me. Having two little kids make this part a convenience. The check in was a breeze, everyone is smiling, very welcoming and it just makes us feel at home. A lot of good things to say about this resort, let me state my faves.. the bed is really comfy, the room is super clean and insulated properly that we can sleep well without any outside noise at any time, a medium size safe is available for your valuables (I kept my 3 red ring camera lenses in it if I don't use them), ABC store is within the building – awesome! Laundry is available and efficient at the 5th floor (you guys don’t need to pack up your closet for a week of clothes because of this), cavana oh-nana!! is exquisite and the infinity pool is the best, another pool - for kids is located adjacent to the hot tub with its own cavana (my kids LOVED it so bad). My kids went to see Moana on their movie night and enjoyed the popcorn next to this kids pool.. but wait, the ease and breeze of the walking distance Waikiki beach is better!! I definitely recommend Alohilani to my friends and family. I wanted to keep it a secret because this is a gem but awesome staff deserves a shout out! Thanks again guys, we’ll see you again soon!

We had 3 generation ladies trip to Hawaii. This has been the best hotel i've stayed in Waikiki, they have just completed a major renovation which features enormous aquarium in the lobby (which I heard used to be a part of restaurant that used to be there), the feeding time in the aquarium is entertaining to watch as the diver trains the porcupine fish. It is located in the center of Waikiki area, 20secs walk to the beach, but the hotel does not have high traffic, it is clean, calm and relaxing unlike other hotels on the same street. Staffs are friendly and attentive, especially those at the pool area. They make sure you are hydrated in and out, you also get free Mai-tai. View from our 36F was amazing, wish I could wake up to that view every morning.

I and my wife visited this resort for our 1st Hawaii trip since July 10th. This hotel was our 1st impression of Oahu island.I found the staffs in this hotel are super friendly! We had some special requests for our stay, and the hotel manager was super patient to listen to our questions and tried her best to help. To be honest, this is my best hotel experience in US. Thank you for the manager who helped us (shame that I forgot her name); you gave us a great beginning of Hawaii vacation.Valet parking guys are friendly too. They offered us free valet parking for checking in.House keeping is top quality and they always talk to you with happy smiles.Front desk lady was amazing too. She always try to assign you a room with the best of your need.I truly hope all hotels can have service in this level.

This Hotel was AMAZING!The staff was friendly and attentive- I will stay here again! I will also recommend the Alohilani to all my friends and family. Thank you for making my stay in Hawai'i so memorable.

The room was very clean. But I've heard outside noise a few times. The location was useful. So it's enough to stay and enjoy in Honolulu. It took about 45 mins from the hotel to Diamond head by walk..

I couldn't recommend this place enough. Perfect stay with a great location and facilities - the gym was one of the best I have experienced at a hotel/resort. The pool was also excellent and it was nice to have a proper heated spa.

Great place to head to straight off the plane to get time zones sorted and body clock straight. right by beach, safe kids swimming. (watch out for the jelly fish stings) Staff very helpful, rooms totally up to standard. Small pool but very adequate (spa and lap pools also) - complementary drink voucher welcomed for Maitai or coffee. Great place to settle down before heading off to villa for a week .

Beautiful hotel, cool vibe, awesome service, great pool deck with awesome music, fantastic view, beautiful decor and fantastic location. What else can I say apart from you have to stay here! We will be back.

Stayed here for 5 nights. Hotel is very close to the best beach in Waikiki. Mcdonalds is directly across the street. Starbucks is close. We ste st Panda within driving distance and Safeway is next to Panda. The rooms in the tall tower are newer. We were given a room with an ocean view st first but if you take a room in the back, thats the newer tower, we switched rooms from the front to the back and had a better view up higher of Diamond head snd the beach. We hiked up Dismond head. Parking is easy in hotel garage. Parking will cost you 30 a night. But i guess its worth it as not sll hotels offer personal parking.

Great trip!!! Cant wait to come back. Looks like we might be coming back just cause we had such a wonderful time, again wish I knew the lady's name at the front desk she was so welcoming to us made our whole trip awesome!!!

What an amazing last second trip! Will definitely be back! Do not read into the past bad reviews. Much worth the value of the room compared to other hotels. The renovations that were completed recently were done very tastefully.

First time vacationers in Honolulu Hawaii.We stayed at this Hotel for part of our Stay in Honolulu. Located on Kalakaua, we booked the rest of our nights here to experience Waikiki beach front and to relax after our days of touring the island of Oahu. We like this location as it is more quiet and a nice beach in front of it ( across the Street).We spent few of our days at the other Hotel located on Kuhio Ave to have a comparison & since we were mostly driving around the Island.My experience with the Receptions was very friendly, we arrived earlier before our check in and our Room is not yet ready.They have given us informations upon check in of the Hotel.We were able to store our luggages and get access to their pool which is relaxing with the gorgeous view.Getting our assigned room was quick despite of being very busy due to the Honolulu Festival. This Hotel was busy at the time also due to the Spring Break.Our Room was located on the corner side of the 26th floor. Gorgeous view of Waikiki beach, the City and Mountain.We have a balcony where we enjoy our lunch/coffee with the view. If you are afraid of heights, you may not want to be on this balcony. The Room is spacious, bed is comfortable, the bathroom although a bit tight on space but clean and sufficient. We can however hear the other guests from the other rooms next to us. As I have said, due to the Festival the hotel was packed.Oceanarium near the lobby has a great offerings every evening with a nice music. My 10yr old son enjoyed hanging out there.We did try it and they have good selection for their food & drink.Staffs are friendly and always willing to help. Upon check out they referred us to a private shuttle to the Airport which I find pretty decent for the price that we have paid.During our stay, the Hotel is still in ongoing renovation. We only experienced positive and it is worth of what we have paid for. I would consider and refer this hotel for our/others trip.

Nice lobby. Room is quite small. Interestingly the actual bathroom does not have a door....sink is exposed to room. Adjacent toilet and tub are behind a door. Although hotel was recently “renovated” the room does show wear. Classic situation of utilitarian building gutted and upgraded with newer material. Ceilings are still short, rooms are small, and exterior sliding glass door to balcony is original. Staff are pleasant.Overall hotel is in a decent location on Waikiki. Homeless abound in the area. Room is clean but small.

I booked my trip through Costco and had chosen a less expensive hotel. When I arrived I found my room to be mediocre at best. I moved with my family to the Alohilani Resort and couldn’t be more pleased with the result. The staff was friendly and polite and we were able to check in early. The room was lovely and thoroughly clean. The beds were extremely comfortable and the view was spectacular. I’ll never again settle for the best priced hotel. It’s so worthwhile to pay a little more for a high quality experience!

Great hotel, great beaches, great service. Clean and great location. Internet service was excellent. I was able to hook up my Roku and watch most world cup soccer game as if I was at home. I will be come back to this hotel and recommend it to others.

Delicious food, friendly maids and workers and when I get the chance I would like to book at the same hotel. I had a wonderful experience at alohailani Resort Waikiki and the workers made the experience better and they were very polite.

Second stay at the Alohilani - was there 5 years ago when it was the Pacific Beach. Has been refurbished and is very nice. Staff very pleasant and courteous. Be very very specific if you want a room overlooking the beach - they are called ocean front rooms, not ocean view rooms, in the beach side tower. Our travel agent got it wrong despite our very specific instructions - luckily we were able to upgrade on arrival.These rooms are well worth the extra cost. Bit of a problem with homeless people in the park across the road from the hotel - don't know why they aren't moved on, but it does seem to be a problem in Waikiki. Wasn't as bad 5 years ago.

The Alohilani Resort was the old Pacific Beach Hotel. They did an awesome job on the redo. When you walk into the lobby it looks very high end. We got a king bedded partial ocean. The view was nice and even had a shot of Diamondhead! Super comfy bed, nice lanai, fridge, safe, and lots of USB outlets. No clock radio and the huge flatscreen had a delay in loading the channels. Bathroom was way nice with Maile amenities. The toilet seat was heated and had lots of controls to run the bidet. For those who didn't like the half shower wall, it felt fancy and we didn't splash any water with the rain flow showerhead! A/C worked great! Free wifi was quick once you figured out how to get in. So thumbs up on the spacious room! Note that this hotel has two towers, I can't remember which one I was in but it overlooked both the pool area, beach and Diamondhead. Pool area was nice and the pool staff even nicer (they even come around to clean your sunglasses!). The comp mai tais were great!
