The only thing I didn't like was that the you have to pay for the loungers in the infinity pool. If I'm paying a hefty resort fee I should be ok to use the loungers ANYWHERE. I get that you have to pay for the cabanas but the in-pool loungers is a bit junk. Lots of kids in the hot tub (as opposed to the kiddie pool) so we didn't go in. But the infinity pool is quite nice. Used the gym, brand new equipment (lifecycles brand) and it was empty when I went down at 6am. I didn't use very many machines but I was impressed. Had breakfast at Lychee. While it's a bit steep for the buffett ($39 all inclusive) the food is a nice variety , portions are not huge so that you are wasting and the staff are super nice too. I quite enjoyed the Kalbi loco moco, the Japanese curry and the bear claw pastry. The miso soup was nice as well (make your own).Bellman are super helpful and it's nice to see such friendliness when you arrive and depart. Also tried the new Morimotos. I like the new concept that it won't break the bank. We had the pork belly pupus and the ribs pupus. Then we split the whole fish. It was very good and we liked the pupus the best.Overall, we had a super nice stay and very much enjoyed our time without the kids! I liked that there was an ABC store less than 10 steps when you walked off the elevator (forgot the liquor and snacks!) HAHA.Mahalo Alohiliani, we will be back! PS you need more fish in the aquarium

Stayed 8 nights, comfortable hotel. Staff very friendly and want to accommodate your requests. Few downsides, firstly the pool area is very nice but the loungers at back row have very loud speakers which is very unpleasant when blaring loud music and you’re trying to relax. Also, there is no in room dining, nor an official restaurant associated with the hotel which was a bit annoying. But overall it was a comfortable stay and the lobby and pool areas were very pretty.

Our family of four had a wonderful 10 night stay at this property; room and facilities were excellent, so too were the super friendly and helpful staff. Hotel is located in a great spot right by the beach, easy walking distance to shops and restaurants. Highly recommend this property!

close to all the action..ie bus stops the beaches and eateries.the time we were there it was in its final stages of it being renovated.clean, good views and a great bar.it has good service ,it feels magical and a great place to stay in..the staff make the difference..nice and friendly and welcoming.

We stayed here on the recommendation of our travel agent, who had booked other clients with good reviews.This is obviously an older hotel which has had a nice, modern refit, but there are signs here and there of the previous iteration. Check-in was friendly and smooth. I had prepaid for our room (ocean view), but as is the way with many hotel/resorts in the USA, I had to pay a resort fee per day for a few things that really should be included in the tariff e.g. wifi, some plastic foldable water bottles, in room coffee maker with coffee and tea pods, surfboard storage! The lobby is shiny and light, and leads down to the O bar with a huge aquarium. They are obviously building up the number of fish. We had our complimentary mai tai's in the bar. The staff member was a little bit abrupt, but served up a nice drink. The singer we heard was great.The corridor carpeting is really odd - at first glance it looks worn or disintegrating, but then you realise it is the pattern of the carpet. Quite strange.The "Ocean View" room we had was on the 21st floor, with a balcony, which had an obstructed view of the water due to the hotel next door. It also had an obstructed view of Diamond Head. I'm not that fussed about views, but if you really want to see the beach, make sure you ask specifically.We had 2 queen beds, which were very soft. Lots of pillows. Quilts were necessary as the airconditioning was very powerful (and noisy). We ended up turning it off at night (and it is summer currently) and just sleeping with a sheet. The curtains didn't really black out, so we woke up before 6am each morning.The bathroom is divided into a sink area which is essentially open to the room, with super bright backlighting that really shows up everything, and a tiny toilet/shower/bath area. The shower was in the bath, which I dislike, but the non-stick bath surface was reassuring and the curved shower curtain rail was clever. The shower had good pressure. Hawaii has very soft water, so don't use too much shampoo or soap.Wifi was OK, not superfast, and the TV had lots of channels.The infinity pool looked nice, and there were lots of people laying about on the provided beds, and using the pool bar. Busy area. We tried a couple of times to book massages, but they were booked out. We also dined at Morimoto Asia, the fine dining option within the hotel, and Momosan on the ground floor which is more casual. Both are excellent.

All I can say is WOW!!From the moment you enter to the moment you leave you’re greeted with smiles and finest hospitality you could ask for.In the main lobby bar there’s an enormous aquarium that’s great to have a few drinks by, bar at pool is good too if it’s not to busy.Located right on the beach in easy distance to everything Waikiki and like every hotel there’s an ABC store within the building for odds and ends you may need.Our room was amazing, bed comfy and a well appointed bathroom and also with a decent balcony to watch the sun go down and have a few drinks.Best part was the room with ‘only partial views’ as the receptionist put it was better than anything we expected (see picture) and really made our first wedding anniversary perfect.Only thing that we found odd was being billed for a ‘tree tax’ and ‘resort fees’ that we weren’t told about on check in, so be aware of those, just an extra cost we weren’t ready for or knew existed even with booking via webjet and thinking all costs had been accounted for initially.Otherwise do yourself a big favour and book here. You’ll love it.

Location was good. we were checked into a high floor with a partial ocean view. The room itself is decent. However, bathroom is at best a 3-star standard. Basic amenities, not even cotton buds or shower caps. The faucet in the shower was broken. A/C outlet was located next to the bed which means one person gets very cold while the other is sweating! Not sure how this hotel got ranked a 5-star...

This is a fabulous hotel in a great location. The rooms are fresh and modern and the pool area is lovely. We stayed in the smaller of the two towers and had the most amazing view of the beach. It was so nice just to be able to check the surf from our window, jump in the lift and straight over the road onto the beach. Other plus points include a conveniently located ABC store in the hotel, great for buying a bottle of wine to drink watching the sunset on the balcony. Also, the free surf board racks are great as they enable you to hire a board for a few days (PS the boards are cheaper and better from the hire shops near the hotel rather than on the beach).What’s not so good? Not a lot, but the pool bar is a bit pricey, so even though it’s a lovely area, we didn’t spend much time there. Also, we stayed during the grand hotel opening. There was a lot of disruption for the big pool party they raved on about on social media. We were annoyed because despite the disruption guests didn’t get invited...or even a token free drink gesture to celebrate or compensate. Seeing as a hotel should be all about the guests, it’s a bit disappointing they have their attention focused elsewhere. Overall, we had a really great time and would love to return to this hotel and the beautiful island of Oahu.

Very clean posh hotel. Our family reserved 2 partial ocean view rooms and only one was available. The other room had 5% peak a boo view of Waikiki beach. The pool is freezing cold so most of us did not use it. Wi fi was pretty bad; keeps on dropping every 5 minutes. Rooms had plenty of room for 4 people; bathroom really small.Air-conditioner works fine except for the noise. Front desk service and cleaning service are very good, nice friendly reception.

I stayed at Alohilani recently when I brought my nephew on a graduation trip. I hadn't seen the hotel since it's recent renovation and it is AMAZING. Arrival, hotel staff, rooms, everything... was awesome! We had the best time and our stay on the resort was part of the reason - I never get tired of waking up to the sound of the ocean. Great location..across the street from the beach and close to food and shopping in Waikiki. Can't wait to go back!

What a beautiful place to start a holiday! As soon as we walked in the door we were greeted with great Hawaiian hospitality. With the staff doing everything they can to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. Breakfast buffet is great, for all sorts of nationalities. Pool is amazing, and the staff are so lovely coming around to offer drinks and food. The doorman that we first met as soon as we got out of the taxi found out I was staying here to celebrate my 21st birthday. The next day a knock at my door with champagne and chocolate strawberries with a happy birthday from Doug the doorman. Highly recommend for somewhere to just relax and treat yourself to a little luxury.

Stayed 4 nights prior to July 4th. We had a great time because we booked a premium ocean front room and it made the difference because of the direct ocean front view. We were unable to have an upgrade to a higher floor room from the 14th to the 17th. The traffic noise directly below Kalakawa and the gardeners' leave blowers started before 7am :( It was not pleasant when we wanted to sleep through from 11p till at least 9am but overall the view from the room lessened our irritability.Pros: 1/ Convenient location, ocean front room views superb.2/ Great front desk welcome- wonderful attentive front desk staff: Special Recognition to Alanna and front desk mgr. Wade who understood our request and honored it; this made us feel we had the real Hawaiian welcome :)3/ Great housekeepers: Special Recognition to Julita, Kim, and our regular housekeeper on #1425, room always kept cleaned and toiletry requests always granted.4/ Poolside mgr. Niki Uylit: great hospitality welcome, hard working, diligent on explaining cabana use rules but sincere and genuine with her aloha welcome.5/ Restaurant Morimoto Asia was quite wonderful, will definitely return, see my review on restaurant.Cons:1/ Some high noise level with rooms facing directly above Kalakawa St2/ Bathroom only has one sink, considering ocean front premium room price & tiltle, should have 2 sinks!! No bath tubs and only half shower door with open flooding to the floor, no hand held shower head available, not up the iPreferred Hotel Chain Asian Standard as a 4-5 Stars Hotel!!3/ No Ladies Bathroom Amenities, no shower caps etc, had to call for them; there were 3 of us, only 1 set of shampoo, conditioner, and soap, no bath soap or gel until after 2 nd night, and I had to ask. 4/ Housekeepers were great, but all toilteries for 3 should have been standard supplies for premium room guests or members of i Preferred Group.5/ Elevators on Oceanside closes door way too fast, almost closed on children and very easily missing the elevator doors being opened. So watch out.4/ Adult Pool and Jacuzzi always have kids, made us not want to swim in the infinite pool worrying about kids'bodily waste. Should have id bands for all guests & kids belong to kids pool.5/ Guest Service Phone Connection- I have to wait a long time on the Guest Service line in order to transfers me to housekeeper every day tell them we were leaving the room and for requests, but the transfers were all to front desk, not housekeepers. This needed to change as front desk were always be busy and guests waiting at front desk, and on phone lines, a very rush feeling.Despite all the cons evaluation, we would like to revisit this hotel again in the near future. Aloha and Mahalo

We have just started a weeks holiday in the Alohilani Resort and we are very impressed. From the time you walk in a very impressive foyer with a huge aquarium to the rooms that look very modern and clean. Beds are very comfortable and very fortunate to experience amazing views across Waikiki. The pool area is very impressive, trendy chic, comfortable lounge chairs with great service by the staff. Looking forward to the week ahead but cannot fault would very much recommend this resort.

Excellent Hotel.location is very very good.my stay was for 4 nights with family.from 30 June to 4 july.room number were 201 and 203. Rooms were big and bedsheets,towels and everything was excellent.Buffet breakfast was also very very good.i like this resort.i will come again

I was on the resident elevator when a employee brought a ton of rubbish on the elevator with guest, It appeared he neglected to use the service elevator. I doubt this would happen even in a 2 star hotel . The location excellent , valet and resident desk staff excellent They need to improve on housekeeping staff education .

The Alohilani Hotel was in a great spot close to the beach and shops but out of the general hustle and bustle of the main street. The view from the beach front rooms was awesome along Waikiki Beach. The pool area was lovely and comfortable with lounge areas and fire pits at night. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were nice, but the bathrooms were too small to be comfortable. Overall a great stay and would definitely recommend to others.

Overall nice, clean, great location, nice infinity poolPros: - nice infinity pool and lounging area - complimentary refillable water bottle- bathrooms clean but can be redesigned- friendly staff at the front desk and pool concierge- great location close to the beach and boardwalkCons:- couldn't find the tennis courts- housekeeping comes early twice before checkout time(~0800 and ~1000). Couldn't tell if he was trying to be nice and offer towels or wanting us to go- bathroom shower little small, if going to have an open walk in design they need to redo the shower head so less water is wasted and escapes to the bathroom floor- would of been nice to know what other amenities they offered

After a cancelled flight to Bali due to volcano eruptions we (6) took a detour to Hawaii. Unplanned and we booked here as our first night place to stay. Beautiful, modern, clean. Pool is cool but stunning, interior bar a bit lacking in ambience. Didn’t use the restaurants but all staff were friendly and helpful. Bathrooms small, beds awesome.

Not quite sure how this place is getting all these great reviews. At best this hotel is a gussied up 3 star. Not even close to a 4 or 5 star. Pros: *Location is great, right across the beach and within walking distance to many Waikiki attractions (International Marketplace, Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center, etc.) *There's a massive indoor saltwater aquarium*Live music every night in the bars*Restaurant/bar (Julius, Tiffany, Allison, Mike) and Front Desk staff (Andrea, Barbi) very nice, helpful, and friendly Cons: *Shower design is horrendous. There is no curtain or sliding door--just a half panel of glass so water is CONSTANTLY flooding the rest of the bathroom. Who in their right mind approved this design???*Lack of toiletries. You go to ANY other 5 star--or even 4 star--property and you get much, much more. Body Wash. Toothbrushes w/toothpaste. Mouthwash. None of that here. *No room service. This is BASIC for any 4 or 5 star (heck even 3 star!!!!) hotels*No SIT DOWN ala carte breakfast options. Yes, that's right. Their ONLY table service breakfast option is BUFFET ONLY (and overpriced at that). They do have grab 'n go options available but NO sit down ala carte breakfast anywhere. That's right, no pancakes, Belgian waffles, omelets, American breakfasts, etc. etc. Just a $39 per person buffet. *NO REGULATION AT THE INFINITY POOL AND JACUZZI. This goes for two major issues. First, there is a TON of kids in the both areas, and when I say kids, I mean toddlers in diapers. Second, there are A LOT of people not even staying in the hotel that are using the pool because they have NO IDENTIFICATION METHODS. So, if you're ok with paying $350+ per night and are perfectly happy with people not paying a dime and still having access to an amenity that you're paying for, this might be the place for you*Bell and valet staff. Extremely curt, rude, unfriendly, etc. No greeting when dropping off our car. No "Have a good day" etc. when picking up our car. Almost no interaction when bringing our bags up to the room. The most words were said when the bellman received their tip, and even then it was just a mumbled "thank you". *Staff interaction on property. You go to ANY 4 or 5 star property and staff (housekeeping, maintenance, security, etc.) will regularly greet you and acknowledge you when just walking around. Not here. Can't count how many times we passed staff just walking about with their heads down, looking at their phones, etc. Most of them aren't even aware of the guests walking around them. No holding open of doors either. SMH*They bill themselves as family friendly but there are not many things to keep kids occupied other than the pool and aquarium. There are several more cons, but I think I covered my biggest pet peeves. I am not one to really complain or voice concerns, but I couldn't let this one go. Keep in mind that this was my 8th trip to Oahu. I've stayed twice at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, twice at the Sheraton Waikiki, once at Aulani, once at the Royal Hawaiian, and once at the Moana Surfrider so I'm using those properties for comparison. In time, perhaps Alohilani can get to where they want to be, but they have a loooooooong way to go.

We were there as a couple on vacation - amazing! Very nice amenities. Clean room and friendly service. Staff easy to talk to. Located across the street from the beach and a close walk to the International downtown Waikiki area. Neat aquarium. Access to flat fee airport shuttles. Only down side was that the tv and internet did not work great, but we spent most of the time outdoors anyway.

This was the 8th trip to Waikiki for my husband and I and our first stay at The Alohilani. My expectations were pretty high based on photos, reviews and articles of this newly renovated hotel and it didn’t disappoint.We were greeted with a big smile from Barbi at check in. She is an asset to this hotel. Efficient, warm and friendly. She also followed up with a phone call an hour after we had checked in to ensure that everything was ok. We booked an oceanview room and I had requested a high floor. We stayed on the 17th floor in the front tower which was the top floor. From our lanai we had sweeping views across Waikiki Beach, the pool deck below and mountains in the distance. I would often sit out on the lanai and take in the beautiful view.My sister in law also came on this trip and stayed in the tower behind. Her view was just as magical with views to Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach.The location of the hotel served us well. Situated across the road from Waikiki Beach and within walking distance the shops, restaurant and transport.We utilized the pool on many occasions. The pool staff were super friendly. You are provided with fresh pool towels and pool chairs covers. The Frozen Mai Tai went down a treat on warm afternoon.I attended one sunset yoga class which I loved. Floating bean bags are provided in the infinity pool.The shops in the foyer are not open as yet bar 1, Mailie. This had no impact on our stay. One of our favorite cafes in Waikiki, Kai is scheduled to open later in the year. Great news!!!We hope to return to Alohilani in the near future.

ProsNice lobby with aquarium and daily feeding of fish showGood location close to beach and bis stopsClean roomsConsPricey resort feeCrowded poolSlow check inOverall I feel resort fee and room fee is pricy for what you get
user_name:
Dee P
Sydney Olympic Park, Australia

review_body: I came to Hawaii to celebrate my son's high school graduation and 18th birthday of June 23rd. He was not physically with me, because God called him home on October 09, 2018. I still came to honor him!

This is as good as it gets- perfect friendly and very professional service (Renee, Sinna, Ahlanna and Quenten were fantastic) , a great location, lovely view, parking directly underneath the hotel, lovely room and a great breakfast. To top it all the pool was amazing. Not to mention the warm and friendly service from the staff at the pool. (Sommer, Nicky, Mickey and Kaini) A nice associate from Security (Joshua) was very informative and took the time to give us directions. Having traveled extensively all over the world and stayed in many luxury hotels this rates very highly on my list. Thank you, we will be back.

I would rate this hotel a 3.5 star, it's not a luxury resort but it's clean and convenient.  It's not good value for money, but there's not a big choice in Waikiki. We paid for an Ocean View King room.  The room had an ocean view, from the side! We were actually looking into two other hotels. We paid $262.50US per night including all taxes (so we thought!!) 16 nights 6 months in advance from Australia.  BUT what you don't get told is about the resort fee tax that is payable on arrival!! This is a new tax the Hawaii has introduced and to say the least….it sucks! It added an extra $35US + tax (5%) per night. So another $582US had to be paid at check-in.  So now our special rate isn't looking so special anymore - an average room will set you back around $330US per night.There's no mini bar but there is a fridge and American pod coffee machine which you can buy at Walmart next to Ala Moana shopping centre as you only get 2 a day and they won't give you more.  This resort also does not offer room service meals of any kind. No laundry or dry cleaning service, there's a DIY laundry available instead.It's not cheap here, but it is one of the cleanest.  It used to be the old Pacific Beach Hotel which was only a 2-3 star. It's still owned by the same people, some of the staff have been here for over 10 years. It's simply a new paint job and higher prices than it used to be.The location you cannot fault. Opposite the beach and walking distance to bars, shopping and restaurants.  The biggest downfall is the service trucks and leaf blowers that start up at 6am 7 days a week. We were on level 11 and the street noise is shocking. You'll be entertained all night with the horrible music that plays non stop from the resort's restaurant on the street below. After 2 weeks here we were ready to cut their power!The Room - very basic. No folio book to tell you if you can even order room service, pool hours, what's available in the hotel or how to use the tv? Nothing.  The only condiments in the room is shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and a bar or soap. Not even shower gel or a shower cap.The bathroom is small. You have to shimmy between the door and toilet to get into the shower. There's an electric toilet but all it does is heats the seat. It basically doesn't work. You still have to lift the lid and flush it yourself.  The air-conditioning is loud and is set to automatically come on and off, you can't control it. Off is the only choice - but there's no 'on’ button so it's easier not to touch it. It's on automatic and when it comes on it's like a Freight Train coming through your room.  We had a king bed which was very comfortable. Hotel Bars - don't bother. A standard middy of beer at the bar will set you back $13US + tax. It's cheaper in Australia.The concierge does not belong to the hotel, it's owned by Expedia which keeps the excursion and car rental costs down. So don't ask them anything about the hotel they don't know. But they will organise excursions easier and cheaper.Pool - beautiful pool and heated spa. BUT don't try and set yourself up in a cabana by the pool they are an additional cost! Yep after paying  $330US per night for a standard room now you get charged for using the pool facilities. We asked why we are paying a Resort fee each night and we still have to pay to use the pool...no answer! Just set-up on a poolside lounge instead. But again don't sit on the lounges directly in the pool, you have to pay for those too! I also didn't like the fact the pool is not key restricted which means anyone on the street can walk up and use the hotel pool, which they do.  Locals use the pool as their own. I find that weird considering this hotel is trying to be 5 star? Maybe this is standard in Hawaii??VIP nights! This hotel holds functions for external organisations and hotel guests are banned from going all over the grounds during this time. Lobby, lobby bar and pool are all out of bounds from mid afternoon until midnight.  One of these functions held a pool side function with a DJ poolside who played “doof doof” nightclub music until 10pm flat out and it's only Tuesday! Customers are not made aware and calling reception falls on deaf ears! They've got my money I'm no longer important to them!  Week 2 we were poolside and at 3pm the staff started removing the deck chairs and blocking the pool off because yet again another private function was being held at 6pm. So pool and bar were now out of bounds to guests again. This place is just downright rude!

I would highly recommend this resort to stay at. Staff friendly, resort first class and would stay again. Proximity to the beach, shops activities were a great incentive to stay. Great food and beverage served!

A most enjoyable holiday experience. Friendly , helpful staff and quality room. Thought the pool not big enough for large hotel. Found it too crowded with kids on floats. Overall a lovely experiece in a central area close to major retail, eateries and beach.

Amazing location, friendly staff, beautiful hotel! Close to beach and shops! Tons of restaurants to choose from. Rooms are inviting and beds Are super comfy! Great value for location! Perfect in so many ways!

Stay at this hotel was great and very comfortable. Highly recommended - stayed on the 14th floor and it was nice and quietRecently renovated. Nice and cleanCentrally located and walking distance to all shops.

I’d highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking at booking, we had such a great experience, the staff are more the helpful, our room was made beautifully everyday by our housekeeper. It was a special occasion for us, we were celebrating my 21st Birthday and the staff went out of their way and sent us up a lovely fruit and macaroon platter and bottle of champagne was a very nice thought. The pool and spa area is absolutely stunning, especially at night! Treat yourselves and book your stay at the Alohilani Resort Waikiki Beach.

The hotel is beautiful and the staff is just amazing! They were so friendly and helpful from the welcome to the checkout. Even the guys at the valet parking were all awesome! They directed us some of out best meals.

Exceptional view , nice room , elegant pool bar and swimming pool , very good breakfast. everything is perfect and the restaurant Morimoto Asia is excellent . With the children , there is the beach in front of the hotel with a surf school . Excellent situation for the shopping .

Hotel was not a 5 Star, maybe a 3, Security was terrible, anyone could come up to rooms. Staff let the noise from pool be very loud could not sleep. Rooms are small. Carpet is awful, looks like scraped off carpet on concrete. When I checked out, the desk said I had a credit, that I had to use right then, when I was leaving, instead of giving it to me ahead, so I could enjoy it. I've been to Hawaii 6 times and won't be back there.

We were here for a family vacation.This hotel is really nice!Right in front of the Waikiki beach with all the stores and restaurants.Front desk staff were really hospitable.We were given an ocean view. The sunset at the balcony was breathtaking.I love the newly remodeled facility and clean rooms.

We had an Oceanfront room and Wow, what a view. Room was clean, modern and really nice. We traveled a long way (Ohio) but if we go back to Waikiki, we we would stay without question. The view was totally worth it.

Not too bad for services, but not worth 5 star hotel.It's worth 4.5 or 4 star hotel.Wi-fi is very weak.Get more stronger Wi-fi. Took too much time for check in and out. More staff to speedy services.Anyway Pool is very adorable.

No longer called the Pacific Beach Hotel, but the service is just as great as it previously was. Nice family hotel, but great for solo or business travelers it well. Limited parking, but next time won’t rent a car. Enjoyed breakfast – price was affordable, and food was great. Wait staff is what made it really great.I really enjoy this hotel, and can highly recommend it.

This resort is incredible. My wife and I cannot wait to stay again. The resort was relaxing, had fantastic amenties and amazing staff. We loved everything about it and cannot wait to come back in the near future. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a fantastic trip.

great hotel,great rooms very spacious and clean .across the road from the beach,we had a room on the 33 floor amazing views of diamond head and the beach.balcony was big enough and very clean rooms,house cleaning every day for the 10 days we were there.small bathrooms but a great shower not in the bath.

Beautiful location, rooms were so clean and beautiful views of Diamond Head and the Ocean. Cleanliness was amazing. This Resort is the whole package cant wait to return.The Foyer is beautiful the staff are so friendly and helpful.

Having booked our accommodation when this resort had just been refurbished, there weren't many reviews online, so I wasn't sure what to expect, but gave it a shot! We stayed in an Ocean View room which was beautiful. The room was spacious and well equipped, with an ocean view from the balcony. The location of this resort is fantastic, opposite Waikiki Beach and in walking distance to everything you need. Staff were lovely and accommodating on all occasions we spoke with them and I'd recommend Alohilani Resort to anyone travelling to Oahu.

Guest services was amazing. Everything about our stay was fantastic and memorable. Great location. Clean quiet rooms. Very comfortable bed. Poolside service was great. Military friendly and helpful accessibility features.

The pool is awesome, and the staff are really great. I wish there are breakfast options in the Swell Bar menu though (to eat breakfast beside the pool) overall, I would recommend this hotel to friends and couples.

We stayed at the alohilani resort for 10 days in June and loved it. From the moment we turned up at reception Renee was absolutely fantastic and did everything she could to please us. We had an ocean front room which was beautiful and clean. The bathroom was small but that’s ok. It was right in the perfect location as well. Probably my only complaint about the hotel would be the pool isn’t very big and was full with kids a lot of the time. It would be good if they had a second adults only pool. Thanks so much for having us.

We thought this would be great as we walked into the hotel lobby to check in, but things went downhill from there.At a glance, the room looked fine, but then we stared seeing a lot of flaws in the room, especially the bathroom. Felt like they did not spend much or nothing renovating the bathroom.The pool is significantly smaller than what it looks like from the photo. And it is definitely not big enough for all the guests. The pool staff was not respectful to us. Stepping on our sandals, woke us up from our lounge chairs just to tell us she iis going on a break, and we should settle the bill....the list can go on and on. In general, service was not great. House keeping staff left dirty bedsheets and rubbish all along the hallway. Staff just barged in front of me when my husband was holding the door for me, The location is good, but the poor service and the lack of attention to details (of both the hotel building and staff) made it an unpleasant stay.

We were lucky enough to have balcony views of the beach and city, plus a lovely spot to sit and watch the beautiful sunsets! Bed soo comfortable, generous room size and pool on 5th floor made for a relaxing getaway!

We stayed for 10 nights and absolutely loved this hotel. Fantastic views and close to everything in Waikikki, allowed early check in, beds were extremely comfortable, reception, concierge and valet really helpful ! The pool area was beautiful. Need to improve signage to pool area and gym area (i.e put a sign in lift area), very confusing to find.

Forget the whole affordable 5 star hype about this hotel. I was so torn by the reviews I just didn't know what to expect. It looked so nice yet very few people had anything nice to say.We booked and we loved it. It was not perfect, but for the price and location (being slightly out of the crazy tourist area), it was absolutely perfect.Check in was a breeze and the staff were lovely. We did seem to get lucky with our arrival time though as throughout our stay, check in seemed to always have long lines.Our room was small but not tiny, the view of Diamond Head was AMAZING!! and we could also see the beach. The bathroom had been renovated, but nothing to get excited about. Speaking renovations, they could have spent a little more and replaced the popcorn ceilings and sliding doors as they both dated the room somewhat.The pool area was so much larger than we expected so we were pleasantly surprised at that, although this was probably our most disappointing part of the hotel as nothing seemed to work here.The towel staff were inattentive, the childrens pool was empty as all the kids were in the adult pool (which was FREEZING cold) and the food service was appalling. Needless to say, we spent the majority of our chill out time down on the beach.The final reason for only 4 and not 5 was the night before we left, we asked about a cab to the airport. We were told no need to book, just come down in the morning. When we did go down in the morning, we were told that we should have booked and it would be at least 45mins. After some harsh words, one of the staff walked down the street and hailed us a cab.Not enough to put us off though. All in all, we enjoyed it thoroughly,

We were so excited to stay at this brand new 5 star hotel and unfortunately it didn’t live up to our expectations. NEGATIVES- Tiny bathroom can hardly fit one person in there and that’s not an exaggeration. - Personal items such as thongs and bathers went missing in the room clean up. - Concierge repeatedly gave us the wrong information. - No room service and Uber Eats took over an hour and got the order wrong twice. - Cost $400 Australian a night with conversions and tax and was not worth the high cost. - It’s not a 5 Star Hotel. POSITIVES - The pool and bar set up is AMAZING and one of the best set ups here. - Beds extremely comfortable.- Perfect Location.

The positives- great location- beds and pillows are comfy- abc store downstairs- can fill up water bottles with filtered water- hotel was able to accommodate early check in without extra charge - swimming pool is goodThe negatives- bathrooms are too small for families. The toilet sits right up against the bath tub, if you call it a bath tub.- concierge not so helpful, was even told to google it- air conditioner too loud- over priced hotel for all the negatives- yes tea and coffee in room provided but only green tea. I had to go and buy my own black tea. You can make your own hot water using pod machine I found this out from staff after going downstairs asking for hot water on more than one occasion - free local calls from room Problems encountered - hotel two days in a row was charging my credit card an extra $374 and couldn’t tell me why. I had to ring my bank back in Australia who then spoke to front desk management to sort it out- housekeeping first couple of days was good then downhill. - my child’s comforter disappeared. I realized it must have got caught up in the linen when they Stripped the bed. I reported to housekeeping and after following up on more than one occasion reported to front desk. This comforter was sentimental as my mum gave it to my son as a baby before she passed away. Didn’t even get an apology from staff. - overcharged for washing machine. $8 instead of $3 but was rectified after complaining to front desk. The machine doesn’t wash that well either- no place in room to hang up wet bathers- asked conceirge to book sealife Park. They did but then I found out it was buy one ticket get one free for fathers. This discount was not passed in to me. Instead of $40 refund I’ve been advised i will get $20 due to transfers which I understood to be free. Unfortunately I encountered too many problems for the money I paid. For a couple this hotel is great. Do your research for activities though. Waikiki is become quiet expensive. Some staff are friendly. Mackenzie in concerige was great. When I reported to management they did sound sincere and tried following up further with my lost comforter but still missing. They were sorry to hear my comments and have my family free Buffett breakfast. Management did keep in touch with me after my complaints.

Beautifully decorated hotel with excellent service from every level of staff members.The beds are so comfortable, the best I've slept in hotels for a long time. The fittings throughout are very modern and comfortable, The attached Restaurants are excellent cuisine. If there was one annoying thing it would be the level of sound of the music that is played throughout the common areas, and particularly around the pool deck. The views from our room on the 17th floor were fabulous , definately visit again.

This hotel was amazing! Beautiful rooms and views. We had an oceanfront room and the view was breathtaking. The staff was very friendly. We were surprised by champagne in the room when we arrived and 2 days later chocolate covered strawberries. My only complaint would be the Wyndham employees with the concierge persuading people to go listen to a timeshare pitch. Other than that it was perfect!

Beautifully renovated hotel with breathtaking views of the ocean. The hotel is 5 star! Rooms are great, staff is superb, pool area is probably one of the best in Waikiki - infinity pool, cabanas, great bar and delicious food. The hotel is right across the street from one of the best surfing spots in Waikiki and you are steps away from Diamond Head. I loved my stay at the Alohilani and can't wait to go back!

Alohilani exceeded my expectations! The Customer service was outstanding, the view of the ocean view was beautiful, access to the beach was incredibly convenient (literally just steps away), and everything we needed was right there! I’m all about cleanliness and convenience so this was the perfect place for me to stay. It’s in the heart of Waikiki with easy access to great food and amenities. Pool bar and oceanarium lounge was beautiful and relaxing, and the ABC store downstairs made it easy to grab last minute things we needed for the day (food, drinks, sunscreen, gifts, etc). Parking was easy too! And let’s not forget the room. Super clean, updated, and perfect temperature! I would definitely stay here again.

Sorry my title is miss leading but it would be perfect if it was an Adult only hotel... Fyi I don't have kids.No hotel is perfect, however this one does hit the right buttons 99% of the time.StaffThe staff cant do enough for you, honestly if you want a room change you get a room change. The service industry in Hawaii is just mind blowing compared to Singapore ( where I reside)RoomsOk hit or miss on who your neighbors are, I changed rooms a few times over my 3 visits to this hotel. Yes I have stayed a combined 13 nights in 3 visits as I love it.Rooms are perfect as long as you don't get noisy neighbors and kids running about. Doors slam shut due to the mechanics on them.Pool deckbest in Waikiki hands down, great music and fire pits to keep your entertained during your stay, hot tub for jumping in and out of as the pool is nice and cold.Beds are very very comfortable, Toilets are small but there is space In the average room for 6 suitcases so don't worry about that.I WILL BE BACK... CheersIan

I’m glad I picked this hotel to stay. The location is centrally located to everything and it’s just right across from the beach. The Swell Pool & Bar is my favorite common area. Their infinity pool is one of the best pools I’ve seen. When we checked in, our room was upgraded for no additional charge. The staff were amazing from front desk to housekeepers to pool area attendants. Special shout out to Caroline Sanchez, our beach girl, who attended to us most of the time. She was very friendly and attentive to the needs of the guests. I would definitely book this hotel again next time.

We stopped by for cocktails and it was amazing!! A huge aquarium to sit and view while sipping authentic cocktails and appetizers. Grey was a fabulous bartender. Tomeika was gracious and welcoming when we arrived.We will stay here the next time we are in town.

We could not have asked for a better stay! From the time we checked in until we checked out, the service and aloha spirit were always on point. Barbie at check in was fantastic. Janice by the pool bar was the best, she always went out of her way to ensure we had cold drinks and outstanding service, her kindness was such a breath of fresh air. Yukki at the O Bar made our evening with her sense of humor and service. Renee at check out was wonderful! Everyone we came across was so great. The food at every restaurant from the pool bar to Marimotos was soooo delicious!!! If you want true Hawaiian spirit and incredible service this is the place to stay. Hotel is beautiful, rooms are clean and well kept, the view is gorgeous, the location is perfect, and the pool is very relaxing. Whether you’re traveling as a couple or with children, this place has it all. The gym is equipped with free weights, bar bells and cardio machines, plus they offer classes everyday!!! The kids club looked so fun for the kiddos. Literally can’t express how great our stay was! Thank you! We will be back...our new favorite place to stay in Waikiki for sure!

So many mixed feelings, this was a revamp that took some of the soul from the old hotel and lost it in pandering for a specific type of visitor - no harm in that as long as all other guests get a look in which did not always happen and at the room prices there are other more stylish and memorable hotels with their own beach frontage within 200-300 yards.Having said that, room was an ocean view (premium room) which did not disappoint, cleaning staff and other staff very helpful and courteous, pool area and bar popular and very well laid out - too much of a tendency to close parts off for private functions however without prior notice or any signs. I complained a little over this and the management recognised the problems and made appropriate offers which was unexpected but very acceptable. Hawaii/Waikiki is becoming very expensive since we first visited maybe 10 years ago however so bear in mind that all food, drinks and other costs are not what they are on the US mainland.

We booked in here for two nights as last stop on our 2 month odyssey and checked in late afternoon so no queue and the lass on the desk was efficient and explained where venue's were in the complex succinctly. Our king bed room with partial ocean view in June (US$227) was huge and a welcome change. However, they've walled off the toilet and shower and you can only just close the door - a mistake - should have put a sliding door on there. compensation is a dressing table bar with sink in an alcove outside. The bed was very comfortable and the balcony had corridor ocean views but mountain vista. Had drinks at the O Bar on level 5 with a chatty bartender as it should be. There's also a huge multi level deck chairs, lounges plus table & Chairs around the 3 various size pools on that level. we ate in one of the leased restaurants in the front building of the complex, Morimoto Asia, which was excellent - see separate review.Didn't use the coffee shop, street food cafe or lobby bar so can't comment on those facilities. It's in a great position in Waikiki with the main drag outside the door and the $2 shuttle trolley to Alo Moana centre across the road. Good for what we wanted so scores 8/10

- We waited over 3 hours for check in, even though we confirmed our arrival time the day before. And the hotel was not even half full. During the 3 hours, our bags were left unattended on a cart in the lobby -- anyone could have walked by and grabbed our bags without anyone stopping them.  - Entrance from Kalakaua has NO esthetic appeal. It is barren and bland. Small glass display cases attached to the wall contained a few shells, that's all.  - Outside of building is painted stark white, like a hospital. It used to be a sunny shade of light gold. The white does not represent the Island. - The carpet is a disaster. It looks like somebody pulled up carpet and left glue on concrete. When we stepped off the elevator onto our floor, we thought it was still under construction. - Tag on the room door (to request or decline maid service) does not stay on the handle. Every time you open the door, it falls off. - All room doors on our floor slammed shut, even if we tried to close it carefully. Anytime any door on the floor closed, it sounded like a bomb was going off... several times a day. - Bathroom is very small. You have to stand way inside to close the door for privacy. Half the counter is not accessible because the toilet is in the way. The showerhead often malfunctioned; it was difficult to control both the flow and temperature. The drain in the shower did not drain well -- water was above the ankles by the end of a shower. There were no amenities (toothpaste, toothbrush, etc) like the Pacific used to have. No clothesline to hang wet swimsuits in the shower area -- another thing we've lost.  - No small sofa in Ocean Front King Room, even though it was on the website in photos. There was only one chair -- what were we supposed to do? Play musical chairs? - No clock in the room -- another loss. There used to be an electric clock radio with alarm, and now there is not. Once again, you are paying MORE for LESS. - Table in room has a round base which makes it impossible to extend our legs when seated. Must keep your legs bent at all times when seated at the table.  - A pole lamp in the room blocks view of the TV. - There used to be a cabinet in the corner for coffeemaker and refrigerator. It made a great food prep area. Now the refrigerator is under the TV and the coffeemaker is next to the TV at the opposite end. With the refrigerator being in the cabinet under the tv, space for clothing is reduced.  - Cabinet with the TV -- I broke several fingernails while trying to open the drawers. You need to have really tiny fingers to open the drawers. - There used to be a vanity in the room, which provided an additional area for personal care. That has been removed, and now it is an empty useless space. There is ample space for a vanity or cabinet or shelving, which is much-needed, given how small the bathroom is. - DECOR - nothing Hawaiian about it. Three different kinds of wood were used, and none of it matches. Knotty pine, white-washed. Looks like something you would see in an antique shop in Texas, not Hawaii. Three kinds of marble was used; none match. Small table on the deck looked like someone left their toolbox behind. It looked dirty and bloody. The only way we could use it was to put a towel over it. It was disgusting. Nightstands on each side of the bed appeared to be filthy, but it was part of the décor (?). The headboard looked like a horse stall. The art on the wall was colorless and not attractive at all. There is very little color in the room. The décor in NO WAY reflects the Aloha Spirit.  - It was nearly impossible to find the pool area. The only signs were in Japanese. We teamed up with several other hotel guests, 6 or 7 of us roaming the hallways, trying to find the pool.  - When it was time to leave (we had already paid in full), we called 30 minutes ahead to have bell-hop service for our luggage. They never showed up, so we had to schlepp our bags down by ourselves and almost missed our shuttle. Thankfully, our shuttle waited an extra 10 minutes, or we would have missed our flight.+ PLUSES + - the mattress -- very comfortable. - the lamps at side of bed were nice. - the floral fragrance pumped in to the lobby area was very pleasant and soothing.We used to be regular guests at the Pacific Beach hotel. But now we will never stay there again.The rooms are over-priced and in no-way represent a 5-star resort. It was disappointing to see NOTHING of Hawaiian culture or history in the rooms.

We are going to stay here another 2 nights(3 nights for here) We just got here first night ... we never experienced that we have to pay for parking for fee etc.. here the parking cost is so high rate.. self parking $30+vat and valet 38+ We are here for our anniversary so we book for king side but got queen side bed so we ask for king side bed..thanks God..we got it. In the room ..There is no shower cap no cotton bud ,cotton pads. The air conditioning is a bit too noisy. The noise insulation is not good . We can here people on the hallway. Well lets see what is next coming... let's see...

I'll start with the positives.Location! You're right in the heart of Waikiki. The beach is right across the street. Tiki's is right next door. Everything you want is literally steps away. The staff at check-in was kind enough and placed us in a tower with a view. Now the negatives, oh where do I begin...1. The refrigerator was leaking.2. I called the front desk three times and no one picked up. I finally called a fourth time and was finally able to reach someone. Two if I recall correctly, there were no other buttons or shortcuts on the phone to call anyone else but the Operator/Front Desk.3. They never refilled the shampoo upon servicing/cleaning the room.4. There was no clock! How is this possible at a 5 star resort? I have no idea. I've never been in a hotel room without a clock. 5. The towels had stains on them. (photos attached)6. Counters were dirty.7. No room service. I would assume a 5 star hotel would have some sort of food. But no, on the desk inside the room there is a menu from a Pizza joint nearby. It's not exactly what you think of when you hear it's a 5 star resort. In comparison to other 5 star (even 3 star resorts), while the following aren't deal breakers, they stand out:7. No water bottles offered in the room.8. After using the ironing board, Housekeeping never moved the ironing board back. Not a major concern but in my experience most 3 star hotels usually tidy up a bit for you. Important questions to ask:What happened to the rest of the reviews on here? I've seen many reviews of this hotel before on here before but all the sudden the hotel only has 25 reviews and the oldest review is 2 weeks old? How is that possible?Lastly, I'm really curious to know how this hotel achieve a 5 star designation. Most 3 star hotels I've stayed at easily surpass this hotel in almost every way. Even some 2.5 star hotels.

My family and I had a chance to stay at this beautiful resort this past May. We were placed on the 13th floor with a "princess view." The view was of Diamond Head and of the ocean. The room was extremely clean and modernized, equipped with portable water pouches you can fill up by the lobby elevators. The lobby was gorgeous and my kids loved looking at their Oceanarium. Twice a day you can see a diver go into the giant aquarium and feed the fish! They have 2 pools here, a keiki pool and an infinity pool that over looks Waikiki Beach. The infinity pool has comfy lounge seats in the pool, but we were told that they were available for rent. Sitting in the hot tub after a dip in the cool pool was a nice touch as waitresses offered a full menu of drinks and food. Right across the street you have access to a part of Waikiki beach that has a break, so it is perfect for kids to play in. Don't let the older pictures fool you, this resort is remodeled from the floor up and it is gorgeous! The staff members were very helpful and friendly as well.

We loved everything about our luxurious stay at the Alohilani! The calm beach literally right across the street was perfect for our family. Then we’d play more in the pool while enjoying yummy food and drinks from the pool bar. Momosan was a delicious restaurant within the hotel with a very hip vibe. My girls loved the oceanarium. So impressive! Staff was all fantastic. Our room was spotless with an incredible view. Felt truly spoiled during our stay here, and will definitely book at this hotel again. Can’t recommend it enough!

Perfectly positioned across the road from Waikiki beach, the Alohilani was everything we could have hoped for, for our Hawaiian getaway. Our two booked rooms were conjoined (which meant we could all hang out together, even in our room!) and we had a spectacular view of the ocean and the mountains (partial ocean view was an undersell… it was incredible!). Stacey on the front desk was really wonderful and the girls at the concierge were super helpful! All topped off by the occasional mai tai in the jacuzzi… perfection! Will be back.

My mother and I stayed for a week at the Alohilani Resort. It is steps away from the beach at Waikiki. In fact, our hotel room overlooked the beach. We could open our patio door and hear the birds and the sounds of the waves. I highly recommend booking a room with an ocean view. The staff is friendly and amazing!! The hotel is beautiful and has excellent dining within. It is located steps from shopping and other restaurants. While we didn't book any excursions through the concierge, they were nonetheless informative, and gave us one or two "insider" tips.

Checked in to our room under a discounted rate and unpacked some of our belongings and case of water bottles into our beautiful ocean view room. Later that evening I was told that the discounted rate was incorrect and that we would be charged a higher rate. The front desk then told me that due to the error we would also be moved to another room but was not given an explanation for the move. Front desk simply said that the Rooms Director ordered the move and that they were unable to give any further information. In the end, we moved into a "city view" room which did not offer any views except a view of a parking lot with a higher rate than our original ocean view room. To add to injury the hotel was not bustling and appeared to be low occupancy during our stay. No clear reason given for the room change. Very disappointed.

We stayed here during the last leg of our honeymoon trip. The hotel itself was beautiful, staff were extremely friendly and helpful particularly Andrea at the front desk. We had a few minor issues with our room which were dealt with straight away so we were very happy with that. The room was clean and tidy, beds were very comfortable though the bathroom was on the small side. Their buffet breakfast was delicious and the on-sight restaurant was lovely too. Cocktails and sunsets on the pool deck was amazing- the atmosphere was laid back, relaxing, chic and sophisticated however it would have been much better if that area around the pool and bar was for adults only- the screaming kids splashing around kind of killed the vibe a little .. would definitely stay again.

We enjoyed our stay at the Alohilani Resort! The location is fantastic with many restaurants, shops and public transport close by. The pool area was fantastic with comfortable pool lounges overlooking the ocean and a bar for a nice cold drink! Our room was clean and comfortable with a partial ocean view and a partial view of Diamond Head. We had stayed at this Hotel when it was the Pacific Beach Resort and we loved it then but I must admit the renovations are fantastic, especially the pool area! We would recommend the Alohilani Resort to anyone wanting a clean, comfortable Resort close to the beach!

We spent 8 nights here for our wedding anniversary. The hotel refurbishment is fresh and very modern and chic. Location is great, walk out, accross road and boom at beach. We spent a lot of time at the Swell Bar and pool area. This hotel manages the pool seating to perfection, their staff help allocate chairs so none of that hotel guests rubbish of racing down at 6am and blocking all the good seats. They issue towels and seat covers. Each time we went down to the pool - no dramas. We ate in the restaurant on ground floor twice - food great. Housekeeping staff simply professional and so happy. Only complaint shower set up, water goes everywhere and is a slipping hazzard, already the bathroom door is warped and swollen from water damage. They have great laundry facilities, on same level as pool. I put in washing went to the pool whilst our laundry being done - so easy and plenty of machines. We were in room 2951 - view lovely - could see beach and mountains.

Newly renovated hotel which is right in front of the beach. Decor are bright and clean. Japanese is the main market whom I love because they are polite and clean, no children running and screaming around the lobby. The ocean front room is a gem which beautiful sunset view everyday. The concierge is part of the expedia and they are great in arranging the private tour, chopper ride, and advising the perfect luau show.

Beautiful Hotel! Great stay!! Staff extremely nice. Mackenzie from Expedia travel group helped to make our Hawaii experience everything it was! She took her time and showed us a map of the island. Showing us all the restaurants and beaches to go to! She made our trip so awesome! Morimoto restaurant was awesome!! We had to eat there twice! Overall it’s an excellent Hotel! I will stay here again!
user_name:
jay2damil
New York City, New York

review_body: Spent 3 nights at Alohilani with work and then 3 nights with family before heading home. I don’t have a lot of experience with accommodation in Honolulu but the alohilani has been tastefully renovated with the entrance foyer and pool area being exceptional. The rooms were of average size and again well renovated. Unfortunately they could not do much with the noisy toilets and ability to hear your neighbours. Staff were fantastic and breakfast options from buffet or O Bar were great. Don’t get too exited about ocean view rooms as these are partial but still ok the closer to the beach the better. Ocean front view is the best but you pay for it. The gym looked great although I did not make it.

We stayed only 2 nights at Alohilani Resort but it was enough to appreciate the Aloha Chic way of life. It is perfectly located, walking distance to everything you might need in Waikiki (but you won't need much, since the hotel has it all! Including an ABC store on the ground floor, facing the street - great convenience for some snacks, drinks and souvenirs). Our room had an amazing view of Waikiki Beach, and the Resort's Infinity Pool is awesome! The buffet breakfast is delicious, with a variety of fruits, breads, sweets, cereals and more. The staff is also super friendly and nice. We loved our stay there and recommend it to everyone looking for a luxury vacation destination in Waikiki.

Morimotos has,a wonderful vibe ans Samuel the Bar manager is very knowledgeable and so enjoyable to talk with . He made us a drink called the "TOM" IT WAS OUTSTANDING.. Kafir, lemon grass, gin a few other yummy spices... my kinda drink.. will be back friday..

I just love that this hotel is a very recent refurb so everything is modern, fresh and tasteful. A large number of other Waikiki properties are dated. Everything was perfect for our stay at Alohilani, just couldn’t be faulted. We arrived earlier than stated check in time. We were able to store our bags, were given a welcome drink cocktail voucher, and were called by reception staff for an early check in as soon as our room was ready. We were upgraded to an ocean view room- BONUS. we were thrilled. The room was light, airy, tastefully decorated and we loved our balcony with an excellent side ocean view directly over Waikiki Beach. The electronic toilet with seat warmer feature was such a luxury and delight!All facilities were fantastic. The O bar with the feature 2 storey aquarium. The lobby, the lounging areas, the pool deck, the gym, the restaurants. All fabulous. We loved the convenience of the ABC store below for drinks, snacks and souvenirs. All hotel/Resort staff were very friendly, attentive and helpful. Nothing was a problem. Concierge were great for local knowledge and booking activities. Valet desk were helpful booking us return transfers to the airport at an excellent rate. Use them! Only $13pp to the airport. The hotel itself is on a corner and has entrances from two different streets, the main lobby is off the side vehicle entrance and there is a front entrance which is directly across the road from Waikiki beach. Excellent location you can honestly walk everywhere and we did. Felt safe to, even at all hours of the night, walking home from bars on a couple of partying nights.We had a wonderful time in Waikiki and the Alohilani just made our stay. Would definitely return.Thank you to the team at Alohilani.

Arrived at the hotel after reading many of the reviews, nervous. But the hotel is top class! Probably the best in Oahu! Lobby is very spectacular when you walk in and you feel like you are waking into a 5 star property. The staff greet you and CheckIn staff were so friendly and fast. The room was outstanding. Very clean and well laid out. Beds super comfy! Location is Perfect! Across the road from a great beach. Easy to get over and back to the hotel if needed. Loads of restaurants within walking distance. Pool area is fab with great staff offering to help at all times. Great lounge area also. Gym is really great - probably best hotel gym ever. Have mens and women’s locker rooms and fully equipped. The best hotel on Oahu! Highly recommend this property!

Have just come back from Alohalani hotel in Waikiki. We had an ocean front room 1620, a large corner suite right at the top, with wonderful views of the beach and both directions down Kalakua Ave. The room had a few issues at first, the bath plug wouldn't stay down, the basin plug wouldn't let the water out, the tv karked 5 times, we didn't know the aircon turned off if you open the lanaii door, and the instructions for the coffee machine were sparse to say the least. All these problems were quickly dealt with by maintenance, and we went on to enjoy the beautiful new hotel for the rest of our stay. I thought the buffet breakfast was somewhat over priced, so we only went there once , but were given a bottle of wine , some lovely chocolate covered strawberries and marshmallow cookies, delivered to our room, because of the issues we had encountered.

Had really enjoyed the stay with my mom at Alohilani. The resort was newly renovated so everything looks good and works great. Location was also very convenient to go anywhere. The only thing that bothered us was the room air conditioner could be quite annoying sometime, a bit noisy while it was working.

The hotel has been redone within the year so it’s beautiful. Staff was friendly. The elevators were having problems and being in the 30th floor we just had to deal. They need to improve on what’s available to do at hotel. We found the restaurants in town were far better than what the hotel has to offer. The beds were so comfortable.

Very good location Just in Waikiki beach , good restaurant aroundSea view is excellent you can the sunshine and the surfers all day You can walk around By the way I leave one day before the volcano explosion , but I hope everything is ok with this wonderful islands

My 8th time to Honolulu and wanted to give this hotel a go as it had be refurbished and looked amazing. If you know Honolulu its rare a hotel gets a reburb. 7 Nights booked an ocean view and the first room we were given was ocean view but the other side of the hotel overlooking another hotel and its car-park more of a side view of the ocean. Spoke to reception stating the site is very misleading to provide ocean view of one side of the hotel but there is 2 sides of the hotel that is ocean view. They did try up sell me ocean front but I was not going to pay anymore I just wanted the view I paid for. They did move us to a room with the view I expected. Those other so call ocean view rooms should be re-named and photographed with their view and a slightly lower rate. 5 Stars the reception and pool area YES takes your breath away the grandness of the entrance of the hotel, but the rooms modern but I don't feel I'm in a 5 star hotel. Not really worried about mini bars but you should have bottled water in the fridge for your guests, considering hefty resort fees 2 bottles of water a day wont break the bank and telling us to fill up around the resort with the taps available with the water bottles provided is not 5 star. Meeting other guests around the pool having general chit chat they too agree bottled water should be in the fridge as a minimum. Kids pool disconnected from the infinity pool so I got no service down there not one server came near me to see if you want drink or food. I had to get my child out of the pool go up to the bar and ask for drink. The lounge area amazing especially when the music in the afternoon starts great vibes. I will mention there is no security in the hotel so anyone can enter the lift and go up to any floor and soon found out that a few people around the pool were from other hotels and come to this hotel daily to swim in the pool. How do you find out kids dont lie. Word of mouth is apparently out that this hotel you can access their pool. I personally think the hotel needs to put a room key access to all floors for security and also to keep the pool exclusive to their guests. The location you cannot fault across the road from beach. ABC shop below the hotel.
